review_body: Very special hotel. Cool and elegant vibe ... upscale but fun. Food is amazing. Room was a good size, especially for NYC. Really well appointed. Staff were incredibly nice and accommodating. Location is terrific. Great neighborhood ... will be back. New favorite hotel when in the city ...

This hotel is amazing. Truly 5 star in my experience. I am a native New Yorker and and loved staying there. Great location, clean, good service, elegant and chic. no complaints and I always complain. Great decor, good coffee and room service. I hope to get back there soon Lauren

Third time at Crosby Street and really enjoy the hotel. Great staff, great breakfast, great location. Rooms are on the small side but as long as you are traveling without kids who spends any time at the hotel outside the bed anyway?

the staff is great and super helpful but nothing can top the quality of their plumbing. best water pressure of any hotel i’ve ever stayed in. taking a shower here is like showering in a waterfall. 10/10 would recommend.

Just checked out of the Crosby hotel feeling disappointed.The disappointed resulted from poor attention to detail in the restaurant .The hotel is much too expensive! Particular with regard to room charges and food.

We've stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel three times in the past year and every time has been an outstanding experience -- so much so that I almost hate to tell people about this charming property and risk that it's booked up the next time we want to come. It's an elegant boutique hotel that feels like it was designed by the cast of Friends, with its warm wood tones, interesting art and sculptures, and bright, comforting colors. And the experience is topped off with the decorator's unique touches like scented spray for the pillows and fragrant bath salts. Definitely an oasis from the chaos of the city, and with a friendly, yet professional and competent staff to boot.If you stay, be sure to grab breakfast at the lovely, serene breakfast room (they have the best turmeric almond lattes in NY). And don't miss exploring the clever outdoor courtyard and the elegant drawing room. Splurge on a room or suite on a high floor so you can enjoy magnificent views of SoHo, the Village and lower Manhattan.

Crosby is a quiet street parallel to the noisy Broadway. It’s nearby Equinox (literally steps away), Mercer Kitchen, SLT (great Pilates), Boqueria (Tapas), and a slate of restaurants The suites at the hotel is spacious and comfortably decorated. Feels like an elegant upper east side apartment. Snow days dresses the scenery romantically from its window view. It’s quite like the movies.The only difference is it wouldn’t get the same type of crowd as Mercer Hotel. Where the lobby is basically the hangout joint for The Who’s who’s.... it’s nevertheless a hotel one must try at least once.Food isn’t shabby either

The service is second to none and the breakfast the best of anywhere in the world and we have travelled extensively. The rooms are very special and each one has a different decoration. Also the Crosby Bar does fabulous evening meals. The location in Soho is great. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York.

We went for a drink, and ended up staying for 2! The waitstaff was so nice and didn’t kick us out for diners. We only had 1 appetizer, but the food around us looked amazing! I want to go back for afternoon tea- it looked really yummy!

From the welcoming greeting upon arriving at the Doorstep of The Crosby Street Hotel to the neatly loaded car (and bottled water for the ride home) as we (sadly) departed, our stay was a Symphony of Flawless Magic. This was our second stay at what is, for sure, our favorite hotel anywhere, and Max and the rest of the team surprised us w a wonderful upgrade to the Crosby Suite. What an amazing space w tremendous windows w a spectacular westerly view. The "Kit Kemp" style touched every detail in the suite. What really made our weekend getaway over the top was the staff. They just get it. They are there for your every question or desire, but they do it in a way that shows they really care. The management of the hotel is spot and the entire machine is working in one direction. It's really great to see and experience. It's also really easy to fall in love w the place and it also makes it easy to fall magically more in love with your wife when you bring her there.My wife has a BIG Birthday in February 2020 and her one request was to plan the weekend w a stay at The Crosby Street!See you soon.Frank & Karyn

I spent two nights here in October. The room was quiet, beautifully furnished and decorated, and extremely homey and comfortable. The sitting room is very comfortable and welcoming. The service was great and all of the staff were extremely pleasant, welcoming and friendly (except for one young blonde woman at reception who was surprisingly unfriendly).The neighborhood has elegant shops and restaurants and is peaceful at night. Several subway lines are close by. I had a wonderful and restful stay and can't wait to come back with my family.

Very few hotels can compare to the Crosby. Went for a two night stay-cation with my wife and everything was superb. From the service at check in to the concierge to the room decor, we had a special time and will be back soon!
user_name:
hhotelier
New York City, New York

review_body: A beautiful hotel with great staff. Downstairs is a wonderful bar in which we have enjoyed several evenings. Last night, the drinks were a total miss even though service was lively. How does a martini have no to little vodka? Hope it was just a busy night.

Stayed here after a stay at their sister hotel the Whitby which was amazing, and I’ll be sure to go back. Excellent location and staff are great. Rooms are a great size and the bed is like sleeping on air. So, after a great nights sleep you’re glad of the awesome power shower in a well designed bathroom. My only floors are, lighting in the bedroom is a bit awkward, low floor rooms are noisy, and as an English man in NYC I’d love tea making facilities. I did love it, just not as much as Whitby. You tore my affections, slightly.

We just stopped in for a drink. Bartender was especially helpful and engaging. Great part of NYC. We will definitely try to stay here on a future trip. The food looked delicious. Beautiful hotel and very clean.

This hotel is by far the best place to stay in the Soho area. Rooms are luxurious. Staff is very courteous, helpful and friendly. The bar, patio and restaurant are fabulous. The hotel is worth going just to see the decor. I will definitely keep coming back❤️

This was our second time staying at the Crosby Street Hotel and it was just as good as our first stay. The service is excellent and the art and decorations make you feel like an extension of someone’s home! We decided to just stay at the hotel one day and thought to ourselves this is actually nicer than our own home :)... we will definitely be back!

I am definitely a fan of Firmdale Hotels and have stayed in many of them, as well as enjoying their restaurants. But we’ve been staying at Soho House lately when in New York, and unfortunately that has upped our expectations as far as hospitality goes, leaving us a little bit disappointed in our experience here. The public spaces are still beautiful, the rooms are still beautiful, but it’s the small things. We are given one small bottle of water in the room per day, for two people, so we need to order it from room service or pay for the one in the minibar. Glassware that’s been used is removed but not replaced. There are no coffee maker or tea provisions, which would be nice in a hotel of this caliber. The rooms are very quiet, which is a giant plus in NYC, but so much light seeps in through the shade and draperies that you wake up really early. There are not many personal amenities in the room—toothbrush, razor, straightening iron — (ok I get that’s unusual, but it’s so nice)—like Soho House generously provides. The hotel is five star for sure, clean, quiet, beautiful, in a great part of town, but they could step up their game a little bit. They have A LOT going for them but there’s room for improvement.

Everything about this hotel was top notch! It's a beautiful and charming hotel with great rooms, great food, fantastic comfy beds, and the best staff and service we have experienced in NYC. The fitness room was very good, they have cool art throughout the hotel, and the hotel was extremely clean and spotless.If you like Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton hotels, then I would recommend the Crosby Street Hotel as an even better boutique style option. Perfect SoHo location. We will definitely stay here again on our next NYC trip.

This is a unique and wonderful hotel. Every detail is carefully addressed. The excellent location, the friendly and efficient service, the comfortable room, the interesting, beautiful and eclectic decor throughout the hotel, and the exceptional food all add up to definitely make this our favorite place to stay in NYC. We enjoy being here! The Crosby Street Hotel is very highly recommended!

We absolutely loved our stay at the Crosby Hotel. The location is fantastic and very central to everything. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel special. It was like arriving to our quiet serenity in busy NYC! The room is absolutely beautiful with its plush soft furnishings and beautiful feel.The bathroom amazing - amenities, shower, towels, all at 5 star plus standard.Breakfast was beautiful sitting in the courtyard, service attentive striking that perfect balance between privacy and service. This will most definitely be our hotel of choice for NYC.

This hotel is perfect for stay!! When I got there at 3pm my room not ready yet, so they upgrade my room, even they don't have to do this.The room is perfect for Instagram Trowels was keeping warm, never got this before, love the idea

We stayed here in late May on a Memorial Day package and had an amazing time. The hotel restaurant served us wonderful food (I love the grilled octopus and the corned beef hash). The hotel staff made everything super easy and convenient. This is our third visit to the Hotel and it continues to be completely easy going while serving beautiful interiors, excellent amenities (gym, drawing room), and excellent food in a great neighborhood. Thank you again!!
user_name:
eerrickson
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is approaching the tenth time we have stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel. My wife just refuses to go elsewhere. The amazing art and decor imbue the stay with a serene quality that is tough to beat. The additional (payment required) 2 hour art tour (lead by the delightful Liora) of the hotel's art collection and two galleries in Chelsea was a special treat.

My partner Lori and I would like to extend a huge thank you to all the staff of the Crosby Street Hotel in Soho NYC, from the very friendly and helpful door staff who can conjure up a taxi at a minutes notice to the front desk reception and concierge service right through to the waiting on staff in the restaurant and the maid services, nothing is to much trouble in making your stay memorable. This must be the finest boutique hotel in the whole of New York the service throughout is impeccable and attentive without being intrusive. The decor in the public areas as well as the individual bedrooms exudes quality and a wonderfully relaxed ambience permeates the whole of the building. The food in the restaurant is to a high standard the menu although at first glance seems limited belies the fact it can be tweaked to individual tastes and expanded to accommodate the fussiest of diners. And finally to the Captain of this fine ship, Steve the hotel manager who is omnipresent and extremely competent and helpful in dealing with any issues that may arise. When he is not on duty it is evident as there is a definitive change in atmosphere as he is ebullient and effervescent in his approach to the running of the hotel. Finally I would add that on any future visits to the city this hotel is definitely first choice and I would recommend it to even the most discerning of travellers. Congratulations the staff of the Crosby Street Hotel we award you 5 stars and both look forward to seeing you againin the near future.

I’ve been using the Crosby as my home-base in NYC for several years now, and they never disappoint. Consistent staff, and the rooms are always clean and crisp. I stay here whether on business or pleasure.

Our 5 day stay has given us ample time to get inside all the “nooks & crannies!” Not surprisingly to us we’ve uncovered no faults. The service is attentive, food delicious, rooms clean & comfortable, bedding is luxurious, gym is well equipped and location is perfect. Aside from expensive (~$750 per night) this was perfect.

Location is good, service is good, decor is great as one now expects from all Ferndale hotels - the restaurant is good and the public areas while limited are very attractive - my room was very comfortable as expected and the only warning is expect sticker shock even for NYC ;))

This is the second time I have stayed at Crosby Street and I absolutely love it! I think the location in Soho is fantastic and close to so much. I live in the UK and meet friends in NYC and this is a great hotel for catch ups and the small bar for guests is perfect - like being in someone's living room. The service from all employees is impeccable and Kit Kemp's designs are lovely. There are great restaurants and shopping all around the hotel. There is a blow dry bar less than a block away that is open really early for jet laggers!

The best hotel in Soho in my opinion. The staff go out of their way to make sure you're happy. They have a great bar and outstanding service. People actually run to get you a cab. They upgraded one of the rooms we were in so we could be right next door to our son and the location is right where you want to be. Compare to the Peninsula in Beverly Hills without the Rolls Royce.

Attention to detail is paid everywhere it counts. Everything you interact with is excellent. It has the comforts of the big palaces of uptown, with the personalized touch and personality of soho.Checking out tomorrow and already booked my next visit next week.

We stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel for my birthday weekend at the end of December. Basically chose this hotel because of it's bright and cheery whimsical decor. The rooms are the hightlight of this hotel. Designed by London based interior designer Kit Kemp. Our room was a beautiful mixture of luxurious color, textured and patterned fabrics. Especially loved the floor to ceiling warehouse style windows overlooking downtown NYC. The walls of our room were covered in gorgeous gray flannel (so warm and inviting in the wintertime). The bathroom was on the smaller side, however, was made of stunning gray patterned marble to compliment the gray flannel walls.The hotel is located on one of the quieter streets in SOHO, which is one of the top 3 neighborhoods in NYC. Breakfast was included with our room rate; and was awesome! The bar/restaurant is cozy and adorable. There is also a small library bar located off the reception area that is available only to hotel guests, which is a nice touch. There is an honor bar system which means you can make and serve yourself drinks and then record your room number and what you poured. Your bill will be charged accordingly.Crosby Street Hotel has the feel of staying in a friends' townhouse; cozy, intimate and inviting!

Light, bright rooms that are well equipped with nescesities. Great hairdryer girls ! Steamer & iron available on requestThe breakfast was among the best I’ve sampled in any hotel.The restaurant / bar was buzzing on an evening but we always managed to get a seat. Nice sized gym for the size of hotel too Defo recommend

I booked the property by emailing them,. Everything was handled very efficiently. The suites are just like the ones at Ham Yard in London, super spacious and with tons of character. The staff was a standout. In particular Jamie at the restaurant. The bar staff. But what was truly exceptional was the concierge. Everyone at the desk was super efficient, pro active and genuinely engaged with the guests; no request was big or small. We had the terrace suite which didn't have lights outside so they arrived with 10 candles as a proactive solution when we had guests for drinks over on the terrace. Just one of the innumerable gestures that made their concierge desk above and beyond.

This is a fashionable, fun, jumping, where-it-all-happens, hotel in the heart of SoHo with all the good manners and service of days gone by. Need a taxi during a downpour? The concierge will find one and lead you to it under his umbrella. Loads of luggage to store? The front desk will take care of it for you while you visit the Black Friday sale at Brooks Bros. If you love contemporary art, cocktails, or want to chill out somewhere near the MoMo shop, this is the hotel for you. But don’t expect to get a room at the Crosby during New York Fashion Week or the Tony Awards. The celebs will have taken over the hotel where modern art works even decorate the elevators.A word of warning, which applies to most top-end hotels in the city: don’t imagine that your final bill will even remotely resemble the price you thought you were paying for the room when you booked it. The online bed and breakfast rate for our room was $880. But throw in State taxes, a couple of meals and some drinks…and before you know it, there’s $1,367 on your American Express card. But then it was a night to remember.
user_name:
Christopher W
Berwick upon Tweed, United Kingdom

review_body: What a stunning and unique Hotel with such welcoming greeting from our arrival through to our leaving. Thank you for a wonderful experience and we appreciate your Restaurant recommendations. Concierge staff were amazing.

There is nothing better than to be out and about on a cold winter's night in New York, and to end your night at the Crosby Street Hotel. The Crosby is a treat for the senses in every possible way. You are greeted by soft lighting, a warm and friendly staff, and a very high degree of elegance without opulence. The integration of colors and textures here brings you to a Zen-like place very quickly, and the outside world soon melts away. It's not over the top gaudy at all, but well coordinated design elements are everywhere. Even the hallways are bright and colorful with clever graphics and furnishings. As I sat relaxing in our suite, I couldn't help but notice the attention to every detail of the room. It doesn't feel, smell, or look like any hotel room; it's like home, only better. Our suite was immaculately clean, as was every common space that we saw. A feature I really liked was the motion sensor activated night light in the bathroom; no need for any light in the room until you need it. The staff here do their jobs very well and the wait staff in the restaurant was also amazing. I cannot say enough good things about this place, and highly recommend a stay there when in New York. It will be hard to stay anywhere else once spoiled by the Crosby; they do it right!

First the good news: this hotel puts you right in the middle of Soho, with a quirky, crafty modern decor that brings Manhattan down to human scale. Now the bad news: at just south of $1000 for a base level room, I should be able to make coffee in my room. When we requested a coffeemaker we were given an ancient drip machine that didn't work. We also asked for a humidifier for my daughter's room. The desk guy asked if it would be okay if they charged us for it. At almost $1000 a room - hard No! Lastly, a point of art - in what is clearly intended to be an intimate hotel, during our week long stay not one employee called us by name. At a price point higher than most other "luxury" hotels, the experience was less than perfect.

I spend a weekend at the Crosby with my two girls the weekend before Christmas. We had a lovely deluxe room, which was plenty of room for the three of us with the youngest on the comfortable pull out sofa. The service was friendly and helpful as always. We spent a lovely evening playing scrabble in the bar when the library was too crowded, and the manager went out of his way to find us a small private table. Breakfast was terrific and the overall Christmas atmosphere very festive and fun. I can't wait to return.

I booked three rooms here as I was staying with my wife and 4 daughters. We all had a wonderful stay due to the excellent staff, great breakfasts and fab location. The hotel itself is beautifully designed with intriguing artwork that draws you in and makes you slow down and appreciate your surroundings. The clock in the downstairs lobby is definitely worth a look as well as the scrumptious dog portraits hanging in the drawing room. Our bedrooms were spotlessly clean, warm and cosy and again, beautifully designed. We really did look forward to coming back there every evening after a full day sightseeing. Thank you for a most enjoyable stay. (My only one slight gripe was that the fires should have been lit in the drawing room as it was very cold in there and after asking a couple of times for the heating to at least be turned on or for the door to be closed, I felt I was asking for too much as this didn’t seem to go down very well with the chap working there who didn’t agree..... so we left and went up to our rooms instead. Shame as everything else was perfect.)
user_name:
Graham H
Welwyn Garden City, United Kingdom

review_body: So disappointed with the disgraceful attitude and ineptitude of all front of house staff at this hotel. Beyond bad. On arrival after a 10 hour flight and commute, the guy at reception didn't say hello or welcome ..barely took his face off the screen to utter "ID and credit card".My daughter arrived 3 hours later to an even ruder 'welcome'. Overpriced and rude waiting staff in the restaurant and very overpriced. This was meant to be a special weekend for my family. So disappointing.Also I was taking photo of my daughter in the entrance and a rat ran over her foot..nice!A disgrace. This place needs an overhaul. Shame on all involved.

So glad we stayed here for our 4 days in NY. Lovely spacious rooms - we were on the 8th floor looking out over the LES - Great big windows to let in lots of light. Very comfortable and beautifully designed. Loved all the signature fabrics.Had drinks and dinner in the bar - great cocktail range and a delicious meal. Amazing service - the hotel helped my teenage daughter and her friend when they were in NY earlier in the year, even though they were not staying at the hotel that time. So impressive. Highly recommend and would definitely stay again.

Of all the hotels we have stayed in in New York, the Crosby Street hotel is our favorite. It isn’t cheap, but the top floor rooms are superb, with gorgeous interior design by Kit Kemp. The whole hotel feels cosy and unique, stylish and hip and special without being pretentious and full of itself.But what won us over the most was the unexpected 2 night upgrade to the best suite in the hotel. For no reason other than just because. It’s this kind of gesture that will make us keep going back and back (and indeed have already rebooked for a week in Feb).

This is the second time we spend our NY holiday at the Crosby, first time it was only couples, this time with family and friends. Amazing as always. So charming interiors, good and friendly service, lovely being downtown. Good food and lovely restaurant, we felt really at home, in a home of a dear friend. Only minus, no spa, there is the gym but no spa treatments that would be a cuddle after a crazy day in the city.Can’t wait to go back again.In the meantime we will go to our favorite Ham Yard in London (same company). This hotel has a proper spa.

A perfect little gem of a hotel. A location to die for in Soho, beautifully designed interiors, very comfortable beds etc. Very good use of space in the rooms - while on the small side, they do not feel claustrophobic. Two outdoor terraces - pretty and convenient.The front desk staff are very well trained, correct and pleasant. Even the way they hand you the key to your room (I left my key with the reception every time I left the hotel) is proscribed. You pay a price for all of it, but you understand what you're paying for - the price/quality ratio is acceptable, if not brilliant.Certainly coming back.

This is by far my favorite hotel in SoHo! My absolute favorite. The décor is Andy Warhol meets Dorothy Draper, and the restaurant and bar cannot be beat! Super cool vibe, the rooms are really quiet, and I love the decor! I also love the location, literally right around the corner from the Subway, which is key to getting around Manhattan quickly. Highly recommend!

This was our first time staying at Crosby Street but it won't be our last. The Hotel is beautfifully fashioned and the staff is impeccable. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite it was nicely furnished, the bed was comfortable. Nice minibar. Great room service. Awesome location. We'll definitely be back!

We have stayed here so many times and it feels like home now. This is a well- oiled Firmdale machine. This is a lot busier than the other New York counterpart, the gorgeous new Whitby up on 56th street. The position of the Crosby within Soho is great for walking to subway stations, restaurants all day and night long and of course amazing shopping district. The rooms are always clean, bed is super comfy and the service is excellent. The bathrooms are all the same with an amazing shower and gorgeous amenities. Some of the rooms have beautiful window sills on their floor to ceiling windows-with great New York views. There are 2 great courtyards for sitting in during the warmer months. We absolutely adore the decor and the breakfast menu cannot be beaten. We hope to return again soon.

My husband and I just returned from NYC and had a fabulous stay at the Crosby Street Hotel. Everything was just excellent—the room, the decor, the bar, the restaurant and the staff! I felt so warm and cozy there—nice change from a mega-hotel in the city!

Beautiful hotel, grand personal service (they do make a point to know you by name), lively bar, great location to explore from and shop. We loved everything about this hotel and our only regret was that we only stayed 2 nights.

My favourite place was the one in the picture attached! It’s a lovely place to have some drinks! The staff was fantastic and they took care of us since the beginning! The location was great as well!!!

my third visit and it was as pleasant as ever despite an exceptionally rude receptionist who told me off for being late - I did point out that this was my third visit and I'd travelled from the UK ! Despite that the waiting staff were lovely and we had a very enjoyable afternoon tea. I would visit again as I would not be put off my one rude person.

First really great people. Super clean rooms, and a great location. Every room was designed slightly different. The service was really friendly and comfortable. It seems like everyone cared about where why worked.

I’ve always loved the Crosby. Never occurred to me to write a review until now. Here’s why I love it:—great location. If you wanna be in SoHo, this is THE hotel (also like the James but this place is more quaint. James is more for partying).—staff are incredibly professional, elegant—styling is tight, charming, elegant—Cute atrium for cocktail hour—rooms are beautiful. You feel like you could be in the French countryside. Or at an elegant home. —little restaurant/bar is great—my girlfriend was very sick. Hotel doc was amazing. —concierge is very attentive—never feels crowded —it’s hot upper east side class but in a hip neighborhood. It’s my favorite hotel in NYC, bottom line. Cannot say enough.

I recently enjoyed checking-out the Crosby Street Hotel in NYC.Even though it was a short one-night stay in NYC in between two flights, I really really liked it.The location is fantastic: SoHo and NoLiTa have so much restaurants & bars to offer; and most importantly (!), the hotel was very-well located a few blocks away from the bridges heading to Brooklyn for my morning run!The staff at check-in and check-out was super friendly; great energies.And I particularly enjoyed the room and its amenities.All I wish is to visit again for a less-rushed stay!

I can't find one bad thing to say about The Crosby Street Hotel. It's everything you'd expect. I slept sound and woke to one of the best room service breakfasts I've ever ate. They get everything right. Very clean on a quiet street. The rooms are standard NYC size but the large windows make it feel more open. The people who stay here are not the type to laugh at themselves, but that's to be expected.

We stayed in both The Mark and Crosby Street Hotel and although they are both exquisite hotels the Crosby was more fun, great bar, reading room and the rooms where great. Loved the area, Soho with lots of galleries, shops and small restaurants.

We have stayed several times at this hotel and have always enjoyed our stay. The hotel is friendly, warm and personal. The rooms are lovely. But, the real draw for us is that, when we visit NYC, we love to spend most of our time downtown, especially in Soho. This is a perfect launching pad for our explorations.

We stayed at the Crosby for six nights in a top floor deluxe room with great NYC views including Brooklyn Bridge. The room was absolutely beautiful, the bed very comfortable and all of the amenities perfect. We had breakfast each morning and also dined at the Crosby one evening, all of the meals were excellent. The only point I would make is that the cooked breakfasts are very large.The service from all of the team at the Crosby is first class, always professional but very friendly with it. All credit to Max Jones, the General Manager and to Chris McCormack, Head Concierge, they and their colleagues made it a perfect stay in what is a great area of NYC.

I found this hotel on trip advisor in March this year. We wanted somewhere special to stay, but a boutique environment for my 50th birthday. When I couldn't see the dates I wanted online, I emailed the hotel and they were able to find the room we wanted when we wanted it - perfect start! Prior to arriving I emailed the hotel again and asked for restaurant recommendations for my birthday dinner - shortly afterwards I received a list of about 20-25 locations near the hotel that they recommended, along with food types, price range etc - more perfection!It was when we arrived at the hotel that I just couldn't believe how amazing it was. Chocolate and champagne on ice were waiting in the room for me (they had remembered from when I contacted them earlier), the room was so divine, the staff were the friendliest and most accommodating staff I have ever encountered at any hotel and the location was absolutely amazing - stay in SOHO!Throughout the stay whenever we left the hotel staff gave us a genuine smile and good wishes for the day and whenever we returned they welcomed us back. Nothing was too much for trouble, and the staff were happy and engaging. We received hand written postcards mid stay, enquiring after us, and chocolates mid stay. It is these little touches (that you rarely receive in other hotels), and the friendly, professional and helpful staff that make staying here worth it.The decor is stunning in this hotel, I just soaked it all up. We had drinks and nibbles in the bar one evening (superb cheese platter), and it was a relaxed, inviting atmosphere.The location was perfect for us. It is just off of Spring Street, about 50 metres from Balthazar (where we went for my birthday breakfast), and about 2 blocks from Broadway. I visited Dean & Deluca most mornings for iced latte (its a 2 minute walk from the hotel), but there are so many other small, 'artisan' coffee shops around that I ended up having multiple coffees each day. There's a subway close by if you need it (we walked almost everywhere, including to Central Park - which is quite a hike, but we like walking).It is definitely a mid to high range hotel (depending on what room you get), but if you're like us and want something for a special occasion, then its worth the splurge. I cannot recommend The Crosby Street Hotel enough - sheer perfection. Thank you to all of the staff who made our stay the most enjoyable stay in New York (and we've visited NY multiple times from Australia).

From check in to check out it was perfect. Top floor deluxe room was spacious, spotless and the view from the window was the icing on the cake. Breakfast was cooked to a good standard and the buffet was as good as any of the London hotels. Ate in the restaurant a couple of times and also had room service; no complaints. I cannot speak highly enough of the staff. All were friendly, courteous and professional. Cannot wait to return.

Such a fun experience! Great art (don’t miss the military time clock downstairs). Eclectic decor with a great brunch on Sunday mornings - try hash, everything is great and the service is efficient and pleasant.

We have stayed in multiple hotels in New York (including The Peninsula, Ritz Central Park, Lotte NY Palace, etc.) and this one just might be my favorite! There is just something special about this place! It has a way of being extremely warm and welcoming yet still hip and fresh. We received 5 star service but there was nothing pretentious about it! We had visited the bar in the past but this was our first time staying at the hotel. Our check in process was smooth and seamless. Everyone that helped us was genuinely friendly! We stayed in a Deluxe Top Floor room and it was spectacular. The floor to ceiling windows were my favorite part. We can't wait to return!

Whenever I come to NYC, I stay at the Crosby. It has always been one of those hotels that is exceptional in every way. The beautiful rooms, charming vibe, excellent food and location, and unbelievable service. But this was the first time, things seemed off. I had asked for a quiet room, and checked into a suite which we were assured would be great. The next morning we were awaked by power tools working on the ceiling above us. It was so loud that when I called to ask the front desk what was going on, I literally had to yell into the phone. They were like "oh we're doing some light remodeling." What????! Who gives a person who specifically asks for a quiet room a room where there is construction going on!!As I explained to them, if I had a guest staying at my house and planned to do construction above the room in which they would be sleeping, I would at least tell them," hey we're doing construction above your room, hope that's ok with you." In this instance, not only did they never tell me, they charged me an extraordinary amount! So unethical. While this has happened to me in other hotels, I would never have expected it of a hotel of this caliber.Other signs of slippage. Typically, the Crosby has impeccable service. They don't get things wrong. This time, in every single room service order, something was wrong. They forgot the ketchup, the utensils, a part of the order. Nothing major right? Just little signs of slippage.It makes me wonder. They just opened a sister hotel in midtown and maybe the Crosby is suffering in the process. Will I stay there again?Possibly, but I may try their new hotel instead.

We were delighted to stay there for 3 nights. Perfect location, excellent breakfast. The staff is really helpful we liked the front office. We hope we will be back soon there. We didn't try the restaurant unfortunately.

Fab hotel if price is no object - even for NYC its very toppy. The public areas are small but charming, the in house cinema a treat and the rooms typical of the chain - delightful if sometimes a bit cramped.

Loved this hotel!! Highly recommend! Rooms had gorgeous decor (exactly like website). Beautiful marble bath. Not huge by any means, but Floor to ceiling windows made room seem significantly larger! Honor bar for wine was available to us. Good restaurant! Comfortable and luxurious!

I’ve just spent ten nights at the Whitby and five nights at the Crosby - the former was outstanding, the latter just “meh”. If you have a choice, go to the Whitby, the team there understands hospitality.For the Crosby:Rooms: These are very similar to the Whitby, but the build quality of the building itself seems worse ... you can hear the water running down the pipes from the higher floors, you can hear your toilet refilling through the bathroom wall (door closed), and the aircon/heating fan is either on or off, no auto setting. When the rooms next door or above get cleaned (including pulling up the blinds), you hear it. No such issues at the Whitby.Restaurant: What a let down. It’s a hip and happening bar, with great drinks, and the food is yummy, but the hostesses are just not on-the-ball:- At the Whitby most staff remembered my name within a day of arrival. Here it seems they still don’t know that I’m even staying at the hotel five nights later.- Yesterday evening, there was nobody to seat me, so I milled around at the entrance for a while and eventually grabbed a menu and picked an open table myself.- Generally, when unsure about a wine, and asking whether one can have a try, it would be customary for the waiter to come with a bottle and pour you enough to taste. Not at the Crosby. There is no trying here, they’ll just put the full glass in front of you. - Over the course of five days, they tried several times to seat me right next to the wait station, even if other tables were available. I would’ve thought that rejecting the same table or having myself moved once or twice would be enough for people to get the message. Who wants to sit right next to the wait station where they have to clock in orders and rustle around with stuff? - Once, I specifically pointed at a table that looked like it had just been abandoned and asked to sit there, to which the hostess responded that it was taken. 15 seconds later a waiter appears to clear it - and no, it was not taken. How about just asking your guests whether they have a preference - that’d be the easiest solution, especially after you see the same person repeatedly and know (or should know) that they’re not a walk-in.Notable exception: Roberto - a great waiter, who saw what happened, saw my discomfort and immediately offered to move me (and overall was very good at making me and other guests feel welcome and comfortable).Reception: Overall good, albeit not quite as personable as at the Whitby.Concierge: Did not use concierge services for any bookings. However, I did ask them to bring my luggage down on check-out and later found that my coat bag handle had been torn off. Not a big deal per se, the thing was neither expensive nor very sturdy, but it would have been appropriate for someone to tell me that this had happened.Summary: It’s a nice place if you have to stay downtown, but it feels like “just” another boutique hotel ... and for this price you can choose from a few of boutiques. (And, yes, after the Whitby, I expected more). Firmdale prides itself on creating places that feel like home (or perhaps an Uber-pampered home). If you want to get the full experience, then choose the Whitby. The Crosby seems to need to some more management attention.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 days with extended family and enjoyed every minute! The hotel was immaculate, the service impeccable and the location was perfect. I especially appreciated the quiet and calm atmosphere after participating in several frenetic activities in the city. The staff was solicitous without being intrusive. The gorgeous drawing room was a lovely place to connect with family & friends during the day. The rooms were beautifully appointed without being stuffy. I also loved the whimsical artwork throughout the hotel. Lastly, they offer an outstanding brunch!

This is me and my wife’s first time staying at the CSH and it absolutely stunning. The rooms are very thoughtfully decorated, with beautiful art, gorgeous tapestry drapes and chairs. The restaurant is top notch. The staff has been welcoming, responsive and polite. However, my favorite part of this hotel are the windows in the room. The whole wall is glass and it is breathtaking. I can’t say enough good things about this hotel. Love and respect, RD

We love firmdale and are never disappointed here. The art is super uplifting. The staff are lovely and it all feels very personal. Great views thanks to huge crittle windows. Amazing location near trendy shops and restaurants yet remains quiet and calming. One thing i would say is slow room service and slightly inferior bathrooms to bedrooms (very small and ugly marble).

This was our second visit to the Crosby Street Hotel. The ambience and the service are still far superior to any other Hotel and well worth the price. You feel as though you were staying with friends not just another nameless face in a large hotel.

My wife and I, former New Yorkers, now Londoners, have stayed all over Manhattan. Now that we've discovered the Crosby Street Hotel, we won't be staying anywhere else. The hotel is warm and welcoming, with not a hint of the corporate austerity of other NYC hotels of a similar level. The art is light and bouncy, the décor a modern London aesthetic plastered onto New York in a joyfully uncynical manner. The rooms are large, well lit and feature huge floor-to ceiling windows (with cushions to take a seat upon the floor and watch the street below buzz away). The breakfasts are lavish and impeccably prepared (as well as being reasonably priced), the gym though small is well-equipped, and the staff, always friendly, seem to genuinely enjoy their work. The location too is fabulous. Yes, it's SoHo, but not the bland brand land west of Broadway. Here, a stone's throw from Nolita and the galleries, hole-in-the-walls and delis of the Lower East Side, the cobbled Crosby Street abuts some of the City's most interesting restaurants, bars and stores. The M to Brooklyn and the 456 are but a short walk. Please don't change a single thing. We'll be back soon.

I was in NYC for an extended weekend visiting my college daughter. This was my first stay at the Crosby Street Hotel. The hotel is is stunning to the eyes. It's beautifully decorated and appointed. On arrival, I was immediately struck by the impeccable service from the friendly staff. Our room, a junior suite, was light filled from the floor to ceiling windows. Tucked on quiet Crosby Street, the hotel is still in the heart of Soho, close to terrific shopping and restaurants. The Crosby Bar was excellent for breakfast and afternoon tea. I enjoyed my stay immensely and will certainly return.

From its great SoHo location to the charming staff, you will love your stay at the Crosby Street Hotel. The wonderfully whimsical, tasteful art that adorns the hotel’s entrance and lobby creates a great first impression. The intriguing eye candy design welcomes you from lobby to room. From the doorman to the reception and concierges, the staff treats guests with warmth and genuine sincerity. Your visit here feels like being part of a special club. We stayed in a top floor deluxe room and loved the lay out (very quiet too!). The design is simple, uncluttered and color schemes are bright yet immensely pleasing. The rooms are redone about every six months and that is something I really appreciated. When we walked in, the finish was pristine and immaculate, as if it had just been redone prior to our occupancy. The bed was very comfortable and the floor to ceiling windows presented an exhilarating city view. The one detraction was that there was no coffee available in the room and it had to be ordered. The hotel’s location makes it convenient to many great stores and activities.

We just enjoyed 5 nights at this hotel and would highly recommend it. Our room was a suite on the top floor with excellent views. The bed & pillows were both very comfortable and the bathroom spacious and well equipped with everything we needed. We ate breakfast a few times and that was simply delicious, especially the fresh fruit. The bar staff were all very friendly and remembered what we had been drinking each day. The bar is nice and casual with excellent service, but never too crowded. We love Soho so the location was perfect for us. The reception staff and concierge team were super helpful and we were very grateful for a late check out. We booked a car to and from the airport and couldn't fault the drivers.Three years ago we enjoyed lunch and drinks at the Crosby and promised we would stay there on our next visit to New York. The best decision and we will definitely be back next time.

The room are clean and very comfortable.the staff are very friendly and helpful.the breakfast was excellent.very tasty so yumm....very good location.great service all staff are very perfosnal..we highly recommend crosby street hotel...

5 star service, rooms, restaurant, bar and vibe. I was upgraded to the Crosby Suite which was amazing. Great staff, beautiful hangout areas and the perfect location in Soho. The room service was on point and he hotel rooms are decorated beautifully. Truly a first class stay.

We stayed in the Crosby Street for 5 nights. The rooms are lovely, bar great, restuarant small but very nice atmosphere, food simple and very good. The breakfasts are amazing. The hotel is in a great location, quiet by NYC standards. If you are looking to stay in the Soho or Tribeca are you would be pushed to find a better hotel.

Crosby Street Hotel has been on my list to stay for some time and I am so glad I made the choice on this trip to NYC. I have stayed in several of the Firmdale hotels before and this one certainly didn't disappoint. i checked in late in the evening from London and to my surprise found out I had a room upgrade which was fantastic! One of the reasons I enjoy the Firmdale hotel chain is because of the interior designs and art - this one certainly lived up to the hype! I am a woman and often travel alone for business; I find this hotel chain very welcoming and feel very comfortable staying in any of them. The evening concierge helped my with my luggage. I can't remember his name as I was a bit jet lagged but he was so helpful and even volunteered to pick up anything for me I might need outside the hotel. He showed me the drawing room with the honesty bar and coffee in case I found that I wasn't able to sleep or might be up very early due to the time difference. I found the hotel very quiet for a NYC hotel. The sleep quality was excellent due to the comfortable bed and high quality sheets and pillows. The pillow spray was a lovely touch. In the morning, the breakfast menu had great choices and great service. The bar was a lively place in the evening to meet for a drink before dinner. The outdoor patio area looked like a perfect place to visit in the summer. The drawing room was an excellent place for have a drink - such a beautiful room!The hotel is practically across the street from Bloomingdales and the MOMA shop. There are many great restaurant choices in the area including Lombardi's pizza, Balthazar, Jack's Wife Freda and Osteria Morini. We also visited Haven Spa on Mercer. Loved this hotel and it will be my new 'go-to' place in Soho!

I couldn't wait to get back to our beautiful comfortable room at the Crosby last weekend during a rather rainy and cold weekend visit....the hotel was definitely the bright spot. It is impeccably decorated and the service was five star. Room service was johnny on the spot...no waiting and the front desk and bell station faculty were all lovely and always offering to assist in anyway....one of my top favorite hotel stays in last 10 years...

Love the bar here, some cracking original cocktails. The food and service are top notch. They have a small private cinema which is so comfortable and probably the best cinema experience this side of town.

We recently stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel and it was outstanding. The room is a good size and it's really, really quiet. The location is superb with shopping, restaurants and attractions almost at your doorstep. The staff are friendly and helpful.

We had put our name on the list at Russ & Daughters and were told that it would be an hour and 45 minutes. We decided to go to one of the new upscale hotels downtown and settled on Crosby Street. We were not disappointed. it was about a15-20 minutes walk where we were seated in the bar right away. We alter learned that the hotel is owned by an English couple. The wife is a wonderfully creative decorator and clearly an artist. We toured the common areas of the hotel after we w e had drinks and marveled at all of the beautiful and creative art.with a sense of humor. The bar and restaurant are open spaces filled with light. We vowed to come back in the summer as it appears that there is an open space which looked quite inviting. We eagerly researched this hotel with a view to staying there if we had a chance.

We were invited to Sunday brunch while visiting for New Year Eve not realizing there was also a hotel. The restaurant is one of the most beautiful restaurants we have ever visited. Brunch is served on Wedgewood China coffee is served in silver pots. Service is superb and the food is excellent truly a delight for Sunday brunch. Eggs Benedict served original, Royal or Florentine have a spicy just right Bloody Mary. Afterwards we toured the hotel, in awe over the decor,conference room and screening room with beautiful bright orange chairs. Pet friendly with a lovely picture of NYC neighborhood dogs. A delight to visit

I was in New York City for the first time and I chose this hotel. I was expecting a very good hotel and it was much better than I thought. The restaurant was excelent. When I will go back to NYC I’m definitely going here.

My home away from home. One of the best hotels in NYC. It is a privately owned small boutique brand. They own this property and another in NY and several in London. Overall in terms of hospitality, service and the unique space I give it a solid 5 stars. You should try their hotels on your next trip to London.

We had a long weekend in NYC and chose Crosby Street Hotel on the basis its location (close to some premium shopping, restaurants, etc.) We had an absolutely wonderful time. The staff was extremely attentive, and the room was super, super comfortable and beautifully appointed with great views. On-site amenities were extremely nice as well--the drawing room is a great place to hang out and the restaurant always available for the folks staying at the hotel. I can also recommend the concierge service as being incredibly responsive and helpful even before we arrived, they helped us find spa services that meet our schedule for the trip. Awesome, laid back staff, with deep knowledge of the area. Very easy to hang out at the Crosby Street Hotel!
user_name:
eerrickson
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Couldn’t ask for a more beautiful, quaint, elegant and wonderful hotel. From the decor to the courteous (always with a smile) staff. We had a deluxe room on the 7th floor. Floor to ceiling and wall to wall windows. The room itself is not large but the windows makes it feel more than big enough. Bedding and bed one of the bests. I seriously want these pillows and sheets (will ask upon checkout!). The location is excellent as well. Right in the heart of Soho. The restaurant is beautifully quaint and we highly recommend. We had breakfast there and everything from decor to service. In summary, this hotel, although on the expensive end, is worth the money if you enjoy a gorgeous small boutique-like hotel with excellent service/amenities in the heart of Soho.

We had a wonderful few days at the Crosby .the staff were excellent ,rooms were nice and large and very comfortable ,we were only booked in for bed and breakfast,and the food was delicious ,the hotel is in a very good position with lots of great restaurants near bye and shopping on your doorstep,if you needed to go further into the city ,Uber was very cheap,in my opinion I would recommend the hotel,

We LOVED this property. Didn't want to leave. Rooms to staff - absolutely fabulous.From our east-facing wall-to-wall black framed windows we watched the sunrise. Those windows are definitely part of what makes this hotel so darn charming. Modern, clean, beautifully appointed in every way - decor, architecture, bathrooms, floor plans, and amenties. Lobby, bar, restaurant, library, sun room, even the hallways, light fixtures and art work, are thoughtfully and beautifully executed. It is comfortable, yet hip in the best way. it's not trying to be. It just is. The staff really stood out as another asset. Before we arrived I emailed reservations about a scheduling matter. I recieved a prompt and helpful responses. During our stay everyone was pleasant and engaging. They accomodated our requests with efficiency. There are less expensive options in Soho. But for my money, the Crosby is worth every penny.

What more could you ask for from a hotel? This charming hotel is a gem! I stayed here for 3 nights and loved it so much I did not want to go home. I wish all hotels everywhere were as great as the Crosby Street Hotel!I also LOVED the cafe and the "drawing room" on the first floor. I will stay at this hotel everytime I return to New York!

Met family here to celebrate the milestone 50th birthday. Wow If the rest of the decade is like this I'm set! Amazing hotel, super comfortable beds. Each room a unique decorative style. Great restaurant and a patio and lounge area just for hotel guests. The icing on the cake the fantastic staff, engaging, helpful, kind and fun. Worth every single cent spent - brilliant hotel full of fun furnishings and color. Pictures of the restaurant.

Our group hosted a private reception and dinner at the Crosby. The entry to the area was right off the lobby and both were beautifully decorated. There were 25 of us. The staff were very professional. The tray passed appetizers were freshly made and painterly in presentation. The dinner was also above par. I was told we had to arrange for an outside florist but I must say, the essentials, food, bar, ambience and staff made for a successful evening. I'm going to consider a hotel stay too next time!

While it's not cheap, this hotel delivers. It is quiet, assured, comfortable, classy and superbly maintained. The public areas are beautiful. The restaurant is a great place to have a meal at any time of the day or night. The rooms are well sized and each is individually decorated. If there are any minor criticisms they are around a slight haughtiness in the restaurant staff and the small size of the bathrooms. But these really are minor and ought not overshadow what is a wonderful oasis in downtown Manhattan.

With its loft-like design and Soho atmospherics, the Crosby Street is easily my favorite hotel in downtown NYC. As with other Firmdale hotel properties, the Crosby Street is built and operated to be casually elegant. Standard rooms are well appointed, comfortably sized, and have floor-to-ceiling windows; the two junior suites I've stayed in were quite large. Worth mentioning - heavy blackout curtains and very comfortable beds make getting decent sleep while traveling a bit easier. Service is engaged and professional. The in-house restaurant is fine, but many excellent dining alternative in immediate walking distance. The outdoor courtyard sitting area is one of my favorite spaces in the City.

This is a fabulous slightly quirky hotel in trendy Soho with the most charming staff and wonderful eclectic furnishings. It is very comfortable and serves amazing breakfasts. The gym is also lovely for an early morning workout. Return to the hotel for a night cap either at the very lively bar or in the quiet of the resident-only sitting room where there is an honesty bar. If the weather is good, you can sit outside in the resident-only patio lit by candle light. Altogether lovely!

Loved our stay here. They have thought of everything to make a guest feel comfortable. Food superb, accommodation excellent and ambience 11/10! Love this place. Staff so friendly and helpful. This is a piece of paradise in NYC with fresh air your room.

For design fans, this is the place to go. Kit Kemp design is in every details. You can feel the love and the passion of the hotel owners who did not save any effort to create such an warm and welcoming atmosphere while providing excellent facilites and top of the class service. Simply perfection. We will be back!

It ticks all the boxes : spacious rooms with large windows, attentive service, great location in a quiet street despite the usually packed SOHO streets, beautiful lobby with amazing art pieces, varied breakfast buffet, nice terrace in the heart of NYC. We'll be back!

We stayed for 3 nights.We had a deluxe room on 8th floor.Beautifully decorated and perfectly furnished with great ambience.Great location in Soho. My only criticism is that there was NO tea or coffee making at all. I don`t think I have ever struck this anywhere in the world before, from a dodgy motel right through to 5 star. When I mentioned to desk he said they could put a coffee machine in for 15.00 a day..I said WHAT do not think so ( obviously just a matter of principle so so at these prices). No mention of TeaHowever place is so good would stay again. We had previously stayed at the Mercer in Soho and Crosby wins by a very large margin

A superb place in a superb city.Location does not have cars driving by all night test has a lovely bar scene at a weekend.Rooms and service are just excellent.This is our second visit and I hope not our last.

Luxury boutique hotel - beautiful, just as shown in the photographs. Attentive service could not have been better. Everything about our stay was ideal and I would definitely recommend to anyone wanting to stay in Soho.

I love the Firmdale Hotels. I tried most of them in London, and when I visited New York I booked straight away. The hotel, the atmosphere, the bar, everything was fantastic. I really really loved the place and I loved the fact they knew me. Next destination is Whitby. Thank you, Firmdale!

This is the best hotel in new York in my eyes. We stayed in this hotel for only two nights we loved it we will be back in 2018 again can't wait for it. Highly recommend the service is second to none. Thanks

I would say this is one of New York's finest hotels. Tucked away on a quiet back street in the middle of Soho. The hotel has beautiful rooms full of interesting and sometimes quirky art. Rooms are well lit and have great towels, robes and bath products. On site restaurant has great food and good scene for people watching. There are several guest only areas where you can relax and read magazines, papers or just chill. Hard to stay anywhere else in NYC!

Everything about this hotel is fantastic! I would highly recommend and look forward to going back in the future. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC!Room service is great and fast. Rooms are beautiful, clean and quiet. Bed is so comfortable. They will provide any toiletries you forgot for no charge. Free wifi!!

Wonderful oasis in Manhattan. Great location.The hotel is really well maintained. Quiet and intimate. Even with all the hustle and bustle outside you hear very little inside this gem of a find.I have been travelling frequently to NYC for over 20 years and this is the best hotel I have stayed in.The staff take real pride in the service they give. The restaurant and bar areas are great and the food beautiful.It is a little pricey but worth the treat.Will definitely stay here again.

This hotel is fantastic! The service is great from check-in to check-out. The rooms were beautiful, clean and the beds were so great that I asked to purchase the whole ensemble. Loved the private bar room - top notch. Can't beat the location.

Planned a getaway in NYC for our 20th anniversary and wanted the be sure the hotel was spot on. Went overboard on the research, comparing all the boutique downtown hotels, down to the square footage/price ratio. I know, too much. Settled on the Crosby after reading a million reviews of all the hotels in the category and feeling most comfortable w/ the Crosby, even though it wasn't the cheapest. I'm thrilled that I did. Not going to say anything the other reviewers didn't, but the hotel is pretty perfect. Pricey, but perfect. Service is an A+ - Attentive but not too much. Room was great. We booked a Luxury Room but they upgraded us to a Deluxe b/c of our anniversary (even sent up some chocolate-dipped strawberries). And the room was ample sized, well-appointed and super clean. Great bed too. The floor-to-ceiling windows were what probably sealed the deal in selecting the hotel in the first place and they didn't disappoint either. And, of course, location was exactly what we were looking for. Would definitely stay here again.

In our experience, this is the best hotel in NYC. My wife and I travel to NYC at least 3-4 times a year and Crosby Street Hotel has become our "go to" hotel in NYC. First, the location (SoHo) and overall ambiance of the hotel is perfect. Second, the rooms and decor are unique and top notch. Third, the service and attention to detail is by far the best we have ever experienced in NYC and among the best that we have experienced anywhere else in the world. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who desires an amazing, first class experience in NYC. We also particularly enjoy the boutique nature of this hotel - the experience is much better because it is smaller and located in a truly unique part of the city.

You feel immediate ease upon entering the premises of Crosby Street Hotel. The staff are professional and have a optimistic and helpful attitude. They helped us with international and domestic couriers and went above in beyond in making us feel as thought they had it covered. The room was open, beautiful, fresh and roomy for New York. Right in the heart of Soho, the location feels warm, inviting and cosy. Breakfeast in bed was delicious too!

Can't say enough positive about this hotel and its staff. From the check in to the check out, perfect! The bed/linens/pillows all wonderful. Stand-up shower with a great shower head and pressure. The floor to ceiling windows are the bomb. And then there is the bar. Great way to cap off an afternoon walking around Soho.

Love this hotel and use it as the standard by which I judge all others. The rooms and perfectly decorated and supremely comfortable, the staff is exceptionally friendly, and the restaurant serves good food. We return every year and the staff remembers us, humors our children, and are generally wonderful. Can not recommend it highly enough.

Oh, where to begin? Let's start before arrival, shall we?My husband and I were planning to attend a party in NYC and since we would only be in the city for a few days, we wanted to stay close to Chelsea, where the party was being held. We usually stay in midtown when in New York, with the exception of an unmemorable stay in a different SoHo hotel many years ago. I wanted to try SoHo again so I was delighted when I found Crosby Street. I was familiar with Kit Kemp's Ham Yard Hotel because we'd had drinks there over Christmas. The hotel was so lovely, I made a mental note to stay there one day. I booked Crosby Street through the Grand Luxury Hotels website, which I highly recommend because of the perks guests receive after signing up for the (free) L Club. I booked a reasonable Deluxe Room and was not too concerned about a high floor or a view of the city because we wouldn't be spending much time in our room during our two-night stay. Shortly after booking, I was emailed by the Grand Luxury concierge. She was very helpful with questions I had and efficiently arranged our transport to the hotel from EWR. A day or so later, I received another email saying we had received a complimentary upgrade to a Deluxe Room on the top floor. Fantastic!When we arrived at the property (transported in a luxurious Mercedes SUV by the friendly Igor), the reception agents were all smiles, warmth, and professionalism. They truly made us feel welcomed. Our agent informed us that we had been upgraded to the Meadow Suite. I was momentarily confused because I had already been informed of an upgrade to the same level of room we'd reserved, only top floor. But I was delighted because I'd heard the word "suite," which meant we'd be in a larger room. The agent then explained that the Meadow Suite is one-of-a-kind and has its own private garden. Nice, I thought. But that was before our porter took us on a tour of the hotel then up to our room. "Nice" is inadequate a word to describe the Meadow Suite. It is large and so, so lovely, with a dominating palette of soft green and taupe. I knew it was meant to be when I saw that the room's upholstered headboard matched the invitation to the party we would be attending, as well as the dress I planned to wear. I just don't know how it could have been more perfect.As for the luxury and comfort of the room, it is flawless. The bed is a dream, the bathroom is superbly appointed (two vanities, a shower, a soaking tub, full-sized, heavenly RIKRAK bath products) and so spacious. Everything about the room is marvelous. The large, peaceful garden would have been an idyllic place for us to have coffee in the mornings had the weather been better. But the floor to ceiling windows in both the bedroom and living room afford such spectacular views of it, we could still enjoy looking at the birds and foliage from the comfortable bed or couch!When we returned downstairs from oohing and ahhing over our accommodations, we stopped by the desk to profusely thank the agents for the upgrade. Then we went into the lovely library/parlor to relax for a bit before heading into the streets of New York. The agent came to the parlor a few minutes later to ask when we would like our complimentary bottle of bubbles sent up (another perk of the L Club). The service all over the hotel is to be commended. Everyone we encountered was helpful, friendly, and seemed genuinely happy to be there and to be of service to the guests. We received the L Club perk of complimentary breakfast for two in the charming restaurant, as well, and were impressed by the food and service. One of the maintenance men working in the stairwell even walked me all the way downstairs to the restroom when he saw I was confused about where I was going. I'd say the only thing the hotel staff were not able to do was help me purchase one of the large RIKRAK gardenia candles, but only because the hotel was sold out of them! I am enchanted by Kit Kemp's design aesthetic and her signature touches all over the hotel will make you want to go home and redo your whole house, perhaps even your whole life! I love racking up great hotel memories and our stay at Crosby Street is one which will never be forgotten. Thank you, thank you!

This hotel is so unique, from the art to the wall coverings and overall design. Great beds, good A/C, great showers in the rooms. The hotel foyer includes an honesty bar and a great little restaurant with back courtyard. The location is awesome right in soho with a Starbucks on the corner and short blocks away from all the great shopping and other places to eat.

This is the ultimate combination of a boutique property offering high end amenities and service equivalent of those at a four seasons. Comfortable, spacious rooms, and a lively bar and restaurant. Superior location. Can't wait to go back.

Staff was generally unhelpful. Doormen frequently did not open doors, did not greet guests. Staff not as friendly or consistent as would be expecteded, with some exceptions. Room interior design met expectations but functionally had serious issues. For example, toilets installed too high for proper use, ones feet do not adequately touch the ground impeding property anatomical use.On a positive note, impeccably designed grounds and public art. Room interior design is very good and consistent with Kit Kemp motif found in her UK hotels, which were a better experience for us.

It was our first stay in a Firmdale property and we were very impressed. The property itself is lovely and very well thought out. The bar off the lobby was always busy but never too busy we couldn't get a drink at it - and if it did seem a bit too crowded then we could use the residents lounge. The room and bathroom were a great size for Manhattan and had everything we needed for a great stay. The thing that really made the hotel though was the staff. They were superb. From the guest services guy providing curling irons for my wife's hair, the doorman going 2 blocks on foot to bring us a cab in a downpour to the maid who on our last day after check-out found my car and house keys in the bedside draw and packed them in our stored luggage they were all fantastic. As an aside, we also are breakfast at their new property The Whitby, it was great and they showed us the suites there and they too looked amazing, but for us, Crosby Street location wins every time.

Tempting to deliver an essay on the robe alone, but will leave it to you to discover this joy for yourself. Every aspect of our stay at the Crosby Street Hotel provided a truly dreamy experience: affable and helpful doormen, location (along the very best stretch of Soho), spacious + pristine bathroom, in-room audio amenities, fabulous restaurant even by Soho standards, wonnnnnnderful mattress & towel warmers for all!

The room we had was large, airy and light. Twice the size of what you normally get for NYC, the big window looking out onto the kitchen garden and the outside terrace was great. The decor and art work are very fussy, which I didn't mind, although it was a bit too much for my companion. Bathroom and shower were A+ with excellent toiletries provided. The hotel lounge and reading rooms were quiet and restful. I was very happy with our bedroom. There were some down points about it: there were electrical plug sockets on only one side of the bed, so I had to buy an extension lead from a local store so that my ipad and phone could be plugged in next to my bed in case I woke during the night and needed music to send me back to sleep. The toilet door did not fit properly and couldn't be locked. There was a gap of almost an inch under the door between the room and the corridor so that corridor noise entered the room and it was hard to keep the temperature to my preference as the room was far from air tight. The staff were very friendly and eager to please. Although, on the last day the concierge gave us wrong instructions to catch the subway to the Air train to JFK and we had to ask the station staff at Spring Street subway.

With a cozy drawing room and leafy green interior courtyard, this small hotel is a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. Beautifully curated with found objects, modern sculpture, and playful art and upholstery you feel as if u r of staying in a very stylish, modern home. The attentive and highly customer service-oriented staff ensure a comfortable and relaxing stay. Bonus - a perfect latte and avocado toast.

This hotel is superb! Just arrived home after staying here for 6 nights and can't highly recommend this enough. Its part of the firmdale hotel group, and has the same high standard of quality as the other London hotels. Its in a great location in Soho, close to all the shops and several subway stops. Plus its not too far from the nightlife in Greenwich village and Chelsea.The staff and service is first class, from the bell boys to the concierge to the waiters in the bar. We got upgraded to a luxury room which was a good size room (especially for New York) and the interior is fantastic, like all their hotels. They have his and hers sinks and a big shower.The restaurant has a lovely bar called The Crosby Bar, which is great for a drink in the evening (buzzy and usually busy) plus breakfast (although more on the expensive side compared to eating out at cafes etc...)Ive stayed in several areas in New York and hotels and this ticks all the boxes for me. When I next come back to New York, I would 100% go back to the Crosby Hotel.

Rooms are incredible, vibe cool. Loved the stay very much. Huge recommend; a breath of super air with vcool staff that genuinely help; but it will costya.. restaurant geeat for vibe; breakfasts are great, lunch only ok (but the rest is the real deal).

Amazing, cozy, boutique hotel in Soho area. Highly recommended. Great substitute for keeping a pied-a-terre in Manhattan. I use it for both business and getaway weekends to NYC with wife. Check-InExcellent staff and friendly greetingRooms:The rooms are large and well appointed. Linens are excellent. My room was quite large and had a very usable desk area to set up for work. Internet speeds are very good. While I was based here for work, the rooms are not sterile. They would be excellent for romantic getaway. My wife and I stay here for vacation trips as well. Lobby and Restaurant:Fresh, stylish lobby. To the left is the hotel restaurant and bar. Excellent food and drinks. The bar is a "scene" of beautiful and famous people in the evenings. I didn't find it overly pretentious though. Even though I don't fit into either above category they treated me very well. Summary:This is one of my Go-To places in NYC if I can make staying in SoHo work from a business perspective. It's a bit of a back-and-forth haul if all your meetings are in mid-town. But it also has that "homey" feel to return to, so that offsets the travel many times.

My wife and I were back up to NYC for another extended weekend. This time we decided to stay at the Crosby Street Hotel. When you walk into the lobby of the hotel you are immediately struck by an explosion of color from the furnishings, nicknacks and beautiful, dog-themed artwork, prominently displayed throughout the hotel. The food at the restaurant is very good. The service from the staff is impeccable. Our room, quite large by NYC standards, was light filled from the floor to ceiling windows, adding to the sense of space, yet incredibly still very warm and cozy in feel. The Crosby has an outside patio where you can dine alfresco, a bar that is hopping every evening, and an overall, decidedly english-hip vibe. All of these attributes make the Crosby Street Hotel my number one pick in NYC, but when you take a great hotel, and place it in the heart of EVERYTHING, that blows the hotel off the charts. This hotel is a winner.

I am obsessed with this place! Kit Kemp and her husband really know what their doing.Feels like home! LOVEThe location is my fav area for walking, eating and super shopping. I'm a designer so I really appreciate the thought Kit Kemp put into making the rooms special and very comfortable.

I went here for a marriage anniversary.First off this is more of a castle than a hotel. I felt like I was a king and my wife was a queen. I love waking up and walking right out onto my own garden balcony. I recommend going here with more than two people at least.

We have stayed at the same hotel in Soho for more than 15 years.......This time we tried out a new place....We have stayed at a couple of the Firmdale operations in London (Covent Garden and Haymarket) and have not been disappointed previously.Neither here.The hotel was immaculate, check-in, the private bar for hotel guests, breakfast, dinner.The room was gorgeous, 11 floor with North-North-East views.No noise.Excellent ServiceWe will continue sleeping at the enemy.

Met with friends and had dinner here Friday night. The food was fabulous. Cocktails were excellent! Fantastic service. Beautiful people dressed very stylishly. Place to see and be seen. Can't wait for warmer weather to sit outside. Will definitely stay at the hotel to experience it fully in the future.
user_name:
DinerWithoutBorders
New York City, New York

review_body: I am usually in New York for business and then tag on a weekend for fun. Have always stayed in five star hotels in Manhattan. This weekend in New York was all fun so decided to stay where we usually end up for shopping \ eating. From the moment we arrived, on Friday afternoon, to a very early departure, ( 4a.m.) on Monday, everything was truly perfect. The décor is so well done I bought the book " Every Room Tells a Story " by co-owner Kit Kemp. The food and service in both the restaurant and the parlor, ( for guests only ) which is open with butler service 24/7, is outstanding. Not inexpensive but a real treat. Will be back.

Very cozy, nice place. Location is great, and not too noisy. Room as well as the entire hotel is beautifully decorated and has a personal touch. Breakfast was at the top; I enjoyed hotel's afternoon tea- it looked quite popular, but not overcrowded.Outside area is particularly nice- just to relax in the fresh air. Staff is always polite and very friendly, having great attention to details. Will definitely come back.
user_name:
sjberg
New York City, New York

review_body: I travel to New York, mostly for business at least ten times per year, and usually for no more than a two-night stay. I almost always stay at a five star hotel on the upper east side. Realizing I usually end up downtown for dinner or drinks, I decided to try the Crosby Street Hotel on my last trip. I was pleasantly, almost overwhelmingly surprised. The hotel is staffed at a very high level, with educated and cheery service the norm. It has the cool vibe of a Soho hotel, with great, youthful decor, an exciting lobby and lounge, a beautiful bar and restaurant (with outdoor patios) and yet...no crazy crowds. This hotel has the warmth and scale of a small hotel with all the amenities of a large one. The rooms are a 9+. Great beds and linens, wonderful housekeeping, perfect bathrooms with all the extras. I can honestly say that I was sad to leave my room the last time. I can't think of anything that the UES hotels have better than this one, and this east Soho/Nolita neighborhood is near or where everything is happening...not to mention that it also contains an outpost of almost every UES stalwart retailer and restaurant. It is my new go-to and I can't wait to go back.

Loved everything thing about this hotel!Location is the best and across the road from my favourite restaurant Balthazar.Gemell at the honesty bar was amazing so we're Chris, Freddy and everyone at concierge and front desk were so helpful.Thank you!Cannot wait for my next visit.

Booked the Crosby for a romantic weekend away with my wife and we were not disappointed. On arrival we were notified of an upgrade to a significantly better room for the duration of our stay. While we didn't try the restaurant we did have a drink in both the main bar and the lounge area, both very nice. As far as the location, staying downtown was a nice change with plenty to do and see!

Just come back from 5 fabulous days in NYC where the snow had me hibernating in doors most of the time. My husband and I couldn't have stayed in a better hotel for the occasion. As soon as we walked in off the freezing 'sidewalk', and were shown the sitting room where we drank ginger and mint tea whilst waiting for the room to be ready, I knew this would be a special hotel.Our bedroom on the top floor was stunning with floor to ceiling windows and views over quirky rooftops.
