The bed, with a choice of pillows, was heavenly, the bathroom stylish and spacious, the room had all the amenities including a Bose speaker, candles and Evian water by the bed. The service was something else...Nothing was ever a problem! I am annoyingly on a complicated diet and they accommodated it to the finest detail (I basically told them what I wanted/ could eat and they created around it) Even on our last morning at 5.45am (!) when we had to get to the airport, they made a phenomenal breakfast of poached eggs, spinach, avocado, tomato and coriander in little takeaway boxes as well as fresh berries with grapefruit and papaya! I can't recommend enough that you stay in this hotel and allow yourself to be spoilt by this haven (which happens to also sit in a neighbourhood of stylish shops and healthy but delicious cafes and restaurants)

The Crosby Street Hotel is a wonderful small hotel on a charming Soho street. The Kit Kemp stylish decor is only enhanced by the fabulous service -- from the doorman to the valet, front desk, restaurant staff (especially the charming Elaine), the staff is exceptional. The rooms are a touch small, but very comfortable and lovely. The hotel bar is lively and the food is excellent. We look forward to returning soon!

Stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary and just loved it. We travel a lot and are pretty hard to please but loved the quirkiness of this hotel. Very cool bar and decor throughout. Rooms very spacious for New York and reception and concierge staff very helpful. Our 2 areas for improvement would be inconsistent service at breakfast (food was excellent) and grumpy bar staff. Despite going in most nights and sitting at the bar, staff did not make much attempt at conversation. And starting to clean the bar at 9pm is just ridiculous for this class of hotel and is done purely for the staff. No-one likes to sit at a bar smelling bleach.

We stayed for 3 nights at this great hotel. It is expensive but you get what you pay for. The service is fantastic from reception through to room service. The rooms are beautiful with the big windows making for a great view out over the city. The bar had a cool vibe and we loved the cocktails. Location is right in the thick of things with easy access to the subway but it is nice and quiet with garden at the back of the hotel a real oasis to chill.Would thoroughly recommend for a special occasion and not so special if you can afford it.

I chose the Crosby for location. Perfectly situated in busy Soho, this charming boutique hotel is beautifully decorated. From the lobby to the rooms, dogs are IT! The rooms are a good size for New York and the bathrooms, beautifully appointed. I was upgraded to the 9th floor. This made for a very quiet room. The service was pleasant (even though the check-in was somewhat slow!) I was traveling solo so decided to try out the bar and restaurant at the hotel as well. The butternut squash soup was perfectly seasoned and the service, prompt and efficient in the restaurant as well. The Crosby is pricey for sure.

Beautiful contemporary art differentiates and complements this VERY pleasant high end hotel in Soho, NYC. The stunning yet understated decor, great rooms, well equipped 24/7 gym provide the backdrop for a wonderful stay. Expensive, but you definitely get a return for what you pay for.

I was eager to stay at The Crosby Street Hotel for a couple of nights because I simply adore the Covent Garden Hotel in London (sister hotel). However, I was not impressed by this outpost.My room was tiny despite it being an 'upgrade'. The picture window though lovely meant I was able to view and be viewed by the occupants of the building across the road. Having to close the curtains for privacy was not what I had in mind. The hotel is located in a road adjacent to Broadway so you are very close to the main drag but far enough not to have to deal with the throng shoppers. The breakfast and welcome gift was nice. But overall I would not repeat the experience.For $550 a night it was a disappointing experience.

Visited in September for a nice cool brunch. The hotel is beautiful, as well as the restaurant area. We chose to sit outside as there was this cute green patio which we loved.The food is expensive, but that is to be expected in NYC. Eggs Benedict were top notch, so was the tea and coffee.We left feeling full and happy :)

The Crosby is a wonderful option for your NYC visit. Located in the heart of some of the best shopping, Crosby offers a unique experience. The bar, restaurant and garden area are all lovely with delicious food and friendly staff. The staff of the hotel is extremely accommodating, even after your stay! I left several items and asked for pictures of their outside walk and they quickly responded with all of my requests. T

I have over the years become a great fan of Firmdale Hotels in London.Although pricey,the quality,service offsets.This was my first visit to the NY location.I didn't t find the staff generally as welcoming nor knowledgable however was informed staff were under training for a new NY hotel.The rooms are much smaller than the Ham Yard in London and my room-had no bath tub-My main concern was a constant rattle from the pipes-which despite informing the engineering dept and they attending -the noise continued-which lead to a sleepless night or 2.Breakfast quality was very good however service was very slow and need follow up and prompting.The manager did visit my table on hearing my issues and was responsive.When you travel a lot small things matter and when one major thing goes wrong you look at things differently especially the price tag you pay to stay here.

A beautiful oasis in the heart of SoHo, the Crosby Street Hotel is spectacular in every way. This was our second visit in the last 12 months. A romantic getaway from the kids and routine and there is no better hotel in NYC for this than the Crosby Street Hotel. The rooms are beautifully appointed and designed with massive floor to ceiling windows. We were upgraded this time to a one bedroom Crosby Suite which is amazing. Everything about the room is relaxing. Service was top notch down to the cupcakes in the room to help my wife celebrate her birthday. The bar is cozy and fun at night and breakfast is delicious. Can't beat the location for shopping and dining. If you are looking for a romantic night in NYC, look no further.

Stayed here with my five girlfriends and we could not have picked a better spot. First, as an interior designer, I absolutely LOVED the decor and am hard to please. It was fun but elegant, but witty! The location was perfect for eating and shopping in SOHO. The rooms were very sizable for NY standards. Would absolutely stay here again!

Stayed here for five nights at great expense. Had a couple of issues with the restaurant, one rather serious. I have only given the hotel 3 stars even though its luxurious because of these problems and the attitude of the manager when dealing with it. Not the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed in, but it was definitely the most expensive. I would probably stay somewhere else next time as NYC is full of lovely hotels.

It has the best location in Soho. Perfect shopping, restaurants, walking area in Soho and close to communication. All the staff are so friendly and helpful, taking care of you in the best of manners. The lobby is so beautiful!

Stayed on 10th floor with beautiful high ceiling and wonderful view. A great experience. Wonderful location. Every detail has been thought through. Maintenence and cleanliness is superb. Interior design is amazing. Expensive but worth it!

Loved this hotel. Am a big fan of Firmdale Hotels. Charming, quirky, cozy.....lovely lobby bar and restaurant. Very appealing. Wonderful bright room with huge windows and views of city. Comfortable beds and baths....good service. They do everything right. Expensive but worth it....Great location!

I took my daughter here to celebrate her 18th birthday. From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out we loved our stay. Friendly, stylish, comfortable, well located, helpful staff. Everything was great. Would definitely stay there again. Very comfy beds and fantastic breakfast in the restaurant.

We enjoyed our stay. Attention to detail was second to none. What a great location. Almost every room we had was different. The restaurant food was good. We stayed for 6 nights and every night was a different experience. The staff was a pleasure.

Was recommended by a friend to stay here. Was surprised at how cool it was when we arrived. Really great location to hit all the downtown neighborhoods. Awesome bar to have a drink at. Staff is extremely helpful. Rooms have floor to ceiling windows that make them feel uniquely New York.

Beautiful rooms. Wonderful service and location. There is unique art in every room and it feels like no other hotel in NY. A true gem. The restaurant is also good. I've had lunch and breakfast there - delightful space and excellent food.

I frequent this hotel several times during the year. I always find each stay very welcoming beginning with the door person through checkin. The breakfast is my favorite, though. Although very expensive, I do not mind paying for the quality served. Each coffee is hand crafted and served b the barista. It's a good option if you don't mind spending the $$$$.

This hotel was absolutely incredible. My family and I stayed in one of the suites and it was definitely the nicest place I have ever stayed in. The room was beautifully designed with amazing views with the large windows. LOVED IT! You will not be disappointed after your stay here!

With lots of hotels to choose from in NYC, the Crosby Street Hotel was a great choice! I stayed here for 5 days on business. Super helpful staff and the hotel is in a great location plenty of places to go near by for dinner and quick bites.

Stayed here this week for a shopping trip to NYC. The hotel is truly the most stylish and inspirational place I have stayed ... fabulous food, gorgeous decor and amazing location .. enjoy if you stay !!

The location at the intersection of SoHo, East Village, NoHo, Greenwich Village and Little Italy is, well, perfect. The decor is sublime. The staff is outstanding. The rooms are large, beautifully decorated, clean, and have the most comfortable hotel bed that we have ever slept in. The breakfast is hands down the best breakfast in NYC, by far. The only problem is that it is REALLY expensive. I still paid a lot after using a $500 gift certificate! Glad we got to stay here!

I use to always stay in Times Square but once you're other the tourist part of New York then the Crosby Street is the perfect hotel. Situated in downtime Soho it's a great location, close walk to some amazing restaurants and a fantastic vibe. You pay for it but it's worth it!

We just had a very large group stay at this fantastic hotel.Rooms are all so different and all so fabulous... the most comfortable beds and the biggest bathroom I have ever had in a New York hotel.The food was just so delicious and the lounge bar a favourite for all our guests anytime of the day and night.A special thanks to Chris our fellow Aussie concierge who looked after all of our guests demands and there were a lot of them..The staff at the hotel were all so very helpful and special thanks to the level 3 housekeeping staff... always smiling and tending to our needs.The location of the hotel is the best in SOHO and overall the best hotel in the area.I loved it here and highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in the area.The design and every single detail of this hotel is unbelievable and a delight to come back to every day.. photos don't do it justice.Congratulations to everyone involved.

From the moment we turned into the side street where this hotel was located we knew we'd made the right choice. slap bang in the middle of Soho, but on a side road this hotel offers a calm from the lovely, crazy chaos. From the welcome of the doorman and front desk to the final wave goodbye, this hotel had it all. Our new NYC favourite without a doubt. Beautifully decorated bedrooms, fabulous bathrooms with the highest water pressure I've ever felt, we had 2 armchairs and an end of bed bench, which meant staying in the room was very comfortable and it was a good size well proportioned room with floor to ceiling windows which made the room feel even bigger. The Crosby Street has that "je ne sai quoi" that makes you feel like your staying in a friends guest room. We loved it! Value for money, if you are expecting the best.

We are in and out of NYC on business quite a bit but finally decided to stay at the Crosby Street. The design of the rooms and common spaces of this hotel are wonderful. Intimate, saturated colors, whimsical. I was so impressed by the room and the level of detail in the curtains, the chair upholstery, and the comfort of the bed. Staying here made me rethink my monochromatic choice of design in my own home since the color ways are so beautiful. Staff was very professional; bar and dining room excellent. And the location is perfect, right in the center of Soho. Wish there were a way to give this place more than 5 stars. Loved it.

I don`t think I can find a single fault with the Crosby- friends and I were there for the NY Marathon weekend. Service was excellent, great touches like small gifts and provisions for the marathon. The breakfast is excellent and room service was prompt and efficient even at 4am....the rooms we had on the 6th floor were spacious and with good views over Soho.We will return....

I have always loved coming to New York but have never found a hotel that I really like, until we found Crosby Street. Almost everything is perfect, the rooms are very tasteful and most of all very quite. The only thing that is not perfect is the waiting time for food in the restaurant which can be too long, but the food is good once it arrives.

My wife and I look forward to visiting NYC in no small part because we love the CSH so much. Like its brethren in London, it's cozy, comfortable, eclectic and charming; the staff is friendly and helpful; the rooms are comfortable and excellently maintained; and the restaurant and other amenities are top notch. Located in the heart of SoHo, it's fantastically located, close to shopping and more restaurants than you can swing a cat at, and keeps you at a comfortable distance from the nightmare that is midtown, without putting you unnecessarily out of reach of places like Times Square, if you really feel compelled to go there.

Firmdale are the best hotel group bar none. Always exceed my expectations, beautifully intriguing decor, warm cozy feeling, luxury home away from home. Unparalleled. Comes with a price tag, but for a splurge or business or just for the heck of it, Crosby Street is marvelous.

This is a lovely hotel, in a fantastic Soho location. The rooms in this Kit Kemp hotel are elegant and plush, upgraded view or not. The only difference I could really see was a great view or a magnificent view of a Soho neighborhood and the gardens of the hotel. I have stayed here three times now and look forward to a return visit. The concierge team is lovely. I was most impressed by their courtesy to my elderly parents. I love having my bed turned down at night--this makes me feel really cared for. I was disappointed that the hotel restaurant didn't have all the ingredients to prepare the menu items on their breakfast menu for a Sunday (goodness!), but in general, while overpriced, the restaurant is convenient. Make sure to visit the shops right next to the hotel including my favorite perfume atelier (their words--not mine!) of all time--Min of NY. It's just down Cosby St.

Magnificent. Unbeatable location - Soho at your doorstep. Fantastic concierge team. Personal atmosphere due to the size of the hotel. Rather "home away from home" than hotel. Nice bar which is crowded as it is heavily visited by non - hotel guests as well and due to that very lively (what I like). Loved the room.

Amazing service on every level.The concierge team are outstanding. Rooms by Kit Kemp are elegant and roomy. Breakfast catered for every whim and fancy in a gorgeous setting. Nothing was too much trouble. Might see a star or two......

Amazing location. Bright light suite. Clean, service quick. The staff were very polite and helpful.... And most importantly honest... I left behind a pair of diamond earrings and the housekeeping have handed them into the management, and when arriving home in the UK I get a call to say they have been put in the safe. Will definitely stay again.

Everyone one of the staff was friendly and professional. I love this hotel so much. One time i need coffee at midle night, i called one guy, then after few minutes , he brought it to me. it's so perfect.

I've always stayed in the Upper East side! First experience of lower Manhattan and I loved it. The whole hotel concept is brilliantly put together.... I felt relaxed from the first minute.... concierge team and front desk are fantastic, the restaurant staff unfortunately seem to work in a different manner. Don't snub staying guests!!!The outdoor garden is a a little heaven.....The rooftop views exquisite...One niggle... the bathroom is on the smallish size.....But definitely I'll stay again, plus I'll go to Ham Yard in London next month to see if they're as good!

My girlfriend and I had the pleasure of staying at this exceptionally beautiful hotel. They exceeded our expectations and even upgraded our room as it was our first stay. The art and attention to detail is as good as we've seen... we will definitely be back!

With so many hotels to choose from in New York City we were delighted to have chosen The Crosby Street Hotel. The hotel's location in Soho is excellent, surrounded by boutiques and fun shops, gourmet food shop Dean and Deluca, and nearby subway stations. Yet Crosby Street is tucked away to afford an amazingly quiet and restful night's sleep. Our room was superbly clean and decorated in a tasteful and imaginative manner with floor to ceiling windows. The bed was deliciously comfortable. The clothed in marble bathroom had double sinks, a fabulous and roomy shower, and heated towel bars. The public areas are charming and decorated with quirky artwork with a "dog' theme as the hotel is dog friendly. The breakfast offered in the "Crosby Bar", the hotel restaurant, is delicious and offers abundant variety. Now to the heart and soul of the hotel: the excellent staff. From the moment we entered the lobby everyone who works at The Crosby Street hotel; the front desk staff, the concierge staff, the doormen, the restaurant staff, the housekeeping staff who kept our room immaculate, ABSOLUTELY EVERYONE was so helpful, warm, friendly, and made us feel welcome and taken care of. Special note; Crosby Street Hotel offers movie viewing nights on Sunday evenings in their spacious theater with popcorn and libations and if you wish a prix fix dinner served in the Crosby Bar before or after the movie. My husband and I recommend this truly excellent hotel in every respect.

This fabulous hotel is on a quiet cobblestone street right in the midst of all the soho hustle and bustle. Great location for shopping and dining. Balthazar is literally across the way, and bond street is just blocks ahead. Amazing rooms and service, totally hip and happening restaurant and bar. Not to mention peaceful sculpture garden plus a funky, private 24 hour drawing room with butler for guests only. Cannot wait To go back!

My husband and I spent the last weekend at the Crosby Street Hotel. The rooms were immaculate and well appointed. The heated towels in the bathroom were an extra amenity we really enjoyed. Service was fast and friendly. The location is fantastic.

Love the diggs- modern and fresh, but comforting and not stark. The location is excellent in the heart of SOHO but off the most crowded streets. The public areas are really,a dn the rooms are gorgeous. I have stayed at the top 15 hotels in NYC, and this is both my wife and my favorites.

We stayed for three nights and didn't want to leave. Great room and super helpful staff.Lots of good places to eat and good location for SOHO.There are several subway stations near by as well.Highly recommended.

What a gorgeous hotel! Each and every corner is so well designed and cozy. Staff is willing to help with anything you need. There is a terrific restaurant as well. Highly recommend if you are looking for an upscale option in Soho/Nolita area.

All round good hotel, great aesthetic and location in the heart of soho. Service was great in most areas, however a minor gripe the restaurant staff were patchy we stayed for 5 nights and had breakfast everyday in the restaurant but the staff never remembered our room number or if we were guests of the hotel.

Recently in New York I enjoyed the exciting ambience of the Crosby. We had lunch in this stylish and welcoming hotel. I own a decorator book by the owner.My meal was gluten free. The "Creme Brulee" flavoured with Morrocan spices served in a Wedgewood bowl designed by Kit Kemp was the best I have experienced. The price for lunch was affordable.

My fiancé and I spent 2 days at Crosby Street Hotel and it was terrific. The rooms are lovely, the decor is beautiful, the service was outstanding and the location is excellent. From the moment we arrived the service and attention to detail were exceptional- for example, everyone we encountered remembered our names and greeted us by name when they saw us. The evening turn down service included a relaxing, aromatic room and linen spray. The bed was so comfortable, the shower was amazing and the products- rikrak- smell amazing. I loved Crosby Street and will absolutely go back!
user_name:
MellieCR
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is an update on the hotel. Nothing has changed since we last stayed almost a year ago. We stayed again this year for 1 week with our teenage kids, the staff all remembered us from our last stay and treated us like family. It has become our home away from home...the wife and kids stopped over NYC again for a few days in August before heading back to Dubai and they stayed there again. They upgraded their rooms because of availability and again took really good care of the family. If you like being in Soho, this is the only place to stay in NYC.

Staff was courteous, helpful, friendly and professional. A little pricey side, but totally worth it. Rooms are decent sizes, quiet and very comfortable. Was here with friends and everyone really enjoyed our stay here. Will definitely consider it when I go back to NYC.

To celebrate our wedding anniversary we decided to treat ourselves to a pre-dinner drink at the hotel bar. It was gorgeous - lovely furnishings, really interesting bar and art and the champagne we had was delicious and a great price. Lovely place to stop for an hour!

All positive attributes about this hotel have been said many times and I concur wholeheartedly.It has to be mentioned again though that the Concierge team (seemingly headed by Chris and Todd) are unsurpassable. Their calm, experienced manner belies their ability to go overboard to help with the most trivial and important advice that you may need.Their breadth of knowledge and expertise is extraordinary. All given to make you feel the most special person in the world and with such good grace.They blow Wikipedia and blogs and Trip Advisor out of the water!Seriously though, coffee in the rooms should be a given.

I love everything about this hotel, from the kit kemp decorated rooms, beautiful courtyard and wonderful service! The courtyard is a lovely spot for breakfast and afternoon drinks. Location-wise, it's close to all the shops and cafés and couldn't be better placed. A gem in the heart of soho! Looking forward to return!

Love this hotel and the Firmdale brand. Have used several of the London hotels and this was the second time here. Great rooms, equally great service. Best hotel bathrooms anywhere. The showers are amazing. Sounds silly, but incredible water pressure. Somehow they manage that in all their properties. Small enough to feel boutique, but with facilities and services of a larger property. Small nits - coffee in the honor bar area in the am would be nice. Bottom line - great hotel and great stay

We loved everything the Crosby had to offer. The staff were very helpful. The breakfast was yummy! The location, well what more can I say, fantastic and just a stones throw away from Dean and Deluca my favourite Deli. Can't wait to visit again.

My teenage daughter and I stayed here for two nights for a mother/daughter visit to NYC. We LOVED this hotel. It is a fantastic small boutique hotel. When traveling, I prefer to stay in more intimate properties and this definitely met that criteria. We have stayed in a number of wonderful hotels in NYC but this one is my current favorite! The rooms were stylish and fun. We were on the 6th floor and the street noise was minimal. Super close to lots of fun shops and restaurants. Highly recommend.

I'm not quite sure how long the Crosby Street Hotel has been in operation, but I'm pretty sure I have been staying there pretty much since it opened. Staff are courteous, friendly and professional. I see a lot of the same faces when I return--always a good sign. Maybe it's the British heritage? Whatever it is, it keeps me coming back. On the pricey side, but it's Manhattan. Rooms are generous, quiet and comfortable. As a designer I appreciate Kit Kemp's style. The Library is a terrific spot for tea or drinks. (I do wish they had a better bar though..think Connaught London..the restaurant was always a little too noisy. I should try it again; haven't been in there in a while.) The neighborhood has become quite fancy now, but it's still a neighborhood, especially if you go east and south and avoid the Soho mobs on weekends. I also require lots of light...the huge windows are a real plus. In all, a lovely place to stay; I'm always happy to be there.

The Crosby Street was my first choice of hotels in New York, however, we didn't book it because it wasn't on the Am Ex FHR program, we booked The London instead, BIG mistake, (separate review on The London!!!), having checked in and out of The London in 15 minutes we booked the Crosby Street Hotel direct. We got a taxi across town and arrived at Crosby Street. Wow, I'm so glad we did!!!! it is truly the most fabulous hotel, the staff are exceptional and so friendly, but not in an over the top ingratiating kind of way. The hotel is quite small, but the design and quality is the best. Everything is of the highest and best quality. The beds are so so comfortable, and one of the best showers ever!!!! I have read a few of the other reviews, and they are all so true. If you are going to New York, definitely give this place a try, you won't be disappointed. Thank you Crosby Street for making our stay so good!!!!

Crosby Street hotel is not cheap. Not cheap at all. But for your money, you get to stay in a beautifully maintained hotel with amazing interior design, courteous staff and real comfort. Our room had floor to ceiling windows, a wonderful bathroom, an incredibly comfortable bed & an impressive amount of space by any standards, let alone NYC. Room rates increase the higher your floor number – presumably for the views. It was slightly irritating to not have access to a coffee machine – meaning that caffeine cravings had to be dealt with by nipping out to a nearby Joe & the Juice or by ordering via room service. And if you needed an ironing board, you had to request one from reception - small things admittedly but not ideal. Do try to get breakfast included in your rate – it’s very, very good but paid for separately it can be very, very expensive. On site, there is a small gym and plenty of communal spaces both inside & out to lounge around. The area is full of shops, bars and restaurants. Balthazar does French food very well & the Spring Lounge is a nearby dive bar with class. We enjoyed both.

Our go to hotel in NY.It always feels like coming home.We love the location in the heart of Soho and the eclectic, witty interiors but most of all the staff. Especially the concierge staff who are knowledgable and delightful.In addition Crosby St is a fairly quiet road in amidst the noise and bustle.

Nice place where I to stayed for a couple of weeks. The staff are very kind and the suite was Amazing with a gorgeous view. I would have liked to stay more, but work in Los Angeles is waiting for me.See you soon because from now on this will be my Hotel in New York.Best regards Francesca Lustrissimi

Everyone who stays at that hotel should feel blessed because it's one of the best hotels with a top notch hospitality!! Everyone was very friendly and made you feel at home from the first minute!! The reception staff is great and the concierge as well. They helped us with anything we may have asked for and sometimes even before we ask for it... Amazing! Our room was just great, extremely clean and absolutely flawless. We ordered three times room service because we didn't want to leave our room! That's something!! A big thank you to everyone and though it's not easy we will do our best to visit you guys and your extremely perfect hotel again sometime in the near future!!

Fabulous hotel, great location, place to be! Would highly recommend in particular for couples and if you have a dog they are welcome too. Rooms great, beds super comfy, we can't fault the hotel at all! We are looking forward to returning and spending more time in New York

We stayed at Crosby Street hotel as we are great Firmdale fans and often stay at the Haymarket Hotel in London.Stepping through the doors in arrival we felt immediately at home . All the staff in the reception area including the butler for the sitting room were introduced to us by name and all felt good . We ordered room service which was prompt and delicious and settled down for a great stay . The concierge were fantastic recommending museums quickly ordering cabs and making sure we were happy when our helicopter tour was rained off . This was a great experience . Highly recommended .

We stayed at the Crosby street on a friends recommendation and are very pleased we did. Loved the quirkiness of the rooms, beautiful amenities, very helpful staff and a fabulous restaurant and bar.The Crosby Street will be our go-to hotel for any future visits to NYC. The best!

Perfect if you want to stay in a small discreet hotel with out pretentiousness. The decor is modern, the bedding and bathroom amenities are good quality and the location is fantastic for Soho. The restaurant is also very good and serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
user_name:
shellesey
New York City, New York

review_body: Me and my friend been in this hotel this hotel room is really good and the restaurant is really good and the service also good and the restaurant foods are really good test and the staff members are really helpful and friendly and cooperative with guest

Loved the low rise and character of this area on a previous visit so looked for a hotel in the middle of the action. The hotel is quirkily decorated with lots of colour and texture. Although I did read one review that thought the decor was too chintzy for men my husband gave it the thumbs up. Very well located close to shops and restaurants and very friendly staff and service. Fabulous room service hamburger for a late night arrival. Didn't try the bar or restaurant but public areas very attractive and lovely outdoor courtyard. We then stayed a few more nights at the Langham midtown area and thought both hotels had a lot to offer despite their very different styes

My wife, daughter and I checked in to the Crosby Street Hotel with our 4 year old dog recently. Very kind, attentive staff. Great decor and terrific breakfasts. Our room was very comfortable and impeccably clean. The hotel is in the heart of Soho and the staff is great at suggesting ways around town and things to see.What made it truly special was the kindness they showed to our dog. Few hotels allow dogs and if they do its not very comfortable. Crosby Street embraces them. Our dog had his own dog dishes in the room. They lets us eat out in the Courtyard with him. The staff reached out to pet him and talk to him. There are picture of the dogs of Soho in the elevator. It was very relaxing for all of us.We will look forward to staying there again even if we did not have the dog with us,

My daughter and I stayed at The Crosby for her birthday and it was a wonderful experience. This hotel is beautiful, the staff is friendly, warm, kind and helpful. When I mentioned it was my daughter's birthday they surprised her by upgrading our room and sending up birthday cupcakes, WOW!! what a welcome we received. We also enjoyed afternoon tea and words cannot describe how fabulous it was. I would definitely recommend this hotel and say it is an experience that everyone should have. Luxury at its best. I will be returning for another exquisite experience.
user_name:
KeishaGold
New York City, New York

review_body: We just loved staying at the Crosby Street Hotel in SoHo! Everything feels very luxurious, great location and the rooms are just perfect. Big floor to ceiling windows, amazing bed and pillows, beautiful bathroom with a bathtub and a giant shower. It's expensive but if you can afford this hotel you should stay here. Great for a honeymoon or for celebrations!
user_name:
Tversover
New York City, New York

review_body: I have been staying at The Crosby since it opened several years ago. I've probably stayed in every room including The Meadow Suite and the two bedroom Crosby Suite. The arc of this place was "hidden gem" to bustling "euro hot spot" to established "in the know" downtown staple. It has held up VERY well and the rooms appear as fresh as the day it opened.Each room is unique with a lively decor. Walls are upholstered which is an interesting design feature that also makes the rooms dead silent. The neighborhood and the views are distinctly SOHO, not a lot to look at but that is the charm of this place. Bathrooms are well appointed with awesome water pressure and towel warmers. Lobby bar is a great place to end the day or start the evening. The restaurant is a better breakfast spot then dinner although Balthazar is right down the street, why eat any place else?The rooms are definitely pricey but it is well worth it. Upon check in the concierge had arranged for a beautiful bouquet of Hydrangea in celebration of my wife's birthday. They always drop a note of thanks and a gift which was a lovely scented candle. We had the kids with us so booked semi-connected rooms which was perfect and there was a tray of cookies waiting for them. Nice touches.Always call to make a reservation and if they say they are booked, call again. They never seem to get that right.This is my favorite hotel in NYC! For those of you who read my profiles you know I travel well, this place is a must stay.

My husband and I just spent a memorable two days at this impeccable, friendly hotel in the heart of SoHo. Staff was attentive and warm, our room on the 9th floor was framed with ceiling to floor windows that offered a spectacular view of the city with vaulted ceilings and a perfect bed and linens. Welcome bottle of chilled champagne and assorted olives, complementary breakfast, cozy private courtyard...we could go on and on but it would be more of the same. 5 star all the way and we can't wait to return.

My husband and I stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel for 4 nights in late June. It was fabulous in every way. The decor is very special - Kit Kemp is the design director for the Firmdale Hotel Group and she is very talented with a great sense of fun. The staff are very well trained and genuinely seem to love what they are doing. the concierge staff are extremely helpful with securing reservations and offer plenty of tips on great places to see. The room was really nice - very stylish but extremely comfortable as well. The bar and restaurant are tip top - try their fabulous bloody mary cocktail and also the fresh baked scones with cream and jam - but ideally not at the same time..... For me it was a totally inspiring place to stay - can't wait to go back....

To be clear: i love this hotel- one my favorite hotel in NY- and i would go back. The top 4 reasons: i/ Amazing location- near all cool restaurants and shops- but located in a very, very quiet street- this is priceless!, ii/ beautiful, quiet and very clean rooms (and all unique)- the housekeeping team is really doing a good job, iii/ a bit less than 90 rooms which is a great size for a hotel to keep a "at home" spirit, and iv/ really good breakfast (try to have a tariff that includes breakfast). The thing which is not so ok is the service. Whilst there are some really good people working over there, my husband and i were quite "surprised" by the attitudes and behaviors of some others. The lady placing people at the breakfast is an example- she would never greet us with a smile; she would never remember where we like to be seated (or where we don't like to be seated)....and we stayed 9 nights (hence 9 breakfasts!!). The waiter at the drawing room as well was quite a challenge- always had to wait for a very long time to deserve his attention... Thumbs up however for the waiters at breakfast. Can not comment on the concierge team- as we never asked anything... Funny as well that we did not see once the hotel director... Moving forward, Firmdale/ Crosby street should be careful not to rest on its laurels...location and beauty of a hotel do not make everything in the long run...

Coming from London, we are very familiar with the Firmdale brand - and this New York outpost certainly lived up to our expectations. The decor is outstanding: very chic but it also makes you feel at home right away. The staff also contribute to this - everyone was exceptionally friendly and happy to help. We had a room on the second floor, overlooking the main entrance, and were not disturbed in any way. The only downside perhaps is that the enormous windows, as well as letting a lot of light in, allow passers by to look into the room at that level. But there are blinds that you can draw. The location is great - right in the heart of Soho with Dean & Deluca down the street and two subway stations within a stone's throw.

the crosby is 10 stars :) on everything. they are our home away from home in nyc - great rooms (room size, beds, water pressure - note, in nyc this is important), great main and side bar, solid small gym, and amazing service all around. it is not in expensive, but in nyc in our opinion its the best. and we always run into friends from the west coast there.

!st time stay at the Crosby Street Hotel and I am a fan! The fabulous interior design felt more unique and home like. The warm and welcoming staff (across the board in every area) made for a great experience.

Beautifully decorated, with a fabulously trained staff and the hotel situated right in the heart of trendy Soho where your your every wish catered for - what more could you want from your vacation or business hotel?Maybe great food and a stunning bar - well you've got that as well! Take it from me you will love the place and feel you have got great value for your dollar

My wife and I like to stay in boutique hotels. So for this cultural expedition to Manhattan, we chose The Crosby. In summation, it was everything that we hoped for, and the cost reflected that! The rooms were great, high quality and trendy. Since it was just the two of us, the size wasn't an issue, but don't expect the spacious kind of room that you might get for a similar price in other cities (Vegas, San Francisco, etc). We weren't familiar with SoHo, so part of our strategy was to stay at the Crosby, so that we could experience the neighborhood. If you've never been, SoHo lives up to its funky reputation -- trendy eateries, hotels, and shops, intermixed in an active commercial area, and all that comes with it. Ironically our key activities were mostly in Midtown, but it worked out fine, because there are two different subway lines withing a 5 minute walk each of the hotel. Our subway trips to Times Square/Broadway, Columbus Circle/Lincoln Center were inexpensive and quick. The staff in the hotel are very solicitous and friendly. Excellent daily breakfast in the hotel restaurant/bar was included in our room rate. Although we didn't use the library, patio, or roof top, they enhanced the ambiance of the hotel for us. Unfortunately there wasn't a movie night in the hotel theater during our stay, but I suspect it would have been a nice perk. If your looking for a price deal, The Crosby is not the place. But if you are willing to pay for an assured delightful experience, I highly recommend The Crosby.

This is a very welcoming hotel. They definitely have customer service down. Being dog lovers, we were not only greeted by the staff but with dog sculptures,dog paintings,even dog pictures in the elevator. Felt like we were home.Our room(404) was very comfortable with a view of the garden below. It was quiet, nice sheets & bed & good water pressure in the shower.The restaurant food was very good. Hotel guests are permitted to dine in the garden for breakfast. A relaxing oasis in the middle of a busy city.

Crosby street hotel is very trendy and hip! Hotel is nicely furnished with lots details! Love the artworks in the hotel! The location is probably the best in Soho New york area. However, i was upset because the front desk did not inform us that our room rate included breakfast!!! So, we missed two breakfast during our stay. I find it unbelieveable that the hotel did not mention this to hotel guests.

The Crosby is a nice hotel. Gym is well equipped, lobby is pleasant, drawing room is a good idea, and outside patio is very peaceful. Nice artwork. Staff was first rate. Room was not large but well maintained. Room service was quick. The only criticism is that a few times the room service food was below par. We did not try the restaurant. We would happily stay there again.

First, I'm obsessed and in love bc this is a Kit Kemp hotel, part of the Firmdale Hotel chain with roots in London which is amazing. Kit is a designer so her touches are upscale, quirky and eclectic. Score! This hotel has a fabulous lobby albeit small. because it includes some killer sculpture and a living room that would kill to live in. It houses an honesty bar and such charming touches you are apt to stay here all day. The restaurant is terrify', the rooms with floor to ceiling industrial windows, are fab. Across the street once you check in, Balthazar, one of the greatest Parisienne bistros. Even the hallways of this place are charming. My husband and I love boutique hotels so even if life or business take us elsewhere in NYC, we are always apt to book a room here bc it is fabulous and since it its in SOHO, there is shopping and coolio nearby. Just such a NYC experience minus the corporate sprawling hotel chain feel.

The prettiest and most comfortable hotel in NYC.. You feel like your going home after a day of shopping or seeing a show. I have stayed there numerous times and have never been disappointed…. The restaurant and bar is a great place to hang out with family because your never rushed out… I highly recommend it!

We stayed at Crosby St for 6 nights on honeymoon and treated ourselves to a few bucket list restaurants whilst there. In saying that, the food at Crosby St was very good too and made for a great relaxed night when we didn't head out. The magic of Crosby St hotel comes from the warmth of hospitality that the team offer. They are sincere, genuine, friendly and professional across the board. The concierge team excelled themselves in getting us some great reservations and some well judged advice too. On top of all that the hotel has been fitted out to a high standard with everything by design, with hotel guests in mind, whilst adding flair with an abundance of colour & texture. Almost everything at Crosby St has texture to it that you can feel, including the hospitality. Thank you for such a special trip. Love from Scotland x

Lovely boutique hotel with well designed rooms. Stayed there two times already and will surely go again next time I am in New York. The location is great and there are a lot of small shops and bars/restaurants in walking distance. Can recommend this hotel to anyone.

Surprising pleasant hotel bar area. Reasonable prices on Tea and Soda ($5) for NYC Bar. Nice seating and light. Would come here to relax between rushing around the city.Nice decor and attentive staff.

This is the best hotel to book when visiting Manhattan.Perfect location, away from the busy streets, perfect to enjoy the boutique atmosphere of SoHo.The team at Crosby Street are perfectly managed, the service is personable and discrete, always available to assist both pre arrival and during a visit.The restaurant and bar offers an excellent range of cuisine,booking is highly recommended.Afternoon tea is a very special experience, book the terrace if available.The style of the hotel is amazing, as with all Firmdale hotels, they have got it perfect. Every detail has been thought of and you certainly feel spoiled the moment you enter the hotel.A fantastic hotel, excellent location, perfect service, amazing food, great event space.I highly recommend and will be returning soon.

There are some things so good, you just want to keep them to yourself. So really, I should stop writing this review. The Crosby Street Hotel is well located in the heart of NYC's trendy and creative Soho. The decor is wonderful and so full of character with a welcoming drawing room for all guests, a thriving bar and a small restaurant with easily the best breakfasts. I had the burrata scrambled eggs which were sublime and my husband had the English breakfast (a proper one replete with black pudding) and poached eggs on another occasion. Both were delicious. We were also hungry on arrival and were served tuna tartar and burrata with fresh tomato at 11pm in the drawing room. The food was so good, I wished I'd had dinner there on our last night after a disappointing meal at Tao.I wondered if we were in the NYC I'd known before as it was so quiet. The rooms seemed well sound proofed with the only weak spot being the door. Being off the beaten track, I only heard one siren making this hotel an oasis in the city. It's well located for shops with a huge variety from high end Saint Laurent to high street J Crew and Zara. Lots of great restaurants are in walking distance with a great vibe.The service was wonderful. As a Brit, I appreciate it when the staff takes its cue from my more reserved nature and they were helpful and friendly, but never overbearing or insincere. Everyone, from the wonderful night concierge, Noah, to the chambermaids was welcoming. The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in with wonderful mattresses and pillows (we even asked for the details before we left). There was also free and pretty fast wifi which was invaluable as my smart phone is not so clever when out of the country.The worst thing was having to leave. I shall definitely be going back......

We found the Crosby Street Hotel to be a great experience. The staff was very pleasant and eager to please. The location is off the beaten path so it is quiet and peaceful. The food in the restaurant was very good and again the staff was very pleasant and helpful.

Unfortunately for us a brief weekend stay for Mother's Day weekend and to visit one of our children. Wish we could have stayed a week! Service was impeccable, the accommodations immaculate and the atmosphere welcoming and almost home-like. The quietest metro hotel anywhere -- particularly in NY! We had a Deluxe King which was spacious. Bath was large (two sinks), towel warmers (nice touch!). Windows allowed huge amount of light and room lighting was best anywhere. Really nice furnishings. Great city location. Very close to subway stop, shopping and superb area restaurants. We will now stay nowhere else on our trips to NY! Thank you for a lovely stay!

The Crosby st hotel is a Gorgeous boutique hotel in soho. Great location. The firmdale hotel chain hits another high note here, and their style really fits perfectly in Soho. Our room was spacious with floor to ceiling windows and plenty of light. A wonderful bed (staple in firmdale hotels) and a fantastic, large bathroom. All the bedrooms are unique. Nice restaurant, shared lounge and patio. Friendly check in.

We decided to stay in Soho in our trip last December and chose The Crosby.This was our first stay at this hotel and a Firmdale hotel.The central location makes it so easy to move around New York and the hotel is a real gem.The rooms are a clean and a good size with all amenities that you require.The bar and restaurant offered easy food in a relaxed atmosphere. Staff are excellent and always there to assist if you require, but sit under the radar.We will be using the Firmdale Group on our next trip to London based on the wonderful experience in New York. Stephen & Chrissie

My husband and I stopped in for a night on our way to ski in Switzerland. We lived and were married at city hall in NYC 24 years ago. Staying at the Crosby was magical for us. The hotel was our type of hotel. A boutique hotel with class but not stuffiness. We were in love with the floor to ceiling windows. Sitting in bed and watching it snow?! Awesome. The location in Soho was perfect for walking around and enjoying downtown. The staff was excellent and we haven't stopped talking about returning.

Being a very satisfied customer of Soho in London, it was only natural that in New York I tried The Crosby. And I was not disappointed.Same eclectic design of Kit Kemp, same attention to small details and good service. Restaurant very good, noisy in the evenings,but you can have the same menu in the drawing room.

One of the best boutique hotels I've ever stayed at. This is my third or fourth stay at the hotel and every time, it's a unique experience because no two rooms are alike. The beds are really comfortable and the noise levels are really low, although in the busy neighborhood of Soho. The 3 meal restaurant is very nice especially for a quick breakfast meal. Highly recommended!

We stayed here in March. I have stayed in many hotels and this must rank amongst the best. The location in Soho is perfect with great restaurants and shopping outside the door. Everyone one of the staff was friendly and professional. The room, bright ,stylish and beautifully appointed. The bar was edgy and always had a great atmosphere. Breakfast really good, with fresh juices and lots of healthy options. However the real high point was the design and décor. Could not image a better hotel in New York.

I was not an overnight guest at the hotel, I was on the premises to attend a Cocktail Reception Benefit/Fundraiser. This was an AWESOME venue. We were greeted by staff and directed to the rooms for our activity. I took an elevator to the 2nd Floor, very accessible space. The cocktails were crisp, strong, and decorative. Passed food was delicious and plentiful (though fingerfood is not my preference...give me a toothpick for items that are crowded). We enjoyed mini crabcakes, spring rolls, crostinis with seafood topping,various sweet tartlets and a wonderful brownie triangle dessert.Part of our evening was in the screening room. Seating is spacious, elevated, not a bad seat in the room! Staff was cordial and accommodating. Front desk was very helpful after the event, helping with acquisition of cars and directions.I look forward to visiting this hotel, and would love to be an overnight guest one day soon!

to say about this hotel. Great location in Soho. Great artwork. Very tastefully furnished. I've stayed 3 times. The last time I was disappointed as I'd asked for a quiet room but they put me by the street which was noisy

This is heaven from the moment you walk through the doors from a tatty part of Crosby St into the warm welcome, the professional service and beautiful surroundings in the small lobby area. Off to the right is the restaurant area (with a buzzy bar further beyond well away from the entrance) and off to the left is the library where you can sit in relative peace (and get a drink brought to you). In summer there is a courtyard with some interesting pieces to look at as you sip your cocktail.We were upgraded - what an upgrade! To the largest suite I've ever seen. It's probably where the band talk to the manager when they're on tour - easily you could have had 8 people meeting in our living area. The bedroom and bathroom were spotless and cool. There are little touches of originality everywhere that make it feel special.We had decided to spend a few days in Soho so we had the perfect base. It is easy walking distance to several top notch restaurants - eg Balthazar is 50m across the road, the Dutch is close by. But the hotel also has a very good restaurant and the breakfasts are superb, although it can get a bit busy with business breakfasts so you might have to wait a few minutes.Of course all the shops are on your doorstep, and if you really can't find what you want, then the desk staff are incredibly helpful.I could not recommend this hotel enough - although of course this sort of quality comes with a price tag.

This boutique hotel is outstanding in every respect. The front desk, concierge and restaurant staff were superb and attentive. The rooms are comfortable and spotless and the bathrooms are large by NYC standards.The neighborhood is safe and quiet with minimal street noise except for the usual 5 am garbage trucks.No place is perfect so here are two nits to pick.On Sunday we spent the entire day touring. When we returned to our room at 5:30 pm it was just then being cleaned. Yet on Monday morning (our check out day) the housekeeping staff was knocking at the door at 8 am.We purchased a package that included breakfast. For some strange reason, the check for the meals contained the normal food prices. The staff said don't worry, the charges won't appear on the final bill and they didn't. Still, it was odd.Stay here. You will like it a lot.

I recently stayed for five days with my wife. We both loved it. Our room was big, stylishly designed, and had huge windows facing a view of mid-rise Soho buildings and rooftops. There's art everywhere, in the rooms and public spaces. We liked the location--central to everything we were doing, and quieter than other parts of the city. Outstanding cocktail bar. Helpful and connected concierges. Employees who remember your name, say hello, and seem to care if you're having a good time. Really, a friendly and fun base of operations for your New York trip. If there's a weak point I thought it was the restaurant...breakfast was just ok and still very expensive. Overall, "highly recommended" and we'd stay there again.

Check in was quick and easy. They gave me a free upgrade when I asked for a street facing room. (The back of the building faces some buildings and I wanted more privacy.)The upgraded room was spacious and very nicely decorated that made me feel at home. Very clean, and room service arrived in a timely manner. All staff I encountered were very pleasant and accommodating.I had breakfast room service which was delicious. No complaints, comfortable sleep, would definitely stay again.
user_name:
cgasp01
New York City, New York

review_body: Hubby and I wanted to do something special for our anniversary, but since we were both working, we decided to take a staycation at the Crosby. Everything was wonderful, the room was beautiful and outstanding services! Delicious cocktails and food at their restaurant. Since we live in NYC, we are always back at their restaurant. I also recommend the High tea.
user_name:
marianad636
New York City, New York

review_body: Love the Crosby Street Hotel. The room was beautiful and absolutely loved the floor to ceiling windows that allows for abundant light. They have great outdoor space for dining and drinks. The hotel has so much natural light on the inside which is wonderful. The staff were extremely pleasant and hospitable. The location is also great. It is right in the middle of Soho but being on the smaller Crosby ST, it allows for a little more peace and quiet (as much as you can get in NYC.) Even with a full restaurant, there was never a time when the hotel seemed overrun or over crowded with people. As a guest I felt I was always taken care of even amongst the outside diners. Would definitely stay there again!

It was a charming boutique hotel but with mediocre service. We didn't find the staff warm or welcoming, but they were efficient enough to get the job done. Our room was absolutely beautiful with large French windows and high ceilings. Room size was great too, considering we were in Manhattan. Highly recommended.

We aimed to find some hotels with more unique characters in New York and eventually found this interesting property through word of mouth.Located in Soho area with walking distance to the nearest subway station (Spring St.), it was refurbished from a historical building. While you could hardly see it from outside, once you stepped into the hotel, you could find a lot of art pieces with various colours in the lobby.The living room was beautifully decorated, some might find their eyes too "busy" to locate at each items there.After waiting for a while (we went to have lunch at the French bistro Balthazar across the road which was fantastic and packed), we got a room on the highest floor overlooking the Soho area.In fact, it would quite relaxing if sitting by the floor-to-ceiling window and looking at the view.Room size was probably what typical New York hotel offered. Design was less funky than the lobby but still playful.I particularly like the white marble design of the bathroom which made it look very chic.Hotel sent us the champagne and pillow mist as gifts for our special occasions.In short, the hotel seemed to us an upscale version of The Standard Hotel which was suitable fo adventurous travellers who were looking for surprises in terms of design, and of course good for shopaholics since a lot of shops could be found nearby.

Beautiful, spacious, most perfectly decorated room. A super clean hotel with a great bathroom. Superb service and the best breakfast on offer. Great location for window shopping and restaurants. A very happy place to stay.

We were recommend this hotel and it did not disappoint! From the minute we arrived, to the moment we left, it was perfect. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. We were upgraded to a beautiful room. I am usually picky about cleanliness of hotels, but this one was so clean. The rooms are bright and spacious. The bathrooms are large, the shower is great and they have a heated towel rack. Breakfast at the hotel was also great! We won't be staying anywhere else when we come to New York and we can't wait to come back!

Really stellar boutique hotel with fantastic location in SOHO close to major subway lines w access to all of Manhattan. Super comfy rooms, delicious breakfast and brunch service, competent gym, attentive staff. Didn't want to leave, can't wait to come back!

Stayed at the Crosby for two nights on our way back to Europe after a month in St. Barths. Felt a bit down from leaving the tropics, the arrival at the Crosby Street Hotel lifted the mood remarkably. The staff and the service level have never been seen alike. The atmosphere especially in the drawing room is full with warmth and cozyness. The hotel accomplishes the goal of feeling like at home - I wish my home was as lovely as this spot in New York. Would recommend this place for everyone - young couples with kids, business people and for a romantic stay with your loved one.

I've stayed in many, many hotels in NYC and this is my favorite. The location can't be beat. The design (both in rooms and throughout the common areas) is original and perfectly executed. The rooms (for NYC standards) are large and comfortable. The staff is very helpful. I love the amenities they provide! Unfortunately for me, they only work in our corporate travel guidelines if they are having a special :( Otherwise I would always stay here.

My experience of this hotel is simply stunning! Marvellous location. Fantastic area. The Crosby is without doubt the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff, the food, amazing breakfast, the decor this goes without saying. Kit's eclectic collection of furnishings, objet d'art, is visible everywhere around the hotel. If you get the chance to visit do. You will not want to leave!

only got to spend one night at the Crosby, was a recommendation from a friend of mine who is NY born and raised. The location in Soho was perfect and lower Manhattan has so much to offer. This is an amazing place, decor, location, staff all was just perfect. Thank you again Crosby Street team

The Crosby Street Hotel is located in the Soho section of NYC. It is a perfect location if you have to spend time in lower Manhattan, the financial district or any place in the Houston st area. The lobby is quite welcoming. Modern yet whimsical. It is very inviting. Nice clean modern rooms. Modern luxury at it's best. There is a very nice outdoor seating area in a courtyard that will be lovely in the warmer months. The restaurant is spacious and comfortable. It is beautifully appointed with touches of modern glass lighting and interesting artwork. We had afternoon tea.They had a nice assortment of small tarts, little cakes, small sandwiches and really delicious scones. Jams and clotted cream rounded things out nicely. They also have a varied selection of teas. The waiter was very nice and did not rush us. We had a very lovely afternoon. Highly recommended.

Utter perfection in a beautiful boutique hotel. We spent 2 nights to celebrate a birthday. We arrived at noon to find that we had been upgraded to a top floor Deluxe Room, with a bottle of champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, and a hand written note. The room was glorious with floor-to-ceiling windows and artfully decorated. Everything felt like superior quality, from the bed and linens to the shower, to the tiny details like a bluetooth speaker for playing music. Breakfasts in the restaurant were delicious and we made good use of the lounge too. The staff were attentive and friendly. Great location on a quiet street in the heart of Soho, close to several subway lines. Could not have asked for more and can't wait to return.

The Crosby is what you can call a true boutique hotel at its best. Fantastic location, excellent decor, super fine taste in all that's offered. Junior suite is great value, spacious, light-full, super comfortable. Courteous, attentive staff. Had dinner at the restaurant, good service, good food quality. Lively, a bit noisy, so maybe not the best choice to a business dinner. Highly recommend.

We had a perfect stay @Crosby! Smooth check-in, bottle of champagne in the room, delicious room-service, great view over Soho, the best bed ever (you just like melt into it and become one with the mattress ;-)), great breakfast and fantastic neighbourhood to get out! Perfect!

I booked both the Crosby and Four Seasons but decided to cancel the Four Seasons closer to the arrival date based on reviews. Glad I did. The Crosby is an outstanding hotel. The rooms are immaculate and luxurious, with real attention to detail and none of the bland furnishings you find in even the top chain hotels. Staff on the whole were extremely attentive and seemed to enjoy being there. Breakfast was superb and facilities at ground level gave an intimate and exclusive feel to the hotel. It's a fairly expensive place to stay but is one of those hotels where you feel you're getting what you pay for, helped by an excellent location. Hope to be back!

We have been looking for a 'go to' Soho hotel since we no longer rate the Soho Grand. We tried this place in November and were actually there for 11 nights with the business that we had in New York. We loved it. The concierge guys are fab. We felt that we were well looked after whilst we were there and we would definitely go back when in NYC.Thank you.

We've stayed many times at the Crosby Street Hotel and always have an incredible, flawless experience! The staff couldn't be more accommodating, the housekeeping is immaculate, the location's awesome and the rooms are the coolest combination of luxury and chic. During our most recent trip over The New Years holiday, we stayed in the stunning Crosby Suite which has the most extraordinary, gorgeous decor. The Crosby remains our absolute favorite in NYC. Can't wait to return!

This was the first time we stayed here and we loved it. Staff were friendly, the room was gorgeous ( we were upgraded which didn't hurt!), and the restaurant/bar was a fun place to be. Soho is so walkable and being off the beaten path, we were able to get cabs easily to get to wherever we needed to be. The decor is really wonderful and was a breath of fresh air on a dreary winter day. Having said that, I would come back in the summer to sample the patio (for guests only!...) This is a dog-friendly hotel, although I wouldn't bring our dog as what would she do all day while we were shopping and going to shows? But dog people are nice people and the room was very fresh - I never would have known. We had English tea in the drawing room, unlike any stuffy drawing room in the UK, and I highly recommend the french toast at breakfast. 10 out of 10.

My third visit and all is good in the world. Nothing changes, what a relief! The concierge are still the best anywhere, the rooms still great, the location to die for. My only slight gripe is no on demand movies!! As we suffer with terrible jet lag, it is great to while away some hours with in cinema movies. DVD's just don't cut it. Other than that, all is perfect.

My daughter and I decided pretty last minute to head to NYC right after Christmas. We love boutique hotels and were searching for something interesting in SOHO. After reading the TripAdvisor reviews, we decided to book at The Crosby Street Hotel and were we happy we did. The hotel is very fun with whimsical, eclectic and interesting art all over - in the lobby, the private guest drawing room, the restaurant, hallways and individual rooms. The staff was welcoming and exceptionally helpful. I had asked for an early check in, if possible. We arrived just before noon and were told the prior guests hadn't vacated yet. We had no problem with that and headed off to a delicious lunch at a restaurant the concierge recommended. Shortly thereafter, The Crosby called to let us know our room was available. Since they couldn't meet our original request for an early check in, they upgraded us to a room on the top floor. It was spectacular with beautiful furnishings and a dynamite view over the city rooftops. The concierge was again very helpful this time with recommendations on where to shop for a New Year's Eve outfit. The bellman always had a cab ready for us and made a smart suggestion for us to take the subway from uptown to SOHO on Sunday afternoon instead of sitting in a taxi in traffic. We're good travelers and the subway was the best option at that time of day. The Crosby's private Drawing Room was the perfect place for drinks and appetizers before heading out to the theater. Our room was very comfortable and spacious and the bathroom was like new. We will definitely stay here again. We had a seamless trip from start to finish thanks, in large part, to the Crosby staff!

This is a gem of a New York boutique hotel. Another Kit Kemp / Firmdale affair so it's chic, art inspired, classy and quirky with a twist of eccentric. Run like clockwork (I do like a well run hotel. The trick is to do it so it looks effortless) with the usual Carrie Wicks (VP of Ops) insane eye for detail.Tucked away in the cool side of Soho (I find Soho sadly homogenised now with the usual international brand shops - but this little corner by Noho and Little Italy still has the achingly cool indie shops and old New York feel)Fabulous internal spaces and alert staff, great bar and breakfast and impressive lighting (came at Christmas - magical tree in reception) Rooms for New York are generous - I have stayed here a few times and whilst I love the rooms at the front (ask for higher floors to get above the surrounding buildings to see a classic New York skyline !) I had a rear room this time which I loved as it was very quite and cosy and romantic. Very comfortable beds and high end bed linen with good bathrooms and an interesting mini bar.I love this place. You're in the heart of it (Balthazar just across the road) but it's a real haven after pounding the crazy New York streets. Recommend.

We just spent one evening at the hotel and were out for most of it but will stay more nights next time!This is a true boutique hotel - small, charming and the common spaces are beautifully done. Kit Kemp (the designer) is a wonder with color, art and whimsy. It is a happy hotel with interesting pieces everywhere you look. We came into the city early for work and had an overnight bag. We didn't want to drag it around so I called the hotel to ask if it would be OK if our bags came before us and had it sent via Uber. When I rang back to check it made it, she said our room was already ready (that was at 11am!) so it was already in there (room 204). We booked through Tablet Hotels so had the ability to check out late (4pm), and a room upgrade upon arrival & availability. Check in was so lovely but she hadn't upgraded us. When we went to the room, it was a little noisy so we ended up asking her about the possibility for that upgrade. She accommodated and we went up to room 904. The room was spacious and clean although missing a chair (imagining they were cleaning it). The bed was SO comfortable we asked at check out if she could tell us what it was. She had a file right there and quickly made a copy for us. The hotel bar/restaurant was heaving so we chose to sit in the private lounge for residents and they had an honor bar set up which was a nice touch. You just have to sign your name & room to the little book. I had room service in the morning and it was delicious and very filling! Room service was perfect (it's usually my pet peeve) & was no more then 15 minutes and everything was there and then some! The smoked bacon was delicious BTW, I highly recommend it. I'd like to stay again when we have a bit more time to enjoy. Although, I highly recommend it. Very professional service with a friendly and accommodating attitude.

I already wrote about the Crosby a year ago and said : perfectionWell.....perfection again.The Crosby does it so well. I can find no fault, at any level. The comfort and personality of the rooms, the service, the location, the bars, breakfasts, turn down service, bathrooms and linens....all top quality.It is just heaven.

Spent a few days here in July for a mini break. Beautiful place. Attentive efficient staff and spacious rooms (By New York Standards), Great Restaurants nearby too. Highly recommended if you're looking for an upmarket hotel but don't find the generic multi-national chains appealing.
user_name:
Momo197911
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We have stayed at this hotel in New York Four times over the last 5 years- with and without kids. The decor is fabulous - Kit Kemp hotels are incredible and the attention to detail is appreciated down to the gorgeous amenities and linen. The views from the rooms are gorgeous, the size of the rooms are quite good for New York standards.The food breakfast menu/ dinner and room service is delicious. The location in Soho is incredible and the concierge will help you before you arrive to get the best tickets to any show any time of the year. This also includes restaurants - there is nothing these guys cannot do!! I love the Firmdale chain and this is the token US Hotel- cannot wait to see where they decide to open another!! Highly recommend!!

The room though nicely compact was nice with a comfy mattress and though not a fan of wallpaper this one I actually liked. The mannequin stand for coats etc is always a lovely touch which most soho hotels have and I enjoy immensely. Now the Ruinart Afternoon tea downstairs is another matter altogether. The idea and concept are admirable but the execution so poor. First the service. The staff there makes you feel as though they are doing You a favour by serving you and Not the other way around. Then they serve you cold tea even though you specifically asked for Extra Hot tea. To sit there, pay money and not enjoy your afternoon tea experience is not worth it at all. Stay there if you wish because of the convenience of location but definitely try afternoon tea elsewhere in the city.
user_name:
Avantikka23
New York City, New York

review_body: Leave it to the Brits for knowing how to transform eclectic, quirky decor into stunning eye candy. Co-owner and famous designer Kit Kemp has crafted each room into something to behold. There's fun detail everywhere. The inviting lobby alone, with its fabulous art, is one of my favorites in NYC. Afternoon tea is a treat. So is the full English breakfast in bed! Service is lovely. There's nothing stuffy here including the cozy library. The screening room is also a nice touch. Location in the middle of Soho is ideal for shopping, dining and exploring lower Manhattan. It's London-based Firmdale Hotels' first NYC property and its a classic. Stay tuned for their next hotel in Midtown coming in 2016.
user_name:
kikaeats
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a deluxe room which was on the 10th floor, with great rooftop views.Decor throughout the hotel was stylish, quirky, fun and cosy.Breakfasts were lovely, cocktails spot on, and an afternoon pot of tea in the pretty courtyard at the back was perfect.The hotel is in a great location, in Soho but on a side street and as soon as you go in you escape the hubub....it's a cocoon of loveliness!Everything was spotless and the staff were lovely and friendly, professional and welcoming.Yes it was expensive, but you get what you pay for!Just can't recommend it highly enough. A special place.

This was our second trip to the Crosby Hotel. We were upgraded to the Meadow Suite which is, in one word, spectacular. Apart from the room, the service from every single person in the hotel is superb. Whether it be the doorman, waiters, concierge or any other member of the staff, they want only to please and cater to our every need. We also dined in the Crosby Bar for dinner and brunch and, like everything else, it was excellent. Thank you Crosby for yet another wonderful weekend with you.

In planing for a romantic escapade to the city, I stumbled upon this magnificent hotel in the middle of Soho; operated by Firmdale, perfectly located for enjoying a vibrant part of New York it exhibits a magnificent decor and even more impressive level of service; efficient, elegant and everything done with extreme good taste.On our departure we realised that staying here had spoiled most of our previously thought great experiences with other hotels!!, for sure we're looking forward to return.

Phenomenal stay. We had a Junior Suite and it was worth every penny. Service is top notch. Bed and pillows are so comfortable. We loved everything about it. Great bar/restaurant area to entertain local friends. Can't wait to stay there again!

This boutique hotel is ideally located if you like your shopping and eating - surely two of the reasons people go to NYC!We stayed on the 9th floor in a deluxe junior suite that was very spacious and had great views over traditional Manhattan. The bed was extremely comfortable. The wifi was very good.The service we received throughout was fantastic. Concierge are very helpful. We only ate lunch once in the main bar restaurant and weren't disappointed.The hotel is less than 2-mins walk away from the main shopping on Broadway. Not much further out is an array of restaurants in SoHo and TriBeCa. Little Italy is only 5-mins away while we also walked down to Wall Street and across to Pier-25 within 20-30 mins. The subway up to midtown and Central Park is also only a couple of minutes away.A lovely hotel that will be top of our list when we next visit.

We stayed at the Crosby Street in November 2014.We fell in love with the energy and the design of the rooms.The view was simply breathtaking.The breakfast was great and really fresh.We will be back this Christmas.

Just back from 4 nights with a pal staying at the Crosby Street Hotel. Really lovely hotel in the heart of SoHo - we had a room on the 10th floor and the superb floor to ceiling windows give fab views over lower Manhattan (and amazing sunrises!). We were happy to share the king size bed but a foldaway bed was also available. Nice touches in the room include the wireless bose dock and complementary water every night. The bed was super comfortable and lovely thread sheets. The staff couldn't have been more helpful with advice and information. Complementary cocktails x2 were also a very nice touch and a good excuse to visit the lovely bar. The location makes access to all the sites (and shops!) of downtown only a few steps way and lots of great places to eat and drink nearby. We will be back!

I stayed at the Crosby St with a friend to celebrate a birthday - we decided to treat ourselves to a stay here and were delighted with our choice. We had chanced across the Bar a couple of years ago and decided to come back and stay this year. We had a room on the 10th floor with stunning large windows and views - the bed and the linen were so comfortable, the bathroom fabulous - great large flat screen TV, USB docks and Bose wireless speakers were all great touches to make the stay memorable. The room was impeccably clean - no dust or dirt anywhere during all of our stay. The concierges were all so helpful, as were the front desk staff. We had some cocktails at the buzzing bar, definitely a place to people watch! The drawing room is a lovely sanctuary for residents ..Would love to come back and stay again - this is truly an oasis of calm in busy Soho.thanks to all for a wonderful experience

Had a great week at this hotel. The location/service/facilities/room/decor/and gym are all first class. First time at the hotel after staying in various NYC hotels in previous visits but the Crosby wins hands down. Top level of service from all staff helped make the trip a memorable one!

The sculpture the arts the lobby the rooms the outdoor patio the themes the cuisine by chef Paris the concierges at this posh Brit Boutique hotel in the heart of Soho will transport you in a set of a Bond like movie, in fact if you happen to spend a week end there do yourself a favor book the dinner and the movie for the 8 o'clock session right there in the "sous sol" a beautiful 100 seats theater the ultimate experience highlight .
user_name:
PascalPicks
New York City, New York

review_body: We spent a week at the Crosby Street Hotel in early October. It was perfect in every way, and I can't imagine staying anywhere else when I return to New York. Location is amazing -- in the middle of Soho, but so quiet and peaceful. The room and bathroom were large, bright, and gorgeously decorated. Service was great too -- genuine and warm.
