What can I say and where do I start? 8 nights in our favourite city at our new favourite hotel- home away from home! Amazing service, perfectly understated and unobtrusive. Loved it so much that I am staying there again, while at work in USA. Do stay at this superb hotel and let it spoil you! What makes it what it is- you got it right, the people who work there indeed! Can't wait to be back.

I stayed 4 night in this hôtel and i had a Very Nice moment Big rooms with lot of light in a Nice english style The staff is very gentle and helpfull Wonderfull breakfast Very good situation You have also a nice terrasse and a drawing room Where you can relax

Love love loved this hotel, spoilt from the moment we pulled up in our hire car , customer service exceeded expectations , all staff happy helpful attentive to our every need. The hotel feels sumptuous without being pretentious , comfortably setting artworks at every glance and tasteful decor and comfortable furniture to chill out on where ever you chose to relax , a stylish lobby, a private sitting room , a lovely outside space, a fantastic breakfast / lunch / dining restaurant, our room was beautiful just sooo comfy and relaxing, plenty of room for all our luggage etc. We can highly recommend and can't wait to stay again.

Loved my stay!!!!! So beautifully decorated and so clean! The staff is incredible!!!! Todd was so helpful in getting tickets for whatever we needed! We will stay there every time we come to the city! Thank you for making our stay so wonderful!!!!!

We have not stayed at the Crosby Street since it first opened, but decided to return after having such a great experience at the Ham Yard Hotel in London. Like the other Firmdale Hotels the decor is lively and engaging. The guest lounge on the first floor very much feels like a private club. The outdoor courtyard is also an oasis that is perfect in warm weather. We had a room on the 11th floor facing away from Crosby Street, very quiet with a comfortable bed, lots of light, and good a/c, as you would expect. The restaurant decor features engaging and quirky art, great lighting, and is quiet enough for fairly private conversations considering its popularity. The menu is rather fussy but they will prepare as requested and are happy to leave out many of the ingredients. The nice atmosphere makes it worth it. The hotel is in a great part of town, right in the middle of Soho/lower east side neighborhoods with great shopping and restaurants.

A great hotel in the heart of Soho. We had a very comfortable bedroom with a beautifully appointed bathroom. The bar and restaurant area were buzzy and there's a very nice residents lounge with a bar based on 'trust'. Dogs play a big part of Crosby St and are very welcome!

Took a quick trip here to celebrate our 5th anniversary. He "happened to mention" that on his booking form, and when we arrived they had upgraded us one level - such a nice gesture. As always, the room, bathroom, public spaces, restaurant & bar, garden, etc. are impeccably maintained, comfortable, and charming. And also as always, the staff are pleasant, helpful and act as if they were put on earth to make my day run smoothly. You sleep like you're in a cocoon here, probably because the walls are padded with fabric, but then you step onto the street and you're in the middle of Soho! Love this hotel, will return and return and return I bet.

I gave a one night stay to my son and his wife for this 30th birthday. It turned to be a great selection. Contemporary design, great location in SOHO, close to Greenwich Village, a block off the main streets. The staff was superb and provided a room upgrade and a complentary welcome gift. The room was spacious and nicely appointed and the included breakfast was delicious. The outdoor space was very nice and the "Library" is a wonderful feature with convenient access to a few self-serve liquors and wine.

Gorgeous Kit Kemp eye candy combined with a lovely staff and excellent food.Sun filled beautifully designed guest rooms plus public spaces that could not be more inviting. Stunning outdoor spaces which provided resort like dining and relaxation.I really didn't want to leave the hotel. It's a cliché but it doesn't feel like a hotel, rather a comforting private retreat from the bustle of NYC. I'd return just to stay in the hotel.

If you want to be downtown the Crosby Street Hotel is an outstanding choice. Located in the heart of Soho on a relatively quiet street the Crosby Street met all of our expectations. From the hotel it is easy to access all that Soho offers and you are a short walk or subway ride away from West Village, East Village or Meatpacking. Rooms are comfortable and modern with a charming and distinctive style that is characteristic of the other Firmdale /Kit Kemp hotels (I have also stayed at the Coventry Garden and Soho properties in London). Service is excellent and friendly without being in any way overbearing. Staff makes an effort to get to know and remember guest names and small details clearly count here. Rooms are attended to as soon as you have left, breakfast and lunch are worthy of the visit and staff were quick to respond to special requests. The concierge was able to arrange a quick doctor visit for us at a nearby office within minutes of our inquiry. A request for an iron and ironing board brought the desired items to our room in less than 5 minutes. The gym is small but comprehensive with pretty much everything you could want for a workout. We made use of both the courtyard garden area and the drawing room from which you can order room service items 24 hours /day or make a late night drink from the honor bar. Having stayed at dozens of luxury New York hotels over the years Without having ever found a favorite I can now say that my search is over. I will make every effort to stay at the Crosby Street in the future and would recommend it to others without reservation.

We stayed 2 nights and we could not fault The Crosby! Staff were fantastic, polite and helpful, the rooms are just divine! Fun bar and the food in the restaurant is delicious! Great location in the middle of Soho! We absolutely loved this hotel and we will be back!

We decided to stay here after trying two of the London hotels of the same group and we did the right thing!It's just the perfect place to stay for an holiday in NY, the location is great, in the heart of Soho but quiet.The rooms look great and all the interiors are nice and original.We also had dinner there and it was good so it was the breakfast.Staff and service are super too.I tried to find a flaw but I couldn't so… God save the Crosby!!

This was our first time at the Crosby and it is now our go-to-place. It was well worth it and we realized we love SoHo. We typically stay in any of the high-end hotels whenever possible, and I'd now take Crosby Street over any other 5-star place. (If only we knew what we've been missing by staying elsewhere.)The staff was excellent and seemed genuine and authentic, from check in to departure. Although we didn't have an opportunity to really check out the restaurant, breakfast in the hotel was just as expected--perfect and realxing. Room service just as one would have hoped as well. The suite we had was far above what I expected and very well appointed. We won't hesitate to return. Thanks

The best afternoon tea in NYC by far. Having lived in London, I've been very spoiled when it comes to knowing what a good afternoon tea is. Here in NYC, I've been disappointed not to find a single worthy afternoon tea. The Plaza's tea (twice) was poor (with stale bread, amazingly); the Pierre was unexceptional, dull even; the RItz-Carlton's was a calamity; Lady Mendl's was the best of the bunch, but only passably charming (but still mediocre). Then I discovered the Crosby Street Hotel's afternoon tea. Goodness! THIS is how afternoon tea is done properly - and with aplomb. I would actually call this a sort of 'rock-and-roll afternoon tea', while carefully acknowledging the sacred rules of the afternoon tea ritual. Being a little 'rock-and-roll' (the afternoon tea, not me), I wouldn't therefore have expected to like it (my preferred choice in London, for example, is the Ritz). However, this afternoon tea just knocked my socks off entirely - a careful marriage of rock-and-roll panache with tradition, elegance and the greatest sophistication. By the way, I've never tasted a better blending of matcha and white chocolate (their mini tiramisu) - my taste buds could only think "crikey!!" for the next 5 minutes, and in a very good way!Every single aspect of this afternoon tea was flawless (including Kit Kemp's china designs, and the treats/cakes, each of which left my taste-buds in a riot), but a special note for the Marigold tea: the most sacred of all principles when it comes to afternoon tea is that the anchor - the tea - should never be eclipsed by the food and should easily be able to hold its own against even the most astonishing, ravishing treats. Rarely does that happen (at least here in NYC) - and this Marigold tea simply stole the show. There is no need to go anywhere else for afternoon tea in NYC.
user_name:
WhatcanIsay_10
New York City, New York

review_body: In previous years when we traveled to NYC, when we were without kids, we stayed in hip boutique hotels and then later in life with young children we stayed at the luxury chains on central park to take advantage of the child friendly location and creature comforts. Now that we have young teenagers - shopping, dining, shows and "city" experience becomes our new reality and requisite for our stay. We laboured over various choices and we decided to stay downtown. Amidst the bustle of Soho we discovered a little haven, place of delicious respite called Crosby Street Hotel. This is my first time stay with the Firmdale group of hotels and from our experience not the last. Staff were very courteous and helpful. The rooms were very well appointed, clean and quite spacious for NYC. We loved the guest lounge/drawing room where we would relax after a fruitful day of shopping and touring, whilst late at night we would indulge in a nightcap.Breakfast every morning was brilliant, quite filling! Our kids loved the place and the interior lobby setting was a visual delight with sculptures and artwork. We called a head of time to the concierge to arrange for dinner reservations and shows. They were able to accommodate most requests, but fell short of getting a reservation for the restaurant we wanted, but at least the consolation prize was our old favourite, Per Se, so not a total bust. It was easier and more cost effective for us to get our own broadway tickets. I would say that the concierge service we received was competent, but I would think it definitely has some room for improvement. The views from our rooms were spectacular and the high ceiling with almost floor to ceiling windows rounded everything nicely. Of course the highlight is to go to the rooftop garden/farm to see the produce that is grown for the restaurant as well as chickens for the eggs! Loved the place and we would stay again without hesitate when we come for Christmas! Great hotel, zero pretense and attitude which you typically encounter in other NYC, but not here. Absolutely loved the place.

Can't rave enough about this hotel, my wife and I travelling through US and we're extremely lucky to come across this gem!Hotel is perfect in room quality and service of all the staff we have met.It's not cheap nor should it be!! A lot of thought has gone into the design and facilities. I look forward to returning soon!Possibly this is our favourite hotel anywhere we have ever been !

Room 709 is absolutely my new favorite place to be when staying in NYC! I just hope i will be able to have that room forever...The Crosby Street Hotel is a chic, upscale, dog/pet-friendly boutique hotel with tons of personality and class. The rooms are surprisingly quiet despite the wonderful floor to ceiling windows. I believe they must have had some special windows installed that really keep out the city street noise. The beds are uber comfortable and the bathrooms larger than normal New York bathrooms. The staff is impeccably trained and there is absolutely nothing I would say needed improvement! The restaurant downstairs is deliciousness from the first bite and the decor is cool and comfy contemporary. I love love love this place, and will be sure to return.

The Crosby Street Hotel is a joy. Attention to detail should be its middle name. The rooms or at least the ones we've been in are uniquely decorated and couldn't be more perfect. They have taken pains to avoid the usual hotel design and it shows. It is not for those seeking bargain accommodations but if you are seeking comfort and a respite from the city, this is it.

Located in a quiet yet very central location in Soho, the Crosby St Hotel is very close to perfection. Great ambience, terrific design by Kit Kemp (including very interesting artwork), perfect rooms, outstanding service, Gold Leed certified, two great patios, everything about this hotel is top notch and appealing. It even has its own cinema! Been to a few 5-star hotels in Soho: the Crosby St out does them all by a mile.

we stayed many times in this hotel and every single time is the perfect one.we find really cool the location and the greates decor. The restaurant could improve but in general is very woth the money, excellent

We stay often at the Crosby's sister hotel in London which we find really cool and great decor and location so we thought we would try the Crosby in New York for a 3 night stay.Its not cheap and our $700 pn room was very small compared to your average US room albeit exquisitely decorated.Normally in quality hotel your toiletries get changed each day - not at the Crosby they obviously watch the pennies ! - very small bottles of shower gel etc and even when there was half left they were not replaced and we ended up using our own toiletries on 2 occasions - not what you expect in a $700 room.We asked to check out late and we could only be extended until 12:30 and there are no facilities to change or shower once we checked out. As in London there is a great resident only Drawing room to relax in and a honesty bar for late night drinks. The day we left I was sat in the middle of 3 people with laptops out talking loudly on a conference call . After 30 minutes I could put up with it no longer and went to reception to ask they be told to move to a meeting room - to be fair the manager came in and asked them to move but they said the waiter had said it was OK - it turned out they were non residents. The breakfast is great and dinner was pleasant. My big issue and the reason for marking this hotel as poor is the concierge - an important resource when travelling and I would assume they are working for the benefit of the guest - not so at the Crosby - we asked for some suggestions re what was on and one suggestion was the play - "The curious incident of the dog in the nighttime" we asked the concierge by mail if they could sort tickets for us when were in Vegas en route to New York - they came back to say they could get us best tickets on the Saturday performance through their 'Trusted Broker" for $450 each !!!! - when we got to NYC I went online to the Theatres website and got the exact same seats for a total of $331rather than $900 . I will leave you to form your own conclusions.

This was my second Kit Kemp hotel experience, and I am very glad I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel. As the name suggests, the hotel is on Crosby Street in Soho, parallel to Broadway and nestled in between Spring Street and Prince Street. The location is fantastic - you are in the heart of Soho, which makes this a fantastic base for shopping, dining and sightseeing. On several occasions I would pop out to one section of Soho for an hour, pop back to my room to drop off my shopping, go to another section, pop back again etc. This is great to be able to do in the summer heat of NYC!The room itself was immaculate, with a lot of space - an absolute rarity in NYC, though you do pay for it in the room cost, and the bathroom was quite small - the room is well-appointed with a good sized wardrobe, very comfortable bed, mini-bar, and writing desk. My room faced onto the street but there was no street noise at all - amazing when you consider that you are right in the middle of noisy Soho!Service was good, not excellent, though I found this common across many places in NYC - hotels, restaurants, bars alike. In the restaurant, for example, I found that the staff unhelpful - for example, the details of what was and what was not included in the continental breakfast were not explained. One day I had a bill for $30 for drinks with breakfast, another day they were included - and it was only on check-out I saw drinks were included. This is something simple that would make a big difference. I will definitely be back to the Crosby Street Hotel - it's a beautifully appointed hotel, in a great location, and I felt absolutely at home in my room.

My daughter and I shared a dinner together here. The restaurant on a Tuesday night was bustling and a bit noisy from the sophisticated customers at the bar. Thus, we selected a cushy table away from the noise and shared the glazed salmon dish and organic green salad. Both were divine with farm-to-table freshness. We ended the night with coconut sorbetto that was outrageously good! We loved our meal so much we made a reservation to return later in the week.

Simply is the best Hotel in NY i ever stay at, and i´ve stay in a lot of places in New York, everything is very good, the breakfast was superb, overall we had a great experience, the service was awesome and all the design from Kit Kemp was amazing, probably next year we are going to end up at the Crosby, can´t wait to go back.

We went to Crosby St on a recommendation and after great experience in one of their London hotels in Knightsbridge. Crosby St is our new best hotel in NYC by far. Its a very hip and cool hotel but first and foremost, run very professionally and to the highest standardsPluses *The WOW factor in the public spaces - guest only lounge with an honor bar, outdoor patio all with incredible and tasteful artworks everywhere* Staff are all very friendly AND helpful Nothing is too much trouble* Restaurants and bar is a lovely blend and mix* Rooms are superb with great bathrooms and attention to detail everywhere - and the art is just lovely* Location is in the middle of all the lower east side / Soho action and everything is right outside the front door in easy walking distanceMinuses Couldn't really fault anything at all This is a really class and amazing property. Love it

Stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel this weekend for a fun mother-daughter weekend in Soho. We both quickly agreed it's one of our favorites ever. We had booked a standard room on the second floor but were upgraded to a deluxe junior suite on the sixth floor, which was so luxurious but in a super-comfortable way. We both decided that we would very much like Kit Kemp to design our homes, what with the effortlessly chic and cozy decor all throughout the property.From top to bottom, this hotel has been flawlessly thought out. As many others have said, once you enter the hotel, it feels a lot more like being in a beautiful country retreat than a city hotel one block over from the bustling main artery of Manhattan's downtown. Our room was incredibly spacious, and stunningly laid out, all done up in deep reds and whites, and giant industrial windows. Such a nice little (silent!) oasis from the loud city. I can tell you honestly, the pictures on the website don't do the design of this hotel justice. Everywhere you look they have thought of everything. Charming dog paintings in the elevator, artwork and printed framed storybook text in the bathrooms...it's a joy to walk around and 'explore' the little things left for us to find. Artwork, furniture, linens: everything is absolute top quality but really approachable as well. What resulted was an experience from top to bottom that was relaxing and luxurious, yet felt fun and quirky at the same time.We had breakfast in the Crosby Bar both mornings, as it was included in our room, which we would highly recommend doing. The crowd seemed predominately European, and although the prices were very high, we could order whatever we wanted as part of our package. The buffet of fruit and granola was SO yummy, the french toast out of this world, and the smoked salmon bagel incredibly generous with its helpings. My favorite thing about the Crosby is its character...there are no shortage of sterile New York hotels that all seem the same as the next, but the Crosby is totally unique in its comfort and almost homeyness, and in its quirky colorful design and little details. There are so many nooks to sit and have a cup of tea or an intimate conversation, and the whole hotel feels very personal and warm. I do have to agree that the service as a whole at this hotel, though we thought it was good, does feel very "young," as most of the employees we encountered were in their twenties and somehow lacked the "seasoned" feeling of older employees at other hotels. The young energy goes along with the new, modern feel of the hotel, but the service doesn't compare to other establishments in the similar price range.Our only few qualms were the fact that our room didn't have a bathtub, the hotel didn't have a pool, and the difficulty of getting a cab on the side-street where the hotel is situated. We were in a hurry to get my grandmother to the ferry and the porter had to run out to the main street to see if he could find a cab. We ended up waiting too long and calling an uber ourselves, but in general this is kind of an inconvenient feature that most NY hotels don't have to deal with.Overall, we loved our experience at the Crosby, and can't wait to come again and experience its whimsical charm, or to try out some of Kit Kemp's properties in London.

Well what can I say other than amazing. We went to New York at the last minute to get married! We stayed at the Crosby and they went out of their way to ensure all of our needs were met. They found me a stylist who did my hair and make up, she went beyond my expectations. They sorted our car hire and driver for the day. They recommended a fantastic French restaurant for our romantic wedding meal, just the two of us. When we arrived at the restaurant the Crosby had ensured that we were served 2 glasses of champagne on arrival on them, nice touch! The hotel itself is really lovely. Our room was beautifully decorated and we had floor to ceiling windows with a great view of NYC. We had a great meal in the restaurant and some fabulous cocktails at the bar. All the staff were superb, great attitudes, super helpful and friendly. The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect. You must try this place!

This was our first stay at the Crosby Street but we have visited Soho, Charlotte Street and Covent Garden Hotels in London. Has exactly the same feel and standards as the others. Delightful staff with nothing too much trouble for any of them. Rooms have every convenience and we loved the floor to ceiling windows which meant we had lots of light. Quiet and peaceful but full of atmosphere and we would recommend to anyone staying in New York. Service slightly patchy at breakfast but otherwise a faultless stay.

My husband and I have stayed a few times at the Crosby Street Hotel and each time has been fantastic. The location is perfect. The cobblestone street is quaint and makes you forget that you are in the heart of NYC for a moment, but then you round the corner and everything is at your fingertips! Shopping, restaurants, people watching, etc... Our room this most recent visit was on the 11th floor and had a great view, fabulous bathroom, and amazing amenities! The courtyard of the hotel is incredibly relaxing and inviting. The staff is helpful, kind, and not at all pretentious, which could easily be the case with a hotel of this caliber. This is our go-to hotel in NYC and I can't see that changing any time soon! Must visit Parm for lunch (around the corner on Mulberry Street)... it's insanely delicious!

Warm and cozy hotel in a great area in NYC. Very good breakfast, in great looking restaurant. The rooms are on the smaller side but well done. Good concierge service. We would go back, location is great.

Without doubt, our favourite place to stay in NYC. Friendly and attentive service, and a very helpful concierge - nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are beautifully decorated, good quality linen and the beds very comfortable. On this last visit our room was close to the service elevator but we didn't hear a thing.

We have stayed at The Crosby Street Hotel many times since they first opened. We stay here every chance we get when we are in NYC, if it is not already booked. The experience, the hotel, and the service is consistent and as good as it gets. This is the only hotel that I have stayed at in NYC and there have been many, that I do not hear the noise of the city from my room. It is a calm, quiet, and restful place to be after the spending the day and night in the exciting city. The floor to ceiling windows in the rooms make even the smallest accommodations feel large. The design of the hotel is current and chic. We always enjoy the Crosby Bar for its vibrant scene and delicious food and cocktails. This time of year the outdoor garden is a lovely spot for drinks and snacks. It is wonderful to see so many familiar faces on each of our visits.The only negative is that I completely miss their signature scent by Miller Harris that they are no longer using. The entire hotel used to have the most wonderful and distinguished fragrance. The hotel still smells nice, just not what I was used to for so many years.We look forward as always to our next return to NYC and The Crosby Street Hotel.

New York is just about my favourite place on earth.The people, the passion, the purpose all invigorate and inspire me.The Crosby has been on my list for quite some time. It lives up to all its accolades.The team are warm caring with fabulous attention to detail. The interiors designed by Kit herself are like a luscious home away from home.i took my two daughters for a girls night. It was magical in every way. As one of them said , the Crosby gives you a place to leave the madding crowd behind, regroup and then walk out again. It's magic.

It is really difficult to write a review for Crosby Street Hotel.... One should go and taste this experience, no other compliments can describe this hotel... More than "amazing"...This is our favorite hotel and I am sure will be for many more years...Nothing to add my Nov.2014 review.... This time we stayed 6 nights...Looking forward and hoping to be back in the near future...

We only had 2 days to see New York and the best thing I did was to book this hotel in Soho. It is a delightful 86 room hotel within easy access to everything including Metro. The rooms are divine, free wifi access, great staff. A real treat in a busy city. Good restaurants close by too; anything from New York Pizza to fine dining. It made a nice change from staying uptown. The bathrooms are wonderful with great showers and heated towel rails and fluffy towels. Would highly recommend it.

This is a place where you want to say goodnight in New York. Every member of the staff we encountered was trying to deliver the highest level of service they could. Only fault, was on our second and last day stay, we have found the room pretty dirty...

Quite Simply outstanding! One of my ALL time favourite hotels, the Rooms, the Staff, the Service just BRILLIANT!This place is not cheap but it is certainly worth every bloody penny! I will have decided if in Manhattan this is the only place I will stay!

Hotel is located in a narrow and rather decrepit street; it stands alone as the only refurbished building on the block. Finding the hotel and unloading luggage from the car was a little challenging as the hotel is a little set back from the adjacent buildings and the doormen stand inside the door until you pull up. Finding a place to park outside and to be in view of the doormen could be a hit or miss. The hotel itself is as expected for the brand - the small foyer is stylishly decorated as are the staff (smartly attired). Our room was nicely adorned, decorated and extremely comfortable - arguably plush. With floor-to-ceiling windows, it was very bright but still suffers a little from the outside noise - especially in the morning. Singular restaurant had good ambiance and provided great food (breakfast and lunch). Our experience with the staff was mixed - several were friendly, courteous and professional but we did encounter a few who gave you the impression that you were not worthy of their attention. I suspect that the hotel receives its fair share of notables but we were on vacation and were in a more relaxed mood than some of the other patrons. To be made to feel that we were "lesser" customers was not a nice feeling - I mean, it was obvious how they thought of our presence - particularly in the restaurant - so much so that our family elected to leave a day earlier for another adjacent and equally luxurious establishment. On a more positive note, this is a very pretty hotel - and its location is great if you are a shopper or on vacation - as it is served by at least 3 subway stations. I would recommend the hotel if you have thicker skins than we do and don't mind the arrogance and pretentiousness of a few members of the staff.

From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the Crosby Street Hotel was perfection. Every member of staff we encountered couldn't do enough to make our 4 night stay the best. The hotel itself is lovely. Huge rooms decorated in a unique style. The bar was friendly and service was quick and efficient. Location? Perfect, especially if you've come to NYC for shopping. 3 subways stations in staggering distance serving all parts of town if you fancy a stop of sightseeing. We asked the concierge team to organise airport transfers from JFK on arrival. This was done with ease, and although more expensive than the taxi flat fare, it was so stress free I recommend it to everyone!

My wife and I spent 5 days at the Crosby Street hotel - this was only our second visit to NY and we didnt know the area very well. The hotel is absolutely outstanding in every respect. The room wasnt massive, but very bright and spacious with a high ceiling. one whole side of the room was a window so it was very bright. we stayed there for dinner on the first night and just had pasta, but it was some of the best pasta we had ever had - both of us thought so. We would sit in the courtyard and have a couple of glasses of champagne each night before getting ready for dinner, which was a beautiful way to wind down - the service was excellent and very attentive.The bed was hands down the most comfortable bed that my wife and I had ever slept in. So much so, that I am now in touch with them to get hold of the same mattress - it was quite ridiculous how comfortable it was - I didnt want to get out of it. I wish I was in it right now, but I am at work. I want to go back to the hotel just for the bed.All in all, a fantastic area, great shopping, lovely staff, beautiful, clean rooms. The reception area is a little underwhelming perhaps and also the cinema screening was cancelled for the Sunday we were there which was a shame. All in all, phenomenal and we will definitely be back!!

The Crosby Street Hotel is the only US property of Firmdale Hotels which owns a number of hotels in London. All these boutique hotels are small, quirky, fabulous and with wonderful service and decor. Kit Kemp designs the interiors and curates the huge artwork collection for each hotel. Bedrooms are larger than equivalently priced hotels whilst large staff and space savings are made by combining the restaurant and bar, small check in lobby and a private residents lounge with honesty bar. It all makes for a wonderfully warm and club like feeling in a hotel with impeccable full service.i recommend the hotel very highly indeed.

A rare find in New York. The feeling is of a luxury boutique hotel in London. It's cozy, elegant, yet laid back and in a great, quiet location. Large rooms for NY with high ceilings and comfortable furniture. Excellent service and a relaxing lounge with honesty bar.

We have been coming to NYC both for business and leisure for past 30 years or so and have stayed in most of the big name hotels.However,The Crosby is without question our favourite.After visiting it a number of times over the past few years,the high standards never falter.Every bedroom is unique,of great size and with everything you need.The public spaces are a joy.but their most prized assets are the staff.They are simply superb.From the Reception,to the Concierge,the restaurant to the front entrance,everyone of them cares about the clients and their hotel.They strive for perfection!Thankyou

I thought this place may be a little too trendy for me but when we arrived everyone was so welcoming and helpful I soon relaxed and had a fabulous 4 days here. We immediately booked a return trip it was soo good. I have to say they have the most comfortable beds and for once the pillows do not stink! As a frequent business traveller I despair at how many hotels have smelly pillows! The location of this hotel is great and having previously always stayed midtown or upper east side the peace and quiet throughout the night without the constant traffic and emergency vehicles' sirens was blissful.

We've just come back from 5 nights and thought the hotel was fantastic. As it was a special occasion, we went for a Top Floor room and the hotel had kindly given us one of the more spacious rooms because they "wanted us to be comfortable for a 5 night stay" - and this really set the tone for the rest of our stay.The room was indeed spacious and very bright with terrific sunrise views across New York. We loved the decor but we knew what to expect having stayed at Charlotte Street previously. The bed was amazingly comfortable and we managed to sleep well even in noisy New York.All of the staff were utterly charming and couldn't do enough for us and we felt completely comfortable here. It's clearly a high-end hotel but it isn't pretentious or snooty. We were there during the Met Gala so the hotel had a high celeb count but we never felt like the hotel treated us any differently to anybody else, and surely that's the acid test.I'm amazed that some people don't like the area - we thought it was fantastic. The shopping and restaurant opportunities are seemingly unlimited.I can't recommend this place highly enough - I'm certainly coming back as soon as my credit card recovers.

Alittle pretentious and cannot drink in garden. They have no license there or something it was good time but, expensive. Service was alittle slow but, they were packed after 6 pm. I still would recommend to anyone.
user_name:
Classact10
New York City, New York

review_body: We spent 4 nights at the Crosby and had the most fantastic time. The hotel is beautifully decorated with modern art sculptures in the lobby and collages on the walls. The staff - especially front of house and the concierges - are most helpful and have lots of great recommendations for trendy places to eat/ shows to see/ private guided tours (we booked 2 architectural and museum tours through them which were first class). The room is really comfortable and roomy by NY standards. And the views are superb. The bed is extremely comfortable and the furnishing are modern and quirky. We had breakfast downstairs once – which was absolutely delicious, but there are lots of other places nearby. And of course you can't beat the location of this hotel in terms of SOHO/ NOLITA atmosphere and the shopping (it's right opposite the MOMA museum shop).Of course it's expensive, but you get first class service and quality.Only minor incident from my end: I had asked for a package to be sent for my attention in advance of my stay. The concierge refused the delivery which means I am still awaiting my package and am likely to face large shipping cost to Europe. But aside from this small issue, I really had a terrific stay and wholeheartedly recommend the Crosby.

Spend a week at the Crosby Street Hotel. Right from the arrival my stay was as stated in the title. The location, the service, the design, the people, just everything. Looking forward to my next stay ....

My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our week-long stay in April. The upper floor room looking out over the skyline of Soho are wonderful to wake up to. Sun just streams in and the cushions along the window ledge are perfect. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the bathroom was ideal (although a bath would have been nice!).The restaurant downstairs is very reasonably priced and the afternoon tea was a real treat. Just around the corner there is a wonderful place to grab a coffee and croissant on your way to the metro (Balthazar). Everything is easy to get to from Crosby Street Hotel - shops, cafés, galleries, etc.We actually preferred this hotel to Firmdale's Covent Garden Hotel (which we stayed in a few years ago). The staff are much friendlier and soooo helpful. Especially Caitlin - who does a wonderful job at the front desk, making the entire operation run smoothly and really setting an example for all staff.We will definitely return!!

We were lucky enough to stay for 9 nights and it was an absolute dream. The rooms are fantastic, the mattress and shower were game changing, and I've stayed in a fair few hotels. The staff were all either polite and helpful or polite, helpful and really nice people to get to know!The room service was really high quality food and the staff seemed to genuinely want to help in whatever way possible. The location couldn't be better and I cannot wait to go back if I'm ever lucky enough to return.

We spent a long weekend at the Crosby Street Hotel. It was a splurge but we were celebrating our anniversary and wanted to stay at a very special hotel. We have stayed at other Firmdale hotels in London so our expectations were high. The Crosby Street exceeded our high expectations. The rooms are beautiful. They have large, floor to ceiling windows and our room overlooked a quiet courtyard. The room was bright and beautifully decorated in shades of red with a warm but contemporary style. The bathroom was elegant and the bed and bedding were supremely comfortable. The location is terrific and we were able to walk everywhere as there are great restaurants nearby. The hotel feels small and personal, especially for New York.

This is a well run hotel with excellent Hotel/Bar/Restaurant and Cleaning staff . Staff very attentive and mannerly . A very enjoyable stay . Top class food and the standard was maintained all during our stay , Comfortable and spotless rooms . Highly recommended .

The first thing that happened when we arrived at the Crosby Street Hotel epitomised the entire stay. Having caught a train down from Boston to New York we were dragging heavy suitcases down Crosby Street towards the hotel. From more than 100 metres away one of the concierge's (Mark) ran down and across the road to us and breathlessly asked us if we were Crosby Street Hotel guests. When we confirmed we were, he immediately took all our bags down the road and chaperoned us into the welcoming foyer from where things just got better and better and before i knew it we having a cocktail at the bar. The room was beautifully styled and the staff fabulous throughout - six days just wasn't enough. Not cheap but made our New York experience complete

Stayed in the meadows suite overlooking a fantastic private garden and terrace. Everything at this hotel was perfection, from the location to the staff.The design makes art part of the experience. We enjoyed drinks in the lobby and will certainly try the beautiful restaurant next visit.

Awesome hotel with outstanding service and great rooms. Breakfast was amazing and loved the gym. Great and sufficient. equipment. If there was any negative Frederick at Concierge made you feel like he was doing you a Favour when you asked for assistance. He was definitely an exception as the staff in all areas were superb.

Great hotel with beautifully appointed rooms and lovely amenities. Big comfy beds and bathrooms. Our room had a huge window with great views over Soho and is in a perfect location to take advantage of the downtown areas of Soho, Little Italy, ChinaTown, Tribeca and East Village. A great special occasion hotel. Lovely bar at the hotel with a great vibe for nightly cocktails.

We stayed 5 nights at this hotel at the beginning of April.It is situated in the Soho part of New York that is home to a huge selection of great bars , Restuarants and shops.Once inside the hotel it is hard not to be hugely impressed by the wonderfully eclectic mix of furniture and wall hangings. There is a great bar and restuarant which is obviously a favourite with the trendy locals and has a really nice buzzy atmosphere.The bedroom we had had beautiful loft style windows over Crosby Street ( a quiet street offf the main road )It was beautifully furnished and the bathroom was luxuriously appointed.The staff were were friendly and helpful and the concierge could not do enough to assist.All in all, a perfect time had in a great city.If/when we return to NYC we will certainly stay there again.

The hotel is beautiful - as are all of the Firmdale Kit Kemp designed hotels. Location is great - tucked away in a quiet corner of Soho but accessible to everything. I am a fan of this "chain" - the properties are always located in interesting buildings in interesting neighbourhoods and The Crosby is no exception. Have stayed in 3 of the London properties too. But, something about the Crosby makes it my least favourite in the series. Those who work at the Bar and the Hotel are just too cool and in comparison - their guests not cool enough. The service was not great - laced with attitude. It is the Abercrombie & Fitch of 5 star hotels. I prefer the Greenwich in TriBeCa.

I was only at the Crosby Street Hotel for a few short hours nannying for a visiting family but the hotel staff was wonderful, the rooms in the junior suite I was in were beautiful and the decor was to to die for. I'd love to come back and enjoy the luxury for longer!

This hotel is where you go if you want to enjoy a special occasion.The best word I can think of to define the Crosby Street Hotel is 'generous'. And generous without being excessive.Bathrobes that wrap you in a warm hug, towels to disappear into. Soft, sumptuous beds. Large, light filled windows, and amenities stacked to the ceiling. I've reviewed this hotel before and it has only become better. In the world, it is hands on one of my favourites.Then and now I don't enjoy the restaurant. It is cold, the staff feel like they were transported from another universe and there are so many better options just down the street. But aside from this minor flaw you are a beauty.

Love this place; a unique and very unusual feel to this place. Just amazing design, decor and overall feel. The rooms are much more like the personal apartment of a brilliant designer than the standard hotel. Tailor's dummies make up part of the decor inside your room, a nod to the original use of the site as a garment factory. Designer lip balms on the bedside make for personal touches. The location is perfect; morning walks on the weekend to grab a coffee at a cafe, or take the excellent breakfast at the hotel. Main complaints: I got hooked on the high quality imported (British) organic lip balms they leave on your beside, so I have to order them from the UK in quantity. Second is the stewed pruned and apricots at breakfast; I'm not kidding. Once you have these, you cannot stop craving them. Addiction is inconvenient. Best hotel breakfast ever eaten on 3 continents. I'd live here if I could.

Great location for Soho area, decent, clean and quiet. Smart and elegant architectural design of the building itself. The grand glass wall windows with the black metal mullions blend in so well with Soho and give out great views of the city.But what is it with the dogs (art work) everywhere? and they don't all look happy.Moth painting here and a dead cow there...There's a kind of underlying sadness, lifelessness, in many of the design items scattered across the hotel. The sweet, but clueless lady at the front desk seemed to contribute to that atmosphere.The movie theatre is definitely a plus, and the "drawing room" with self-service bar, warm and cozy. However, what made my stay memorable, was being in the company of the most wonderful Lady.

We preferred to stay in this hotel because it is in the very lively part of downtown Manhattan which is Soho. In the middle of shopping area, away from the rush of uptown Manhattan and near to Chelsea Galeries it was a perfect choice.The Bar and the restaurant are excellent.. The rooms are very confortable..

This is a charming hotel in the middle of Soho created by the talented Kit Kemp. Her interiors are warm and friendly in atmosphere. I wouldn't like to live like this at home, but here it really works. The rooms have large floor to ceiling metal windows which gives you a real Manhattan loft feeling, very nicely done. The bathrooms are spacious and they have a great shower. Breakfast is very nice indeed and they serve beautiful scones, danish with preserves, fresh fruit,different yoghurts, eggs ,bagels etc I love the fact that you walk strait out from the hotel and are in the middle of Soho, not great if you are on a business trip and need to be mid town as it takes time to travel in NY but perfect for a weekend away. The staff is very friendly and will help you book a table at Balthazar which is literally 2 minutes away.

Good quality Soho Hotel and I prefer to the James and Soho. More of a boutique feel and much better location than the other two mentioned. Personally I would like a bath which many rooms do not have. Gym is basic but sufficient. Staff very helpful and honesty bar useful if you want a quick drink.

My new favorite hotel in NYC. Exceptional service combined with accommodations that are both luxurious and make you feel at home. The staff couldn't be better and the hotel has the feel of an english boutique hotel with a strong influence from the NYC modern art scene. This is far and away my first choice when staying in manhattan.

We are fans of the firmdale line of hotels, most notably the Soho Hotel in London. If you can't get to London, this is the next best thing. The staff are incredibly customer focused and are there to help. The decor is bright, comfortable and unique. It is not a clubby W hotel. It is sophisticated and English. The rooms are super quiet and well appointed with a walk in shower and great water pressure. The beds are super comfortable. The fitness is open only to guest and very clean and complete. You cannot go wrong, especially with the location in the center of Soho. Enjoy.

I just completed a three night stay in a deluxe room (high floor). I have stayed at several Firmdale hotels in London, but this was my first visit to the Crosby Street Hotel. Great service, and the food was excellent. I was a little bit disappointed with the room size/value. The room was great and well appointed, but small for almost $800 per night. I will return because the atmosphere and service continue to impress me.

Just a fantastic hotel. Small and intimate but with everything you could want and more.Warm and friendly staff added to the whole experience.The artwork that the place is full of adds to it's trendy atmosphere without losing any warmth at all. The rooms were large and comfortable and quiet and the bed was superb, a couple of great nights sleep!Bathroom was comfortable with a great shower.All the shopping you could want is located within just a few blocks and the subway is just a short walk away if you need to head uptown.Something a bit different was the Drawing Room which was open 24/7 and featured an honour bar where they would serve room service when the restaurant was closed. It was warm and cosy and full of lovely art (and I'm not really so artsy!).

We went for a getaway weekend in January and WOW! Our usual hotels in the city are 5 Star midtown hotels; well no more! Big fans of SoHo we had recently stayed at another boutique hotel very close to The Crosby, but after our recent visit to The Crosby we couldn't wait to go back. From the moment we pulled up and were greeted by the warm and friendly doorman, to the lovely reception desk, the housekeeper that was so friendly and seemed to want us to feel at home. We were thrilled to be upgraded to a fabulous cozy room(304). A few weeks ago I called and spoke to George who was very warm and kind, I rebooked, as we need another Crosby Street fix! Might I add that we enjoyed appetizers that were oh so delish and a fantastic breakfast all 3 mornings we were there. To put it plainly, we felt like we were staying with friends.

A lovely weekend at Crosby a Street Hotel. The staff went out of their way to make a celebration weekend truly celebratory. Room upgrade to a higher floor. Cupcakes and chocolates. All a bonus, but the hotel is great and would have been good even without the extras. Nice touches like avian in the rooms. Good gym. Great bed and shower. Charming and special indeed.

Having stayed here twice, once alone and once with my husband I can not recommend it highly enough. It is lovely and quiet, comfortable and the food in the bar is excellent. The staff are friendly and the overall ambience is cool. I'm on my way there again in a few weeks and looking forward to it already.

We loved Crosby St Hotel, the rooms are beautifully curated and so clean. We are native new Yorkers and stayed there for a romantic night away from home. It was fabulous, we will definitely stay there again.

Fantastic. By far my favorite NY hotel. Love the entire design and the staff is top notch. The attention to detail in the rooms and lobbies are evident. The owner/designer makes you feel like you are at a wonderful cottage in England

Although very pricey, but what isn't in NYC, it was totally worth it. The hotel is in SOHO, one of NYC's hottest neighborhoods and close to great restaurants and stores. The staff at the hotel was extremely friendly and accomodating. The rooms were very comfortable and luxurious and the hotel was tastefully decorated. Even the restaurant inside the hotel was top notch.

'Comforting' is not something you always want in a city hotel. You might like vibrant, cultured or stylish and I wanted all of these things, but I wanted to relax instantly for my short trip to NYC. I was serenely happy that I could do just this at the Crosby Street Hotel.The service is tip top and very British. Not too much interference, not too much chatter from the staff, just right. But someone is there is you need them. I felt really spoiled. I have to admit that I upgraded to one of their junior suite packages and I didn't regret it for a moment. The decor and furnishings were the inimitable style of the group, which you may know from their London properties, with some carry through signatures like animals everywhere; that's one of the reasons I chose the hotel. If you like to feast with your eyes, especially modern art, you'll love it.I made the right choice and look forward to my return.

I have just returned from a 10 day visit to New York with my mother and we were lucky enough to stay at the crosby street hotel! The service and staff are amazing, soooo attentive, greet you by name and always willing to help with a smile! The rooms are large, trendy and bright! love the design of the rooms making them quirky and stylish. The location of the hotel is perfect, one street from the broadway shopping area, east village, greenwich village and multiple subway stops surround the hotel. I cannot fault this hotel at all it was a perfect stay and my mother already booked another stay! thanks again to the staff at crosby street, you are all amazing!

I had an absolutely superb stay at The Crosby Street Hotel. We had 3 people in a king room with a pull out, as well as the 2 bedroom suite. Insane SoHo views. Superior service. All who worked there were friendly and beyond accommodating. I got coffee at the bar in the restaurant each morning. The bartender remembered me and remembered how I liked my coffee. Even the hostess and manager remembered me my second morning and said hello. Beds were SO comfy, bathrooms were spacious and beautiful. I love a hotel that has a great robe and slippers. I will definitely recommend to all looking for a luxury hotel in New York. Thank you Crosby Street Hotel for an exquisite stay.

I was making a quick trip to NY and decided to stay at the Crosby. Since my last stay at the Crosby I have had many disappointing hotel visits to NY. My question to myself is why would I want to stay any place else. The hotel is perfect. The service is unmatched, the rooms are large and it is in a perfect downtown location. Take advantage of the Drawing Room which is only open to hotel quests. It is a perfect place to meet friends and grab a drink before dinner or have an after dinner cocktail and dessert as we did. It is quiet, has comfortable couches and the service was perfect as always. One extra bonus, as we sat having our drinks, a stream of flashing lightbulbs went off outside the hotel. My daughter went to see what was happening and to her surprise it was J Lo coming into the hotel. The hotel has a beautiful cinema room which is were J Lo was having a private screening for her new movie. Since it was less than a 12 hour stay, I chose a basic room which did not disappoint me. The rooms are beyond clean and extremely well maintained. No spotted rugs, torn wall paper or stained covers. I can not wait to return.

I gave my husband a dinner, "Boyhood" movie and a one night stay for Christmas. The customer service was beyond top notch, the room was perfectly clean and comfortable, and the bed was one of the most cozy beds we have ever slept in! The dinner however was where it all fell apart. We had the movie/dinner special for $55.00 each. The waitress was lovely, and told us the Branzino was a large portion, each order having 2 pieces of fish in broth. We had our appetizers, then proceeded to wait 50 minutes for our entree. Our waitress literally came by 3 times apologizing, and at one point said there was a large event downstairs and the kitchen was backed up. But we watched customers that started their meals after us, get their entrees and then dessert while we waited. When our entree finally arrived it was one very small piece of fish per person! For $55.00! Dessert came in a timely fashion, and the movie was wonderful. Breakfast in the morning was delicious , served in a normal timely fashion. Too bad a perfect evening was ruined by slow service and extremely small portions. We love the Crosby Hotel but probably will eat dinner elsewhere next time.
user_name:
Renee D
Southport, Connecticut, United States

review_body: To arrive at a hotel earlier than expected and to be immediately upgraded always will put a smile on my face! But that is just the start of the great experience staying in this hotel. Firstly I have to say that it is not a cheap stay in New York , one for a special occasion but having said that I have paid nearly as much for nowhere near as nice hotel experience. It is perfectly situated in the heart to Soho among fantastic shops and restaurants (which was a blessing at -6!) . We found all the staff charming and attentive. the decor of the hotel is funky but warm and luxurious.Kit Kemp the hotel owner and designer has a fantastic style. The complimentary breakfast includes anything you want and as much as you want on the extensive menu and the food was very good. This is now my default hotel in New York! If you stay here you will not be disappointed.we stayed in room 406 deluxe on the 4th floor.

This hotel is a slice of heaven! It's a luxury waking up here to the floor to ceiling windows and gorgeous decor. Walking into the lobby you feel transported to the most wonderful place, full of exquisite art and furnishings.The staff is superb - Kathrin Apitz deserves much praise. She makes running this special place look easy, but clearly it takes a highly skilled and talented professional to make it work. This is our second stay here. It's the perfect place for a getaway. I can't recommend it enough!!

It's been nearly 4 years since we stayed at this wonderful hotel and it was as good as I remembered it. As last time we were delighted to be upgraded to a mini-suite- in fact the exact same room as we were in 4 years ago! The staff were as friendly as ever and made us feel completely welcome. The bar/restaurant was as good as I remembered especially the buffet breakfast option which is superb with lots of fresh fruit, pastries and cereals. You can't ask for a better location in terms of access to subway, the best shopping and great restaurant choices. The hotel itself is beautifully appointed with wonderful art and tasteful decor. The concierge provided excellent suggestions in terms of restaurants and just getting around. Friends who visited us at our hotel bar couldn't stop praising the ambience and coolness of the hotel.We really couldn't recommend a better place to stay in New York City.

First timers to NY and this was a delight for our family. Good restaurants and shopping nearby but quiet for sleeping. Amazing art work and decor. The restaurant is great for breakfast or even Christmas dinner. It was nice to visit the busy sights such as Times Square and the Rock and then retreat to the Crosby. Good metro access options too. We will be back!

Stayed here on business. Thank goodness, because the rooms are outrageously priced. I seriously expected something more for the price than what I got. My room was decorated beautifully, but had a view of nothing but the building across the street. I suppose if you're into the Soho scene and have the bucks, stay here. I've had my fill.

What a great hotel! It's five star, fun, quirky, funky and incredibly comfortable. The designer finishes to walls, floors, soft furnishings, beds, bathrooms, switches, objets d'art, everything, have been so carefully chosen, and are extravagant, modern without being severe, the colours and combinations fresh and happy. You can wander around just looking at everything for ages. Make sure you go downstairs. There's a great communal drawing room to sit in, and the outdoor courtyard gives a feeling of space. Our complimentary full cooked breakfast was delicious and the restaurant nicely fitted out. The position is perfect. I could live here.

First, a preface. I wanted to go to one of my very favorite hotels, the Covent Garden Hotel in London, one of several "Firmdale Hotels" as I do every year. Alas, it just didn't work out this time, so I decided to stay for four nights at one of the Covent Garden's sister hotels and the only one in the U.S. The Crosby looked so lovely. Reception, complete with cubby holes for keys, so very similar; the decor, always personally arranged by the Firmdale's owner.There was a drawing room! The rooms had some delightful touches! Everything LOOKS great at the Crosby. Also, it is located in a great part of Manhattan, Soho and the small outdoor garden is likely lovely in milder weather. But this is just the point it "it looks..." Emblematic of this is the fact that the Drawing Room features two fireplaces (as does the CG), but they are fake in the case of the Crosby; a line of tall candles stand, solums-like as if defying you not to love a shortcoming as if it were a virtue.That was the preface. Here is the "but" and it is a significant one. The Crosby looks rather perfect, in step with its sisters, but the service is, on the whole, terrible (with the lack of the employee of the year, who was fantastic) and the food is nearing wretched, though it might improve if it ever arrived warm. Now, I expect that many who read this review might have selected the Crosby following the same logic that I did. Maybe the slipshod attitude and astounding pockets of mediocrityI came to realize that there were 2 problems, at least in my experience. First, staff. They are okay, though whenever I ordered room service something like, oh, half of the breakfast was missing and I never seemed to get a place setting to save my life! However, what makes the Firmdales really distinctive is not just how it looks but how the staff makes it feel. At the CG (always going back to my best case here), the staff is welcoming in a warm way. They are capable without being officious. A number of them are transplants from other countries--Italy, Poland, etc. but they are no less capable and articulate. At the CG, when one arrives, there is an actual quasi-room for the concierge staff. And they are attentive, inventive, helpful...they know London and can get you into some of the best restaurants at the last minute. In short, they are fantastic. Arrive at the front desk and after a single dialogue, the desk staff will likely remember you and have your key ready. Service to the Drawing Room, Room Service, the adjoining restaurant is always impeccable (and they always ask 'for how many' so nobody is stuck (like me, constantly), without linens or silverware). Also, the food at the CG is good. In fact, it ranges from satisfying to delicious. Oh, and the Honesty Bar is respectable and stocked with the ingredients of a martini, bloody mary, soda etc. NOW for the Crosby. On the phone, the desk staff is rather clipped--not completely rude, but they give the impression that they are very busy with something more important (and they don't discriminate; I had one of the very best rooms). They are abrupt and not necessarily skilled. I was given the wrong room key twice.The rest of the staff is the same, though some are exceptionally kind, most are polite in a very casual, careless way. For New Yorkers, they are fine. Direct and rushed. But this is a Firmdale. This is supposed to be a sister to fantastic boutique hotels in London. It is mimicry. Oh, and although none of the staff was rude, it felt like it was run by a bunch of lazy Americans. When the concierge sent up staff to assist with luggage, the staff member greeted me with "Hey, how's it going'? What do ya got?" Satis dictum; enough said.Also, as an aside, I mentioned the food. It is not good and it comes out tepid at best. Oatmeal and milk had developed a skin etc. Also, some things (like the chocolate pudding cake and the corned beef hash and the pastry basket etc.) were simply not good in addition to being the wrong temperature. If you are still reading, I hope that you have a sense of what I'm trying to communicate: The Firmdales are more than their material parts. The STAFF makes everything work, makes all the pretty material objects part of something even better. The Crosby has a great location and looks pretty, but you can find much better boutique hotels in the area. In fact, if you are looking for that experience, you're likely better off there. Good luck

As a big fan of Kit Kemp's interiors I had to check this hotel out when in NYC so booked in for afternoon tea. I was not disappointed as the eclectic mix of furnishings and art were just as good in real life as they are in the book! Would love to stay here next time when traveling without kids.

We spent a fantastic Christmas at the Crosby Street hotel. Others have said it all but the location is fantastic, right in the middle of SoHo, easy to walk to Greenwich village or downtown, really close to 3 subway stations........but the best thing is the hotel itself. We had a room on the 4th floor but it was big with lovely decoration, a bed to die for and room to sit, spread out and spend time. Breakfasts are included and are great. Concierges are helpful and knowledgeable.I would return here in an instant and would highly recommend for anyone.If I had one gripe it would be that Christmas day meal was overpriced for what it was and the kitchen didn't seem to be coping very well- however other meals were great so I can forgive them!

I almost hate to share how much I adore this hotel and London sisters in the boutique chain. I have stayed at Charlotte Street And Covent Garden Hotel. The service is awesomely 5 star from concierge to front desk and dining. servers,. Decor is more than charming, eclectic and cheerful. This is truly the most comfortable home away from home with typically a wonderful sitting area with honesty bar set up only open to guests. As I was in London for 3 weeks on my own, I really enjoyed the close knit relationship developed with the staff. Food and drink selections are delicious too. Kitt please come decorate my home!!

If your wife is a interiour design nut ........ then this is winner. The details in our spacious room. The minibar with great selection of drinks and superb map for shopping in Soho.  Great gym eevn though it was in the basement.Amazing concierge team. The knowledge of town and finding small cozy restaurants and (can you guess it?) interiour shops for the wife. When you check in you have to go up and ask to check in before they look up. It looks cool with the 27- inch iMac but they can see the guest arriving. When asking a question the answer was ask the concierge. Even about the hotel facilities..... ask somebody else.Very nice drawing room with the honour bar after a long day of shopping.Check out the rooftop garden. We had breakfast included and food was very nice. Hostess asked us everyday if we were staying in the hotel. We were there for 6 nights. Seemed like there was nobody in charge of the restaurant. We had dinner before the filmclub, is allways good fun, but the service and the food was unfortunatly not.

Stayed in the crosby street for 3 nights on a stay over in NY. It is a lovely hotel. The beautifull decoration is repeated all throughout. Every room is different and filled with small details. Beautiful materials and quality, it just feels like home. If you are looking for a 'boutique hotel' this is the place. Attention to detail is everywhere: great reception and client attention, wonderfull bar and a restaurant that is worth a visit. The hotel combined with the Soho area is just really fantastic and lively, worth the money. We will be back!

This is where I'm going to stay from now on when I'm in New York. I can't think of a single thing I'd have changed during my three nights there. I seek out boutique hotels whenever I travel and this is now one of my favorites. I smiled whenever I returned to my room. The service is friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms and common areas are well-represented on Tripadvisor. They're stylish, modern, and luxurious but don't sacrifice comfort. The hotel is in a great location, surrounded by Soho shopping with most other parts of downtown easily walkable. Having Balthazar around the corner for morning pastries was a nice plus.

Stayed here recently, in the heart of Soho district just of Broadway. What a fab little boutique hotel. Great interiors of reception, resident lounge dining room and guest rooms. Personal staff who always had a smile on there faces. Rooms are sooooo comfortable, great beds, pillows...perfect.Hotel even had a small gym in the basement. Close to so many great attractions, shopping, cafes, bistros. Hotel had a great choice of meals at breakfast, lunch and dinner in case you didn't fancy venturing out.Will definitely be back. Don't tell too many people though!!!!!!

We have stayed here many times, the longest being a week over last New Year's Eve weekend; the rooms are lovely, the food superb, thebar is full of attractive people, the decor eclectically gorgeous, and the staff couldn't be more accommodating. The owners have several hotels in London, all first rate. The Soho neighborhood is great fun, too,mand the Crosby Street Hotel is located ideally, one block from the incomparable Balthazar Restaurant and many one-of-a-kind stores. Try something different, and better, try the Crosby Street Hotel.

Absolutely stay here. It was about 100$, but the roomwas big and clean with a tall shower head, nice tv, etc, but THE VIEW WAS INCREDIBLE!!! Food was decent, gift shop fine too. EVERY room has an unobstructed view of the valley.

I was here for a long weekend ahead of Christmas with my 14 year old daughter. The staff could not have been more charming or helpful. The food in the restaurant was tasty and catered to both my and my 14 year old's tastes. The decor (Kit Kemp) is very cool, colourful and open. But it's the location that really smashes it. A short walk from all the shops we wanted, and close to various subway stations on different lines getting us uptown, across to Meatpacking/Chelsea and over to Williamsburg. A perfect weekend stay. If a little pricey!!

This is the most adorable boutique hotel. We had a fantastic stay when we visited NYC for a weekend break. It was organised through business, and we certainly weren't disappointed. The staff are all very courteous and professional- the concierge are brilliant, special mention to Nick, who always went out of his way to assist us in any way possible. Breakfast in the hotel was fantastic, smoked salmon was the best I've ever had (and that's not an exaggeration). Great location, Soho is a very cool area, much more chilled compared to the main touristy spots. Rooms were spacious and comfy, beds great, cocktails even better. If you have the money, it's definitely well spent if you book to stay here. Will definitely return!

I'm not a fan of small rooms but my sweet room on the 11th floor with the floor 2 ceiling windows overlooking the city,the decor, the closets, the perfect little bathroom were perfect. Who knew a 385sf room could feel so spacious! It was warm and welcoming and plush! Loved the bed and linens, the brownies waiting for me (even though I gave up sugar I had to taste or it would be considered rude!) the dear gift of nail lacquer and top coat. So girly a bedroom that produced a sweet slumber I hated leaving. I will be back on the 3rd of January I can't wait for my next visit! Front desk staff not a lot of help but all the staff was very polite. And stayed out of your way. Breakfast was just amazing. Not for the faint of pocketbook but worth every penny. The decor is breathtaking

Loved the whole experience at the Crosby. The rooms are so charming and warm---bathrooms, luxurious! The sitting room/library for drinks feels at home...and the bar and restaurant, far exceeded our expectations!

My only reason for not giving this gorgeous hotel 5 stars were the room prices starting at about $800 a night - I was lucky enough to get to stay there on business and my company paid, not I, thank heavens.But if you want something really different and special for a hotel stay in NY, then this is it -- beautifully decorated throughout with a very British sense of style and whimsy, intimate spaces, the best showers in NY, pretty good food (for a hotel), a wonderful inner courtyard for fine weather, a small downstairs movie theater with regular showings, cream scones for tea, an odd glimpse of film stars like Michael Douglas, and genuinely nice, friendly staff and service. The hotel's location on a small cobbled street in Soho is also great - the MoMa store is across the way, as is Balthazar's restaurant and bakery. A small Bloomingdale's is just down the street and lots of other small and big stores are within easy walking distance, including my favorite, Frye, for stunning leather bags and boots. My only regret was not being able to stay in the Meadows suite which has its own terrace and wildflower garden in the summer.
user_name:
Jane S
Winston Salem, North Carolina

review_body: We stayed at this AMAZING hotel with clients for a few days in November and to be frank - it was overwhelming! I think I am still digesting all the wonderful impressions, waking up every morning being so disappointed that I am in my own bed! :)This is such a beautiful hotel with a unique interior design, an exclusive atmosphere, glamorous rooms and beyond all - superb service! From the beginning of the organization to the arrival to the complete stay and finally the departure - we were taken extremely good care of. All staff members contributed a great deal towards such a memorable stay. I can only recommend this luxury, prestige and not to mention beautiful property with such service orientated staff as well as a superb location! The Crosby Street was worth every cent and exceeded our expectations in every aspect possible. Special thanks to Robert, Deidre & the General Manager Kathrin for making us all feel so welcome. I personally cannot wait to once again be enchanted by this hotels chic charm! Thank you all so much!

Located on a cobbled narrow street in SoHo, this hotel is charming from the moment one enters the lobby and collects the room key from the wooden hutches behind the front desk. The room was amazing with a wonderful view of the rooftops of Soho. There are so many features of the room that deserve comment that to list them all would seem over-the-top. Suffice it to say, that we had nice surprises throughout our stay. The Drawing Room in the lobby is definitely a relaxing place for a drink or a quick bite. The fitness room was small but well equipped and not terribly busy even at typical high volume hours. The restaurant served a nice breakfast, but very crowded, especially on weekend mornings. Plan ahead and consider reservations. The clientele in the hotel was worth the trip in itself -- people watching sometimes has considerable entertainment value. Overall, a fantastic hotel and worth the price!

This is my first time staying in SoHo and I will be back. The neighborhood is awesome, the location of the hotel is so convenient. The room was modern and clean. The bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately we did not have time to eat in the hotel but would love to give it a try in the near future. We were given a welcome present which is always a nice touch. The workout facility looked adequate, they even have a rower. Would definitely recommend.

Just returned home from an amazing three-night stay at Crosby Street Hotel.Our room was spacious and impeccably clean, with large windows, thoughtful amenities, high-end finishes and designer touches.We loved the location - close to lots of great shops & restaurants and the staff was terrific - always ready to assist with directions, recommendations & reservations.Thank you Crosby Street - we'll be back!

We stayed for 5 nights at this lovely , cozy boutique hotel ....Excellent management, lovely and helpful staff, terrific housekeeping , well equipped and exceptionally clean rooms and so many perfect details........It was really one of the best , unforgettable hotel experience we have ever had :-)

I loved everything about this hotel. The staff went out of their way to make us feel at home, decor is perfect. Loved the big windows, the guest lounge in the lobby, bathroom and towel warmers...I already want to go back! The bar has great food and drinks too.

Welcome to the Covent Garden Hotel in NYC. Almost uncanny! I felt right at home. Yes it's expensive but way better value than most Manhattan hotels and in a great shopping/eating location. My brother lives inNYC so he bought me the room as a birthday treat but I thoroughly enjoyed it and the staff are as you would expect uber helpful. Breakfast is efficient and delicious. Way better than mid or uptown in my opinion.

Great little gem of a hotel in a great location. Walking distance to plenty of dining and drinking establishments. Very hip, upscale boutique hotel that oozes Carrie Bradshaw qualities. You'll feel like you're in a fashion mag. There is a lovely courtyard for dining and reading the paper, etc. Rooms are small, but the staff was incredibly attentive and room service was very accommodating with late night dining options. Highly recommend this hotel. Unfortunately, this experience comes at a price. It's worth it.

Love this beautifully put together boutique hotel. We stayed a week and had a number of different rooms - each with its own special style. Upgraded on the first night to a single room suite with gorgeous views of the Soho area - what a treat. Concierge was super helpful, as were the lovely staff in the restaurant. Our transfer to JFK at the end of our stay was undoubtedly the quickest, most informative and entertaining I've had to date. Not the best choice if you're running a tight budget, but if you're not so constrained then totally recommend Crosby.

Good experience. Not inexpensive. The hotel public areas and rooms were stunning. The boutique feel was offset by the gross rat / garbage show at night on Crosby. Some silly aggressive event security were completely obnoxious. I felt "swarmed" as they stopped me from going to washrooms from the drawing room. They have to do something 'bout that.

A truly bright, lively, bar/ restaraunt on the ground floor of the Hotel.A quiet street , very stylish.Super drinks, and extremely tasty and well prepared small bites with drinks.Had a group of 10 and they were very accomodating.Only complaint is they got the drink order wrong twice. Oh wellVery personable staff

One of the most important considerations, when choosing a hotel, is the location. The Crosby is in the middle of Soho which has immense charm and character. A metro station is in close proximity, the shopping is diverse and boutique with an amazing assortment of great cafés and restaurants. The hotel itself has an eclectic, artistic vibe which is both unpredictable and interesting. A sitting room off the foyer is a lovely escape with an attending butler and bar whilst the sculpture garden creates an stylish oasis which would be amazing in the warmer months. Service is attentive and polite without being too obvious. Our room had a great view of the neighbouring rooftops and skyline and the room decor was creatively presented. A fantastic place to visit.

First time visit to New York. My wife and I booked for 4 nights hoping it would be the same great experience as the London hotels in the Firmdale group. We were not disappointed. Stylish, beautiful decor, great service all round. We had a deluxe junior suite which was impeccable and just right for the 2 of us. Excellently situated in Soho with short walks to the main subway lines and great boutique shopping areas and restaurants nearby. Hard to fault. We will definitely come back again.

We had a lovely stay at this very sweet hotel that is the perfect size (i.e. not too big) in a great central location. Staff is attentitive and welcoming, the rooms are nice with amazing views over the rooftops of SoHo if you're high enough and facing west. There are a couple of gripes though: - the television kept cutting out (but to be fair, we did not report this to the hotel, so it may have been easily fixable) - one of the restaurants recommended by the concierge was not as romantic as we'd hoped- their airport transfer rates are extortionate

This was our first trip to NYC and we wanted to see the SOHO area. My sister lives in New York and made us reservations in the restaurant. The restaurant is absolutely gorgeous.
