It is exactly what I thought a swanky New York hotel and restaurant would be like, from the presentation of the food to the extensive wine list and the attentive service but yet it was never stuffy. I highly recommend.

My husband and I stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel for our anniversary. Upon check in, the front desk surprised us by upgrading our room to the Crosby Suite. What a fabulous anniversary gift! The suite was spacious, well decorated and absolutely beautiful. The windows were floor to ceiling with lovely views of Soho. The service was exactly would you would expect at a 5 star luxury hotel, perfect!The restaurant was trendy with a good vibe. The food, drinks and service were all fantastic. The location can't be beat! Who doesn't love Soho!!We are frequent travelers to NYC and have stayed in many luxurious hotels across Manhattan. This one tops the list of best of the best.
user_name:
JacquelineWH
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is fabulous. The rooms are luxurious and exceptionally clean. The public areas are both beautiful and interesting too.The staff were generally very lovely and helpful, delivering a high standard of customer service.It is therefore a shame that we received poor service in the residents lounge. Whilst the staff were courteous, it took ages for our drinks orders to arrive on several occasions.It seems that the public bar area takes priority over the needs of the hotel residents.We would still recommend this hotel as the place to stay in NYC though.

First class hotel in a terrific location, quietly tucked around the corner from all that Soho has to offer. Buzzing bar and great lounge and garden for guests. Convenient for exploring the city and is our favourite Manhattan hotel.

I loved staying in this hotel. Our luxury room was just as pictured on the website and spotlessly clean too.We enjoyed fantastic food and cocktails in the bar / restaurant area.There is an inconsistency with the level of service delivered by some of the staff though.Our first night was amazing. We had a lovely evening in the bar. The cocktails and food were wonderful and the staff were fantastic - nothing was too much trouble.We were disappointed on the next evening though with poor service from the staff attending us in the 'Drawing Room' (the residents lounge area) The cocktails were really poor and we had to wait ages before they arrived. We had decided to move here from the bar as the music was far too loud and intrusive.The following afternoon we received the same level of poor service in the lounge area again. After this disappointing experience and for the rest of our stay, we chose to eat, drink and relax at other high end establishments with better service and a lot less noise.If are expecting to enjoy breakfast at this hotel as a resident, it is wise to book a day in advance to ensure you get a table.Again, the level of service is unpredictable. Some days we had fabulous service, on others different staff were quite miserable and vague.

Visited the Crosby Street Hotel in March 2014.Had cocktails and canapés.Beautiful ambience in a luxurious but unpretentious hotel.Many thanks to the staff who treated us with much kindness.Rose and Steve

Our stay at the Crosby Street hotel in Downtown Soho was total bliss. This gorgeously over the top boutique style property is decorated in pure Kit Kemp style with a mash up of tactile patterns and textures, eclectic art, vintage lighting and the most comfortable beds husband and I have ever experienced. Bedrooms have huge loft style windows with panoramic views from the upper floors. Little touches like the Intimacy kit in the minibar, the scented oil, the downy beds and a curvaceous torso giving out a soft red glow made for great couple time.....The bar and restaurant are lively and a great meeting place for drinks and on the night we hosted guests our dinner was graciously adapted to my husbands fussy tastes. The bathroom was well appointed with a huge shower but please note for those who like to soak in a tub to check whether your bathroom has one. Just outside the front door are some of the most interesting shops and restaurants in Manhattan so what could be more perfect?!

Wonderful few days. Could have not wished for anything more luxurious and wonderful. Fabulous location.And rooms ... Oh my!! If you prefer luxury this would be your perfect retreat. All is incredibly well thought out...beautiful beds, baths, luxury fluffy towels...Their beds are amazing!!Customer service among the very best I have come across. And please note that I have travelled rather a lot.Highly recommend this hotel. Perfect if you are aiming to impress your partner. I was certainly suitably impressed :-) Top marks to my incredible man!!

Not a bargain but a great value. Staff very welcoming. Decor is quirky and sophisticated, modern and charming. Room was small but very comfortable. Bathroom was lovely and well equipped, though needed a better-placed towel bar and a better shelf to store toiletries. Restaurant and bar were fun, welcoming, beautiful and food was delicious.

Went for a Sunday brunch and everything was absolutely top standard! It took 2-3 hours and then the food poisoning was a fact. It didn't help that I had a flight back to Europe that same evening so when I contacted the hotel a few days later I got terrible service from the management saying that it couldn't been their food that got me ill. Would have been easy for them to just send their apologies but instead u got some arrogant answer from F&B manager. Would not go back!

The hotel upgraded us to the "The Meadow Suite". It was one of the best room I ever stayed. This is the only room in the hotel with a big terrance garden. The living room was also spacious and the best thing was they allow I bring my dog there.

The So Ho in London is one of our favourite hotels.have stayed there 3 times...stayed there 4 weeks earlier...the Crosby felt like home....the decor was as similar...the room spacious by New York standards...great spot ..right in the middle of everything to see in So Ho. We ate in every night...excellent food ...good cocktails and choice of wines...sitting in the courtyard for a pre dinner drink with the New York buzz in the background topped the day off. The staff were tops...friendly and helpful. ..the sitting room butler introduced me to raspberry bellinis...!!!! The bed super comfortable...top floors so quiet..room spotless. We finished our 6 week travels at Crosby street...made the long trek back to Aussie more bearable...going to New York?..do the Crosby!!

A brilliant few nights with the family in what is surely one of the finest hotel in NYC if not the world. I cannot wait to return! Fancy setting up in Berlin too so we don't have to travel so far to savour your delights?

The staff were extremely helpful.the room was nice size great character with floor to roof window , fab bed .in the restaurant we had a lovely lunch.great area to be in for shops and restaurants . Balthazar is at end of street , get concierge to book breakfast , lunch or dinner there

Yes, this is a quality hotel in a great location, as numerous reviews attest. These comments are based on a five night stay.But to maintain its enviable reputation The Crosby might do a few things better. Tea and coffee making facilities in the room are essential - especially for travelers from afar. There were none. And in this day and age the ritual daily replacement of linen and towels (no option provided to do otherwise) is a gratuitous extravagance and environmentally uncool. In a similar vein, trash recycling options, now standard in many better hotels, might be added.These are minor irritations but The Crosby plainly aspires to be amongst the best so why not keep pushing the standard?

My wife and I recently spent three nights at Crosby Street Hotel and we could not have been more charmed by what we found within that delightful hotel. The exterior facade of the hotel stands in sharp contrast to the older buildings surrounding it. Its modernity stands in significant but not disconcerting contrast to the rest of the neighborhood,upon setting foot inside the front door a different feel overcomes the visitor namely a whimsical, colorful and fun loving twist on a traditional hotel. There is a drawing room to the right of the front desk with what appeared to be an honor bar and 24 hour Butler service. Beautiful contemporary artwork was to be found throughout the public areas and comfortable furniture and conversation nooks were easily found.The hotel was decorated by Kit Kemp who employed a masterful blend of color and contrast throughout the property that set a festive mood throughout. The hotel rooms are spacious and light filled thanks to the floor to ceiling windows and the bathrooms are similarly modern and spacious.The hotel's staff is super efficient particularly the Concierge named Freddy. Freddy recommended and procured reservations for us at a bistro located close to the hotel which was excellent. He also orchestrated the shipment of multiple items back to our home, all of which arrived promptly and undamaged.Crosby Street Hotel is a gem that will not let you down!!! We will be back!!!

This Hotel is a serene and charming place in the middle of soho's hustle and bustle. The location is perfect, lots of great shops and restaurants in walking distance. The hotel itself is lovely decorated...the restaurant/bar is very elegant yet cosy, the rooms are beautiful with huge windows. It is a wonderful place to relax and unwind with very friendly and throughout helpful staff. I can really recommend this charming peaceful hotel!

Exceptional Rioja by the glass. Pricey, but good atmosphere for couples and small groups.Friendly bar staff on a day when it wasn't too busy. Didn't get to try the garden but looks beautiful.Mixed crowd of older, younger, male, female. Worth a drink!

We stayed one night at The Crosby Street Hotel out of four nights while in NYC. We both wished we stayed more at The Crosby, but it was our first trip to NYC, and we wanted to stay in more than one area. We arrived before check-in. They handled our bags and we went off and explored the area. Check-in was very quick and professional. We loved our room. It was on the 3rd floor with a view of the sculpture garden. The room was good size and the decor was perfect. We chose the view to save money, but was not disappointed. The room and bathroom are designed so well, there was nothing to complain about. We didn't visit the restaurant/bar because our schedule was jammed-packed, but it seemed like a happening place to be! We relaxed in the sculpture garden & enjoyed a few drinks provided by the butler. The garden is beautiful & peaceful at night! The staff answered all questions and made sure our stay was perfect! We will definitely stay here again our next trip to NYC!

The Crosby Street Hotel is pure luxury, as with all other Firmdale Hotels I have been lucky enough to visit - great staff, fabulous bedrooms, lovely decor throughout - a real haven amidst the hussle and bustle of NYC. Thanks to everyone there for a great trip.

My fiancé and I stayed here for a long weekend for his birthday. Couldn't ask for a better hotel and it's in the best location. The room service is quick and everyone is really cool. Top of line mini bar to top it off. Don't stay anywhere else.

I just love this hotel every time i am in NYC. From its comfort, to its design element, to the food, to the service. Plus, there is an Equinox next door. Insider tip = Book a deluxe room on floor 7 or higher, facing to the East. This will afford you some nice lower Manhattan city views.

It is my favorite hotel in NYC when we come for a romantic weekend. I don't come here for business cause usually this one is too expensive and I don't mind going for less. But when we do want to spend - the Crosby is amazing. Just go down the stairs and look at all those stylish lobby rooms to understand the huge effort that was invested in every detail. You will meet here movie starts for a reason. Try to ask them for a room with a view.
user_name:
tokyojustin
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great location in interesting neighborhood away from the neon-sign noisy and hoplessly touristy mid-town Manhattan. Well appointed rooms, terrific restaurant/Bar and outdoor cafe. Service is impecable. Can get anywhere in Manhattan by taxi or nearby subway. Downtonwn Manhattan rocks.

Recently stayed here again after trying several other properties in nyc for a get away weekend and was reminded why the Crosby is my favorite -- the decor service food location all pretty perfect. Yes it's expensive but worth every penny!

They did not have a room for the night we were spending in the City, so we just went the next morning for brunch, because it is one of those hotels to be visited as a landmark/design inspiration/very cool place to hang out. The interior design is spirited, fresh and inspiring, the food delicious, and the service impeccable. Looking forward to my next visit.

The Crosby Hotel is one of the interesting boutique hotels in NYC. It's located un the heart of SOHO in a warren of side streets that any visitor should find interesting. They have a screening room on the lower level that showcases new releases by invitation only. The main level has the Crosby Bar, a restaurant that is frequented by an attractive mix of patrons. I like having their brunch with friends and business associates, the atmosphere is just right, and the people watching doesn't hurt. A good find in a great city.
user_name:
JeremyNYLA
New York City, New York

review_body: The rooms are pretty good sized (bigger than an average NYC hotel). The furniture is very colorful and modern. Bathroom is the best part. They have towel heaters and a really nice shower area. The hotel has a nice bar/restaurant located in the back alley.

I have stayed in many hotels in NYC: Waldorf, W, Soho Grand, Gramercy Park Hotel etc… The Crosby Street Hotel has by far the best rooms of all of them! The room was big, bright, airy, cool (functioning A/C, something not all NYC hotels have), quiet, groovy and very well equipped. The bed was big and comfortable, not too soft, not too hard, just right. The bathroom was lovely with a huge shower. The room service was good. The bar / restaurant downstairs is very nice, good food, bustling but not overcrowded, good atmosphere. The only gripe was that is was a smudge cold due to the A/C. The cinema downstairs is very good too, if you feel like a lazy night in. The service was attentive and friendly. All in all, not cheap, but pretty much everything you want for the perfect stay in Soho.We'll be back!

My family and I recently spent eight nights at the Crosby. My wife and I have an 11yr old and an 8yr old. We opted for two end rooms that had a common connection/foyer-like scenario (as opposed to one of the suite setups). That gave us two separate rooms with kings, two separate bathrooms, two separate couch areas... etc.Everything went great! The hotel is beautiful and has a solid "guests only" reading room with honor bar for booze.The concierge crew handled everything we threw at them really well. The pulled together great babysitters when we needed them.There were a handful of music pop-stars staying at the hotel during our stay, and the staff did a great job not letting things become a fan zoo (other hotels in NYC don't do as well with this and it can wreck the stay). Despite paparazzi and fans lingering on the street, things never got chaotic in the hotel, or outside.Breakfasts (buffet and full menu) were delicious and covered the entire family's needs well.Housekeeping did a great job knowing when we were in or out, and I found very little disturbance from them.The courtyard gave everyone some space to hang out on their own when folks needed a respite from each other (as did the reading room when dad needed a solo drink).In the basement is an incredible screening room that does movies on Sunday nights. I highly recommend this experience.The gym is basic but gets the job done.Only criticism would be the lack of a dedicated doorman. Concierge crew seems to do double duty here and they're always busy doing concierge stuff.There is an incredible rooftop garden and chicken coop that is a must see for the kiddos. Just ask the front-desk and someone will run you up there.Also, when I say this is good for families, I mean the property can be made to work for families. They don't have special kiddo facilities or programs. In my experience most of the nicer boutique places to stay don't go out of their way to accommodate families (for obvious reasons), it's a question of whether or not you can make it work well at the property. Without much effort, we were able to make it work really well.The general manager did hand off some coloring books to the kids at one point :).

The location is perfect as it is walkable to fantastic shopping and everything in lower Manhattan, decor was stunning, room was perfect, and the shower was a genuine guilty pleasure. My only gripe, (and it could be because I'm from Kauai and everyone is friendly), we walked in and they said "welcome home", but never followed through. We were there for 5 nights, and for a small hotel, they pretty much ignored us as we came and went - Could have been a 1500 room hotel in Vegas. The advise from the concierge was terse, and found to be inaccurate. then a film crew showed up and as we walked by the lobby the staff was very attentive to the "A-listers", the term the doorman gave them. I found that pretty much icky - I don't think its good form to tell a guest that "that person over there" is more important to the hotel than you. All of New York could be this way, so my complaint could be off for the area.

Probably my most favourite hotel to date. The initial impression from the decor is absolutely astounding - the hotel is packed with really interesting art around every corner! The service was great and our stay was so enjoyable - extremely comfortable beds and lovely views of the city, in beautiful rooms. It is also a great location in the soho area, near some great restaurants. We ate one dinner there which was delicious, although it was a bit of a strange concept that most of the dishes didn't come with sides, you had to pay extra to a price that maybe could have at least included some vegetables. The only reason I didn't rate the hotel as excellent is because at breakfast every morning the kitchen/service staff seemed unable to get it seamlessly right. To be fair, one of the party was lactose and gluten intolerant, however after the first day you would think this would have been clear, or there would have been a better understanding of the dietary requirements. The food when it came was of course delicious, I could not fault it... but with what you're paying for in the hotel you would expect the restaurant service to be more refined. Despite this, I would no doubt return to the hotel on every stay in New York hereafter!!!

Let me start, like always, and admit upfront that I am a hotel snob. A bad hotel can and surely will ruin a trip for me. So it's a stressful situation while booking travel bc...my hotel is key. I was referred to The Crosby Street Hotel by a friend-and also saw it listed on Mr and Mrs Smith (it was my friends referral that sealed the deal)The hotel is located on a cute cobblestone street in Soho. The rooms are big (NYC standards) they are absolutely spotless with crisp white sheets and blanket. The bathroom was great and the shower had THE BEST water pressure!! Service was great and everyone was extremely nice and professional (even when we fell asleep in the drawing room after our red eye from LA (our room was understandably not ready). Our room package included breakfast, although bc of the time change, our bodies weren't really ready to eat- so we only indulged on our last day. But on the note of breakfast- you have the liberty to order anything off of the menu (not a crummy continental breakfast). If the subway is your preferred method of travel- the station is steps away from the lobby doors...When in New York- The Crosby Street will be my hotel of choice from here on out!

I live in lower Manhattan and fell in love with the Crosby Street Hotel when a good friend suggested it for drinks one night. The decor is beautiful and the food is fantastic. Since then, I have always looked for an excuse to stay there and finally had the chance to book a room there for my wedding— my fiancé and I wanted to spend the night before the wedding apart and I wanted a place that would work for getting ready with my sister and mom as well as a place to stay with my husband the night of the wedding. I booked a deluxe room on a top floor, but when I mentioned that I was getting married that weekend, they upgraded me to a 1 bedroom suite on the 11th floor. The room was absolutely stunning, with an incredible view of the neighborhood. It was also extremely quiet and I was able to get my beauty rest the night before my wedding. All of the touches in the room, from the furniture to the glassware, are highly curated and beautiful. It's elegant without being stuffy—comfortable luxury.The staff there was incredibly helpful. When I needed something printed out they brought it up to my room almost immediately. As I was leaving the hotel in my wedding gown, it was raining and the doorman took each person from the door to our car with an umbrella and helped us with all our bags. When my husband and I arrived on the night of our wedding, there was a bottle of champagne waiting. Everyone was super friendly.The room service was also delicious. I ordered breakfast twice during my stay and it was wonderful.Although the hotel is expensive (I don't think I could bring myself to pay full price for a suite there!) they definitely pull out all the stops and treat their guests right. If you're looking for a splurge while in New York, I couldn't think of a better place.
user_name:
Catherine C
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed June 27th and 28th. The hotel is beautifully and uniquely decorated. From the time you arrive you are greeted by very friendly valets to help you get bags out of your car; escorted to front desk to check in, and then assist with luggage to your room. Our check- in experience was fine except rooms were not ready @ 1:30 pm. After a few minutes we we're told rooms just became available on the 4th floor. For $600+ a night I would have expected a higher floor. One room was right next to elevator and our second room just down the hall. Both overlooked Crosby St. versus the backside of the hotel overlooking a private garden/patio area. Def preferred our view but heard the garden view side is much quieter. On the 4th floor you def hear the street level noise, even with windows closed. And I could hear our travel mates talking in their rooms from the hallway. Crystal clear. Our room's decor was just mediocre. A bit flat and unexciting with navy and yellow curtains with a matching headboard. The highlight of the room was the bathroom. Very roomy with double sinks and a shower that made you want to stay there all day. Water pressure was phenomenal. And to top it off, towels hang on a warming rack. Beds were so-so comfy. A bit too firm for my liking. The hotels restaurant was the worst part of the hotel, IMO. Service was really slow. I mean REAALLY slow. You'd think they had to get everything from the dungeon 3 levels underground where the bathrooms reside. The food was absolutely not worth the prices they charge. We started off with the housemade guacamole. Good. Then we shared several items such as the margherita flatbread. Crust was soggy and chewy. Overall taste was bland. Not good. The Reubenini sliders. Basically a Reuben sandwich cut diagonally to make 4 triangles. Just okay. Croque Monsieur... Great if you like bread. The bread was very thick and nestled between two slices was a modest amount of ham. Again, just okay. The highlight was the housemade bar fries. Tasted just like McDonalds shoestring fries. Delicious. $157 later we left very dissatisfied wishing we had walked to the corner and gone to the highly rated Balthazar for lunch.Overall, our stay was pleasant. Location in SoHo is great. But everything we wanted to do was midtown ( theatre district, Saks, Henri Bendel, Patsy's...) With the exception of the restaurant, the hotel service was top notch. Wouldn't stay again. At these prices would rather stay at the Gansevoort , the Carlyle, The Towers at the New York Palace...

The service at the hotel was amazing! The decor in the room is beautiful and the beds are very, very comfortable. The hotel is located on a quiet block and the rooms were quiet too. The breakfast and the lunch were both delicious. We felt like we were in London!

This beautiful hotel in SoHo has it all. The staff is very friendly, decor is amazing, the food is tasty and the drinks at the bar, oh man, just perfect! I was there for an annual conference organized by my firm, they are so good at organizing these!

What a fantastic stay at this hotel! I visited for two night in May and can honestly say it was the best two nights I have ever had in NYC. The decor is so interesting and fun, the staff was very accommodating and friendly, the room/bathroom was superb, the courtyard was lovely and inviting, the location was amazing. I chose this hotel because I wanted to stay in the Soho area. I couldn't have made a better choice in hotels. Balthazar was practically across the street, Bloomie's just on the next block plus all the other wonderful boutiques within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

In general, we liked it very much, an exquisite decor in the lounges and room, a wonderful neighbour (Soho) location. What was terrible was the street location: Crosby St is a kind of service way for stores located in Broadway St, and starting at the end of the afternoon it becames packed with lots of huge garbage bags, which are collected by noisy trucks all night long, which was a problem for us because we love sleeping with opening windows (if you do so, ask for a room in the higher floors, we paid a high noise toll by being in a lower one...). Prices are adequate for the level of the hotel and services are ok, meaning they may well be a little bit more attentive to the guests.

The service from every member of the staff was amazing. Everything was anticipated before we asked for it. There is a sitting room for gussets of the hotel that is so comfortable. You really never want to leave...just move right in. Usually we like to eat outside of the hotel. Not here, the breakfast was delicious and reasonably priced. Cocktails were mixed by professional mixologists. And dinner was delicious and memorable. This was a fantastic neighborhood for shopping!

Superb location, excellent decor, prices for the bar and restaurant slightly high.Service not the best but overall an enjoyable stay, if the minor issues weren't there it would be amazing hotelI'm sure there is better value for money elsewhere in NYC

We had a wonderful stay here in May, as a weekend break away from our 2 children. Perfectly located in Soho surrounded by restaurants for all tastes and budgets and shops from designer to quirky boutiques. So nice to see New York from a downtown point of view - I think we hardly saw a skyscraper! Rooms are beautifully decorated (we were on 9th floor). Quiet and very comfortable and a good size for New York too. Concierge desk was incredibly helpful with metro advice but otherwise we sorted ourselves out happily and walked nearly everywhere. Only complaint relates to the indifferent staff at breakfast on our first morning (not included with some deals and expensive). My food didn't arrive and the waiter never really seemd that bothered enough to have to find out where it was. But that was fine as we went elsewhere for the other mornings including an incredible Mexican 5 minutes walk away. Otherwise we would highly recommend the Crosby St and hope to stay in some of the sister hotels in London one day!

My husband had business in NYC and the Co he works for put us up here for 2 nights. I will tell you .. I have stayed in many hotels .. this was the best 2 nights and 2 and a half days ever! The hotel is chic, posh, yet warm and comfortable. The attention to detail is 5 star! I arrived early, before my husband as he was traveling from a different city ... and I only had to wait about an hour and a half. I sat at the bar in the hotel restauant and had an amazing breakfast. Our room was on the 6th floor facing the courtyard. It was a busy Friday afternoon and I heard no noise!! The room was stellar! We were in a delux room with king bed. Ohthe bed and pillows.!! So very very comfy. I slept sooo well! I usually travel with a sound machine and in this room I did not need it!! The walls are covered in fabric and help with the sound proofing. I was most impressed!! The huge warehouse style window with cushions on the sill was my favorite spot to sit in the sun and watch above a few rooftops and out over the city. While I unpacked I noticed details like - lights in the closet - a electical outlet - beautiful shelving as well as a lavendar sachet on a hanger! There were at least two beautiful chest of drawers as well as a nightstand with drawers to keep things tucked away and tidy. Lighting was wonderful - in bathroom and our room. There was a very comy sofa and chair as well as a desk and chair. The bathroom is amazing too, Heated towel bars for 4 big towels and although we were there in the summer - I swear the floor was heated. I never got cold in the huge lovely marble shower or standing on the marble floor while getting ready. Bathrobes were lux and the shampoo, conditioner and soap .. all lux! Two beautiful pedstool sinks and there was plenty of room for my husband and I to get ready in same bathroom. The service in the bar and restaurant as well as the front desk were all excellent and friendly! I read that each room is different .. I loved ours ... not sure Id want to change. The air conditioner was great. Kept us cool at just the right temp or wherever we set it! Loved the close proximity to many NYC attractions as I spent a day exploring SoHo! My husband is a NY'r and we spent a lovely summer evening strolling the SoHo, Tibeca and The Village. I was sad to say good bye to our lovely room and most quiet little gem in the big apple!

This is a beautiful addition to the neighborhood and the inside has gorgeous artwork for guests to enjoy. Conveniently located and extremely pet-friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend this beautiful space if you're sick of chains and feeling like a number. They offer high-quality service and delicious food.

Having been to NYC numerous times but typically stay at kind of generic hotel chains, wanted to treat my mother to a fabulous trip and stay at the Crosby Street. Beyond the luxury and top-notch location in Soho, some of the details are what really made this place fabulous and unique:- Turndown service includes a complimentary Evian bottle for each guest, as well as very pleasant smelling (spa-like) room spray, also these unique French cuff links (at least I think that's what those were)- The conceirge and staff went above and beyond to accommodate a special request I had for surprising my mom upon arrival w/ a note and bottle of wine; the bell man also ran several blocks during a rain storm to hail a cab for us...these acts are above and beyond what your typical NYC hotel will do- back Garden is lush, tranquil, and beautifully decorated. It's a gorgeous sanctuary in the city and I haaven't seen anything like it at any other hotel in the city. Building is also rated LEED Gold- Like many other reviews mentioned, the room is HUGE compared to standard hotel sizes, including a very roomy bathroom. The floor to ceiling windows make the rooms bright and airy and the view from the upper-level floors is AWESOME. I would just sit and look out the window. Bed is also very comfortable.The only downside is some of the staff seem a bit aloof and snobbish, while others are extremely friendly. I kind of felt like it's luxury boutique hotel kind of catering to the snooty crowd or celeb-type clientele and if you don't fit that mold, you were kind of looked down on. However, this was only a few of the staff and maybe I'm just sensitive (b/c my mom didn't seem to notice a thing). Plus, most of the staff personnel were really, really friendly. One other thing to note: the Library Room and Honesty Bar are a cool perk, but beware if you actually make your own cocktail. The prices are pretty ridiculous ($20 for a shot of vodka) and I made my own drink pretty stiff and got charged $40 when I was checking out. Sure, I probably had 2 shots in my drink, but I was flabbergasted they actually measured & charged me $40 for one cocktail. I've stayed at other 5-star hotels in different cities/countries (ex: Esperanza in Cabo, Boca Raton Resort & Club in Florida) and this competes with the best of them. The price is pretty hefty for even their basic room (in fact, the per-night room charge at Crosby is on par w/ the Esperanza - which is on Conde Nast's Best Hotels in the World list) so I think it's a little overpriced for what it is, but that doesn't negate the fact that it is a unique, amazing luxury hotel in Manhattan.

Beautifully decorated spaces in convenient location close to Broadway, restaurants, good shopping, subway and 20 mins walking distance from 9/11 Museum. Funky guest sitting room with honesty bar on ground floor. Pet friendly. Dining room with variety of seating. Delicious breakfast and central sculpture courtyard with relaxed seating for lunch or a drink. Friendly front desk and excellent Conciege. And the down pillows are heavenly to sleep on.

We stayed here for 6 nights in May and it is a lovely, lovely hotel. Beautiful rooms, comfy beds, gorgeous and spacious bathrooms, extremely helpful and attentative concierge as well as being in a perfect location. The one let down, was the restaurant staff and the length of time it took on each occasion we went for something to eat to get our food. Staff were snooty at times, and we left feeling they cared more for the guest who weren't staying at the hotel. We stayed in a Deluxe Junior Suite and although lovely and spacious, I wouldn't call it a suite. Having said that, this hotel is a great find, and we would love to come back soon.

This is a lovely, cozy boutique hotel in the SoHo neighborhood of NYC. We come to Manhattan once a year and wouldn't stay anywhere else. The rooms are cozy without being cramped, with beautiful linens and towels and a well appointed bathroom. And the rooms are QUIET, which is saying something in Manhattan. The staff are uniformly helpful, especially Concierge Chris, who invariably goes out of his way to assist us each time we see him. The lounge is an intimate sitting area with bar service if you'd like. Our one quibble: the music in the restaurant is generally too loud and too hip for us at breakfast. However, the staff are generally willing at least to lower the volume while we are there. We recommend the hotel highly -- we will return in several weeks.

We stayed at this gorgeous place for one week. The rooms are beautyfully designed and spacious. We chose a deluxe junior suite which offered a fantastic view of Soho. In addition, concierge was very professional - thank you very much!

First visited 2 years ago and said we would be back. We have just returned. And we will return once more. This is possibly our favorite hotel of all time. It is amazingly well run. You are truly looked after and it just gets better and better. The food is great - the best English breakfast I have had in a long while. THE best shower anywhere and a bar that just works with really interesting bar staff - thanks Monya for making our stay so comfortable and organising the best cocktails. You must go to the bar if you are staying in the hotel, or indeed if you are not.We love New York. We love this area. We love the hotel. You will too. Thank you to all - we returned refreshed thanks to your care

Great location if you want to go out in downtown nyc and shop in soho. British decor feeling hotel that is dog friendly with great service, restaurant and bar. Small-ish rooms but nice baths and overall pleasant experience. But not cheap!

This is one of the best New York hotels I have stayed in. Fabulous location, comfortable pillow and bed. Room and bathroom very spacious for New York standards. Decor is very edgy. Kit Kemp is so very talented. Staff very friendly and helpful. Restaurant was very good. I will definately be staying at this hotel again.

Stunning Decor . Friendly Staff . Very Comfy beds . I was travelling solo and encountered a very rude limo driver from JFK to The Hotel , the doormen came to my aid immediately , helped with Check in and made me feel , like i was home . I have stayed there 3 times now , even tho its a bit on the Expensive side .... it's worth it .

We checked in on Sunday 20th April and left on Tuesday 22nd. From start to end, the stay was brilliant. We had a stunning 'luxury' king room on the 4th floor at the front of the hotel looking out over the flag flying above the entrance. The room was so comfortable and spacious for NYC. We enjoyed the Sunday night film club - with a 3 course dinner first followed by The Secret Life of Walter Mitty in the basement cinema after. The dinner was mostly tasty - the experimental dessert (flavours of grape) was a little bit on the bizarre side. The cocktail menu could be a bit more varied. The service and friendliness of all the staff was exceptional.

We had a great stay at the Crosby Street Hotel, the staff and the service are perfect, welcoming and warm. The hotel is very nicely decorated, both the rooms and the public areas, including a very nice terrace. Our room, on the 11th floor had a beautiful view on Soho. The gym is good. Food at dinner and breakfast were very good, sophisticated but not over sophisticated.If you want to stay in Soho, I would highly recommend this hotel.

This is one of the few hotels in NY that feels like it was designed by hoteliers that actually care about their guests. Many others have nice touches or work well with their limitations but it is clear they are working around limitations. We started our trip at another hotel and upon spontaneously extending our trip moved here and are so glad we did. The other hotel was located in Greenwich Village and was a nice hotel - well appointed, reasonably nice staff, etc. But moving here we felt like we graduated to a real hotel. Service was spectacular, close to everything you want and yet don't feel like you are in the middle of it either, design is tastefully done and everything feels authentic. I will never stay anywhere else in NY!
user_name:
nutoca
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Crosby Street Hotel is set on a quiet, cobblestone street just off the most exciting Soho shopping streets. The lobby and public spaces feature a brilliant combination of modern and ethnic art. I think the dining room is one of the most thrilling and inviting I've ever seen in a hotel. My room was very pleasant and faced a back street. Design and fixtures all immaculate and well-chosen. The Crosby Street is my favorite New York City hotel. Super location, a wondrous sense of design and decor that combines hip London (it's owned by an English firm) with energetic New York. It completely exceeded my expectations and also felt fairly priced. Highly recommended!

I love this hotel because it is a stylish, sumptuous urban retreat, a treat for the senses, but does not sacrifice functionality. The hotel is ever ready for a photo-shoot but they have also considered how everything feels and works. The beds and furniture are comfy, the showers super strong, plenty of light, perfect alarm clock, lighted closets, solid doors, fabric padded walls for quiet, an inventive and a delicious room service menu that satisfies both adults and kids. The location is perfect for a fun trip to NYC, right in the heart of SOHO and right around the corner from a couple different subway lines that put the theaters, midtown, etc. just a few minutes away. The visual appearance of every nook and cranny has been well considered. Not sure if they have just renovated after being open several years but almost everything is in pristine condition. The lobby, an art and garden oasis, even smells divine. All of the employees we encountered seemed like invested professionals who provided excellent service.Caveats - the views are mostly of the very close neighboring buildings, the best/only place to enjoy your room service is sitting on the floor at the coffee table (junior suite connected to deluxe room), some rookie mistakes like an alarm clock left on from previous guests or missing utensils from room service. I'd also add that the junior suite, while significantly more expensive than the next best room category, provides, as far as I can see from our two rooms, a larger and lit built-in closet vs. an armoire, a larger bathroom, and a slightly larger room. I'm not sure there is a consistent price to value relationship though I would certainly opt again for the junior suite on future visits.Overall, this hotel definitely elevates your entire experience in NYC. As others have noted, it is a very special place.

On my first trip to NYC in over 20 years it was important to me to stay somewhere special. This was also the first holiday I had had with my husband sans enfants in 18 years. It's always a gamble picking hotels; will it live up to expectations? Especially when there's a reasonable amount of money involved. Well The Crosby exceeded my expectations. Having long been a fan of Kit Kemp's interiors I knew it was going to look good but it was still a thrill walking into the entrance, the room was divine. It's location is perfect, walk everywhere. Hip cafes and boutique shops on its doorstep. I'm hoping to be in New York next year and don't intend to stay anywhere else.

Rarely do my relatives from the West Coast come to the Big Apple, so when they did, I wanted them to see something special. A friend who works in the area had introduced me to this place. I made a mental note to come back with out-of-towners, and so I had the pleasure of breakfasting in the hotel's restaurant. The server knew how to stay attentive while in the background. Our water glasses were never empty; my napkin was refolded when I excused myself. The coffee was superb as were the fresh berries. After breakfast, we wandered from room to room around the lobby and outdoor patio. There is tasteful and eclectic artwork everywhere that combines primitif with modern. The furniture clusters makes it feel more like someone's home than a hotel.The front desk staff was most accommodating. They gladly charged up my dead battery while we dined.
user_name:
Billie E
New York City, New York

review_body: The Crosby Street hotel was one of the best places I have stayed in a long time. I have a daughter at NYU and have stayed in a number of hotels in the area. This is by far the nicest and worth every penny. Not only are the rooms gorgeous, the hotel in top shape, the staff was beyond exceptional. They wanted to do whatever they could to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.The room has small amenities that just make this hotel a step above other hotels in the same price range. One of our most enjoyable parts was the private room to have drinks that is only open to guests. It was a Saturday night and we had friends joining us for dinner. We decided to have drinks before dinner in order to catch up on our lives. This room I felt like I was siting in my living room being served drinks. Fabulous!! I found everything exceptional. I can not wait to return in about a month to celebrate my daughters graduation.

Crosby Street Hotel is a gem in every way.Beautiful, spacious(by NY standards) rooms with magnificent city views.Most importantly the staff is the most attentive group we have ever encountered in NYC.Be sure to grab a drink in the library after dinner....heaven.The location is ideal with shopping, food and culture at your door step.Nowhere better in the Big Apple.

I chose the Crosby Street Hotel because it felt a bit 'different', not just the bland hotel chain option. I wasn't disappointed - this hotel has character. Quirky, beautifully furnished, but still friendly and laid back.The rooms are cosy, not just art installations as in some design hotels, and a great deal of care has obviously gone into providing all the little things that make a difference. Great minibar too!The staff are welcoming and friendly. I'd agree with the reviewers who have commented on breakfast: it's not that it's bad, just doesn't live up to the rest of the hotel, and it's a bit crowded and rushed. Why bother when you have Balthazar at the end of the street, or Dean and Deluca for takeaway? I was glad I booked room only as it gives an incentive to explore and it would be a shame not to since you're spoilt for choice in this part of NYC.

I live in New York but this is the hotel I recommend for anyone coming to stay who has a bit more of a budget. This is not a cheap place, but it is an impeccable one. The common areas are just terrific, the lounge and dining rooms are imaginatively and beautifully decorated. The restaurant is excellent and the location in the middle of Soho is wonderful. It's close to subways but also very easy to get a taxi and great to walk around. It's an elegant place, not child unfriendly, but not especially kid friendly either. I recommend it for lovers and very upmarket business travel. I go there for lunch often, it's a respite in the hubbub of New York.
user_name:
Liat0001
New York City, New York

review_body: The location, decor, and amenities in this celebrity studded hotel are exactly what you think they are going to be. Uber stylish and cool, the rooms are comfortable, the restaurant superb, the location perfect and to top it off they mix a mean martini in the bar. The walk to the toilets from the bar is a bit of a trek and some of the staff were clearly hired more for their good looks and fashion magazine froideur than for their efficiency or even interest in their jobs. But it is all part of the fun. Who doesn't want to be ignored by a model in a painfully groovy Soho hotel? Not really a businessman's hotel unless one is in film or fashion, but certainly worth staying in for those weekends when you simply must pretend that life is like a Sex and the City episode.

I decided to try out Firmdale's United States experience, based upon the strength of my previous stays at the company's properties in London. I was glad that I did.It's almost like they have transplanted one of the London properties into SoHo. Arriving at the property presents the same feel as arriving in The Haymarket in London. Cheery faces and the now expected readiness to please attitude from the Front Office staff. My room as not quite ready on arrival, and I was politely shepherded into the restaurant adjacent the lobby and settled at the bar for a drink while I waited. This restaurant reminds me of Brumish as well. The same warm, comfortable furniture and English drawing room feel with uplifting colour added to the decor. Once again, great food and beverage served with flair and confidence from the staff. The restaurant has a an outdoor terrace, which I can imagine would be lovely when the weather isn't -4C!Now for the rooms. Again, that same British feel and complete with the transplanted bathrooms and British made tap ware. My shower door did not close properly and ended up with a large puddle around the toilet and moving towards the sink. A small matter, but could be dangerous as the tiles are grey and some people would not necessarily see the water on the floor, possibly slipping. A very comfortable bed as well as the signature seamstresses manikin in matching décor. My room looked out onto Crosby street with floor to ceiling glass windows to enjoy the very urban view. Double glazed windows shielded me from the street noise.As far as the location is concerned, a great spot central to SoHo and surrounded by lots of shopping and food and beverage locations, literally a skip around the corner or across the road.I've rated the property a 'Very Good' vs. excellent, for only one specific reason. My breakfast experience this morning and the behavior of the staff in the restaurant. Sadly, this disappointed me. It may be my feelings only, but I found the hostess surly when arriving for breakfast. I was really looking forward to the experience and this set me off on the wrong foot. As I type the manager is standing at another table mentioning, 'that breakfast is the most important meal of the day.' That should be matched with a cheery greeting when you arrive at what would otherwise be a great experience. This experience continued with my waitress determining that despite never having met me before, I would be referred to as 'honey', for the duration of the meal. I then got to listen to the staff discuss their love life. For me, in this standard of property that is not acceptable and far too familiar when I am paying $600 USD per night to stay. I can see that the hotel does have a number of regulars and definitely agree that this type of rapport is both appropriate and familiar, as I would expect to be treated if that was my circumstance.Having noted this, I would definitely stay here again. As I've noted before I really like what the Firmdale brand offers as an overall hospitality experience. Although the challenge of building a brand, is that customers then start to compare. On this occasion my comparison was related to the staff's manner and behavior compared to London and it came up a little short. I hope that this can be addressed so that the next stay moves my comments to 'Excellent'.

Stayed in June 2013. Very comfortable, very large bed (we stayed in a superior room on 11th floor) - great shower but no bath. The staff were all very friendly and genuinely helpful. The location is fabulous, right in the centre of the shopping area of Soho with its excellent boutique shops. They charged the wrong credit card when I left which cost me a lot in exchange rate and when I went back to them (after I had been home for 3 weeks in the UK) they refunded the difference with no issue - that's customer service at its best !! Oh it also has a nice bar and does a good breakfast !

A visit to NY is not complete without a stay at the Crosby. Kit Kemp's stylish hotel is a must.The rooms are lovely. The service excellent and the food delicious. Extremely well located in the heart of Soho close to fabulous shopping and trendy restaurants.In the summer, the lovely patio allows you to enjoy outdoor dining in a cosy atmosphere.The decoration throughout the hotel is refined yet whimsical which defines Kit Kemp's style.She promotes artwork of young designers.She is not known as the Hotel Queen for nothing. The Crosby Hotel summarizes what we love about the Brits : tradition and fun.A must see - even for drinks

We stayed at the Crosby Hotel for 4 nights (including new year's eve). The hotel is situated in the SoHo area and located near metro stations, pubs, restaurants, shops, shops, shops!The rooms are nicely decorated and big. The bathroom is also spacious, the shower is wonderful!The staff needs an extra mentioning: there are simply the best! Friendly & helpful and always with a smile! The restaurant is a nice but expensive, there are many nice restaurants in the neighborhood to choose. Yes, this hotel is expensive but worth every dollar!

Lovely, sizable rooms full of natural light. My room's outside wall was a floor to ceiling window and the ceilings are high. We were on the sixth floor. The transitional decor is warm, smart, clean and inviting. Beautiful color, wonderfully comfortable bed. The bathroom was well appointed and roomy. All the best. The hotel is located on a cobblestone street in Soho, close to shopping, the High Line and the more historical parts of Manhattan. The frontdesk and concierge service was professional, friendly and helpful. We enjoyed refreshing drinks in the salon followed by a delicious meal in the restaurant. The Crosby is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in and I will be returning later this month.

We went to the Crosby for their offer "dinner and feature film". We do that a lot at the Charlotte Street hotel, an hotel from the same chain. And what a success ! We had an aperitif at the charming salon, an excellent dinner and then we went to the film room. You can even take your glass of wine there if you like! Great comfort, an experience I want you to try !

My husband & I always stay at this hotel every time we're in the city. Sometimes it's just a quick overnight stay before a flight the next day, and other times for a few days at a time. The service is always spot on & the front desk staff is so nice. We travel quite often with our small dog, and the hotel is very pet friendly! Room service is always delicious, and the restaurant inside the hotel serves one of the best hamburgers around. If the weather is nice, take advantage of the hotels courtyard {which is only available to hotel guests}. They staff a butler who will bring you out drinks and small plates to nibble on.
user_name:
Andy A
Sunny Isles Beach, Florida

review_body: Staying here at the moment for a day on the way back to Europe. Excellent bar, great decor, good restaurant, and amazing service! Would definitely recommend it to others! Walking distance to all the retail therapy in SOHO!! A must visit if you are visiting NYC for a holiday!!

Stayed in this lovely 'designer' hotel for five nights in September 2013. It has a unique, contemporary designer feel. The hotel is located in a narrow street in the heart of Soho, a short walk to Little Italy and Chinatown. Our room, on a higher floor, had a nice outlook over the roof tops of the city. The bed was very comfortable. The room wasn't overly large and there wasn't much storage for our luggage. We've stayed in larger rooms in NYC for less than what we paid here. Breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was outstanding with a selection of tasty options although we thought the $7 lattes were a bit steep though. New York has a long way to go in the coffee stakes. On that note, a Nespresso machine in the rooms would do wonders to change this perception! The concierge service was outstanding. They organised concert tickets and recommended and booked restaurants before we arrived. One small glitch was a recommendation of the Loeb Boathouse in Central Park (for the view). Give this place a wide birth - it's a tourist trap. Despite booking weeks in advance we were told there was an hour wait when we arrived for our 1.30pm reservation - we didn't hang around unlike the long queue that snaked out the door. Apparently they had booked too.Handy tip: for those away from home for a long period of time like we were there are a few laundry services located a short walk away that do a large bag of washing for $15 (same day service). A criticism I did have but not about the hotel but about the city was all the rubbish strewn outside along the streets of Soho. It felt dirty, looked terrible and we saw two rats on the street within hours of our visit. On a previous visit to the city I had not noticed this before.

Great little getaway trip .... Hotel is very eclectic .. Service was wonderful ... What was stand out was the concierge ...!They went above and beyond and made the stay an experience ... Thoroughly enjoyed our stay ..

The Crosby is the epitome of great design, it defines what a boutique experience should be like for a guest. Color palette is divine, and rooms are full fantastic vintage and glamour cross hybrid feel. NY is a great place, but the Crosby made it even better. I will add this to a list of favorites, as I only visit the best in boutique.

Traveling on business, my wife joined me so we upgraded to this hotel from the standard business hotel. Perfect location for walking, shopping and being in SoHo. Quirky and cool, as another reviewer describes it, seems about right. Not inexpensive. A very nice, large room with comfortable bed. The staff is very attentive. Service in the adjoining bar, and room service breakfast were a bit slow...but everything else was quite nice. The self service bar in the lounge area is a nice alternative to the more crowded hotel bar.

Love this hotel! Really quirky and cool, but with all the mod cons you expect from a good hotel. Great staff, fab location and gorgeous rooms. The perfect luxurious base for a city break in Manhattan.

This is a hip hotel which is well furnished in a great part of soho. So from a physical perspective the property is great. However the service lets it's down. F&B is really more faulty towers than five star. Firstly there is no real provision for in house guests so if you don't book you wait for a table. Yep New York style. Madness they don't have an allocation or configuration for in house guests.... I've never experienced this at a hotel of these prices!!!! Then there is the service in the dining room or lack of it. You can seriously wait at your table for put to Hal an hour before a server will take your order. Often my coffee would take 20minutes and then meals after and then another 15minutes to get the check. This place is the ultimate test of your patience. We were traveling with our two young daughters and the hotel has no clue about kids. Note no kids menus, high ball and Crystal glassware everywhere. Nice cool hotel in great location BUT not the place for a young family.......

I stayed for three nights in this hotel and could not fault it - it was total luxury. It did come at a price, but I felt that it was worth the expense. The hotel is very close to Broadway and right in the heart of Soho, so very easy for getting around lower Manhattan. The breakfasts were good, and I ate in the hotel one evening and the food was excellent. I can highly recommend this hotel - if you do not mind paying a high sum for the room, you will certainly not be disappointed in what is provided.

Buzzy , busy , uber stylish in an eclectic English sort of way . Great food and exceptional service . Just a lovely , lovely place to have stayed ; from start to finish . Have previously stayed at the mandarin oriental , the Mercer and the Mondrian in NY: No contest .

I simply loved this hotel for its many wonderful attributes: fantastic location, chic and inviting décor, wonderful rooms, boutique ambiance and friendly service.  Location wise, I loved the fact that it was far from midtown where the hordes of tourists go, but instead in SoHo which has so much to offer in terms of cozy restaurants, wonderful shops, and genuine neighborhood ambiance. It’s also within a short walk from Little Italy, Chinatown and Brooklyn bridge for those who are interested in the nearby tourist attractions.  The hotel itself has a striking décor, both reflected in the communal areas (try the lounge bar – fantastic!), as well as in the beautiful rooms. The rooms had all the amenities you could need and ours also had commanding views of the city – a wonderful view to wake up to! The whole experience of the place was that of an exclusive boutique hotel. The service was overall very good, especially the concierge. However one minor complaint was the service in the breakfast room, which was a bit slow. The breakfast itself was good, but not great, with a very limited buffet. However they had an extensive a la carte menu you could order from, that contained all the dishes your heart could desire.  I will definitely stay here again next time in NYC!

My husband and I went to NY for my birthday. We decided to try a new hotel, so I booked Crosby st. We always stay in Soho, the location is perfect for shopping and our favorite restaurants. We arrived at the hotel which is located nicely and on a cute street. The woman at the front desk seemed inexperienced and was not very welcoming, there was an envelope for us and she started to open it and then pushed it towards me and said "it's free drinks coupons for our bar" I said well thank you but we don't drink. She said "oh I guess I'll try to find something else for you". Fyi she didn't "find something else" Then the bellman showed us to our room, I had reserved a suite, the curtains were open, it was early evening and not 10 feet away was a man in his window, I am used to the city and close living, but this is an internal courtyard with out even the distance between buildings you would get with a street in between. So I went back down and asked for another room. I dealt with another woman, who gave us a VERY SMALL room by the service elevator, I don't have to tell you what that was like at 630 in the morning. So we checked out and went to our usual Hotel for the duration of our trip. Overall I would say if you do stay here, ask for a street side room not the courtyard. And stay as far away from the service elevator as possible.

My husband took me there in May 2012 for our 20th wedding anniversary, walked into our room the GM of the hotel gave us a nice complimentary bottle of Champagne, a box of Chocolates and a very warm greeting cards! It was very nice because we both felt like we were special. Our room was facing towards the back area but still we have a lovely view. It isn't cheap but it's bloody worth the experienced! The bar/restaurant downstairs served fabulous drinks and foods be it a canapé, main course or dessert! A walking distance to Balthazar, Meat packing District, Mercer Street, china town and little Italy area. The staff were friendly expect the guy at the Receptionist a Desk in the restaurant as he thinks that we are not a celebrity, so he kind of snooty and obnoxious though ... Anyway, all in all I have had the best time in NY. I am sure with out a doubt we will coming back again to the Crosby Street Hotel!

Everything about The Crosby Street Hotel is good.The room layout and the small things such as providing a bedside clock, water at night, bathroom ammenities etc all add to the goodness of the hotel.The staff, the care they show and the facilities are great.The concierge desk is extremely helpful with all requests and nothing is too much trouble for them.The location is second to none in New York.

An incredible boutique hotel that even though medium in size felt very intimate. Great downtown location close to everything fun in the city. The room was amazing, the biggest windows of a hotel I have ever looked out of in Manhattan. The bed, one of the comfiest I have ever slept in The staff are at your beck and call at a moments notice. The food was a little bland but still very edible and fresh. We had to stay in this hotel for a few weeks and I definitely looked forward to coming 'home' each night.

We stayed here for 5 days / great central location to explore manhattan and numerous boutiques and restaurants of soho&nolita districtsVery calm&chic design / spacious rooms with three meter high windowsMeanwhile, to avoid night noise from the street I would strongly recommend to ask courtyard looking rooms

just wonder around and there is no dull spot or corner! a sanctuary of design and querky furniture. Retro, modern and ahead! totally loved it!The restaurants are nice though not top top class but pleasent and well serviced.have tea there.i cant wait to go back!

Such a great experience, The staff really gives a nice service everything is possible ,good location, I am definately going to repeat my stay there.The whole atmosphere is just great.Super breakfast ,and fantastic decoration, you really feel that every room in that hotel are personal , very nice comfort
user_name:
Eric N
New York City, New York

review_body: One of the best hotel experiences we have ever had. Cant say enough about this hotel. Great location which really helps as you are in the heart of Soho but on a nice quiet street. Dean and Deluca is a block away. The design is modern but comfortable and staff were very friendly and helpful. The bar is a great little spot to people watch and have a drink also. We will stay here again for sure. Has to be one of best hotels in NYC.

We really enjoyed our weekend stay. Great location. Floor to ceiling windows in the room felt very loft like and added a nice edge to the quirky furnishings. We received a cute box of pencils and a atomizer on our pillow in the evening to spray a relaxing scent before going to sleep. Everything about this hotel is "creative". Concierge extremely helpful and everyone at the front desk friendly and without attitude. Great decor in the "library" off the lobby area to have tea, drinks or a light bite. We will be back on our next trip to NYC.

One of the best hotel experiences ever! Loved all the little extras like free water bottles on the bedside refreshed each evening, the gifts in the room, water in the gym, etc. Rooms were very comfortable and excellently appointed although not sure they need to change the bed linen every day! Staff were most helpful especially the guys on concierge who couldn't have been more accommodating. Only complaint was slow service in the restaurant. Useful tip is to request a room on floor 6 and above for excellent views. Highly recommend this hotel for service and location!

There is only perfection at this hotel, other than price! From the floor to ceiling windows to the cosy library, you feel like you are up in someone's home from the time you enter to the inevitable departure. The staff is as cheerful as the color palette throughout the hotel. A worth while splurge in the middle of Soho!

Stayed at the Crosby for three nights with my teenage son for a bonding mini break. Loved the rooms, simply gorgeous floor to ceiling windows and great decor. Location is great, so easy to get everywhere and right in the heart of Soho but quiet. Best of all were the staff, particularly the three guys on the concierge desk, each one was very knowledgable and extremely helpful. Nothing was too much trouble and everything came with a genuine smile. I have stayed in some of the best hotels across the world and these guys faced stiff competition but they really delivered.Very very impressed.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights to celebrate a big anniversary. I must admit, I am a hotel snob. My feeling is if I can't stay at a property that is at least as nice as my own home (and my home is very nice) or nicer, then I would rather stay home. This boutique hotel was perfection. Between the gorgeous and inspired interior decoration in the public areas as well as the guest rooms (brilliantly executed by the owner Kit Kemp, classic, modern, sophisticated and timeless, quite a difficult mix to master) with every attention to detail including really beautiful art, accessories and flowers everywhere.....floor to ceiling windows with fabulous views on the upper floors...every amenity/service you can imagine....and THE STAFF is TOP NOTCH professional...A special thank you to Adam Parnes who made us feel like VIP guests, I can't thank you enough, and Terence, Arbor, the Georges, Jeremy, Ruben....the housekeeping staff as well...you all helped to make our stay a truly memorable experience. We cannot wait to return.

There is a lot to like about the Crosby Street Hotel. The rooms are light and airy with floor to ceiling windows. Bathrooms are nice and modern with great showers and nice toiletries. The location is on a pretty quiet street (for New York, anyway). Beds are very comfortable and the staff is friendly. If you are spending most of your time in lower Manhattan, this is a very good place to stay. There is a lot going on these days in Soho, the Village, etc. So there is a lot to be said for the Crosby Street's location.There were just a couple of things that were not top notch. The service in the very small bar can be slow -- the waiter was prone to just disappear. The food at breakfast was good but, again, service was a bit slow. If you are going back and forth to midtown, the traffic can be a real mess and you can have some taxi rides where the fare resembles the national debt due to the time you spending just sitting. I realize that isn't the fault of the hotel, but it is a fact of life in NYC. If you can stand the subways and need to head to midtown, do it.

The hotel is well located in the Soho , quite street and easy to get anywhere by foot.The room , lobby and restaurant are all very well designed and the service is good,the night concierge Adi was great and helped us get to nice places.we had arrived late and checked out at 7:30 pm , and had to pay the full price, although I did agree to that in advance I thought a little extra was due just to make us feel better, as one free breakfast or a small discount on the last night (7h of extra stay) .All in all a very nice hotel , a bit overpriced , spa services and bicycle for guests could have made this hotel my regular hotel in NYC.

Just stayed here for three nights with my wife. The hotel is in a great location. Absolutely perfect for everything you want to do downtown. Design is top. Great look. Rooms are pretty small but have lovely large windows and feel spacious.The restaurant is bad. When there for breakfast this morning. After being seated no-one turned up for 25mins to take our order. Too busy? We just left. Overall only okay value for money.

Went here for a special birthday afternoon tea whilst staying elsewhere in NYC. As we were early we sat in a lovely outdoor area beside the bar and had a drink. After we sat in the main bar area at a round table. There was a lovely atmosphere with very cool art work on the walls. Especially loved the Beano dogs at the reception desk. The food was lovely with a good selection of tea and cakes. Pineapple upside down cake was to die for. Service was very good. Considered going to the plaza for this but really glad we didn't and chose here.

We had a very pleasant stay at the Crosby Street Hotel. As you get older NYC can be rough on the senses and this hotel made up for whatever I felt I was lacking when I returned from hours of walking around the city. The hotel is an oasis for a weary soul. The decor and art is just lovely. We had a room on one of the top floors and because of the huge windows we went to bed with the moon&stars and woke up with the sun and with a fabulous view. This hotel is pure quality and because of that, pricey. Great showers, great bed. Excellent staff. Every now & then handwritten messages + candy from the director wishing us a pleasant stay, just really nice.

We spent 14 nights at the Crosby street Hotel. It is expensive but it is well worth it. We booked an upper floor room which gave us great views over Soho. Instead of becoming tired of the same surroundings, we were made to feel at home every day. All the staff were wonderful, the concierges who always gave current, accurate advice, the waitress in the cocktail bar who could more accurately predict what cocktail I would enjoy better than I could. The reception staff who were always welcoming and pleasant right through to the hotel's General Manager who was engaged and welcoming. Guests had access to an Honour bar where you could make your own drink or our your own champagne, sit in the luxurious lounge just like at home BUT with full butler service if you would prefer. The hotel has an eclectic design with a focus on the local dogs of Soho. The products I. The bathroom were excellent quality and I found myself using the body lotion in preference to my own. The turndown service provided a bottle of water per guest and a beautiful spray of lavender on the daily fresh sheets and pillows. It is one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in, in a hotel. If I had any criticism it would be breakfast. We only had breakfast on our final day and were glad we had opted not to take the breakfast package, there are far more cost effective and delicious breakfast foods throughout Soho and NYC in general. However that is more of a tip than a criticism. Eat breakfast out. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, a place that makes you feel at home whilst providing amazing service. It will now be our go to place in NYC. Oh, and the Sunday film night was also great, my advice however, is if you choose the dinner and movie option go earlier so you don't have to rush the three course meal!

I wasn't sure what to expect as some of the trendier hotels often don't serve afternoon tea, but we were very pleasantly surprised. The room & seating is more that of a traditional dining room than typical tea rooms or you can sit outside in the garden area ,but the tables aren't ideal for tea as the waitstaff pointed out & we agreed. I wasn't crazy about the decor or ambiance, but we soon got over that as everything else was great. Beautiful china & teapots, good tea selection, good food, sugar cubes (a must for a proper tea) and very polite attentive service. I would recommend and go back.
user_name:
CBWS
New York City, New York

review_body: Kit Kemp is a brilliant interior designer and hotelier. Her hotel properties in London are always well situated, decorated to the finest detail and fitted out with the best furnishings - likewise for her hotel in NYC at Crosby St. Located off a quieter street in SoHo, staying at the Crosby is great for exploring downtown NYC. The hotel is in a convenient location but nicely tucked way so it is never too noisy. The bedding is so comfortable, and the bathroom well done up (water pressure is very good). This is a hotel that feels like home away from home.

The last of our 4 hotels in NYC proved to be the best, in terms of location (perfect for strolling around SoHo with lots of shops & restaurants), design, service, size of the luxury room & bathroom. The doormen double up as expert weather forecasters!

I stayed 4 nights with my wife in this beautiful decorated hotel. Professional staff, a warm welcome on arrival and the concierge and doormen were always willing to assist and recommend for shopping, dining and directions. Hotel was extremely clean and well appointed, a high quality of decoration and soft furnishings used. Free Wifi in the hotel, excellent breakfast. Large rooms for NYC, nice bathroom with great powerful shower. Excellent location in SoHo, great shopping possibilities. Also very nice bar for drinks with friends and/or business partners.

We just returned from our 6th stay at this awesome hotel. As usual, the staff was so welcoming and accommodating. The room decor is eclectic and totally cool. The fabrics and furnishings change from room to room which keeps it interesting for return visits. We've stayed in deluxe junior suites and luxurious one bedroom suites...all fantastic! Housekeeping is terrific and the rooms have always been spotless. We love the Crosby Bar for a tremendous selection of delicious, flavorful dishes in a cool setting. Definitely our favorite hotel in NYC!

My husband and I spent the night at this amazing hotel when going to watch the U.S. Open. We were surprised at the attention to detail in the artwork and decor in all of the rooms. The two spacious yet comfortable conference rooms had their own color palette and feel with beautiful furniture and pieces of artwork you won't see anywhere else. There is even a movie theater/screening room where they offer specials on certain nights and weekends. We didn't get back to the hotel until after 1 am and wanted a nightcap. The library off the main lobby offered an "honor bar" even though a waiter came to take our drink order. Our hotel room which had an amazing view from a huge oversized window had a fully stocked bar and a bathroom one could only dream of- gorgeous marble walls and flooring with a flat screen TV above the tub and spacious free standing shower stall. The front desk staff were actually very nice and friendly. I was not expecting that in a boutique NY hotel. Our only bad experience was in their adjoining restaurant at breakfast. You would have thought the waiter had to pay us to be in his station. He was the epitome of NY rudeness. Not a "good morning" or "can I start you with coffee" not a smile-Nothing! And that wasn't the worst part. After we ordered our food, I had to pull him away from a conversation with another waiter to ask for my coffee--he disappeared and another staff member brought it out. We waited quite a while for just our water and OJ, but when the food did arrive, our waiter delivered it to us and never asked if we wanted any refills, how our food was-- again disappeared and never returned. Ever! We finally had to leave and another staffer came to clear our dishes and leave the bill. Unfortunately, I had to excuse myself to the ladies room and my husband handled the bill. He later told me a 15% tip was automatically included in the bill! I couldn't believe it! If I had known before we were in the cab, I would have gone straight to the manager and let him have it. Bottom line, the hotel was fabulous and well run with terrific staff--they should either separate themselves from the restaurant or have the front desk train the wait staff in the business of hospitality.

Checked in for our third or fourth visit and were told that breakfast wasn't included in the $800 rate. It always had been before but not now. The reason we got was, "We're really busy at this time of year so we don't have to offer that." Same story from the reservations manager. They seem to think that because they're busy they don't have to show any appreciation or loyalty to a returning customer. I figure we'll probably come to NYC about six or eight more times in the years ahead but we won't be staying at the Crosby. So that's somewhere around 15 or 20 room nights they're losing because they wouldn't spring for a continental breakfast. That seems to be bad business but then, it goes with the bad attitude other reviewers have mentioned.

lovely room, very modern fantastic view full of sunchine the window is from floor to top. Great bathroom. The only down point was breakfast the people wasnt as nice as the hotel staff. Looks they doing you a favor when you ask for something.

Very funky hotel.Typical downtown with a dirty,dirty location, but the rooms are large and decor innovative.Most of the staff are great, but some are typical of New York's arrogant wait staffWould recommend if you don't mind the filth in the streets

Stayed at a really nice junior suite for 2 nights. Great quiet location just of Broadway in Soho. Fantastic down to earth staff and concierge. Marvelous suite with lots of lights and nicely fitted. Solid chic interior, not flashy.Cosy bar and restaurant with great food.Will stay there again in the future.

I've long been a fan of Kit Kemp's London hotels - including the quaint and perfectly wonderful Knightsbridge Hotel. It's great to have that same level of perfection in NYC. A recent return visit reminded me how personalized service and authentic decor makes all the difference. Suite 809 has wonderful views over the Soho rooftops, with fantastic loft-like windows which bathe the room in sunlight. Certainly the best place to stay in Soho.

Stayed at Crosby St for 05 nights in July with my kids. Already a fan of Firmdale hotels in London, Crosby was no different.
