Very - very - chic, still laid back - confortable well tasted room, sleeper sofa for my son amazingly confortable, bathroom in marble with delicious amenities, impecable friendly service.Charming cozy "living room". Best location ever in Soho.One of the best hotels I've stayed in my life (-:

we spent the night here for our anniversary. The room was beautiful and the service was amazing! We will definitely come again! We had a package that included a delicious breakfast and we were gifted a bottle of champagne for our anniversary. The room is expensive but worth it for a special night out.
user_name:
moxie8
Chatham, New Jersey, United States

review_body: I won't even go into my more thorough, point-by-point review for this one. The place is gorgeous and modern. Elegance without stuffiness. It's a hipper place so if you're looking for an old-world aesthetic, this isn't for you but if you want to feel like a millionaire in 2017 - book it.
user_name:
Chicagodude07
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed at Crosby Street in December 2012. It is a beautiful hotel. The decor is stunning, the rooms are smallish but perfectly formed. Views over NY stunning. We liked the location in Soho a little off the main drag. Very helpful concierge and doormen. It is a good example of how a hotel should be run. Only downside - it's very expensive even for NY.

Great hotel in a prime location. If gets no better for shopping or diningDecor is just amazing too.Service top notchGreat breakfast We took our kids on their first trip to NYC and have thoroughly spoilt them with this experience.Top choice for any trip to NYC

I travel a fair wee bit for work and holiday and stay in lovely places, however Crosby Street Hotel in Tribeca has got to be my most favourite place to stay yet, my husband and I were there for a three night break in NYC for his 50th birthday, I cannot tell you how special we felt, what a warm welcome we received and how nothing was too much trouble. Crosby Street was also one of the most unique and beautiful hotels I have ever stayed in, I cannot wait to go back there :) Katherine and all her staff could not have done enough, pre trip advice on restaurants and things to do, a beautiful card and bottle of champagne on arrival, and just the most personal attention from everyone. Ok I am raving now I realise, but it's worth it , Crosby Street Hotel and all the staff thank you all so much for a very special weekend.Claire and Hunter Wallace :)

My favorite place to stay in NYC. It has the touches of Europe (honor bar in the living room, English breakfasts, lovely courtyard) while being very accomodating. The rooms are very comfortable, with the beds being one of my favorites in the world. Great service that always makes me feel like I am home versus staying in a hotel.

I stayed at the Crosby stret hotel twice, the rooms are very lovely and clean, and the bed is comfortable. Ask for the little pillow spray when it's turndown time, it smells amazing!Breakfast is really good but a bit pricey.

It is difficult for me to write an objective review about the Crosby Street Hotel because I love the brand so much. Each time I stay in a hotel run by the Firmdale group the more my love grows. The Crosby Street is no exception. They STILL have the best showers of any hotel I have ever stayed in. By far. The rooms are spotless, beautifully appointed and entirely individual. The bed is so comfortable that the idea of getting out of it in the morning requires some serious thought and reflection.The decor remains the freshest and quirkiest in a hotel for miles around and it is a pleasure returning to the hotel every day after a day in the NY trenches. The concierge desk is exceptional - thanks again to Chris for suggesting that we eat at Atera (it turned out to be the culinary highlight of our trip) and to Todd for all his helpful tips. I love the location of the hotel on a quiet street in Soho - peaceful but steps away from the madness of Broadway and two subway stations to choose between - one around each corner. Great coffee to be had at La Colombe around the corner on Lafayette, at Gimme Coffee! on Mott Street or in the McNally Jackson bookshop in Prince Street (with the added bonus of being able to sit and drink it in their lovely bookish space).I would definitely return to the Crosby on a next trip. In fact, I would happily move in permanently. Thanks again!
user_name:
JezebelleH
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: We stayed at the Crosby Street hotel for 4 nights. Everyone and everything was great! From the concierge who helped with bookings for restaurants outside to the reception and waitstaff (which is trained impeccably). The decor of the hotel is kind of Mary Poppins, but we loved it! Rooms are very nicely appointed and absolutely spotless, the best beds ever and the water pressure in the showers was also best ever:) The quality is above similar offerings in NYC. We tried breakfast, lunch and dinner several times, great! High quality and service! We will definitely be back!

This was our second stay at the Crosby Street Hotel and it was just as good as our last visit. Staff are genuinely helpful and interested in their guests. Both reception and concierge staff were outstanding.Our room (903) was fine beautifully presented and had great views. Our only disappointment was the waiting staff at breakfast. They lacked interest in their guests. Several times we had to chase them up to get what we wanted. We did not have dinner in house but expect that the waiting/serving would be much better there.Overall a great location, excellent fit out and presentation and genuine helpful staff.

All the positive reviews about this boutique hotel are SPOT ON. This place is lovely. Our family of five stayed in a junior suite connecting to a deluxe room for several days. Had plenty of space. We also slept well. The beds were extremely comfortable, including - surprise, surprise - the pull-out couch! The shower pressure and temperature were perfect. Right amount of space to keep belongings organized and out-of-the way. The mini bar frig kept drinks well chilled. The a/c functioned efficiently and quietly. The hallways were well-lit. Elevators were speedy. The bar has some really tasty things and the wine list is extensive.Fabulous location for shopping in Soho. Subway stops are close as well as a ton of cabs.Downside? TAXES to New York. This applies to any hotel in the city. For two rooms plus valet parking we paid a whopping $250.00 in taxes PER NIGHT!!!!!!!!!! The rate is around 14.67% on the room and 18.38% on the car parking. We budgeted for this trip and were prepared to spend the money. Please make sure you do too! You don't want to end up paying credit card interest on taxes.Yes, staying in Manhattan is expensive especially at a place like the Crosby Street Hotel. This luxury boutique hotel is well worth it.

I met a dear friend for a long afternoon’s discussion at the Crosby Street Hotel bar. The interior design of this hotel is simply world-class, and absolutely breathtaking in its freshness and brilliance. Really just spectacular. This ambiance had an impact on what was already going to be a fun conversation. Indeed, we lingered over our iced teas and enjoyed first-rate hospitality. I have now found my “home base” for future visits to NYC, and I will be staying as a guest at this outstanding property tucked away on a quiet street in SOHO. A gem.

Where to start? One word - quality.From the staff, to the room finishes, to the linen to the location. This hotel is a wonderful choice.My stay was short and I didn't have anything out of the ordinary I needed assistance with, but you can tell the staff care about the experience of those staying. The rooms are well appointed, with a wonderfully comfortable bed, great cushions and pillows, a separate couch, arm chair and some cushions on the window sill to take advantage of the floor to ceiling windows. I stayed in a standard courtyard room and it did not feel basic at all.The guest sitting room was a nice option after a busy day or evening on the streets of NY, with an honour system bar for a nightcap or afternoon drink.My initial reason for selecting this hotel was location, but I have no doubt it is far more superior than other smaller hotels in the Soho area. If you are going to spend most of your spare time in Lower Manhattan, don't look any further.Having stayed at several chain hotels further uptown, I think Crosby Street is fantastic value for money and I am very pleased I had the opportunity to stay there! I will certainly be back next visit.

Stayed at Crosby Street hotel for a weekend. The staff is impeccably trained and it shows. Rooms are not huge but very nicely appointed and absolutely spotless. The quality of the furnishings is head and shoulders above similar offerings in NYC. For those who pay attention to these things (and I know that not everybody does) -- water pressure in the shower is the the best I've experienced in my travels. Great breakfast on an outdoor patio. Try it out if the weather is nice.Will definitely consider again for our NYC weekend getaways....

Really impressed at all the staff at this lovely hotel, especially the doormen - one even went off in the tropical storm to find me a taxi from one of the busier roads nearby. They remember your name and make it seem like you're a special customer. Funky design, big windows, good location, free wifi, peaceful even in the midst of Soho - and even a chance for celeb spotting, with the film evenings at their cinema.
user_name:
Sue H
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: I've stayed here twice and both times enjoyed every minute. The hotel is gorgeous, probably the most beautifully decorated hotel I've ever stayed at. The restaurant and bar area is great. It's situated on a perfect street in Soho. The only downside - extremely expensive (but worth every penny).

We chose to stay here having stayed (and loved) the Charlotte Street and Soho hotels in London. Crosby street felt lovely and familiar with the beautiful decoration and Kit Kemp styleOur room was gorgeous and bright and the floor to ceiling windows allowed us a fabulous view over the rooftops giving it an unmistakable NYC vibe! Bed was huge and comfortable and bathroom spacious with a nice luxurious feel. The bar has a great vibe, good selection of fizz by the glass and the decoration is gorgeous and quirky. The courtyard garden is just lovely – a little oasisWe absolutely loved this place and would not hesitate to go back or recommend.Location is also great especially if you like shopping! The mini bar has a map of area with all the shops, bars and restaurants listed – we used it extensively! SoHo is fantastic for shopping and it’s an easy walk to the Village and Meat Packing District for even more shopping! Lots of metro stations close by as well so easy to get aroundHotel as perfect and staff lovely! Great restaurant recommendations from concierge

My first time staying at Crosby Street Hotel...and I absolutely loved it!Quiet, comfortable and convenient, this luxury boutique hotel is a true gem in SoHo. European feel, intimate communal spaces and garden, vibrant decor, small but well appointed fitness facility, and a great restaurant all make for an impressive property worth booking when in NYC.Service was consistently professional and friendly from the concierge to housekeeping.

I stayed here with my wife 2 years ago. It was great to return. It was as good as I remembered. The rooms are extremely comfortable. Free wifi. Excellent bar and restaurant. I only ate breakfast but it was all one would want.

I have stayed at The Soho hotel in London at least 15 times now and was really looking forward to staying at the sister hotel in New York. Once again a Firmdale Hotel lived up to all my expectations. On arriving at the Crosby Street Hotel at 14:00 I was informed that because my room was not ready to make my way to the bar and that all drinks and food were on the house. A big thanks to Jason for this gesture. My room , a rooftop deluxe, was beatuiful with a wonderful view of the rooftops across SoHo. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choices on the menu and any meals I had in the bar were also very good. The bar can get very busy but the atmosphere is very laid back. All members of staff that I came across were great.

This is a review in retrospect and a long time coming! I have to tell you....this is a gorgeous boutique hotel and you should stay here when in New York. We holidayed NY winter 2011 and our first stay was at The Crosby Street Hotel. The rooms are beautifully appointed, creative and the whole hotel smells delicious all day long with its own personalised candles/toiletries throughout. Staff are attentive and smiling (all of the time!) Food is tasty and plentiful in choice. This hotel makes you feel happy. It has the right mix of vibrancy, privacy and cool.

First of all, book a great room. A suite if you can. A Jr. Suite if you can't. I guess like most hotels. This place feels clean. And that's the most important detail for me. Decent bathrooms. Nice size room and living room. Thoughtfully detailed. The staff is great. The management greater. The answer is always "yes". If there were a drawback, I'd say it was the paparazzi. Not a fan. But I guess that's a sign of the clientele they draw.

A most wonderful stay at Crosby Street - the entire trip was spent raving about the hotel- location, decor, and incredible helpfulness of the staff.... I adored the art, the sculpture and textiles were beautiful- the attention to detail everywhere was superb. The rooms were perfectly appointed with tons of storage, full length mirrors, floor to celing windows that actually open [an important feature]. I did not want to leave- I was feeling like this was my home after only 3 days! The staff went out of their ways to be helpful- flagging a cab included the concierge going around the corner to find one somewhere nearby and drive back to the hotel with the driver! other Soho hotels have left us to fend for oursselves in this regard so these efforts were very much appreciated.The gardens are lovely and it was wonderful to eat breakfast outside or relax amongst sculpture and greenery. a little oasis in the midst of a busy neighbourhood!Only suggestion to make this an 11/10 experience: Nespresso machines in the rooms, chocolates on the bed- other boutique hotels of this calibre have these extra thoughtful touches.otherwise- total perfection and cant wait to return!!

I have stayed a few times at this hotel am always impressed with the rooms and the service on hand. I feel like am back in London being the chain hotel to Soho London it speaks for itself. Highly recommend you stay at least once while in NY!

Big rooms, comfy beds, great position, inspiring decor, but most of all a brilliant concierge - and in a place like NYC a good concierge is worth their weight in gold. After all why visit the Big Apple unless you are going to eat, drink, shop, tour and catch a few shows. The concierge sorts it all, from tickets to shows to restaurant bookings to directions to planning your visit to museums so you see the attraction rather than someones back in a queue. The end result is that one almost feels like they are a New Yorker. The breakfast is lovely and the buffet is healthy. The help yourself bar is fantastic if you want to entertain a visitor and in case you are caught in a snow storm the gym will keep you active. The Crosby Street Hotel was a pleasure. Every big city needs a Crosby.

I am a repeat customer. This is my favorite hotel anywhere. From the moment you walk through the doors you get scooped up in tremendous customer care and service. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are beautifully decorated and have quirky decor that is just charming. Location is one street off Broadway and perfectly tucked in Soho. Don't hesitate. This is where you want to be when in NYC. Sorry if I'm gushing......such a great place.

I have stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel twice and will definitely return again if I have the opportunity! The rooms are spacious and bright which is not always the norm in the city. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms/ bathrooms are spotlessly clean! The service is friendly and accommodating- management even sent us a bottle of champagne since we were celebrating our anniversary! My husband and I really enjoyed the lounge/ restaurant in the hotel as well. The neighborhood (SoHo) is lovely- I love all the stores and cobblestone streets- one of the more relaxing parts of NYC.

Returning to The Crosby Street Hotel for the first time in three years it was a reassuring pleasure to find it every bit as perfect as it was before! I expect that Firmdale hotels will not drop the ball when it comes to standards of decor, service and relaxation - but you can never be sure, so it was very reassuring to find that The Crosby Street still remains a welcoming and delightful touch of England in NYC!Located in SoHo this was Firmdale's first expansion outside its native London and was also the first purpose-built hotel in the portfolio. This part of New York has become a trendy destination and certainly suffers less from sidewalk-overoad! Galleries, boutiques and designer shops plus individual restaurants and bars are neatly packed into traditional architecture it has less glitz than mid-town but is more relaxed and attractive for it.And The Crosby Street fits perfectly into that vibe with ultra-helpful staff, a very knowledgeable team at the concierge desk, supremely comfortable rooms and an excellent bar-restaurant that is every bit as buzzy and bustling as a newly-opened celeb-destination all combine to make the hotel a great choice for aNew York City stay - whether for business or pleasure.This visit was for the NYC Motor Show, so I had a small group in tow and this is another area where Firmdale excel - they go out of their way to make everyone in a group feel individually valued and responded fully and effectively to one of my guests who had a bit of an issue with their room. Without exception they were all converts by the end of the visit!I hear that Firmdale are building a new, bigger hotel in New York and can't wait to see what that will be like - but it will have to be good to unseat The Crosby Street.

I have visited NYC on many previous occasions and have always stayed midtown before and really enjoyed the atmosphere, so i was a little sceptical to be staying so far south as it were.I need not have worried- its in a fab location right in the heart of Soho with all its shops and restaurants. Several subways stations a very short walk away can whisk you quickly wherever you need to go.We arrived at the hotel a little jaded to say the least from a very long immigration queue at the airport and a nightmare long joyrney into the city to find Booking.com had not advised the hotel if our booking so they had no idea we were arriving on a very busy weekend.No problem- it was sorted out quickly, with no fuss and the general mamager came over to introduce herself and make sure we were ok.Our luxary room was great- tastefully decorated, huge windows, very very comfy bed and a nice welcome gift. The shower has to be the best and most powerful ive ever experienced.The concierge was very helpful, sorting out show tickets and a nice meal at short notice. The tickets were even delivered to our room.Love love love this hotel- it really is an oasis of calm and lovelyness in the madness of the city.Will be back!

Stayed here three nights. I usually stay at the W on Lexington/49, but wanted a change. Great looking hotel and location, and fun with the floor to ceiling windows. Bathroom was really nice and the room was of top quality and spacious. Service was great as would be expected. Nothing wrong with the Crosby hotel at all other than the price. I realize that we are talking about NYC, but value for money though.... (although internet was complimentory). Not completly sold.I now space is a limitation, but this place could need a cool bar other than just one in the restaurant.

I wrote this a while back about the Soho Hotel in London which belongs to the same chain.Since it also applies to the Crosby Street Hotel, i will paste it in :Everything about this hotel is what you expect and hope for in a luxury city hotel : clean , big rooms, incredible mattresses and bed linens, big bathrooms, great products, new thick towels and robes, great assortment in mini bar , impeccable service, 2 cosy living rooms for meetings or reading , big healthy breakfast choice , both buffet and a la carte, fun( but noisy ) bar and restaurant area, amazing location, beautiful and well taken care of interior design......what else can you want ?The Soho Hotel makes you feel like someone, a person not a corporate, really cares.Ok so everything applies here , except if i could add just one little detail ...the breakfast restaurant at the Crosby can be at times a bit slow and cold , their buffet selection could be a bit broader....more like the London one, a wider cooked selection ? . I am also a coffee person : double expresso cortado for breakfast sort of thing , but i have not found yet the perfect morning coffee at the Crosby , too milky , or their brew is too bitter and watery . So i go to my secret place in the neighborhood for my fix because at Balthasar's around the corner the coffee is burnt and not good at all .For the rest....perfection. This hotel is my NY home away from home.

Have just returned from this amazing hotel. From the moment you step out of your cab you are treated to the very highest level of luxury, sheer perfection and service that an hotel could offer.Kit Kemp's stylish interiors are stunning- incredible use of colour, fabrics and contemporary art make every room and every turn in the guest areas, a visual indulgence.We were generously upgraded to a beautiful suite- as spacious as an apartment, stylish and so comfy with huge sofa, armchairs and the best bed ever slept in .The food was incredible too- the sweetest fruits, most delicious pancakes, granola and croissants- in fact every scope of breakfast catered for.Freshly pressed fruit juices were a morning treat - the fig and strawberry was great.Attention to detail is tops and the dashing staff are so helpful and accommodating giving great restaurant tips, route plans and the feel that nothing is too much trouble.Jason took us up to the roof to see the site of the vegetable garden and meet the chickens !Having stayed in rads of Morocco, palaces of Rajasthan and hotels all over the globe - this hotel comes out with the very best and despite room rates it is worth every penny and will make any stay in New York spectacular.

The hotel is part of a small London chain and it shows; the staff are superbly trained and engage the guest rather than parrot,"have a nice day". The rooms are elegant and comfortable. My only criticism was the room service menu - it could be more extensive. I will stay there agin.

We stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel for the last two nights of our honeymoon.We arrived early and were told our room would be ready at 2pm which we were expecting so we went to explore the area.We arrived back at 2pm but our room still wasn't ready, so we had a drink in the bar. Slightly disappointed that the drink wasn't FOC but in any case it wasn't long until we were up in our room.I love the style of this hotel, and after visiting The Soho, The Covent Garden and The Charlotte Street hotels in London, I was not disappointed with the fresh, sleek décor of the hotel's communal areas, however our room had a bright green feature wall which was a shame as I adored all the other room designs I'd seen on the site.The room itself was very luxurious. The bed was so comfy and came with a beautiful lavender pillow spray. The windows are very grand and I enjoyed sitting in the window seat watching Soho go by below.We were very grateful to be welcomed moments after arriving in our room with a complimentary bottle of champagne and a note congratulating us on our wedding - a very special touch.The location of this hotel is amazing! We had stayed in Times Square for 3 nights prior but much preferred the cool, urban feel of this location with the best shops on the doorstep!We visited the bar again after returning late evening from a charity gala and, even though the kitchen was just shutting, because we were guests they kept it open to serve us. We had the sliders and flat bread which were amazing!!All in all this is a 5 star hotel, a very cool one at that! The staff are very friendly and professional but it is what you'd expect for the price.We really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to anyone!

We stayed for a quick Saturday night visit. The hotel is in a wonderful location, close to great shops and restaurants. Upon arrival the valet secured us a free parking spot right on the street. The management is friendly and efficient. The decor of the hotel is artsy but cozy and elegant at once. There is a dog motif throughout the hotel and I was told that smaller dogs were allowed there though exceptions had been made for larger ones on occasion. (This is important to those who travel with pets!) Our room was lovely and spacious and overlooked the street with a huge window. They have the most amazing showers! The water pressure is like an amazing massage-don't want to get out! When we entered our room the valet asked if we would like a tray of coffee or tea. He promptly sent up a tray and felt bad that he forgot the cookies we requested so he sent those up without charge. The beds are extremely comfortable. THey had a small but nice gym.I was sorry I wasn't staying longer. I would highly recommend this lovely hotel to anyone. The staff is courteous, never snooty and very welcoming.

Stayed in a deluxe upper floor room for a week over Christmas period. The room was outstanding... bigger than other big cities like London/Paris etc for the price (about $700) with a large bathroom. The decor is gorgeous (someone said its like Paul Smith did it and they are spot on), and the full length warehouse style windows are great for just sitting in front of. Bathroom is nice with good shower (no bath in deluxe room) and a heated towel rail (so you can actually do a bit of laundry if you like rather than send everything out).As others have said the location is great - walking distance to everything in Soho, Noho, East Village, and Greenwich (and even Little Italy if thats your thing...). So right in the middle of some great shopping. Not many great places around to eat, but theres always subway and taxis... (btw I echoe how bad Balthazar down the road is... good burgers and pulled pork sandwiches up the road north at Back Forty West for lunch though).Only bad thing about Crosby St is the restaurant and the food - we ate breakfast there most days and were very satisfied. But Christmas lunch was an appalling affair waiting an hour for appetisers and a meal of generally mediocre quality (some things needed to be sent back). Room service one night was also comparably mediocre and both were expensive. So bottom line, if you want a nice meal book outside of the hotel, or plan ahead locally!Would we stay again... 50/50... rooms and location are awesome, but maybe we would try somewhere up near the park if the restaurant didnt improve.

We had a thoroughly splendid stay for three nights at the crosby just before Christmas 2012.Check in was effortless, the room was delightful, (plenty of space for two adults and two children!) the breakfasts were excellent, the service was friendly and attentive. The bed is by far the most confortable, perfectly formed marshmallow I have ever sunk into and, despite jetlag we had an amazing nights sleep! It was our wedding anniversary plus our kids firts ever visit to NY and we arrived back the first night to thoughtful cupcakes for the kids and a gift and champagne for us! So much appreciated! Lovely lunge for a glass of wine (great winelst) by the fire......The location was great- walkable to little italy and chinatown for dinner, two seconds to the main subway that takes you up to mid town in a few minutes.We will most definitely be back! Thank you Crosby Street.

We are 8 nights into an 11 night stay at this truly wonderful hotel. I researched hotels in NYC for a very long time before choosing The Crosby. I arrived with very high expectations and these expectations have been fulfilled and surpassed. The hotel is beautifully appointed. The lobby, drawing room, restaurant and rooms are full of art, gorgeous fabrics and finishes. Firmdale has nailed interior design. I love the feel of this place. Our room overlooks Crosby St and watching the street life below is one of my favorite things. The bed is top notch, the bathroom fantastic and the housekeeping pristine. The location has to be the best in town. We stayed in Midtown for two nights initially - never again! Crosby St is quiet in busy SoHo. The neighborhood is amazing and the shopping especially off Broadway is incredible. Three subway stations are walking distance from the hotel- the 6 on Spring takes you east up to Upper East ( Bleeker and Union Sq on the way) and downtown to Walk st, the N&R takes you to Times Sq and Midtown and the A&C takes you west to Upper West side.The staff make the hotel really special. The restaurant staff are so friendly and welcoming we now prefer to eat in rather than go out. (Balthazar was terrible). The head Concierge Chris is very helpful and a top bloke. He sets the tone. Couldn't be better. Every staff member, without fail has been first rate. The only downside is all other hotels will be a disappointment after this stay. Attended a conference at the Waldorf Astoria and couldn't wait to get back to The Crosby each day. What a contrast. I am already planning my next stay.

Loved it. Fun lunch. Very interesting and tasty food. Surprisingly value for money. Chic interior and interested staff who talked about food provenance and wine combinations. Great cocktail menu. Perfect really. V thoughtful to a child too which surprised us. Go there!

We were staying elsewhere but had a wonderful Saturday night dinner at the Crosby Hotel Restaurant. It was recommended by a friend and we enjoyed the atmosphere of this hip happening scene along with excellently prepared dishes. The three of us dined on lamb chops, Bronzino and Chicken Pot Pie. All was delicious. The service was friendly and efficient and the evening was delightful

Fabulous Soho location and wow lobby. The check-in staff were friendly and efficient. Loved the quirky, personality-clad decor. The rooms were comfortable and bright. The restaurant is great for breakfast, lunch and dinner (best, juiciest burgers). The Concierge services were really good - nothing too much trouble. Would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend as a modern, boutique hotel in a hot spot.

We just spent six nights at this hotel.With one exception, we loved the hotel, the staff and the location.We've stayed uptown on many occasions and downtown as well. The vibe in Soho is just right for us.The hotel is clean, fresh and modern. The decor is unusual---in a good way.Breakfast was included with our room. The food was uniformly excellent.The staff was friendly, courteous and always helpful.The room was silent---a huge thing in New York. The bed was comfortable. The room had lots of light due to the floor-to-ceiling windows. The only negative is that the hotel was somewhat stingy in granting us extra time on our departure. We had stayed for six nights and we asked for a relatively short extension to accomodate a late afternoon flight. We had to negotiate hard for a short extension, something I felt we should not have had to do given the length of our stay. I didn't quite believe the reasons given by the clerk who denied our request.

The hotel is located in a top spot if you like to be in the Soho area . i love the deco of the hotel , like all the other hotels of the Firmdale chain ( in London ) the feeling you get when you enter the place is like entering a friends home , the lobby is small and warm , the check in desk is friendly and efficient.we booked 2 rooms - a Deluxe and a Junior Suite , both rooms were very beautiful the only differnce was in the size , the suite had some more space and was on the upper floor . the mattress in the room is our #1 in the world - you want to stay in bed for ever , the linens are crisp cotton and the pilowes are perfect . they could do beeter with the bath amenities -the soap is so ordinary ..the Concierge team is a pro , they have the conections but some times they are looking for the easy work .. they will send you to the restaurants which were "in " last year ( still good ) but they will not pull strings to get you in those hot places you read about now ..the restaurant and bar - is a lively space very colorfull and with a good vibe . the food is ok not more .the service is immaculate , they remember your name and try to please you iwith every request.we miss a spa badly , the gym is tiny and the equipment is not adequate , we asked for a private trainer , the price they asked for was 275 $ for 1 hour which is way too much !!there are 2 gyms in the same street but they do not offer you to get in for free - you have to pay ...the limo sevice through the concierge costs 50% more then you can find alone , same with theatre tickets - they will charge you double then the prices you will pay through the web.i think that this is a very important point that as a guest you do not need to feel you are being robbed , you pay for the room ( a lot ) and you want to relax and enjoy your stay and the services the hoet can offer .we will return again but - will watch carefully the charges.

We stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel for a long weekend in December 2012. The service was excellent throughout and we loved the stylish design of the hotel. The hotel is well situated for shopping in Soho but was surprisingly quiet with no traffic noise at all. The food in the bar/ restaurant was delicious and the concierge recommended very good restaurants nearby. Overall this is my favourite of the many hotels I have visited in New York.

We chose the Crosby Street Hotel as my dog is called Cozby (but with a z) and I am so glad that we did! When I return to NYC for any future holidays I will be staying here without a doubt.We paid a little extra and booked a room on the top floor which was worth every penny. Our room deco was stylish and very comfortable with amazing rooftop views. The bed was so big I had to climb into it but was pure luxury. The bathroom had a walk in power shower which was divine.We ate at the hotel restaurant on the Friday night which was buzzing and had a great atmosphere, pink champagne and the crosby burger was yum! We ordered breakfast in bed on the last day, pancakes with syrup and hash browns were very good.Being an animal lover the dog theme was great and the deco is very stylish. Hotel is in a great location and the tube is nearby as are the Soho shops.Staff were friendly and helpful, concierge did a great job in managing to get us taxis.The hotel is relaxed and not pretentious, there is no where else in NYC I would rather stay.

I loved my stay at the Crosby.The location is ideal: very close to the action of Soho and Nolita, but on a quiet cobblestone side street. The subway is only a block away to take you uptown if needed.The lobby and restaurant are both beautiful and the staff was very accommodating. Both a shaving and toothbrush kit were brought to our room in minutes upon request. The rooms are the highlight of the hotel. Our deluxe room had a wall of gorgeous casement windows, with both a privacy shade and drapes that blocked out all light. The bathroom was beautiful and was appointed with heated towels, bathrobes and slippers.Our only complaint was that the air conditioning was difficult to control with the wall touch-pad. Easier controls would have been helpful.I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a hotel in New York.

We have stopped in New York many times and The Crosby Street Hotel is our favourite hotel. The location is superb for shopping in SoHo. Little Italy and China Town are easily within walking distance. The hotel itself is like a home from home with fantastic decor and features. Great bar and really friendly staff. I would recommend this place for anyone looking for a well run and stylish boutique hotel. Ivor and Joanne Allchurch. Worcestershire UK

This is an astonishingly good hotel in terms of convenience, location, service, but above all in terms of design. it's principle would appear to be largely canine and harmonious eclecticism. Which is to say that the public spaces and rooms are peppered with fabulous, curious, beautiful and intriguing objects and paintings, many to do with dogs. Rooms are large and personal touches abound so that you almost feel you're at home..Windows, are room-sized, and you almost feel you're in an adult dolls' house (not a dog kennel). Of course you can stop people looking in!It comes at a price, of course, but good things do, and it is worth it.

There is only one way to explain our stay at this hotel-exquisite.Every detail is looked after, from the decor, to the room layout, china tea cups!!!!!!! We were in this hotel when Sandy hit, it was devastating that we needed to leave the hotel the day after due to no power-the hotel and the staff were fantastic-they are a credit to the hotel and the owners. Well done!!!!!We cant wait to get back to NYC and to the Crosby Street Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I chose to stay here for my business trip for 1 night. My flight arrived at 7:10am, by the time I arrived at the hotel it was only around 8:30am ish. Upon arrival I requested for an early check-in over the email, however, they did not guarantee it, which is perfectly understandable as the usual check-in time for most of the hotels is 2-3pm. To my pleasant surprise, the staff already had a room ready for me when I was checking-in. I can go on and on about the outstanding service that this hotel provides...The room is contemporary, but yet cozy and homey. It is definitely one of the best hotels in NYC.
user_name:
Michelle915
New York City, New York

review_body: We love the firmdale brand, so chose to stay for my wife's 40th Birthday for 5 nights.From the moment we arrived the personal touch and experiances made our stay a dream.We have both travelled to NYC many times and hardend global traverlers, if you want and deserve a treat, then enter the world of Crosby street.The front staff and conceirge made our stay, Room upgrades, champagne, cup cakes, personal cards, flowers, all on the house! I had my heart set on a special restaurant, no luck booking from UK, the conceirge suprised us both on the eveing of my wifes Birthday with a reservation to the restaurant! amazing and extremely thoughtfull.The bar area is chilled, best drinks and service and bar interior in town, you can hear yourself think and unwind after a day on your feet, the breakfast is superb, try the full english! again serviced with perfection in peice and quite.The Hotel is very quiet, sleep quality outstanding for NYC, you will not beat this.Thankyou, Thankyou all at Crosby street, the value you give is extrodinary and rare.

I've stayed at this hotel several times - for business and pleasure. The staff are superb and cater expertly to both types of traveller. This trip was with my 15-yr-old daughter who loved it. Front desk staff, who really does everything, are outstanding. Room not ready? Have a glass of wine and a cupcake - on the house. Rooms are huge, stylishly and functionally appointed, quiet and whimsical. Kids will love the bench cushions on the huge sill of the gorgeous floor to ceiling windows. Great place to eat breakfast and watch the world go by. The smallest request is addressed courteously and promptly. No attitude in this boutique hotel. Everyone is a "somebody" and is treated with respect. If there is any area to work on I'd suggest the concierge desk could brush up......of the three who were on the weekend we were there, one was outstanding, one was miserable and surly and the third was knowledgable but curt. These failings, though, are more than balanced by all other staff. If you like the downtown location, I have no reservations about recommending this hotel. Also - the best subway is right around the corner, not to mention Dean and de Luca.....:)

This place is such an oasis of calm and non-ostentatious luxury in Soho. My room was peaceful and comfortable, excellent bathroom (good water pressure, heated towel rack,nice amenities)... this is New York, so nothing to be done about the garbage truck coming by early in the morning. Rooms on higher floors have beautiful cityscape views. Service is attentive. I spent an hour Sunday morning in the guests-only lounge reading the Sunday Times and feeling like a lady of luxury. The place is pricey; drinks and bar food expensive to match. I was fortunate to have been invited for a conference, and would stay here again in a minute... as long as someone else was paying!

From the minute we arrived we loved everything about Crosby Street. The decor is brilliantly cool like all the Firmdale hotels with interesting fabrics, art and objets everywhere. It feels warm and friendly the staff are helpful, knowledgable and obliging, I'm sure the concierge could arrange dinner with Batman. Our room was beautifully furnished and very comfortable with huge windows looking on the street. The bar is a great addition to the NY scene and the restaurant quality is as good for snacks or a la carte and the lounge is terrific. SoHo is an interesting area with a great vibe, shops and restaurants all in walking distance. Well done Crosby Street, can't wait to go back

As a now multiple time guest of this beautiful hotel in trendy SoHo, I can truly say that this place is incredible in all aspects. From the warm and friendly front desk to the wonderful service, The Crosby is a small boutique hotel that is part of the Firmdale hotel group out of London that truly stands out! During our last visit, we arrived quite early and were immediately greeted and told that although my room was not ready, we would be upgraded since the hotel had some open rooms. A nice treat for a regular guest!! Our suitcases were secured and then we were off to explore the great surrounding areas. Visiting Balthazar, a fantastic and very popular french bistro, around the corner for a late breakfast was amazing. We then walked the great streets of SoHo (South of Houston) to just enjoy the sights and sounds of the city. We arrived back to the hotel to be rewarded with an upgrade to a spectacular suite for the evening. The suite was beyond belief and jaw-dropping....impeccable in all ways with enough room to entertain ten or twenty in luxury! Beautiful robes, high end bath materials and superb bedding are all part of the Crosby experience in all rooms! Although we have not eaten in the restaurant, we enjoyed the top-notch lively bar scene. The bar always seems to be hopping! The bartenders are quite imaginative and the atmosphere is cool!This is a must go to hotel and one that you will not be disappointed in.

I looked at several hotels in this location and went with the Crosby based on the very positive reviews and it lived up to the hype!! It is a modern, fresh, somewhat funky vibe but all very well done. Our room had floor to ceiling windows that encompassed almost an entire wall with black iron mullions and casing.. beautiful. We looked down on the hotel's courtyard and it couldn't have been sexier and yet romantic at the same time. Terrific service checking in and when shown to our room, our very early check out two days later was very efficient also. It balances the allure of a new, hip hotel while still blending in with the area and not feeling cold or trying too hard. I can't wait to come back!

We had to change our hotel due to Sandy. Because of his London sisters hotels, although not cheap, we gave this hotel a chance.And yes, it is like many reviewers stated.The reception and welcome are like you expected in a friendly way, the neigbourhood and the street are so good. The concierge was the one every hotel is looking for. There is a room for the guests where they can zip a glass, take a snap (like a bar with sofas).The rooms are great with floor-to-ceiling windows, decoration in style for anyone who is classic, but also for anyone who likes more the modern things. Bathroom is clean and functional (by the way: good products).The breakfast is a very good buffet (unfortanetely no normal bread) or there is a a-la-carte possibility.One more thing, after one week I still remember the nice smell of the hallway.

I've stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel twice in the last three years, and I can't wait to come back for a third visit in May. The list of reasons for why I love this hotel are endless. To name a couple... The location is top-notch. You're smack-dab in the middle of SoHo, on a cobblestone side street, which means you won't have to deal with as much NYC background noise. You're within walking distance to Balthazar, the MoMA design store, Bloomingdale's, Kate Spade, and all the other amazing SoHo boutiques. Want to see a show on Broadway or check out the Met? No problem - it's a $10 cab uptown to hit all those touristy spots.I also love the British-inspired decor: modern yet classic, sophisticated yet unpretentious, feminine but not girly-girl...overall a fresh take on hotel design. Each room is unique, and its colour schemes are a breath of fresh air. This extends all the way from the lobby to the screening room to the restaurant to the tea room to the gym. These spaces are so unique - no hotel could every recreate this vibe.Finally, it comes down to those little luxuries: Miller Harris bath products, Dean & Deluca minibar snacks, an honour-system bar, Frette bed linens, complimentary Monocle magazines etc. If you're a couple, group of girlfriends, or a mom & daughter duo, definitely consider the Crosby. You won't regret it!

I recently stayed in this hotel with my husband. When we arrived, we were told that we had been upgraded to a top floor delux room. The room was stunning with great views over SOHO. I adored the decor because it was different from the generic decor of so many chain hotels and because it was floral and I am a bit of a girly girl. I also liked the dog themed art in the lifts!The bathroom was lovely. There was no bath but the bathroom was a good size and the shower was one of the best I have ever been in! The towels were nice and fluffy, there were plenty of them and they were replaced very regularly. The little amenities in the bathroom were great too. There was a little hair elastic in the pouch with the shower cap, which was a great touch for ladies with long hair.The location is fantastic for shopping and restaurants and I would definitely stay here again.The little touches such as the relaxing pillow spray that comes with the turndown service and the box of pencils that come with a note from the manager are all really cute and make you feel welcome.I think the service in the restaurant is one area that could improve slightly. I had porridge on the two mornings I was there. It was excellent and there was a choice of small or large oats and a choice of whether you wanted it cooked with water or milk. The first day I received brown sugar in a little dish and no fruit salad (that was meant to come with it). The next day I received the fruit but was give raw sugar. I received a blank look from the waiter when I asked for brown sugar. It came eventually but apparently it isn't a popular request, even though I received it the day before without having to ask. This is a very minor area that could be looked into in an otherwise stunning hotel experience. All other service was impecable.

As may be gathered from the title we stayed in the hotel before, during and even slightly after the hurricame. The decor in the hotel meets its billing and may not be to everyone taste but it fulfils the ronseal test in doing what it says on the tin. we stayed on both the 10th floor facing west and 11th floor facing east. The room on the 10th had inadequate closet facilites so we asked tobe moved, may be the booking people should not have put us in the room in the first palce but they rectified this as soon as they could. in our opinion the high rooms do provide a good view of downtown Manhattan and the view to the east is more interesting. Not all the rooms are the same size ( or have enough closet space ) so check this when making a booking. we did not make much use of the dinning facilties, when we did it was excellent and service ( dispite the 14th st sub station explosion) excellent. The bar is intergated into the dinning room, may sound odd but it works and creates a great atmosphere. We were required though not forced to relocate with the prospect of no power for several days. (4 as it turned out). The management staff were terrific, keeping both their cool and sense of humour in trying circumstances. Jakob, Freddie and Adam should all get speical mentions, as well as the guy who went to the pay phones with quarters to find hotels with rooms, ( its what hapapens when there is no power, no internet and no mobile relay stations). Vinny, the hotel driver, is out of a hollywood movie and should be treasured

I was travelling with my Mum who is a travel agent, so we were given the most beautiful suite I have ever seen (the lounge dining room was bigger than my one at home!). Everything about this hotel screams perfection - the decor, the art, the location, the lounge bar with 24 hour butler, the courtyard, the restaurant, the cinema with Sunday screenings. And when you walk out the door of this wonderland you are in the middle of Soho, with the best restaurants, cafes and shopping at your doorstep. What more could a girl want. One proviso, some men may be put off by some of the decor - make sure you request a room with no pink if you feel pink cushions in the room might bother you.

I was drawn to this hotel by it's location in Soho, the pictures of the cool, quirky artwork and bright room and the real thing did not disappoint! The hotel is tucked away on a cobblestone street in Soho and is steps away from lots of great shopping and restaurants in Soho, Nolita and not far from the East Village. I was pleasantly surprised that we received an upgraded room and I loved it!! The room was very bright with a wall of windows and was furnished beautifully with unique, cheery, high-end fabrics. My husband found the bed a little hard, but I was happy to have fluffy feather pillows and high quality sheets. The bathroom was a good size with a marble shower and had Miller Harris bath products. The hotel staff was unobtrusive but very helpful if needed. There is a cozy, beautiful library with an honor bar and nooks to relax in as well as a lovely garden to hang out and have a drink. I found the hotel to be a comfortable, classy oasis away from the honking horns and crowds and can't wait to stay there again.

I have stayed at 2 Kit Kemp hotels in London, and this New York hotel was just as wonderful. The staff made us feel special and pampered from the beginning. The rooms were comfortable, like new, spotless, and decorated to perfection. No attention to detail was missed. The feeling was casual and artsy, yet very sophisticated. We enjoyed cocktails in the lively bar as well as in the drawing room with honor bar. We ordered room service for breakfast, and it was excellent. The concierge was super helpful, getting us theatre tickets and restaurant reservations. We loved the NOLITA location on a quiet street, one block from busy Broadway. What a great funky neighborhood! We enjoyed shopping in the designer boutiques of nearby SOHO and eating at outdoor cafes. It was so nice to be away from the masses of midtown hotels. We would definitely stay here again!

Excellent hotel but make sure to request a pet-free room if you are allergic to dogs or cats. This is a very pet-friendly hotel but my room had a strong odor of dog pee in the bedroom. Can't fault the hotel on anything else.

New York is busy, brash and crazy. That's why people go there. This hotel is tranquil, calm and delightful. Excellent service, wonderful decor and classy ambience. If you want to stay outside of the madness and mayhem in Time Square and other surroundings then come here, with excellent other shopping and restaurants close by in the SoHo area.

We had 3 wonderful nights and loved every minute. It is a light and colorful boutique hotel with uniquely tasteful design. The common sitting area is warm, comfortable and inviting. The staff at the hotel, inside and out, who greeted us each time were so welcoming and attentive. Loved the decor in our room, especially the beautiful orchid print on the headboard of our bed. The bathroom was spacious and yet intimate. Would go back again over and over! Expensive and worth it!

This was our third stay at the Crosby Street Hotel. Great rooms and interesting art everywhere. What stands out is the friendly but professional staff who make every visit feel special. The SOHO location is now buzzing with new shops and restaurants and the lively bar and light restaurant choices mean that one can also enjoy 'staying in for the evening'.

We just returned from a long weekend here and we still can't get over how amazing this hotel was. We were interested in the hotel because we stayed at a sister property, the Soho hotel in London, a few years ago and just loved it. We booked a deluxe room on the top floor but were updated to a Crosby Suite which was just amazing. The one we stayed in is actually the one pictured on their website (it has a bedroom with double door adjoining to a huge living/dining room) and it was unbelievably beautiful. The entire wall of the suite, including the bedroom, is entirely windows with a great view over Soho. The room had absolutely everything including all the touches I need for a good stay - a nice firm mattress, a translucent shade for day and great light blocking curtains for the evening, a beautiful bathroom with excellent water pressure, an ipod stereo system, and a really powerful hairdryer. For me, the bath products were so-so, a little perfumy for my taste, but very high quality nonetheless. We loved this room so much we ended up ditching our plans to do some sightseeing and just stayed in the room and relaxed. We had breakfast brought up everyday so we could sit at the dining table looking out over the neighborhood. The room service was very good in terms of food quality and fast - no more than 15-20 minutes for anything and often times less, like when we ordered drinks up.All the staff were extremely friendly and immediately rush to help you with whatever you might need. Cabs are brought nearly instantly, bags are brought down immediately, etc. The concierge was a big help in making dinner plans and even though we had done a lot of research ahead of time, pointed us to a great restaurant we had never heard of.The location was ideal for us as we did a lot of shopping. There are also a lot of great restaurants steps away including the famous Balthazar (which we didn't go to) and great little gems like Ed's Lobster Bar (best lobster rolls I've had in a long time) and Dominique Ansel Bakery. The subway is also just a block away.This combination of room quality and service is exactly what a luxury hotel should be and I looked forward to staying here again.

Wife was shopping on Broadway, so brother and I were looking for a place to grab a drink and watch some football. The CSH is what popped us closest when searching Gooble maps so off we went. While there was no TV in the bar, we stayed anyway. Our Manhattan's were prepared by Brian the Bartender as though his very life depended on them being perfect... and they were! The crowd in the lounge is NY chic... but SoHo chic, none of that Times Square riff-raff... it really is very good people watching and their drinks are top drawer. We didn't eat but the plates we saw go by looked fantastic.It's off the beaten path but well worth looking for... At $600 + per night, we'll probably never stay there, but we'll be back for drinks and meals!

A bustling hotel, with a very inviting lobby and a nice restaurant. In Soho, it is a slightly funky (tho grown-up) boutique hotel, near all the classic shopping, clubs and restaurants of Soho. It has been open only a year or two and is affiliated with a small wonderful hotel group with hotels in London (where I stay all the time). There is a lot to see and do in Soho. The rooms are very large, inviting, with good natural light, large windows, great mattresses, good storage and a good size modern bathroom. Our room only had a shower, which was fine for us. The large windows mean that you will need to pull the privacy screens down a good deal but this did little to reduce the charm. There is a work-out room and the wifi is free and works well. Having stayed so often in one of their London hotels, I felt right at home here.The best things from my perspective were the service which was very good and friendly, with only a few "bobbles" or slight slowness. And the private reception room and patio with an honor bar for guests was excellent. The lovely outdoor patio was a real refuge from Soho noise and bustle, simply delightful and romantic in warm weather.Unfortunatly one drawback is the distance to mid-town, if you have business or theatre in that area. It is near enough to the Seaport and Wall Street areas to walk (slightly long but interesting). Cabs seemed reasonably available, the doorman always ready to go find one, but the traffic getting out of the area and up to mid-town could be a problem if you are in a hurry or do not want to use the subway.

We stayed there for the third time and will continue to go back. The staff is brilliant and not snooty. The rooms have similar styles but are all different in color and textures. The more you pay the higher up you get and the views out of the large windows are stunning.. If you book a luxury room which I believe is their standard you get rooms on level 3 to 5. Try to get to level 5 to catch some of the light. On our first stay we were upgraded to level 7. Quite simply stunning and interesting to look into other people's apartments. This time we were not lucky and got only a room on floor 3 room 308.... It looked towards the street and it felt like a prison cell... Not worth the money to spend, as due to the low level it was dark and it looked at an unappealing house front. We were lucky enough to change to floor 4, room 407. Funny what a difference one level makes. The lounge area is comfy with an instant nice atmosphere. It has a honesty bar and is very nice to meet up with friends before dinner.Ah, and yes as a returning customer you get a little present with a personal note. This time is was a relaxing restoring night cream... It's the little things that matter...Also, try to get breakfast, which is delicious, included in your rate.

This was our second stay at the Crosby Street hotel and was again a perfect trip. The rooms are magnificent, the service is impeccable and the ambience is always so relaxing. The location is also perfect due to the proximity to SoHo which is our favourite shopping location in NYC. We will be back.

Hotel is stunningly decorated. The nightly cost is pretty crazy expensive, although not so much when compared to other hotels in the area. The standard size rooms are sort of small for what you'd expect for the price. Buuut they are beautifully designed with great views of the city.service in the tea room was lackluster. We had to repeatedly search out the waiter for service. However front desk service was fantastic.

We were in NY for the weekend and decided to try the SOHO area, because of the recommendations on Tripadvisor we decided for the Crosby Street Hotel, and only can say that from the decor, property conditions, location, service all were " excellent". Everybody was very attentive, and every area of the hotel was like a conversation piece...

The style and location of this property is right on for the kind of scene I like. Artsy good music. The outside terrace and restaurant are a plus as well. You can reach from both sides of the block. Nice staff. Recommended.
user_name:
nicole A
New York City, New York

review_body: We were staying downtown for a night and had heard about the Firmdale Group from friends in the U.K. so we decided to try the Crosby Street Hotel. We arrived in NYC on the late side and the hotel was full and how fortunate we were - we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a 1 BR suite. It was a gorgeous, elegant, quirky hotel room with a mix of contemporary and antique touches, colorful and cheery with high ceilings and classic NYC views including water towers. Every little detail of the rooms was amazing, from the bathroom fixtures to the glassware. The staff was great too. We shall be back when we stay downtown.

What a pleasure it is to stay in a Hotel where you feel that all the staff know you and go out of their way to enhance your stay. The Team at Crosby Street Hotel all appear passionate about what they do and this is clearly reflected in the manner the guests are treated.During our stay all the restaurants recommended and booked by the concierge team were great. The Breakfasts cater for everyone's requirements and are excellent quality.Little things make the difference:- The main reason for our visit to NYC was my son participating in the NY Ironman. The day before The Ironman event a basket filled with Bottles of Gatorade and energy bars was delivered to our room with a really nice note handwritten by the Duty Manager.In summary It was a great experience staying at Crosby Street Hotel and would have no hesitation staying there again on my next trip to NYC and have already started recommending it to others.

My love affair with the Firmdale Group began a number of years ago when visitiing London from Sydney. It just intensified and became international with my current stay at Crosby Street in Soho, NY. Anyone wanting a boutique but 5 star, glamour with a quirky edge, service with low-key, no fuss and a location to rival any of the cities best, this is the hotel for you. I know Kit Kemp, the designer/owner's style well, but what impressess me most here is the grown up, slicker New York interpretation, still with the ecentric and surpising mix of colour schemes, textiles, furniture and artwork. I love the outdoor terraces and restaurant to chill from the summer heat. The gym is modern and well equipped and the service as always is impeccable and personable. Long may the affair continue...

Cracking hotel and rooms, sensational staff/ service and fantastic location. We also stayed at the standard during our most recent stay in NYC, which felt cheap and tacky relative to this classy hotel.

When coming home on a stormy, rainy day ... everything is good once you close the door of your house and feel the warmth of it. So is Crosby Street hotel. Home in mid of madness and best shopping of Soho. Rooms are great; staff ultra-helpful; and a breakfast that is amongst the best of the world. Not cheap; but so worth every $!

If you plan on visiting NYC at any point in time, then do yourself a favor and stay at The Crosby Street Hotel. If you love great shops, dining, and entertainment you will love the neighborhood that is SoHo, where this amazing property is located. Our room was beautifully designed, as well as the rest of the hotel, and very comfortable and accommodating with its gigantic windows and spacious restrooms. The lobby has a fantastic restaurant/bar as well as a "Drawing Room" where you can serve yourself drinks or opt for the butler service where you can eat and drink and relax in the quieter area only available to guest! As beautiful and well situated this hotel may be, the main focus is definitely on the staff and guest services offered at The Crosby, I mean seriously they are really on point. Upon arrival I was greeted with a complimentary upgrade to the very top floor and a larger room, which was amazing! All of the staff was superb, always sincere, always smiling, and always always helpful.so a very special thanks to Jeremy, Patrick and Tim just to name a few employees who were nothing but amazing! Also to the concierge who just happen to be miracle workers :) I would definitely return as well as recommend this hotel to anyone

Have stayed at a previous Firmdale residence in London and loved it back then. Crosby Street didn't disappoint and I love the townhouse feel of the interior decor of the rooms and lobby areas. Stayed 3 nights in a Junior suite with husband and baby with great floor to ceiling views across town towards Brooklyn bridge. Room was a nice big size (huge comfy bed) and had everything you would expect from a top class hotel with all mod cons e.g. iPod docking, 2 TVs (in sitting area and bathroom) plus stocked luxury minibar and loads of Miller Harris toiletries. Best thing about the hotel is the location... we were minutes away from all the great shopping/dining in the Soho area. Staff were extremely friendly and helped us out with a few things we needed for our baby. We mostly ate out so can't comment on the dining experience but really enjoyed the afternoon tea time cake served in the small lounge room. Well Done Firmdale!!

This property was recommended by friends whom have "tried them all". We were thrilled we took there advise, much preferring smaller boutique hotels to the large chains.The Crosby, is located on a quiet cobblestone street in the heart of SoHo, admist a wide range of dining and shopping options. We loved walking around SoHo, not at all missing the frenetic crowds around midtown and upper E/W. It's close to subways, and or a quick cab ride to any of the popular sites.The hotel is done is a warehouse style with floor to ceiling windows in every room. The rooms are spacious enough, not huge, and very well appointed and fun with a odd collection of art and styles. Very comfortable beds with over sized down duvets and pillows. Modern Leroy Brooks granite barhrooms. The lobby, guest only outdoor garden and drawing room with honor bar are trendy, and comfortable with bright colors and an amazing, but very eclectic art collection. You want to stay in the hotel, as these spaces are very comfortable and cool just to hang out. The renowned Crosby Strret Bar is very popular with locals and guests alike. Fantastic decor and ambience. The staff could not do enough to make our 5 day stay memorable. Special mention to Todd the concierge who very persistently and patiently got us into some of NYC's best restaurants, and booked some travel for us. Well done to the owners and the staff! We will return.

When my wife told me she booked us in a quaint hotel in Soho for the weekend, i was a bit nervous. I was expecting an overpriced, small room, no fitness center and cramped restaurant experience. I could not have been more off-base. The hotel was recently remodeled (apparently within the last three years) and it is fresh, clean, cleverly and attractively designed. The rooms are spacious with lots of natural light (the hotel is also LEED certified), too. The restaurant has a great menu and breakfast buffet and the bar is capable of serving any drink you can conjure up. Throw in great service, a surprisingly nice, new and decent-sized fitness center and a location within the city that is convenient to great restaurants and fun shopping and both my wife and I were more than satisfied.Our stay was incredible and we will definitely be repeat customers!

This Hotel is my favorite option in the City.It is modern and elegant.The rooms are decorated in a different style.The art is fun and beautiful.The rooms are super clean and comfortable.The food is very good too!The ambience is very downtown with an English flair.Overall it is worth to spend a special occasion or just a good night there!!!

Wow, what an amazing stay! This Firmdale “design hotel” is an intimate, 11 story, 86 guest room gem located in the heart of SoHo. The hotel is just the right size to offer exceptional personal service as well as seclusion. From the moment we entered the Crosby Hotel, we felt pampered by the wonderful staff. This standard of gracious personal service was the norm from all the hotel staff we encountered during our entire stay. It was just the right balance of attentiveness and privacy that’s really hard to describe, but I just know and appreciate it when I experience it. The hotel’s common areas, lobby, Drawing Room (guest lounge), Sculpture Garden (inner courtyard), restaurant and bar are very stylish, welcoming and tastefully decorated with original artwork and sculptures. If you visit here, make sure to get downstairs to check out the private event rooms, screening room and bar too. It’s very clear that a great deal of attention to detail was put into the design and decoration of this hotel’s common areas and guest rooms. The hotel is truly an intimate space in the middle of SoHo, akin to a peaceful, carefully designed, visually appealing art gallery. We booked a King “Luxury Room” for our 2-night stay. Although these are among the hotel’s smaller bedrooms at (350 square feet), the room was refined, comfortable and spotlessly clean. Our 4th floor room had a floor to ceiling window directly overlooking cobblestoned Crosby Street, and our room was very quiet. We heard no street noise or hallway noise during our entire stay. The room was attractively decorated with lots of natural light and an excellent King bed with soft sheets and very comfortable pillows. The bathroom was luxurious and impeccably clean. The marble and glass shower was amazing with water pressure approaching that of a medium-sized waterfall! The bathroom also had two pedestal sinks and a heated towel rack which were nice touches. The quality Miller Harris toiletries and Turkish bathrobes were nice touches too. The service and food at the Crosby Bar were wonderful too. On Friday night we sat on the terrace and ordered Mojitos and small plates from the bar menu. It was a great space to talk and unwind after our hectic journey to New York City.Our “Summer Promotion” room rate included complimentary English breakfast each morning (basically a $40 dining credit per person per day). The Full English breakfast offers a choice of 2 eggs any style with potatoes, roasted mushrooms and tomato, black pudding, sausage, bacon, fresh fruit, dates, figs, yogurt, granola, pastries, juice and coffee or tea. The breakfasts were too abundant to finish, but absolutely scrumptious nonetheless. The perfectly brewed Illy coffee they serve is delicious too.As frequent visitors to Manhattan, my wife and I prefer the more vibrant and dynamic “downtown” neighborhoods of Chelsea, Flatiron, NoLita, SoHo, TriBeca, Union Square and the West Village because of the many activities available. We also feel much less “touristy” in these neighborhoods. The Crosby Hotel is in an ideal location close to upscale shops, world-class restaurants, galleries, museums and the many cultural activities available around SoHo, NoLita and Greenwich Village.We’ve stayed all over Manhattan in some very nice boutique hotels over the past few years, and there’s no doubt that the Crosby Hotel is now our favorite by far. It’s truly a world-class property that perfectly combines classic elegance with city chic. The hotel provides its guests with superb service, charm, style, quality, cleanliness and complete attention to every detail. In fact everything about our stay at the Crosby Street Hotel was absolutely perfect and we thoroughly enjoyed our two wonderful nights of comfort and relaxation at this truly remarkable and beautiful hotel. This is our new standard for subtly sophisticated deluxe accommodations in Manhattan. The Crosby is a truly exceptional hotel and a remarkable value. We will definitely be back.

Located on a peaceful cobblestone, tree-lined street in SoHo, The Crosby Street Hotel is an absolute gem. I could not decide what to look at next...the art, the statues, the unusual color palette of the hotel, rugs, etc. This hotel is just eye candy. It is set back from the cobblestone street with benches out front for you to just sit in and enjoy watching things go by. If you prefer beautiful gardens then just go to the two back courtyards and soak it in. Full gym for workouts. Wonderful breakfast in the Crosby Street Bar. No worries about plans with their wonderful staff of concierges who immediately respond to your every need. The rooms are sumptuous and large by NYC standards. Best shower I have ever had...it must pump out 40 gallons a minute!! I felt like I was bathing in a waterfall. I have always floated around from one 5 star hotel to another in NYC for my visits...but now this is my "other home" when I am in NYC. No need to search for new hotels after this stay. Don't worry if you get a room on the street or back garden...the rooms are totally soundproof and you will sleep like a baby.

the location is great if you prefer to be in trendy areas of New yorkthe decor is wonderful. there is a peaceful and joyful feeling when you walk in thanks to the touch of architect/decorator Ron arad. the bar serves wonderful drinks...and the service is nice and attentive.the rooms of course it depends how much you are willing to pay!
user_name:
annetteapproved
New York City, New York

review_body: I've recently spent a longer time in NYC during the July 4th week and had the pleasure of staying at the Crosby St Hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, that what you would expect from a first class hotel.The hotel is perfectly located in soho. Shops and subway stations are all located steps away. I really enjoy that there is a great little fitness studio on the property! The rooms were spacious for NYC standards and were meticulously cleaned everyday by housekeeping. The Crosby Street hotel makes my visit to NYC that much more enjoyable everytime I'm visiting!

Loved everything about this hotel from the location to the decor. Staff were friendly and professional very accommodating about giving us another room when we had late check out. Cocktails are perhaps some of the best in New York

My husband and I stayed at Crosby Street for 1 night last month, and really enjoyed it.The hotel has obviously spent a lot of money in renovation costs, as the lobby is lovely, and the rooms/ ensuites are fantastic. Very spacious and with great decor.There is a great courtyard as part of the hotel, and downstairs is a bar/ restaurant which was very good also.Staff were great - very helpful.Would have been more than happy to stay a few more nights...
user_name:
VITaylor
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: This is a great place to relax and be near to a variety of nightlife and activites. We met work mates here for cocktails and they loved the atmosphere too. My employer let me upgrade to stay here rather than a chain hotel - I was so thankful! The staff was extra helpful in getting me to my meetings on time. Thank you for a great week and experience.They recommended the Gotham City Tours! Excellent way to learn more about a great city.

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in May whilst holidaying in NY. It was absolutely perfect in every way - the best shower I've ever had, the bed felt like a big fluffy cloud and I loved just sitting in the window seat watching the world go by (with a coffee feom Balthazar across the road). The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. The bar is funky and the sitting room is so beautiful. I don't think I've ever had a better hotel experience. It's not cheap - but perfect for a special occasion splurge.

The Crosby Hotel is lovely. The decor is so cheerful and bright and fun. As a New Yorker I am always recommending hotels and making sure to visit where my friends stay. The staff at the bar were great. The gorgeous little sitting room to the right when you first walk in is lovely in its decor we wanted to sit there all afternoon. Also, if you haven't been to Soho you are in for a treat. See a different part of NYC than Midtown/Times Square. Go to Soho or the Village and enjoy! You should check out Cafe Gitan if you stay here. You can wander around Soho window shopping. The rooms were extremely clean. And there was even construction across the street- but from the room itself you couldn't even hear a whisper of the street noise. Certainly a cheerful, colorful alternative to many other hotels in the city.
user_name:
TallulahMae732
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is pretty hard to fault. We stayed here in May and we loved it. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location was great and the room was lovely and the bed was comfortable. We loved all the art works throughout the hotel and the decor. The bar was great too. We had a great stay here.
We just loved everything about the hotel. The location is fantastic. The rooms are beautifully decorated. The restaurant is fantastic. Could not recommend it more.
user_name:
baci2003
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great location, design, comfort, privacy and staff. If you can afford it, just book it.We stayed at The London last time we were in NY and there is no comparison.

We recently stayed for the second time at the Crosby Street Hotel in New York. What a great location and the rooms are funky and fun. The only disappointment was in room service breakfast where items were forgotten and the coffee was lukewarm (always a bad thing!). The staff is friendly and accommodating. We will definitely stay there again.

As a treat, a friend and I stayed for 2 nights at the Crosby Street Hotel. The location was perfect for shopping and sightseeing in the area. The hotel is gorgeous and has a laid back contemporary feel. Everywhere you turned there was a fabulous artwork or installation to enjoy. The interiors and furnishings are works of art on their own - so beautiful. We had a meal one evening sitting up at the bar. Food and cocktails were divine. The staff were friendly, helpful and engaging. We used the gym both mornings and although small, it had all the equipment we needed. I look forward to another visit.

The Crosby Street is an absolute gem. I can't say one negative thing about the stay (unusual for me), so instead I'm going to mention the things that made it extra special:1. The design and decor is interesting, with a sense of humour and at the same time homely and perfectly calming.2. Room was a haven from the city. Very spacious, light airy, bed super comfy, bathroom perfect.3. Staff couldn't have been more professional or friendly if they tried.4. Extra special elements - the comfy 24 courtesy bar drawing room.5. Allocating us a room in the evening, hours after we checked out to shower and change after being caught in the rain.6. Concierge - advising excellent restaurants and making flawless bookings.- Will definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

Although we live in NYC, my family and I spent Christmas at the Crosby St. Hotel.
