We checked in very early on Christmas Eve since I had to go to work, and were pleasantly surprised to find that the rooms were ready, which started our weekend off on the right note. i was able to unpack and have breakfast in the bar before heading off to my job.On the return, we had a lovely afternoon tea in the sitting room - with Ruinart Champagne, don't miss it - and our server was extremely gracious and knowledgable. Meals in the bar on both Christmas Eve and Christmas Day (as well as breakfast on Boxing Day) were thoroughly enjoyable.The design aesthetic of the rooms is in keeping with Firmdale, although I will say that the rooms are showing some wear. We booked two luxury doubles. A nice touch was the full sized candle given to each of us on Christmas Day.The only let down was with check out. I was paying for both of the rooms, and although I had settled my account, one room was never transferred to the other and approximtely $1500 was held on my debit card. I'm not sure what it is with Firmdale, but they never process my bill correctly.Overall however, this was a very enjoyable Christmas made all the more pleasant by spending it in a service oriented, boutique hotel that manages to capture the spirit of London in New York City.

My husband and i stayed at this place and were very disappointed. They put us in a room next to a room w/ wall sanding going on at 9:00 am!!!!! We called the front desk and were told that it was a vacuum cleaner. It was not a vacuum cleaner! It was a sander! We recorded it, and boy was it loud! So, for $700 a night there should have been NO sanding at all! Front desk admitted but did not make any kind gesture to make up for this. Bad business.We will not return! : (

We stayed there with our teenage daughters (who were in a seperate room). The room was spacious and well fitted out. The bathrooms were absolutely sublime.The staff were extremely professional, competent and obliging (to say the least).It was an excellent place to recharge from the frenetic pace of the city.Could not recommend The Crosby highly enough!

For the past two years, my wife and I have enjoyed New York City during the holiday season between Thanksgiving and Christmas. While I was there for business, my wife has accompanied me and we have always added a few days for holiday shopping. The Crosby Street Hotel decks itself out in its holiday best and its staff is part of this holiday cheer. It's warm and cozy, quiet and convenient. Even without my business trip, my wife would still book the Crosby.

Cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel. When the price is close to $600/night (& that was a special including breakfast, for the 2nd to the cheapest room), expectations are very high. We arrived very early so waited in the Drawing Room. Rooms are quiet, beautiful, NON-shabby chic, great environmental controls (excellent A/C), extremely comfortable beds, flat screen TVs with video inputs (for the techie geeks) with large windows and great bathrooms with (only) shower with powerful water flow! The staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. The breakfast was your choice of anything: the steak & eggs were phenomenal-huge portion set us up for a whole day of walking the city! The buffet of yogurts, berries, fruit, muesli, cereals, bagels, toast, plus one may order tea service or coffees of any variety. We will definitely return, if the budget allows!

What's great: Rooms are beautiful & spacious, Floor to ceiling windows, hot shower & lovely amenities.What's bad: The Staff, smelly bed & pillows, price.I booked the CSH based on photos & location, which more than met my expectations. However, the staff was horrible. Polite, but not helpful at all. Housekeeping broke the shade while we were out to dinner despite having a "do not disturb" tag on the door. When I called to have it fixed and ask why housekeeping came into my room even tho I left the DND sign, the concierge blamed me for the shade & never alerted maintenance, so after 3 calls, the maintenance man finally arrived. The housekeeping question was ignored even though i asked 3 times. We requested a wake up call which never happened & when we expressed our frustration to the front desk, they desk clerk said flippantly "sorry". The bed & pillows STUNK, like dirty hair-I'm guessing housekeeping never heard of Febreze, but they did come in uninvited to break the shade & fold the toilet paper into an arrow....For $700 a night, I expect a better experience. The staff is unnecessarily snooty & apathetic, and in my opinion, incompetent. They smile & say hello, but no one went above those mild pleasantries. The stink was also upsetting, as I had Client appointments in the room & ever client remarked on the odd smell.The restaurant is not much better. overpriced & painfully slow. The Caesar Salad is good, tho. Go to Balthazaar for an amazing meal or head down to Lomardis if you want affordable pizza. The Crosby Bar is disappointing for the price. For $700 a night, I would expect a doorman or someone to help carry bags inside. I also expect a room not to stink, and for the hotel staff to do their jobs. It's a shame, it's such a beautiful hotel & a great location, the staff ruined my experience.

We live about 30 minutes outside of Manhattan in Westchester County, New York and have stayed at many four/five star hotels but we wanted something very special to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. We had tickets to a play and wanted a special hotel. Upon arrival we knew our friends from California had suggested the right place. Our car was picked up by the Crosby Valet in the warmest of welcomes. We were greeted by Jason at the front desk, upon check-in, who told us the hotel wanted to congratulate us on our 25th Anniversary and that they knew we were excited to be staying in our Deluxe Room but they would have to upgrade us to The Crosby Suite. Adam who had taken our reservation had worked this out in advance and Jason was the one to share the amazing news with us. We were escorted up to the 9th floor and welcomed into a downtown Oasis. We love SoHo and to be able to see it while staying in such an elegant and fun hotel was beyond our expectations. Champagne was delivered and everyone couldn't have been nicer. The hotel staff paid attention to every detail right down to the two water bottles that were placed in our car, when they brought it around, for our ride home. Excellent doesn't begin to describe this hotel it is Beyond Excellent. My husband and I will be celebrating my 50th Birthday this year and we are hoping to stay at one of the Firmdale Hotels in London this fall. Truly a must see! Even if just for Tea! Thank you Jason, Adam and everyone else that played a part in making our 25th something very special. Cheers!!

We have previously stayed midtown in New York but wanted to stay in a different area but in a hotel that we could rely on. We have stayed in other Firmdale properties including the Haymarket and Covent Garden Hotels and love their quiet luxury. This hotel has the same attention to detail, incredibly well trained staff and beauty. It has an advantage in that it has been purpose built which makes the bar/restaurant a special place to go day or night. We wanted to be looked after but in an unobtrusive way and we certainly got that. We love New York and will certainly return here. An quirky hotel in an interesting area. Well done to all

We stayed at the Crosby St Hotel for 5 nights and did not want to leave. It is not only a beautiful and stylish hotel, but the staff especially the concierge staff, are amazingly helpful and lovely. The little touches like handwritten notes from the manager and the excellent turn down service at the end of the day were great. The restaurant and bar had fabulous food and was obviously a very popular place to be! Will be back again. Thank you for a great start to our US holiday.

The Crosby was an amazing find - tucked in a side street but close to the action. Perfect location for exploring the soHo area and it's surrounds. Relaxing was easy in the beautifully appointed and decorated room and public areas.

I was looking somewhere special for my girlfriend and I to take my Mum and stepdad on his 60th birthday and we certainly found it. In the cool heart of soho is this gem of a hotel. Ok the free upgrade for my stepfarther from a deluxe junior suite to the $3750 a night Crosby Suite helped but we enjoyed our standard room almost as much. The hotel is beautiful. Looks like it has been around for years but actually only built a couple of years ago. This means it is purpose made to please. There are little touches everywhere (loved the free cuff links) and light streams in from all sides. The staff are great but not fussy and the whole place has a relaxed luxurious feel.I have been a fan of the firmdale hotels for a while and this is another great addition.

We stayed at the Crosby Street recently and everything was just perfect. From the moment we arrived we were struck by the attention to detail from the welcome, the service, the beautiful decor and general ambience.It was early evening and everywhere candles glowed giving a warm welcoming glow. The hotel itself is big enough to feel spacious yet small enough to feel inviting and homely.We loved the decor with its quirky art and each time we walked through the lobby and bar we spotted something new to entertain us.The rooms were lovely : fresh, spotlessly clean with very comfortable beds and great pillows. But its those little extras- like a decent hairdryer which make the difference. The shower is excellent and who uses a bath these days !We had a lovely breakfast with very well cooked eggs and we would have used the courtyard if the weather had been warmer. The surrounding area is fairly busy with lots of shops nearby and you can pick up the bus tours just down the road.Would thoroughly recommend Balthazar just down the road, where you can enjoy a great meal in a friendly atmosphere.All in all Crosby Street is a little oasis in the frenetic city of NY. If you want all the hustle and bustle of Times Square then don't stay here, but if you want to enjoy the fun and energy of NY by day and escape to some luxury and tranquility in the evening then you won't find better!

I have stayed in several good hotels in NY, but this hotel was the best by far. It is quirky, friendly and perfectly located for a private trip. 3 subway stations are close by from where you can get easily around Manhattan. Funky boutiques, restaurants, bars etc are right at your doorstep too.The rooms are of a good size, well equipped, amazingly quiet for NY and the shower's water pressure is heavenly. The interior design of the rooms is refreshengly different to most hotels in the world. Very fun and uplifting. The rooms are light due to the beautiful huge windows. Oh yes, the beds are very good too-we slept so well! Room service is quick and delicious. The lobby, restaurant and library are beautiful and welcoming. And the gym is also well equipped.The front desk staff is super friendly and helpful and so is the concierge team. Only the restaurant staff could smile a little more.We had the best 4 days in this great city! Thank you to the Crosby Street Hotel!

I have travelled to NYC on vacation for the past 5 years at least and each trip I have stayed in a different hotel in a different part of the city. I must say that this hotel and location is now my new favourite. The staff were very attentive and accomodating, I was so grateful for the lunch reservation at Balthazar on a Sunday with only a few hours notice. The room was beautifully decorated, as is the entire hotel. Sadly I don't think it's a great choice for me to return to in December with my three kids as the rooms are too small, so if that's what your after then try The Surrey. However if it was just for the grown ups then I'd come back in a heartbeat!

Wonderful stay. The hotel is beautiful. It is full of art and very personal. I prefer this type of small lobby. The lobby and the Drawing room are great places to hang out and read, have a drink or wait for a friend. The junior suite we had was great. We had an unobstructed view looking east. The room and bathroom are very comfortable. My only minor nit picking criticism is that once they did not replace the glasses we used in the bar. Also some days we got one wash towel and other days two. At this price level one has high demands. It has no affect on my love of the hotel.The staff is very good and attentive. The location is superb. Soho is full of life. There are plenty of stores and restaurants. There are at least 3 subway lines within walking distance.
This is a pleasant Boutique hotel in a great part of NYC. Expensive for sure...especially considering the size of the rooms. Good but not outstanding!

We stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel in June 2010 with a large family group celebrating birthdays and anniversaries. Our group was mixed ages from two children aged 6+ up to grandparents who were late 70's.It was the perfect location to keep everyone together and make us feel very welcome. The staff were very accommodating and everything was done to a very high standard. We arrived and were overwhelmed by the decor and the reception, I personally loved the alphabet head sculpture by the reception desk.Our room was absolutely amazing and we were left a lovely handwritten note and box of chocolates on arrival. A nice personal touch!We were in NY for four days and on the third night we had a family meal in the private dining room. The food was fantastic along with the service and we had use of the cinema, drawing room and dining room. It again was a great way to keep us all together and allow us time to catch up and reflect on our once in a lifetime trip.The hotel is a great location, around the corner from Bloomingdales and easily accessible to the subway. We tended to get taxis most places as there was a large group of us and this didn’t take long to get to the main tourist attractions.The hotel has a lovely patio area which is great for sitting out and having a drink after a long day of site seeing. This hotel isn’t cheap but is worth every penny. I can’t recommend it highly enough and if I go back to New York I hope I’m lucky enough to stay there again.
user_name:
Kim H
Leeds, England, United Kingdom

review_body: This is such a beautiful hotel. Really nice time and head concierge Chris is bloody first rate. Food was soso (servie pretty bad but there had been a few staff called in sick). We managed to watch Hugo in the screening room. Thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone going to NY Soho.

We split our stay in NY between The Standard and The Crosby Street Hotel. As much as we were disappointed by The Standard, we were bowled over by The Crosby Street Hotel. Everything you would expect to find in a good hotel is doubly true for this one: their staff members are charming, attentive and very competent, often going out of their way to help you out. The hotel is a visual feast - a wonderful, quirky mix of styles, with witty touches everywhere. No featureless white spaces here, nor over-the-top gleaming, velvety opulence. Instead the space feels light, airy and very elegant. The floor-to-ceiling windows in the rooms were one of my favourite features, as were the showers. I was disappointed to find out that their standard rooms had no baths - I love a good bath (I think some of the suites may have baths). The reason is sound (it's a green hotel), but I forgave them completely when I tried their showers. Best shower I have had in any hotel, anywhere. We didn't try the food in the hotel as we prefer to venture out for meals, but enjoyed drinks in the bar and in the lovely walled garden/ terrace. If you do decide to eat outside the hotel, you are perfectly located - countless good restaurants within walking distance. Our stay at the Crosby Street Hotel was an absolute pleasure, marred only by the fact that it came to an end and we had to go home. Sniff.
user_name:
JezebelleH
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: Hotel is fantastic and in a great neighborhood for food, shopping and people watching. Love the hotel but when we requested a bath tub, we were told hotel is green and no tubs. Still remains our favorite NYC hotel.

Recently stayed at the Crosby for a short stay in NYC for fashion week. Loved everything about it from the vibe which is casual elegance at its finest to the special touches that make this hotel my home away from home. I am a stickler for cleanliness, scent, visual, service and food. Even the other guests at the hotel were charming, worldly and a pleasure to ride an elevator with! All earn an A+ for this discerning traveler. Additionally, the concierge staff was extremely helpful and professional even having recently purchased Broadway tickets delivered to us at the restaurant where we were having lunch the day of the show so that we did not have to go to will call.

It is hard to find fault with this sumptuous yet low-key hotel on a quiet cobbled street in Soho. Our weekend stay, to celebrate a wedding anniversary, was flawless from start to finish. From reception staff who bent over backwards to make the weekend special for us, to a lavish and delicious breakfast served in our room, everything was utter comfort and peace. Wonderful power showers, heavenly beds, breakfast served on gorgeous bone china. Just one small criticism. Every time we wanted to access internet we had to phone down to reception - slightly irksome. But a tiny caveat in a sea of praise.

The Crosby Street Hotel is gorgeous and the service is excellent. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. Great views from the large windows on the upper floors. Have stayed at two other hotels from this group in London and they were both just as lovely. The guest areas and the back garden at the hotel are perfect for lounging or grabbing a drink with friends. The food in the restaurant is very good, especially the breakfast. Great location in the middle of Soho, if you like the neighborhood you will love the hotel's central location. Not much of a scene at the hotel in the evening, but if you are looking for a peaceful retreat amidst the bustle of Soho this is the place for you.

We stayed at the Crosby St Hotel for a week in November 2011. Unbeatable location, lovely quirky decor, comfortable rooms (I particularly liked the floor to ceiling windows that you can open), cool bar and restaurant, good food, loved the guest lounge with honour system drinks - great place to relax after a hard day's shopping. But what sets this hotel apart is the amazing staff, particularly the Reception and Concierge guys who were so helpful with restaurant bookings, sightseeing advice ... they even found us a dentist who was open on a public holiday ! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and have already done so, and can't wait to come back.

Pricey? Yes. Worth it? YES!A charming, high end boutique hotel, owned by the Brits and this is their first venture in the 'colonies.' Location, location, location: The Crosby is nestled into a small cobble stoned street, within walking distance of everywhere you want to go in SoHo and the surrounding NoHo,LoLita and more.The rooms are beautiful , comfortable with upmarket touches such as Frette towels and linens.Bathrooms are granite, and the stall shower is about the best there is. Service is friendly and professional. There is an elegant lounge, for hotel guests only, where you can read, relax order a drink or light meal.I would go back in a New York minute.
user_name:
manhattan10021
New York City, New York

review_body: The Crosby Street Hotel is now my favorite or perhaps second-favorite place to stay in New York, depending on the neighborhood I want to stay in. Its understated elegance matches its location, on a quiet back street, secretly tucked away between the bustling SoHo shopping district and Little Italy. You get all the convenience in a quiet atmosphere. The rooms are beautifully designed to be roomy yet cozy and warm. The staff are a delight, always with a smile on their face, always willing to help. Walking distance to some great little places, one of which happens to be a favorite, the McNally Jackson bookstore on Prince St. Also a block away from a fantastic newsstand, the Lafayette Smoke Shop on Spring & Lafayette, open 24 hours. The Crosby Street bar and restaurant serves a great bloody mary! Bonus: If you get an upper floor room with an eastern exposure, you get a great view. The hotel is part of a UK-based company, and it indeed has a British accent. A padded dress form punctuates the corner of many of many a room (if not all) adding a touch of class and a nod to the city's roots in fashion and garments, perhaps. That's how I imagine it. While that adds a feminine lilt to the air, the feel is quite understated, not overbearing in personality. Walls are covered in wallpaper that feels like garment fabric, like wool or cotton, in yet another sartorial undertone. The effect is comfort, warmth and high style. In-room mini bars are well stocked, something that is still important to me. Room service is reliably good, and the fixtures in the rooms are very up to date without going overboard on gadgetry. The bathrooms are high style and spacious.
Such a wonderful hotel...prime location, lovely room, and helpful staff. We couldn't have had a better stay and look forward to returning soon.
Wonderful hotel, trendy, perfect location ,unbar exemplary service. Bit of a British feel, which is comfy and warm. Really wonderful. Pricey,yes. A major treat, yes!

Let me begin by saying, The Crosby Hotel in NYC is a wonderful place. A phenomenal location, a beautiful and artfully decorated space with spacious and high tech rooms. The rooms are all decorated beautifully and are extremely comfortable with lush furnishings and excellent bath products. The full granite bathroom has the most amazing water pressure I have ever seen. What a great shower! The lobby and the bar are exquisite and just invite one to stay in for a drink or for breakfast. So why do I wish I could give a 4 1/2 rating. It is simply spotty service. Poor advice, on two separate occasions after asking specifically, at the concierge desk, advised us to park along the street and we were ticketed. Note: The manager was very good and offered to take care of the ticket for us. The wait staff in the restaurant are very spotty. Seemingly oblivious to us twice in the morning. We had to ask for extra coffee and then I had to get up to get the bill both days as all waitstaff seemed to vanish. On several occasions, no one greeted us and no one was at the front door. Not that we expect it but for over $600 a night one should.There were some excellent personnel as well. The young lady with the British accent who greeted us at the front desk for check in was lovely, and the excellent young man who took our bags and commiserated with us on the parking ticket was a great and helpful person as was the manager or was it the assistant manager who took care of our problem with class. Overall, TRY IT if you have the means. It is an excellent Hotel and with just some continued tweaking of the young personnel it will be a 6 out of 5!

I love this hotel so much. It is really a special place: the staff, the rooms, the decor. The location is spectacular, and the vibe and sunlight in every room is truly wonderful. I love staying downtown, and was a regular at a different hotel but have switched my loyalties. I will stay there again the next time I'm in NYC, no doubt.

My husband, 12 year old son, and I stayed at the Crosby Street hotel this winter for only one night. I cannot overrate how nice this hotel is. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are not only beautifully decorated, they are also spotless. The hotel has paid a lot of attention to detail, beyond the nice bath slippers, they give you a newspaper in the morning, the turndown service provides everyone with a complimentary bottle of water, and our room was upgraded without us even asking. This hotel is well worth the price in every respect. Breakfast was delicious too.

This magnificent boutique hotel reaches the top spot in our hearts. It is just perfect. From the warmth and professionalism of the staff to the incredibly well decorated surroundings. Just try it and fall in love with it! It is well worth the price.Enjoy!

Just returned from a 2 day stay at the Crosby Street Hotel, Fab hotel and Fab location. Staff were very polite and helpful. Stayed in one of the 'cheaper' rooms on the 1st floor, the rooms are very clean and the shower is to die for, loved all the Miiler Harris products, I can only imagine what the more expensive rooms are like. Loved it and will return budget allowing.

Chic and fabulous splurge for your stay in NYC. Stayed for 3 nights in January. Absolutely loved the modern, yet cozy decor of this boutique hotel brought to the U.S. by its London Family (Firmdale Hotels, all with their equally outstanding signature designs) - vibrant colors and charming patterns but not over-the-top bright; large inviting upholstered sofas and chairs in the lobby living room with its honor bar; the British shower head in the ceiling-to-floor granite bathroom - which had some kind of air pressure power device which I've not seen the likes of before nor since, the hairdryer (yes, even that was different and amazing); the location - conveniently within walking distance for shopping and eating, Dean & Deluca, Ed's Lobster Bar, and Balthazar, and the subway to take you everywhere. I gave Crosby 4 stars instead of a 5 just because, unfortunately, they forgot to remind us when we checked in that an English breakfast was included in our rate. They do have amazing attention to detail in many regards, but missed that one. We didn't realize it and walked down to D&D daily for coffee and croissants, so didn't try the food at Crosby. Bar is a lively scene, experienced and friendly bartenders, and the cocktails delicious. We will return and are looking forward.

Had the opportunity to stay at this great property for a couple days last week. It feels brand new , the staff is extremely nice. Public areas are beautifully decorated (bar/lounge , lobby , outdoor garden , restaurant). The rooms are very clean and tastefully designed. Nice size room and large windows. I only had breakfast in the hotel restaurant but it is very nice , staff is very attentive and food was excellent. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in soho area of new york , eventhough it is a bit more expensive than other options.

A fab, fab hotel. Service is very good, intimate, you know you are at a special place just from the fact that the hotel is set back from all of the other buildings on Crosby Street. Room on the 11th, twice the size of a normal hotel room, apparently an upgrade so not sure what the standard room looks like. Very comfortable bed, plenty of space to spread out, great bathroom, likewise spacious. There's a great little smoker's balcony, at least on the 11th floor off of the elevator lobby. Also, ask to be taken to the roof so you can see the small garden and chickens they have up there.Would recommend on visit to New York but not sure I couldn't find something cheaper with more value.

The Crosby Street Hotel (Firmdale Hotel) is a real trend setter hotel where every details is important. From the warming welcome arrival to a very updated and very well informed concierge. Apple computers everywhere. The area is very nice. I had a 11th floor de luxe room with ceiling window and a fantastic overview on Manhattan. Wifi everywhere. And you feel at home, all staff is gently and smiling. They care you all day. Breakfast impressive for the quality more than the quantity of the food. Definetely will come back next time in New York. High value high price but you get really quality in this hotel.

it's my first substancial trip to new york city and when looking for a place to crash one night, i found the crosby street hotel. it was a lucky find. from the moment i arrived, i didn't want to leave, lol. it's so comfortable and cheery. the rooms are pleasant, bright and i love the windows and staff - the ones i interacted with - were always polite and welcoming. would definitely stay here again :)

A slightly belated review from our visit to New York at the start of November.We hadn't stayed in SoHo for a few NY trips - always seemed to end up mid-town but decided this time to return to SoHo.Hadn't stayed at Crosby Street before but a friend in Brooklyn recommended it to us.Certainly no regrets at all. Despite being in the heart of SoHo there was a great sense of calmness to the hotel. Probably due to the size of it.We get slightly annoyed when staying in hotels where there's so much going on in the bars, restaurants etc. that as a staying guest you almost feel like an inconvenience.Not the case here. Within a couple of nights of our 9 night stay the staff greeted you warmly. Our room had a great view towards Brooklyn. Plenty of space. Good WiFi.Special thanks to the concierge Todd who helped with transport and restaurant bookings. Really very good service.Highly recommended.

The location of the hotel is amazing, just across the street from Balthazar restaurant (SOHO). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with no exception. The room was a little small for the price I paid even with the outstanding service the price was still high!I would defenitly go back to this hotel! And btw the bar food was amazing especially the tuna tartar and the veal chop, amazing! Yeah, and even the breakfast was very good.

So often, my experience in a boutique hotel is underwhelming. Sadly, often "boutique" is code for "small and lacking." Not the case with the Crosby Street Hotel. Two doorman at all times--one to fetch you a cab regardless of time of day or night. Three people working the front desk. Two at the concierge desk. A bar full of great and great looking waitresses. A drawing room for casual conversation staffed by a waiter along with a top shelf honor bar. Excellent rooms with all the amenities you could ever expect--see Bianca's review for details as she is right on.Try to get on the 5th or above for better views. This place is not cheap but it is competitive price-wise with other high end hotels and it is off the charts better. Great location, easy access, no long waits for 30 story elevators, cozy bar rather than some huge room (and really trendy people all over the place). Concierge took care of every request we had with ease and a willingness that almost made me forget to tip for his great service. He even seemed pleasantly surprised when I offered him a gratuity.We had one small issue with our room location and it was handled in a completely over the top manner. I hesitate to describe for fear I will encourage others to fake a problem, which are few and far between to non-existent.Go. Stay. Enjoy.

The Crosby is the perfect hotel. Perfect location, rooms beautifully designed and extremely comfortable and a good size for a NYC hotel. The bathrooms are ideal with great amenities, plenty of towels etc. The staff are friendly and knowledgable. Overall a perfect hotel that I can highly recommend.

I was in New York for a conference which was held at The Crosby Street Hotel. When I made the reservation I nearly gasped at the nightly rate and contemplated selling my left ovary to pay for my stay there. However, I made the reservation and hoped it was worth it.Was it worth it? Absolutely! Every penny was worth the amazing views (5th floor and above), the Voss water, the turn down service, the handwritten welcome note from the manager, the parting gift (handmade soap), and the heated towels in the restroom. I died. Twice. Staying at the Crosby made for a perfect NYC holiday! Close to great eateries and subways, Soho was the best choice. Two thumbs up!

I stayed at the Crosby St Hotel early this month and it was fantastic! The interior design of the hotel from the lobby to the rooms was beautiful! The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I like to use the gym at all the hotels I travel to, and their gym was very nice! Being located in SoHo was also a plus since i could just meander about the shops when I had free time! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a 1st class experience in NYC!

This hotel has some great things going for it i.e. the house keeping is impeccable and the staff are precious, the concierge desk is helpful and kind. It is unfortunate that these wonderful base ameneties are being down trodden by a horribly managed front desk and an over priced and underwhelming restaurant. The pretentious attitude from both of these aspects of the hotel ruined any notion that I might stay here again or reccommend it to anyone I care about. My advice is to fire the lot and start fresh. If I read that news I would go back.

Beautiful Hotel in my favorite area of Manhattan : Soho. The hotel decoration done by the owner is beautiful with many different colors and beautiful art pieces. Generally speaking the staff is very nice and helpful. The rooms are also decorated with a lot of taste and big compared to many hotels in the city. The only reason this hotel doesn't get my maximum rating is because the lady doing the welcome for the breakfast is always looking at you like you were coming from another planet, seems always in a bad mood and the only time she seems happy is when you leave !

Our first visit to this part of New York City and our first stay at the Crosby Street Hotel. Had read extensive reviews prior to booking and found nothing wanting. Great room on the 8th floor...spacious with wonderful bathroom and amenities. Bed more than comfortable...room exceptionally clean and service very good. The hotel is well designed and very functional and the location superb. Chris, the head concierge (Australian) had all the answers re directions and places to eat. Front desk staff were more than helpful and the bar was terrific. If you do get the chance have the Afternoon Tea...you won't need dinner that night. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

This is my third stay (I think) at the Crosby, and it just gets better. Owned by London-based Firmdale Group, the Crosby has the lively style, impeccable personal service and great location of the Soho, Haymarket and other sister hotels. If you want all the great aspects of a boutique property and none of the we're-too-cool to be helpful vibe of trend-surfing hotels like the Standard or any Schrager property past, present or future, then the Crosby is YOUR hotel as it is mine.The room was decent size for NY, and beautifully done in classic Firmdale style - a unique combination of modern and classic British style - think what a hotel by Paul Smith might look like, and you're not far off.But what sets this hotel above and beyond is the service. How do they know my name wherever I go? How do they remember how I like my coffee? And make it all seem effortless instead of as a play for a tip??? I don't want to know, just keep treating me this way back and it will remain my ONLY choice of hotels in the cities they are in. Right now, that's NYC and London, but I have heard they are scouting West Coast properties now. The one inexplicable shortcoming is only the suites have bathtubs. If you can live without a tub, the showers are big and have amazing water pressure, then make this YOUR hotel as well. You will never regret the choice.
Relaxing with attentive, but not suffocating service. A class act who have translated their successful London formula well in NY.

It's such a pleasure to write about the Crosby Street Hotel. This was our first visit and we were greeted like old friends. The CSH staff, start to finish, is genuinely gracious, welcoming and attentive. The indoor and outdoor public spaces are homey and inviting, so told as the place was filled with both out -of- towners and locals. (Yet another good sign) Our room and view were stunning and had it not been for the City of New York, I wouldn't have strayed. This hotel says "I am a special place" without being contrived or overly "aren't I swell." I love that they pull off this sensibility and do so because of the staff and sense of style throughout. We are now amongst their loyal clientele.

This is one of my favorite hotels in New York. I like staying in all their hotels. The rooms are great, well appointed. Service is good - will go out of their way to help but they need a business center. Food is good and service in the restaurant is good if a tad slow. I would recommend it if you can get a good deal

i stayed here for 4 nights towards the end of October.it is a superbly decorated and well furnished hotel, with a reasonable gym, excellent bar and breakfast buffet.Amenities are good and the bathroom is well lit, the bed is comfortable and it cannot be faulted on cleanliness.The elevators are a tad slow and the location is ideal if you are a shopper for fashionable gear and tat, but not for buisness folk.overall, I tohught the service was good and helpful, with one exception , a fat chap with black hair who works on reception and was uniformly rude from start to finish.He didnt help with my bags when I arrived, had a condescending attitude to allcomers( I observed him a couple of times with other guests) and frankly lets the whole place down.No doubt he will be rooted out in due course! in terms of value, at 800 dollars a night plus taxes this is no bargain, but I would definetely stay here again

WE have been to most of this hotel group in London.They never stop to amaze us with their good taste of rooms, wonderful staff andservice, attending all our needs, location and design.The stay in Crosby Street hotel was wonderful due to all the above and the locationin the center of Soho, though in a side, quiet street.We had breakfast and lunch in their resturant, again the food and service wasperfect. We were served by a staff member called Naromi who was very charmingand make us feel like in a private home rather than a busy hotel.And this is exactly the difference between hospitality and management when you describeyour stay at an hotel.

After staying in London at the sister hotel Soho hotel I decided to cheek out the Crosby.It is a beautiful hotel in a great location, perfect breakfast and attentive staff.The room was very comfortable good room service. My son loved the fact that when you order a movie you receive popcorn!!!The only tiny little problem was that the TV was too small.We will surly come back.

We really searched high and low for the perfect NYC hotel and in the end we settled on Crosby Street - thank god we did!! We had already stayed at the Soho hotel in London (another Firmdale) so we had high expectations and this hotel delivers the same high standard of accommodation and service. The rooms really can't be beaten - they are large and light (in NY this is difficult to find) and all the amenities you need are there. The rooms are so clean (top marks to the housekeepers) and every little thing is taken care of. I think the staff must be trained to emulate the British 5 star service level and they do it pretty darn well. Location is brilliant in Soho and the street is quiet - no crazy street noise that is typical of Manhattan. But although it's a quiet street, the surrounding streets are pumping with life and fabulous bars and restaurants are just steps away. It's also a real up and coming shopping area and close to everything downtown - and midtown is just a short cab-ride away. During our 6 night stay we received a couple of thoughtful gifts (a box of pencils and a box of Crosby Street themed purple macaroons). One other thing - it's like having your own apartment in NY - sure it's a full service hotel, but it feels boutique and intimate with no overbearing hotel-like stuff. It's the perfect size. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and its excellent staff and we will definitely be back. I hope Firmdale expand their empire to other American cities and into Australia too!

I chose this hotel based on its location and positive recommendations from Trip Advisor. The public spaces are contemporary without being stark; especially inviting on a sunny day are the outdoor courtyards. The guest rooms have high ceilings, very comfortable beds, spacious bathrooms with two sinks, separate shower, soaking tub, toilet & bidet. Windows cover one wall and the lighting is more than adequate. Room service was quick and polite. Special diets are easily accommodated (gluten free, etc). The front desk & concierge staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The only slow service I experienced was breakfast in the restaurant one morning....the waiter was less than attentive.I would absolutely stay in this hotel again.

This is a first time stay at the Crosby Street Hotel in Soho. We loved it! From the moment you walk into the lobby, you are met with fabulous art and accessories..a friendly staff and a happy place. There was only a junior suite available for us so that is what we took. The room was colorful and light and the bedding delicious. The room had a large floor to ceiling window with a vista of NY, exactly what we like when we stay in the city. The housekeeping service made me feel like I was at home, putting away my shoes and hanging up my clothes! Although it is not inexpensive, we will definitely stay there again...the only downside was the restaurant..food did not live up to our expectations, but there are so many other wonderful places close by that that should jot be a hinderance.

We stayed 4 nights and really enjoyed this great hotel. It's designer chic rather than a grand chain hotel, not cheap but given NY pricing, we felt it was good value. It is in the middle of Soho (with all its great shops and restaurants) and Greenwich Village is only a short walk away. Despite the buzzing area, we were not disturbed in our quiet room with its comfy bed. We only had breakfasts which were good. All staff were friendly and helpful especially the concierge desk for subway directions, restaurant recommendations and airline check in.

Love this place. Great location. Newer building in the heart of NYC's Soho neighborhood. The owners have really given this place loads of charm. It's contemporary urban chic. The service is not 5-Star, but neither are the prices. Great place. Very clean and comfortable.

It is 18 months since our first visit to the hotel and pleased to say found it just as good. Expected to see signs of wear, i.e. paint chips/scratches, but no, everything looks fresh and clean.Contrary to the review from Australia, we did have a clock in the room and the sheets were changed daily. Agree about the loo paper though. Super comfy beds.Did notice a couple of in-room changes, gone are the small Miller Harris candles, now a small box of choccies await your arrival, I would have preferred the candles ! No linen laundry bag, now plastic ones.We had lunch in the restaurant one day and the service was efficient and friendly, the food was good too.We found the level of service good, discrete/attentive, not fawning and overbearing like some of the big hotels i.e. Plaza.We don't plan on returning to NY for a while but if we do, this is our hotel of choice.

The Crosby Hotel is incredibly chic and much thought has obviously gone into the interior decoration. It is a wonderfully furnished hotel for an overnight stay.However, the same thought has not gone into the practical matter of providing accommodation for travellers who are staying for several days.We were in a Deluxe Room and our immediate impression on seeing the décor was very positive. But then, where were the cupboards in the bathroom for our possessions? The bathroom did not look nearly so chic with toothbrushes and other bathroom paraphernalia lining the ledges around it. There was nowhere for a spare toilet roll to be kept so we never got one and we had to continually request replenishments. We also had the same problem with paper tissues. Amazingly, the soap was not changed until the last day of our stay.The bathroom has two very impressive sinks but they are of such size that it was very difficult to get within range of the mirror in order to shave or apply make-up. Despite having two sinks, only one bar of soap was provided and the soap in the shower was a sink soap rather than a shower soap.The bed sheets were not changed until we requested it (we knew because the bottom sheet had a tear) and, yet, the same daily rate was charged as if we were new guests each day.With regard to the rest of the accommodation, there are similar practical issues for the long-term traveller. There are no facilities to make tea or coffee in the room so you have to have room service or go down to the guest room each time you need a coffee or tea. Design triumphs over substance so there is no clock in the room.Room service is not really a practical option in the Deluxe Room as it lacks anywhere for two people to comfortably eat.The accommodation smacks of a designer who has never stayed a night in the room that he or she designed.The bar and restaurant areas are good and the food is good.Service in the hotel is not overly attentive and some of the breakfast staff, in particular, have the knack of avoiding your eye at all times so that one is often left surrounded by dishes and waiting for tea and coffee. That said, there are a couple of wait staff who are quite exceptional. The staff in the entrance area may or may not pay you attention. It seemed that the more staff there were hanging around the foyer (which could be as many as eight), the less likely that any of them would open the door or acknowledge your existenceThe hotel is located in an exciting area of New York that is always gridlocked with traffic and where piles of rubbish litter the streets. However, the street in which the hotel is located is remarkably free of traffic and is relatively clean and quiet.This is a hotel with great potential but it is very amateurish in its approach and lacks basic quality control.We have marked the hotel as a long stay destination. The score may have been a little higher had we merely stayed overnight.

We have stayed here several times and it is by far, my favorite hotel in NYC. The location in Soho is convenient to the subways. The hotel is trendy and nicely done. I love the huge windows that are from floor to ceiling. It is also very quiet and very comfortable. The front desk and staff are always helpful and friendly. I highly recommend this hotel.

We have travelled extensively during the last ten years, both business and pleasure trips. We are both in high end hospitality and this place just sets a new benchmark. If you act upon a review that someone else writes... a tricky one, but please take our advice, GO TO THIS HOTEL! Its not cheap but it really delivers as far as value for money. Great room with great views but arrange your own transport to and from the airport.

I have travelled a lot for work and stayed in several great hotels. The Crosby Street Hotel is really fantastic. The attention to detail is rare. The maid even wrapped ever so perfectly the cord of my blow dryer cord for me ( which i hate doing and never have the patience to do well).The rooms are beautiful and are all individually designed. The staff are truly outstanding. Food is fantastic!! Its not cheapmbut worth the money (do not stay at the Trump Soho)

Every detail was perfect; from the welcoming staff, beautiful accommodations, delicious food, delightful garden spaces, impeccable service and overall attention to detail resulting in this incredible oasis. I am a native New Yorker and have traveled widely but found the Crosby Street Hotel to be one of the best hotel experiences I have had. Having had the pleasure of staying at their sister hotel The Knightsbridge in London, I was happy to see that wonderful hotel translated to these shores.

We spent the holiday weekend here and loved it. The hotel is exceptionally well designed, making use of the space in ways that are sensible and still exude a sense of comfort and grace. The service is also smart and comfortable and graceful. And as a bonus, the food in the bar and restaurant is fresh and well presented: best enjoyed in the outdoor space, if possible.If you driving, you might pick somewhere else: traffic (automotive and pedestrian) in the neighborhood is difficult to negotiate.

a demotivated almost absent staff,i.e. restaurant receptionist more concerned with filing nails than seeing customers hotel ticked all the boxes but no feeling of warmth ..............lacked soul and spirit design greatlocation great $800 a night (all in )and a shower only in small bedroom (for the money)style over substance

After travelling to New York City about once a month for the past year and a half, I have finally found my "go to" hotel. Located in SoHo, the hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of midtown but convenient, by subway, to downtown financial institutions and midtown offices. The staff is superb, the cleanliness and quality shine throughout, and my three stays at Crosby Street Hotel (most recently July 2011) are by far my best hotel experiences ever. Other hotels in Manhtattan will "do," but this one exceeds expectations and actually makes business trips something to look forward to. My only regret is that I can't afford a room at this hotel that will accommodate my family of four when we come to New York for fun. Stay here if you can. You won't regret it.

This hotel is absolutely beautiful and never have we stayed in a quieter hotel in NYC (our room faced the courtyard). We have stayed at this line of hotels in London (Covent Garden and Knightsbridge Hotel) and were thrilled the Crosby St, although different, measured up.The room was not as large as the ones we had in London, but it was lovely with a huge window, nice private view, fabulous embroidered drapes, pull out sofa and a super comfortable king bed. The closet looked small, yet was so well designed it held our three suitcase and loads of clothes and shoes. Each night we had bottles of water at turndown by the bed. The bathroom had a great shower with loads of water pressure and was solid marble but a single sink, small and dark, but pleasant.We did the summer special and got the free breakfast and were surprised by how good food was. Included was a great buffet of amazing fresh fruit (local rasberries, blueberries, etc) and yogurt selection (including greek), pastries and cereals. You also got a hot choice, including eggs benedict, etc. The service was very nice and the dining room cheerful and beautifully eclectic. We even had a tour of the restaurant's rooftop garden and met the resident chickens!We also enjoying sitting in the gorgeous private lounge and having cocktails and snacks (though the octopus was embarrassingly small for the money) in the courtyard.The location was great, right in the middle of Soho, and with Soho amazingly crowded with throngs of tourists, it was a pleasure to step into the civilized calm of the Crosby Street Hotel.

We stayed at Crosby St Hotel twice in December on our first and second visits to New York between over the Christmas and New Year periods (breaking up both stays with a few days' sightseeing in Washington DC). We had booked the Mark Hotel for our second stay, but after seeing the much smaller rooms and upper east side location, decided the Crosby St Hotel offered better value for money and bigger rooms.The hotel is beautiful and we were happy to hear a familiar, friendly Australian accent at both reception and concierge. The concierge were exceptionally helpful, from making excellent restaurant reservations for Christmas dinner, to organising the safe return of a teddy bear left behind in a hotel in Washington DC.Basement gym was never very busy, which was a plus given its compact size. Minor service issues were the only drawback:Drawing room was lovely, but service, as with breakfast in the restaurant, was inconsistent. Similarly, housekeeping service was variable, but overall very good.Liked it so much we'll stay there again over the Christmas and New Year period again this year, and look forward to getting reacquainted with the neighbourhood

It’s a very nice hotel, with an interesting design and confortable rooms. Yet, for the price asked we were expecting something more. Plus:-       Right near the hot spots in south Manhattan.-       Design: interesting and peculiar.-       Rooms are wide enough, characterized by the great window.-       Nice staff.-       Close to the subway.-       Umbrella in the room (quite handy since it rained).-       Nice closet-       Nice bathroom and shower.-       Flexible check out hour.-       We had breakfast at the hotel once. 20$ for buffet. Tasty but not great.  Minus:-       Too expensive for what it offers. Keep in mind: you’re mostly paying for the position. Considering just the hotel, it’s way too overpriced for a 4 stars.-       Minibar: you pay for everything, 4$ for 330 ml of water.

I stayed at the Crosby this week with two team members. We've already booked five of us in for a week in October, based on a great first visit. The rooms are large for Manhattan, funky, functional, and comfortable. iPod docks, heated towel racks, turndown service, a well-stocked mini bar, two sinks in the bathroom, and lots of peace and quiet. We used a meeting room for a day and a half and were happy with both the space and the service. Ask one of the bartenders for a Duke of Perth: a divine creation. We did have one quirk with the restaurant. We weren't able to sit in their gorgeous courtyard, even though it was just after ten at night. Noise by-laws, which is understandable but still too bad. We also were unable to order food, even from the small plates menu. When I asked if we could just have some bread and butter, I was told that they threw it out. I confirmed that I could go to my room and order 24-hour room service. We heartily accept that kitchens close, but 10pm seems a bit early in a metropolis like NYC. A small incident in an otherwise impeccable stay. Absolutely fabulous concierge and door staff. There is a Starbucks on the corner, lots of good shops and restaurants, and a running path one mile west, just down Houston to the piers. This is where we'll be staying from now on.

I have stayed at the Crosby a couple of times in recent months. It is a newish property that is very comfortable and well run. Loved my time there and will be making it my home base in New York from now on.Rooms are pleasant, well decorated and very comfortable. Service is impeccable and attentive.All in all a great experience
user_name:
IslandHopper888
New York City, New York

review_body: I admit I'm head over heels for Firmdale's Covent Garden Hotel. The over-the-top decor. The huge bathrooms. The big windows. The little silver strainer for my tea cup at breakfast. The pencils. It all adds up for me. So I was excited but a little nervous to try their New York outpost - could it possibly be as wonderful as London? As it turns out, yes it could and it is. Because they basically picked up the London experience and dropped it into "the other" Soho. Right down to the little silver tea strainer. The beds are every bit as luxurious. The fabrics and textures are awesome. The window took up the entire wall. They even have the high end English bathroom fixtures and a signature Miller Harris fragrance. Loved it. In fact, in certain respects, I loved it even more than London. See, this hotel has the space for a fantastic guest-only garden. And a special appearance by Brooke Shields in the elevator (your mileage may vary). And, most importantly, I can get there by Amtrak so I can conceivably visit more than once a year. I definitely plan to.

Nice on-line reservation system. Hotel staff impressively trained and accommodating. My on-line request for a quiet room was cheerfully noted when we checked in. Our deluxe room was spacious, well appointed and airy. Since NYC rooms tend to be small, I think it's worth paying for a larger room especially if our stay is more than 2 nights. Concierge called before our arrival to offer help with reservations - another nice touch! All the staff were so friendly and welcoming. A nice departure from so many downtown hotels that take themselves a bit too seriously (eg the Mercer and the Greenwich).

What a place, what great service, what a joy to visit and stay at Crosby Street Hotel... with wonderful 5 star white linen breakfasts every day in the garden or in the restaurant, fantastic staff who think of nothing to ensure your ultimate satisfaction. TIP: after a long flight, order the Crosby street burger - it's to die for - and make sure you have a few cocktails in the drawing room to really luxe it up.

Actually, it is hard to put word on this - this is one of my very best hotel experiences ever - from the moment I went inside I was blown away..........World class serviceWorld class roomsWorld class everything!
Beautiful Hotel with lovely courtyards........Lovev ly Rooms, very nice toiletries and you also receive a preety box of pencils.
Great location, beautiful back courtyard, really great staff. It's a bit more expensive than some other hotels in the Soho/Village area, but well worth the extra $$$.

Magic. Our weekend was magic. We walked through the beautiful entrance and entered the oasis of The Crosby Street Hotel. We must specifically thank Nell who made it her mission to make my husband's birthday memorable. Our upgraded suite was luxury and loveliness and so, so, very beautiful, spacious and cozy. We ate an early evening dinner tucked on a sofa in the garden and the food was delicious. We needed help with navigating some evening plans and all was worked out for us. Every time we walked through the hotel doors my husband was greeted with "Happy Birthday". Just so far beyond any hotel we have stayed in New York City(and we have stayed in most). Don't hesitate on your choice to stay at The Crosby. Well done Nell and team. Can't wait to see you all again soon. :)

Beautifully appointed rooms. Spacious, with great furnishings and floor to ceiling windows. Room also had a very nice bathroom.Overall, was a great experience at this very nice hotel.The location is also great and close to the subway in Soho.

The Crosby Street Hotel offers a pefect combination of great service, design and comfort in a downtown location, with the added bonus of outside spaces. We wanted something a bit special to celebrate our birthdays and so were prepared to pay the extra dollars. By booking through design hotels we were given an upgrade from a superior room to a deluxe room on floor 6 which gave us extra space and a great view over the hotel sculpture garden and across the streets at the back of the hotel. A gift and personal note from the Manager was in our room on arrival. The room itself was a soft grey with red accents and included a sofa and chairs, full length windows, plenty of wardrobe space, a really comfortable king bed and a marble shower room. Downstairs the guest lounge and garden areas are perfect for relaxing in after sight seeing and the restaurant offers a well priced fixed menu at $25 for two course and $35 for three, between 12.30 and 7 on weekdays. We also enjoyed afternoon tea and the 'twisted' mojito cocktails should not be missed. Husband made use of the gym which he said had good equipment. We really enjoyed staying here and it made a great location for exploring downtown areas of Soho, Meatpacking, and the rest of the East and West Villages. It is also near a metro to hop uptown or there are plenty of taxis. If we can get back to NYC soon we shall certainly stay at the Crosby again.

since today i was a passive reader of Trip Advisor and didn't write any reviews or comments.Our stay in Crosby Street Hotel made me write a review.we stayed 5 days at the hotel. The room, service, concierge, location everything was great.Every penny spent for the hotel worths.

We don't like big chain hotels no matter how upscale. The Crosby is elegant and beautifully desgined. The service was top notch from Dan in the lobby to Patrick at the front desk. We arrived really early and while we were having breakfast our room was ready. And, if you don't know the Soho area of NYC, go - it is vibrant. lots of galleries, shops, bars and restaurants. It is within walking distance of the Lower East Sice and its history, Greenwich Village, the HIgh Line and the Meatpacking District. In this whole area of Manhattan there is no sense of a down economy - the joint is jumping!

Having stayed in many different hotels in NY from the St Regis, the Giraffe, to the Elysee and many others, this would have to be my favourite hotel in NY city. For one thing everything works!!! No blocked toilets, wonderful housekeeping, spotlessly clean rooms, lovely gesture of a bottle of water at turn down. Beautifully eclectically decorated rooms and common areas. Free wifi for all and any devices! The best breakfast ever!!I stayed here for 4 nights with my husband, and it was so good, I have booked a special weekend for my daughter (who is moving to NY) and myself as a treat.The service was faultless, wonderful concierge Chris who had good restaurant advice, helpful on laundry service and directions, everything we asked was no trouble. And you didn't have to wait in a queue at the concierge desk. This is a small intimate hotel, and you pay for the luxury you get, as well as the special ambiance. The position of the hotel was perfect for us, very close to the subway to take you uptown, when you walk out of the hotel you are in the thick of Soho shopping a block away - again just perfect - as it wasn't in the high rise jungle of mid town. With Balthazar just a few steps away!The hotel isn't cheap, but I really feel it is value for money - it is a truly special experience. And to top it off, everyone who works there looks happy!

I've travelled to over 60 countries and I have to rank this hotel at the top of the list. It is quite expensive but you get what you pay for and this place delivers. Everything is new, modern, trendy. Highly recommended to anyone wanting to impress his/her significant other.The location is really difficult to beat if you like shopping. Subway access is also easy. I've stayed in several higher end hotels in NYC and this is my favorite.The breakfast is the best I have ever had. . .seriously its awesome and not to be missed.

My husband took me here for my birthday, knowing how much I love New York Cool. The Crosby Street Hotel fit the bill perfectly. From the minute you pull up to the gorgeous front on quiet Crosby Street, with it's mod glass canopy, you feel like you've "arrived". The lobby is striking for its hip, but humorous artwork. Lots of it focuses on dogs, which hotelier Kit Kemp is big on. In fact, the artwork makes you feel like you're a houseguest at a friend's cool place in the City. Many pieces have personal notes to Ms. Kemp, adding to the feel that you are in a private home. Discovering the public areas of the hotel was a joy. Each room was so delightful, from the drawing room to the outdoor bar area to the downstairs private party rooms. I could not get enough.Our room was gorgeous, with it's floor to ceiling windows and wide, cushioned low window seat. The upholstered headboard was stunningly done in a tufted green and fuschia orchid print. The lime green, fuschia color scheme was carried through in the comfortable arm chairs and bench at the foot of the bed. The bathroom was a vision in cool grey marble. (And Ms. Kemp gets kudos for equipping her rooms with a 7x magnification mirror for flawless makeup application on us over-40 women who can't see close up as well as we used to!) The plush robes were a delight to slip on. Oh, one of the true treats was the turndown service...instead of the tired old chocolates, we got a heavenly small cannister of bed-linen spray. The scent was very light, but so soothing and wonderful on the nose when you slid between the crisp sheets.I cannot wait to get back to this hotel with my husband again, but also with my girlfriends. You feel beautiful just being in this stunning space.
user_name:
Burbanista
New York City, New York

review_body: very good room, nice restaurant and drawing room. Service is average - could be better at the reception, but concierge really nice and helpful. A bit expensive still for what it offers.

SUPERB IN EVERY WAY! Crosby Street is our new favorite hotel in NYC. Brand new; absolutely gorgeous, chic, funky decor; top-notch friendly service; well-located on a quiet street in the middle of Soho.Owned and operated by London's premier Firmdale Hotels group (ever heard of the fab Number Sixteen???), Crosby Street is their first outpost in the United States. We were told that a second New York hotel is due to open in midtown later this year.We had one of the premier, corner rooms and were delighted. Good-sized by NYC standards, sparkling clean, floor to ceiling windows, finest quality furnishings and hardware - all from the U.K. Even the smallest touches were appreciated: padded hangers, bathrobes, heated towel rack, and a shoe horn! The bathroom and shower were to die for. When was the last time you had good water pressure from a shower head in a hotel!Public spaces were awe-inspiring and hats off to the decorator. Feng shui to the max. If you stay here, make sure to get downstairs to see the film screening theater, function rooms, and bar. I'd have a meeting in that conference room any day.Every member of the staff was lovely, and we were treated with warmth and respect from the moment we arrived. They are genuinely service-oriented without a hint of snootiness. No faux sycophancy here. They went out of their way to be helpful, including getting us out of a restaurant snafu on a Saturday night (thanks again, George!).Coincidentally, a few days after our return to Boston, we noticed that the weekend Financial Times had a feature about hip NYC boutique hotels. A full two-spread photo of Crosby Street's art gallery, um lobby. Well deserved, and wow did we feel on the cutting edge.The only gripe over our two-day stay had to do with the bar within the hotel's restaurant. Living in New England and frequenting Boston and New York, we are more than familiar with high prices and rarely blink an eye. BUT -- $18.00 for a cocktail is simply over the top. We each had one drink and a tiny bowl of peanuts and the tab plus tip came to $50.00!!! As good as the ambience and drinks were, it felt like a rip-off and we would not visit the bar again. Our recommendation? Lower the prices to within striking range and attract more customers. That being said, we adore the hotel and can't wait for an excuse to go back.

I can not recommend this hotel highly enough. The decor is genious. The quality of the furnishings and art could not be better. The full wall loft windows gave a wonderful sense of space to the room with wonderful day light, yet two kinds of window coverings for privacy or darkness. The bathroom was perfectly set up for funtion which I appreciated. I was impressed with what lengths the door men had to go through to get me cabs each time. They had to hail them from Spring Street since the cabs dont travel down Crosby, it being a quiet side street. The only strange thing was my check in. I was only handed a key and had the elevator pointed to. No assistance to get my bags to my room or show me how things worked. In addition, it appeared I was given some other persons room as another name appeared on the welcome letter. Made me feel like I got a room that was rejected by the individual for some reason or other. I ended up loving my room though, so did not think anything of it after getting settled. My breakfast was delivered exactly at the time requested each morning and presented so lovely besides being delicious. I also enjoyed having brunch for Mother's Day and evening coctails in the courtyard. I am really looking forward to returning often. Next time I wiil be sure to reserve the top floor rate. It is worth the price to secure the higher floor and not chance missing out on the best view.

Couldn't say enough good things about the Crosby Street Hotel. The staff was attentive. Breakfast was delicious and the rooms spacious. The feature that I loved the most was that every room had a floor to ceiling window. The shower was the best I ever had anywhere in the world or even my own home. We had 3 people in the room. 1 king size bed plus a sleeper sofa. We all fit beautifully. I highly recommend this hotel.

Ideally located in the very heart of the hip SoHo, the latest addition of Firmdale collection is a magical adress, a very exclusive property absolutely different from all the other hotels of NYC. For sure, if you're a fan of Firmdale, you'll recognize right away the Kit Kemp's style but like in all the Firmdale hotels, there is a strong identity. Discreet and elegant, the lobby is dominated by grey oak floorboards and an impressive human head sculpture created with letters of the alphabet. Immediatly when you get into this exceptionnal hotel, you'll feel the difference, the incredible warm atmosphere and the impression to be not in an hotel but in a place where you'd like to live for ever. Adjacent to the lobby, there is a drawing room with marvellous patchwork sofas and a collection of oil paintings showing dogs, the symbol of Crosby Street Hotel and a real New Yorkers passion. On the other side is the Crosby bar and restaurant with a crazily intelligent style full of colours and with a multitude of 50's ceiling lights.This beautiful style can be found in the 86 rooms and suites, each one individually designed meaning you'll be able to have 86 very unique experiences at Crosby Street. This time, we have been so lucky to stay in a fantastic suite (number 906) located at the 9th and offering stunning views on the rooftops of SoHo. The decor with a beautiful scheme of grey, orange, almond, blue and pink colours is truly impressive, with beautiful curtains and no word about the exceptionnal comfort. With more than 65 sq.m, a suite at Crosby is like your own little flat in South Manhattan. A large living area extremly comfy is adjacent to a oversized bedroom with a deep bed and the most perfect linens. In both room, you'll enjoy the floor to ceiling warehouse style windows overlooking Big Apple and the very best bathroom ever with a shower and a separate bathtub, much more larger than the NY standard.There is also a romantic garden to enjoy a cup of champagne when the weather is nice, a state of the art gym and a screening room. Everywhere you'll look, you'll be impressed by the real beauty of this hotel.But Crosby Street Hotel is not only beautiful... This is truly a five stars hotel where you'll meet a team with an heart with the only objective to make your stay so unforgettable. Everybody is very professionnal but cool which is different. You'll be able to be yourself cause nothing is snobish at Crosby Street Hotel. Each person working in this place has always a nice smile on the face and always a nice word to tell you. I wanna point as well on the management team, often not immediately concerned with the guest satisfaction but at Crosby, there is always a manager and the GM himself, Jakob Hansen, is a very nice person and undoubtly one of the best hotel manager i met. We shared a glass of champagne in the adorable garden and he's really motivated to make of Crosby Street, a place you'll never wanna leave...It's undoubtly what will happen to you after a few days in this property. Breakfast are so yummy and even if you just wanna book a Superior room, no worry not to be satisfied cause even the smallest room is large enough for a complete relaxation and the sense of detail is the same for all the rooms or suites.We're so in love for Crosby Street Hotel, probably the best city hotel in the world thanks to the designer, Kit Kemp, who has created a superb place with an atmosphere and thanks to the ultra professionnal team of Jakob who will try the best to make of your stay something you'll never forget. EXCEPTIONNAL...

The Crosby is a brilliant hotel. I travel a lot for my job and have stayed in a lot of five star hotels over the years all over the globe and there is no question this is the best. I will go as far as to say that if you want to stay in the best hotel in the world choose this one. The interior design is pure genius. The rooms are huge compared to other hotels in New York. Everything is pretty immaculate and has a great feel. The food is high quality and the staff are attentive. They pay attention to the detail, for example, they don't drive you nuts by charging you for wi-fi as it is complimentary.
user_name:
AAinbigapple
New York City, New York

review_body: I will start by saying that I have stayed in almost all of the 5star hotels in NYC over the years. The Upper East Side hotels are too stodgy and formal, like the Peninsula, or they are too hip and crazy, like the Gansevoort or Standard. The Crosby Street Hotel, mixes the two perfectly. The Art in the hotel is amazing and gives the entire hotel a vibe of style and substance. The rooms are works of art. Someone (The owner) has put their personal touch on every room. The last room i was in had a silver penquin in the fireplace!!! I spend about 1/3 of my life in hotels, so I like to walk in the front door to a front desk. I like to be greeted. I like to feel like this is my home away from home. This place fits that bill. The front desk is great, so is the concierge. The bar and restaurant are also very good as are the outdoor common areas. The location, in the heart of SOHO is great. If you take public transportation, it is just a block away. I cant really think of a negative comment. I have stayed at other Firmdale (the group that owns The Crosby) and i love them all. If you are going to be in NY and want a place with a great vibe, then this is your hotel!

Being fans of Firmdale hotels, we were delighted to find one had opened in New York. The decor was Firmdale all the way. The rooms were nicely appointed and not too small by New York standards (interestingly, our hotel room was larger in London) and they were clean with some very nice touches to them. The staff were very friendly and helpful, which made for a very pleasant stay. We tried the restaurant, but it must have been an unusually busy day for them as there did not seem to be enough staff to properly service customers. We did find that the restaurant could use some help from acoustic tiles, as it was quite noisy.All in all, we would definitely stay here again.

My wife and recently spent 9 wonderful days in New York staying at the Crosby St Hotel. Although we had not stayed here previously we knew things were looking positive when on checking in, we were immediately upgraded to a mini suite. The tastefulness of the decor and comfort of the room was superb. The overall design of the hotel, the lobby and guest areas is tastefully modern and adorned with beautiful artwork. All the staff were extemely helpful and courteous right down to the housekeeping staff. We were assisted with all our reservations, advice and directions by a highly informative and friendly concierge and doorstaff. Nothing was too much trouble. Although the service in the dining room could be tightened up a notch or two, the staff were friendly and did their best to serve a sometimes hectic dining room. Having said that the food quality and presentation, as well as menu choice was excellent. The hotel is in a wonderful location in a quiet street near great shopping, restuarants and bars. You can walk across the street in the early morning to Balthazar to pick up a pastry and good coffee to bring back to the room if a big breakfast is not what you're looking for. There is easy access to 3 different subway lines. After a long day trudging the New York sidewalks shopping and sightseeing it's a joy to return to such a great hotel. We can't wait to return and will recommend to all our friends travelling to New York.

What an amazing experience. From the moment we were greeted at reception teplete with plants shaped as dogs to our last glass of wine in the plush sitting room, this was a sheer delight. The interior finishes are amazing, room brilliant with soft bedding, water pressure that will take your skin off, excellent food, great wine selection. And a NYC view over the rooftops through large, warehouse style windows. The staff were on hand for every need and the location (if Soho is your preferred location) right in the heart of the action suited us to a t. As we watched the snow fall over the city on the last day of our stay I wished I could stay at Crosby Street for another week. A testament to a great hotel experience.

Decided to spend some in NY on the rebound from a trip to Asia and chose The Crosby Street. I have stayed this company's London property, The SoHo, and wanted to check it out in NY.I reserved an upper floor room, great roof tops views. It was quiet and had the same design aesthetic as their London property. Several nights of great sleep, in a great bed.Met some friends for drinks and nibbles at the hotel bar. Super selection of small plates.The location could not be better. The 6 train is a 5 minute walk, Houston, Prince, Nolita, all within walking distance.Not the least expensive option in NY, but a terrific stay.
user_name:
gcosta58
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel was selected as a Traveler's Choice winner for a reason: it's a fabulous Manhattan experience. As the other reviewers have stated, the SoHo location is outstanding. The service is impeccable -- a hallmark of Firmdale, the hotel's owners. Every detail is noticed, and they quickly react (but more commonly are proactive) to each need you may have. I loved the size of the hotel, the lobby, the rooms (a friend was upgraded to a lovely, lovely suite), the room service. This is a great place for a weekend getaway as a couple or with friends. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Totally lovely small hotel. The rooms are small, but stylish and cool. The staff is great and the best part.... the fantastic room to the right of the Lobby, an honor bar, library, service and a charming hidden garden.

I have made seven or eight, and until I discovered the Crosby Street Hotel (CSH) I'd used a different hotel on each occasion. Before the CSH, no hotel had quite managed to fit the bill. THE CSH is now my go-to choice in the city.I won't waste your valuable time by repeating the positive comments made eloquently in many other reviews. I'll simply concur that the hotel is bright, good value for NYC and the rooms are comfortable, interestingly decorated and nicely-sized. There are downsides, which while small are worth mentioning and which others have not really highlighted.The breakfast service is simply hopeless. Restaurant staff are sullen, appear to have short attention spans and poor hearing. Errors and a basic lack of manners are too evident.The reception staff offer nothing beyond the most cursory of welcomes. In some ways, this can be preferable to the gush one receives at the Ritz-Carlton and Mandarin Oriental.
