On the other hand, it gives a poor first impression and keeps the CHS from getting a full 5-star rating.Other than these fairly minor failings, two-thumbs up.[As an aside, In December 2010 my original booking was at The Chatwal, a hotel so monstrously ugly and uncomfortable that I left on the second day. The move across town to the CSH was bliss by comparison. Should you be considering the CSH and Chatwal side-by-side, i implore you not to opt for The Chatwal. Trust me, you'll thank me for the advice. :) ]

Having loyally stayed at Firmdale properties in London, we were thrilled that their only NYC property exceeded our expectations. Backed by an outstanding location in the shopping/nightlife mecca of Soho, Crosby Street is the definition of a luxury boutique hotel - sophisticated design, smart rooms, special amenities, lively bar/restaurant, and consistent service. Plus, the bathrooms have the best showers around. Of course, you pay for the experience, but Crosby Street is worth it!

Stayed at the Crosby street Hotel whilst visiting relatives in the area. We've visited another establishment by the same group in London. Was pleased with that experience and decided that we would camp here whilst in NY. I must say we were not at all disappointed. Our room was gorgeous, sleek and rather spacious. Most of the staff were warm and courteous. Location is truly unbeatable. Decor throughout the hotel was splendid and colors were very "cool modern english". Who would've thought that one would opt to stay in an English hotel in the heart of New York!? There was a nice warm feel about the place, yet edgy and rather ideal for us middle-aged couples.

I stayed at this trendy hotel 5 nights at the end of Jan into Feb 2011. The rooms are larger than most upscale NY hotels and the location was perfect for my visit. Fun bar and room service was nice. My favorite feature was that after you buy a movie, they deliver warm fresh popcorn to your room, if you choose. I am a sucker for popcorn~ and to have the option on the television was fantastic! I could tell which day I had different housekeeping people because one lady in particular (of american-asian descent) would leave the room sparkling clean, the others... not so much but still fair. The room service did mess up my order a bit more than I am used to and promised to remove their mistakes from my bill, which I have yet to get my credit card to check but will soon know, other than that... great place.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Crosby Street. Everything from the service to the room was spot on. Its pricey, but what can you do. From my experience easily beats other equivalent hotels nearby. Where many places fall short of the fancy press photos on their websites, Crosby Street does not. From the lobby to the rooms, the hotel is exactly as good as it looks in pictures. The location is obviously great, right between Soho and Nolita, close to a ton of shops and restaurants.if I'd have to come up with one complaint, it would be that the AC unit was extremely loud. we couldn't leave it on for the night because even at the lowest fan setting it was very noisy. That said, the room temperature ended up being perfect for our entire stay without it.if my wallet permits, I certainly wouldn't mind staying here again.

For people who like hotels - and let's face it - it's a bit of a club of junkies - there are only a handful of places that really make the extra effort. It's pretty easy to find a place with a flash spa, gym and shiny marble lobby. It's pretty easy to get a good location if you're willing to pay for it. But how many places offer that bit of extra effort that turn a night in a hotel to one big fun filled, elegant journey? Crosby Street is the best addition to the New York scene in years. In a city where fashionable boutique hotels open every month on every other corner - it's a little piece of heaven in the middle of Soho. It's creative, fresh, friendly and professional. It has all the trappings you would expect and the staff to back it up. All day dining in the lovely restaurant - drinks available in the drawing room 24 hours a day which is particularly good for jet lagged travelers on NZ time..... If you're going to really enjoy New York - put yourself in the hands of true professionals who will help you to navigate the city like a local without missing any of the must see icons. Give Crosby Street a go, You'll love it.
user_name:
pinkberrytraveller
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stayed for one night this past weekend. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. The lobby was gorgeous and immaculate; the staff was very polite and helpful. Our room was very spacious, especially for NYC and the view from our wall of windows was spectacular. Loved the decor of the room--nothing cookie cutter about it--and the bathroom was sleek. You can tell that a lot of thought went into the layout and furnishing of the rooms, and we loved everything about it. Hope to have an opportunity to stay at the Crosby Street Hotel again soon!

This was our 3rd trip to the hotel restaurant for Sunday Brunch. Same arrogant waiter named Phil O who rolls his eyes and loudly tells other waiters that he's 'fed up' when we asked him to return our Steak and Eggs because the steak was so undercooked and my nephew's cappuccino was so luke warm that we sent it back. He starts clearing the table while everyone is eating. The place is beautiful and glamorous but service is very bad and the food is very buttery as far as brunch. Our total bill for that brunch was $350.00 for 9 of us and it was a big disappointment. That's it for us, we are not going back.

We spent a Saturday night in January at the Crosby Street Hotel. I booked the room directly from the Hotel's website. I was somewhat reluctant to book the stay because I opted for the least expensive rate. It included a standard room and breakfast for two. In the past, I have had experiences with other hotels where I booked the most inexpensive room and was treated poorly at the hotel - either the room was horrible or the service I was given was horrible. However, from the minute we walked through the front door until we checked out the next day, we were treated exceptionally well. Our room was not ready when we arrived and we were told that we had been upgraded and that the wait would be about half an hour. We sat in a very cozy and beautifully decorated room immediately adjacent to the lobby. We ordered tea and coffee and it arrived with cookies. We were not charged. After we finished our refreshments we were told that we had been upgraded to a two room suite. The suite was absolutely beautiful. The bathroom was very spacious. Everything was very clean and well maintained. We had the English breakfast the next morning. If you are an English breakfast fan, the food was very good. If you are not, I believe you can substitute up to the value of the breakfast. The restaurant staff was very pleasant.The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very professional. The area is great with lots of shopping and restaurant.

We just spent an absolutely superb 4 days at The Crosby. The hotel is perfect in every way from the location smack bang in the middle of everything to the service which was 6* to the absolute splendor and beauty of the place. Having stayed in several hotels in New York now I cannot recommend this one highly enough as probably the best hotel I've ever stayed in, anywhere.

What a hotel. My wife and I stayed here for four nights in early January for our honeymoon, and were absolutely thrilled that we chose this hotel. The attention to detail of all staff members cannot be faulted, and everything about the hotel was thought out and considered. Great location, excellent room and well, can I rave about this place more? You will not be disappointed.

I stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel after hearing good things online about the family of hotels of which Crosby is a part. I had high expectations, and the Crosby Street Hotel exceeded them. From the moment I walked in I felt like I was a welcome and appreciated guest. The property is beautifully kept and has a great vibe. The lobby had a very nice cozy feel, and the front desk staff couldn't have been friendlier (Patrick was a real star when it came to freindly service). I had a great time at the Crosby Street Hotel. I don't typically use a lot of hotel amenities when I travel, so I can't speak to amenity services. The most important things to me are customer service, professionalism, and above-all, cleanliness. The customer service was spectacular. The staff was completely professional, from the front desk to the housekeepers and room service staff. Everyone was extremely courteous. The room was immaculate. It was a good size for New York, with a unique one-of-a-kind style. The mirrors and floor-to-ceiling windows gave the room a nice spacious feel. The personal service and the immaculately kept stylish accommodations were well worth the price of the stay. When ever I make it back to New York, I will definitely stay at the Crosby Street Hotel again. I have no reason to go anywhere else.

I and my partner fell in love with this hotel during our stay.Everything stated in other praising reviews is the truth. I am quite sure this is because 'the crosby' is a breeze of fresh firmdale air in a city full of show-off-no-substance expensive hotels.Major plus; it's quiet and private and very clean.The drawing room off the lobby proved to be the best dinner/hang out space. Forget about the Balthazar!Can somebody please recommend a similar hotel for half the price in NYC??

Had a wonderful 5 night stay at this hotel, it has a really relaxing/chill out vibe, with beautiful modern decor in bedrooms and public spaces. The English breakfast was included in our room rate, but as we perfer something lighter we where allowed to take any breakfast items to the value of the English breakfast. We actually choose to share the Crosby Breakfast which is sufficient for two people. It will be my first choice of hotel for any future visit to NYC.

Having really made an effort to get to New York during the snow storm, we were very excited about our stay at the Crosby Street Hotel. The location is fantastic, close to excellent restaurants, bars and boutique shopping and easy to travel to and from by subway.The hotel design, clearly in the Firmdale tradition, is stunning, eclectic and witty with a penchant for pooches. Our room had pleasant views, was beautifully furnished and was a pleasure to be in.Perhaps having expected so much, we were disappointed by the extremely slow and frankly, poor restaurant service that we experienced on the first 3 days of our 6 day stay. Having to wait for 30 minutes to be asked for our coffee order at breakfast and then a further 20 minutes to receive it is beyond the pale. A similar, if not quite so tardy, experience was repeated for the following 2 breakfasts. The Film Club dinner on the Sunday unfortunately, confirmed that this level of service was as much as could be expected. Again blighted by what seemed to be chaos, we like other reviewers received the wrong food. Beyond the restaurant, the housekeeping service was also patchy - frequently not replacing bathroom products and necessitating a call from the shower to get them!I would like to hope that the restaurant service was a feature of staffing during the holiday season and perhaps a less experienced group of waiting staff, as there clearly were great improvements after New Years Day - but only after our complaint to the hotel manager.This hotel is beautiful, in a fabulous location and has all of the potential to become top of its class. It will have to focus on improving its service and the 'little details' that make very good into great.

Tough to find a good hotel with spacious rooms in a good location at a reasonable price...The Crosby Street Hotel is not cheap, not at all, but the hotel, the rooms, the service and the location are all perfect!Rooms are huge and very elegant and comfortable with nice large windows. The hotel is nice and small, very elegantly equipped and has a great area for outside breakfast! The bar is extremely cool and the service is very good throughout the whole place.The location is great, would definitely come again, even though it is not cheap - but again, this is NYC...

The hotel is a nice size and in a good location. The décor is exquisite and they have nice touches like an outdoor courtyard garden with lights and a Christmas tree. The hotel felt quite buzzy and had a good vibe in the evenings.We asked for a quiet room but were put next door to a lift, although it had good views and loads of light from the floor to ceiling windows. They moved us to a ‘quieter' room, but we found out too late that we were right next door to a cupboard used all the time by staff and the door banged every time it closed! Also, the views were awful although we knew that when we accepted the room. The bathroom was big with good quality fittings and a really powerful shower. The mini bar is well stocked with all manner of goodies, but it was expensive. They have a cinema and ‘movie nights’, along with a gym, and a good range of films to rent. We had a breakfast in the hotel and it was very good, although the service was slow. On the strength of it, we tried the restaurant one evening – big mistake! The service was slow and not very professional. The food was bland, presented badly and the whole evening was made worse when they gave us the wrong food so we ended up waiting a long time.Most of the staff were ok, not brilliant, just ok. Housekeeping was a bit inconsistent.It’s quite an expensive hotel and I’m not sure it was really worth it. It misses the mark in a variety of ways, particularly with the service and the restaurant.I wanted to rate this hotel as 'Good' rather than Average or Very Good, but TA doesn't offer this option :o(

We spent a night in the Crosby right after the massive January 26th snow storm. New York was partly closed down but the hotel was open and welcoming , the nearby subway was running and the restaurants in the area were open. We loved our room, particularly the "warehouse" style windows across most of one wall and decorating, uncluttered but striking. . The Crosby was only opened a year ago. The hotel ambience and decor might be described as "English hip" as opposed to corporate and we liked it very much. The lobby, meeting rooms, and restaurant are very attractive. The staff was very helpful. Breakfast was included and we enjoyed it. The concierge was able to help us navigate the intricacies of subway and bus tickets, and checked to find which museums were open. The location in Soho couldn't be better, Dean and Deluca is just around the corner, the MOMA store is across the street. Balthazar is a grat place to have lunch - it's steps away. And there are a multitude of little interesting shops around too, as well as Bloomingdales. My only reservation about the kingsized bed is that the mattress was hard - I thought this kind of hotel bed had had its day. But for those who want that kind of support it will be fine and we slept well. Overall we loved the Crosby which provided a degree of comfort and personal service to which we could very easily become accustomed. ,

Having stayed previously in the English-based Firmdale Group's delightful Knightsbridge Hotel, the news that this group had opened a hotel in New York resolved ouraccommodation question for a recent visit there. The Crosby Street Hotel has been created in what was previously an industrial building (car park) and is a stunning example of the eye for detail and decorating flair of the principals. Tastefully modern, our room and bathroom were large and well-appointed. The bed and linen were of the highest quality, service was friendly and spontaneous and a laptop was provided free of charge. Crosby Street is a quiet, one-way thoroughfare one block from, and parallel to, Broadway in the Soho district. The hotel is adjacent to a myriad of bars, restaurants, clothing boutiques and a Bloomingdales outlet. While there should be no need to venture into the nearby Chinatown or Little Italy ( which, we found tacky and seedy) they are only a few blocks away. Similarly, Greenwich Village, Chelsea and the vibrant Bleecker Street are also a short walk. Cabs uptown to Central Park and 5th Avenue etc. are plentiful and cheap at less than ten dollars and the downtown Financial District and waterfront even easier to reach. There are also a number of subway stations in the vicinity for those who prefer to travel that way.The hotel boasts a bar and restaurant which are justifiably popular. (There is also a private bar for guests which provides drinks on an honour system.) An enclosed rear terrace opens into Lafayette Street and is popular in warm weather. The choices of both food and wine are top class and the service unfailingly efficient. Some past criticism has been directed at the general youthfulness of Crosby Street staff. Exactly what issue this poses is unclear as we found all of them engaging, polite and very capable. The hotel clearly attracts a young drop-in crowd but is by no means a youth hostel. Rather, it is a modern, attractive, comfortable, professionally-run and welcome addition in an exciting city. It offers a quality alternative to many longer established properties of varying standards and, most certainly, to some of the more famous properties further uptown.
Fabulous hotel, quality furnishings and excellent service. Right in the centre of SoHo restaurants and beautiful boutique's. Perfect hotel to hang out with your bestie for a girlie weekend away!

Second stay here. Actually spent first 4 nights for Christmas at The Strand near Bryant Park (not bad for the price and view). After the NYC Christmas Blizzard spent two nights at the Crosby St. Hotel with two feet of snow everywhere. Even though the housekeeping staff was minimal because of the inability to get to work, this hotel was incredible! Great service, warm hospitality, great room with huge window overlooking the snow, wonderful breakfast, and the concierge spent 20 minutes trying to get us a cab in the two feet of snow! This hotel is the right size and the perfect laid-back location. The courtyard/patio had a beautiful Christmas tree and lights. I can't say enough about this place.

I chose the Crosby Street Hotel to take my god-daughter for her 21st birthday for a five day shopping and NYC sight seeing experience. Often in London we go to the other Firmdale hotels, Charlotte Street and Soho Hotel being two firm favourites. I have so say we weren't disappointed at all.The staff were fantastic, wishing my god daughter happy birthday etc. The concierge recommended some bars for us to visit for some celebratory drinks. I had requested in advance that the hotel have champagne and cup cakes waiting for us in our room when we arrived. They forgot :-( which was a bit disappointing. But the apologies and follow up more than made up for it. It's true that you can turn a bad experience into a much more positive one. All the staff were lovely and friendly and not at all snooty (which I have found at other 'trendy' hotels). Most of all, I had - through no fault of the hotel at all (Coffee Shop - Union Square) - horrendous food poisoning on our last night. Very kindly they accomodated a late check out for us and even offered to bring me some chicken soup in bed.We had an amazing time. I loved the ambience, the rooms, the decor - can't recommend highly enough and it's the most perfect location if you love downtown NYC.Thanks to all the team for a wonderful stay.

We've stayed in several so called high end New York hotels and always left feeling somewhat disappointed. Not the case with the Crosby Street hotel. Modern, friendly, efficient, genuine, clean, great location, beautiful reasonably priced food, great bar......and on and on. Highly reccommended!

We chose Crosby after having done several thorough internet researches on the hotel. It exceeded our expectations easiliy. The moment you enter the lobby you feel instantly like at home. Staff was very friendly and competent. The rooms are light and airy with bright windows, lovely decorated and spacious. Marvellous beds! Comfortable marble bathroom even though without a tub. Good pressure in shower. Overall, very clean room. English breakfast was included in room rate. Instead of the English breakfast we had the choice of any other breakfast on the menue at no additional charge and it was really a rich one with freshly baked pastries. The hotel's restaurant is worth a visit every hour of the day as it combines dining with lounging. Ask for the movie nights as the hotel has an own cinema. Also recommended for company events as they have various private dining rooms to offer.After all, an exceptional stay worth the money and definitely an enrichment to the city's mainstream hotel chains. We will definitely be back!

This is a lovely boutique hotel in a perfect location in the heart of Soho near Broadway, Prince and Spring St. Breakfast across the road at Balthazar, shops all around and if you get lazy the hotel restaurant and bar is a Soho attraction itself anyway and not a disappointment. I think there was an NBA star having dinner there with his mother when we were there and Hillary Swank was staying in the hotel as well. You can do laundry on Lafayette St (the back street of the hotel) much cheaper than the hotel- I did 10kg/20lbs (a full suitcase) for $20. Right next to the subway line so you can get anywhere in the city for about $2. Its pricey, but so is the rest of NY, and at least you know with Crosby, you wont be disappointed by the stay. The only bad point was the concierge service was just adequate but not fantastic. Not very interested in helping with other dining locations nearby- just wanted us to go to their restaurant! But the staff were pretty good and quite helpful on the whole.Soho is a great place to stay in NY with lots to do all around. Enjoy!

This hotel is hitting on all cylinders! Incredible Interior Design, impeccable cleanliness, excellent service, great rooms, excellent food, quaint location and the list could go on. I am critical to a fault, but this Hotel has done a wonderful job. Strong water pressure in the over-sized marble shower, heated towel warmer, upscale finishes, it is just non-stop fantastic. The Soho location is tucked away and perfect. There is an awesome Dean and Deluca half a block away. Balthazar across the street and the subway around the corner. Non-stop shopping/strolling in Soho and adjacent areas. I would not say the hotel is necessarily intended for families with small children. Our teenage boys had a blast though! Just a perfect NYC experience to be had. Congratulations to all the hardworking people at this hotel! I will certainly return.

We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Crosby Street Hotel. We travel to NYC several times a year and usually stay midtown. I was extremely pleased with our decision to try the Soho area for our hotel on this visit.First, let me begin with the couple of areas that I think the hotel falls a bit short. While not completely rude the front desk staff is less than pleasant. On one occasion when my teenage son had returned to the hotel with friends and asked for our room key, he was told it was not left for him. He insisted that he knew it was and of course was given the key. He felt that he was treated unfairly. The front desk had asked us for his name when we left the key for him. They never asked him for his name, if they had, perhaps it could have eliminated the need of making him feel uncomfortable.Second, the housekeeping should be more consistent. On night one of turn down service, we were left 3 bottles of Voss still water by our beds. We thought that this was a very nice touch. On night two, only one bottle was left. On night three, we did not receive any turn down service. Strangely enough, there was no extra toilet paper left in our room. We had to contact housekeeping twice for additional rolls.Now onto the many reasons why the less than perfect service by some personnel would not prevent us from staying at the Crosby again!Many of the hotel staff were amazing and exceeded our expectations. The concierge went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. We enjoyed theatre tickets to a sold out performance and dinner reservations at restaurants that we had never been to. Every night we were pleasantly surprised by their recommendations.The valet and doormen greeted us with a smile each and every time we saw them. When they were hailing a taxi for us in the rain we were politely told to remain inside the lobby to keep warm and dry and they would call us when the taxi arrived. Both the concierge and doormen wished us safe travel on our departure and graciously asked that we return again. We will!The Crosby is a beautiful hotel in a great location. If you have not been there, go!The public areas are beautifully decorated and comfortable. If Kit Kemp would decorate my home, I would hire her. While we did not spend time in the enchanting outdoor garden due to the cold, I have no doubt that when we visit during warmer weather that we will enjoy it. Rooms are spacious, bright, and for someone who is a light sleeper, super quiet. I have never slept so well in a hotel. No speeding traffic, noisy car horns, or waking up to trash trucks picking up at 3 a.m. The beds are the most comfortable I have yet to sleep in. In this day and age the free in room internet was appreciated. Bathrooms have high end fixtures, plush robes, and are very spacious. Rather than the typical chocolate on your pillow, the Crosby Street Hotel leaves a personalized hand written note with a lovely scented candle. What a unique token of appreciation! We had breakfast daily in the restaurant and were not disappointed. The menu is extensive and reasonably priced. Food was delicious and service was excellent. The location of the Crosby Street Hotel is a winner. Right in the heart of Soho with out all the noise. We walked to most of our destinations and used taxis for trips to midtown with ease, even with the busy Thanksgiving crowd. Our son used the convenient nearby subway stop with friends.We look forward to staying at other Firmdale Hotels.When in New York the Crosby Street Hotel is sure to be our first choice!

Why stay here? The rooms with their huge picture windows let in the light and lay bare the City vista. The lovely decor actually cheered us up: who would think decor could so affect your mood? The bar is popular, but the restaurant food seemed to lack taste.The location: a different world to mid-town's mass tourism.Good concierge service and pleasant staff.

We have just stayed at crosby for 4 days. What a disappointment vs thompson and mercer where we have stayed before. First we found contact lenses in glasses in the minibar (management offered us the breakfast to compensate). More important service level for this price (655 dollars the deluxe) is totally insufficient. Concierge were hardly polite in our email exchanges prior to arrival. And completely useless to book the right spots in nyc. This is the kind of hotel where you don t feel you re a guest. Just a customer. They got something wrong here. Not a goodbye when you leave. Nothing.

We stayed at the Crosby for 4 nights for my girlfriend's birthday, as part of a trip to the US.The hotel is immaculate and the attention to detail in the décor is impressive. It's widely commented on here but the rooms are huge by NY standards, with full length windows and great bathrooms. My girlfriend was particularly pleased with the Miller Harris products.The location couldn't really be better if you want to be right in the middle of SoHo and away from busy mid town. There are an countless restaurants and bars in the area and each of the places we tried were of a high standard. After reading reviews on here, I was slightly concerned about the service, however I found it to be good. Yes, it's not as polished as you might expect from a hotel at this level but that adds in some way to the charm. The people on the front desk and concierge were always very friendly, welcoming and seem genuinely please to be working there, which counts for a lot.Overall, the Crosby is the kind of hotel where you feel like you are at home and somewhere where you feel comfortable relaxing with some tea, a paper and one of their free cakes.Recommended.

What a great hotel - brand new and in a great location for shopping and restaurants. Fantastic bar to meet up with friends - always buzzing with a very New York feel although it has its unique British style. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. One of the best hotel stays I have ever had!

From the moment we pulled up in the taxi the service was great - bags taken care of with a smile, check-in, taken up to the room. Everyone we encountered was helpful and friendly. The room (junior suite) was really beautiful - spacious, bright & filled with natural light due to the fantastic floor-to-ceiling window. The colours and decor felt like a bedroom, not an anonymous hotel room, and little gifts like a Miller Harris candle and pretty cupcakes made you feel like you were a valued guest, not just a number. I wouldn't have minded a bath as well as the shower but that's the only criticism. Don't assume the taxi driver from the airport will know the hotel. We didn't use the concierge so couldn't comment, and didn't eat in the restaurant, but did have drinks in the bar, which was buzzy and had a nice vibe. The service there was a bit... erratic, but fine as long as you weren't in a hurry. My room service breakfast was tasty and had huge portions! This area has so many shops packed in - mainly international mid- to high-end brands, but is a short stroll from the Lower East Side for more independents, and Broadway has a lot of high-street chains. It's also a comfortable walk back from eating at one of Greenwich Village's restaurants, and just near a subway station that'll take you uptown, so it couldn't have been more convenient. Not cheap, but if you've got the budget for it I'd happily recommend staying here. I hope to go back some time.

We stayed for two nights & we really liked the Crosby - our room was large, light filled & beautifully decorated with just the right amount of colour & liveliness. The chairs were comfortable & the bed was divine.The shower room is sleek & stylish as well as practical.House keeping was great.The airconditioning was perfect - thank heavens as it was unseasonably hot.& unusually for NYC hotels & it's location the Crosby was a quiet hotel.The food in the restaurant was good.Most staff were friendly & helpful although my two gripes are that staff on the front desk were surprisingly low key & that there was an absence of staff presence outside the hotel which meant getting out of taxis with luggage & getting a taxi to go anywhere was a chore you had to do generally unaided.But this is a very good hotel - in my view it's better than the Mercer.

This is one of the loveliest hotels I've had the pleasure of staying in. The decor is so inviting, warm, and cool all at once. Bravo on that. Location laughably good. Turn left and you're at Balthazar, turn right and you're dining at Savoy. All the shopping and excitement of Soho at your feet. The hotel had some minor snafus on the room service front - not just once but twice - and there was confusion about the Sunday screening room procedure and pricing, but overall I had no major quibbles. Hard to imagine doing better in New York unless you really don't enjoy being in the "scene." I found it a nice follow-up to my quiet, wonderful Plaza Athenee stay on the UESide. Great to experience both. I'll definitely return to Crosby and try their London properties as well.
user_name:
kartwoman
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Given this hotel is part of the Firmdale group I had very high expectations and it didn't fail me at all.The design style is, as expected, very similar to the London hotels and translates very well to New York. The room was a very decent size and the floor to ceiling windows allowed wonderful views and flooded the room with light.The bar was very busy with a great atmopshere but doesn't encroach in to the hotel or disturb guests.The real high point however was the amazing level of service. From the moment we arrived and throughout our stay all the staff but superb and I couldn't have asked for more.

We have stayed in numerous good Hotels on all Continents. Crosby Street is the best. It has all the characteristics of a wonderful home created by the look and 'feel' of the Interiors and the warmth and engagement of the Staff. It's a Firmdale Hotel. They have a 'culture' and this hotel is exemplary. Ashley Muir

Loved it! The price seems to be climbing but I still think it's well worth the stay. After trying a couple of the competitors I would heartedly encourage visitors to choose Crosby. It definately has that continental service and charm that the trendy (LES, Gansevoort, Smyth) sorely lack.

We recently had the experience of a life time when we celebrated our wedding anniversary in New York. Prior to our arrival at the Crosby Street Hotel, the Concierge were generous with their local knowledge and assisted us with restaurant suggestions and bookings, which were all wonderful. We were warmly welcomed on check-in after a very very long flight from Australia and were taken to our sumptuous suite! Breath taking was our initial reaction to our superb room and it was how we continued to feel during our week long stay. From the stylish toiletries to the exquisite linen to the fabulous art work, it was all perfect.It never ceased to amaze my husband and I that we kept discovering new pieces of artwork and sculpture every day and all so expertly chosen for the wow factor! Kit Kemp has a very unique style and has not spared a dime on decorating this hotel with her fabulous signature combining colour, quality and design.We made friends with fellow guests in the gorgeous guest lounge which offers succulent daily treats under the dome of decadence and an honesty bar. It has a cozy opulence and makes you feel like you are inviting other guests into your own home - I wish!!!We want to thank the Management team and staff of the Crosby Street Hotel for making our stay in Soho so memorable and congratulate them on their top level of service, professional attitude and first class hotel.

Agree with favourable comments re: Crosby St Hotel. I've ever been motivated to write an online review before this hotel. Perfect location, atmosphere great (helped by adjacent bar/restaurant), staff (subtle, helpful, worldly), rooms are stunning with the best hotel furniture ever. My new favorite hotel in the world. I felt like we were being evicted from our own deluxe apartment after staying there 5 days. Only trivial problem...the TV was extremely difficult to navigate.....but probably shouldn't have been trying to use it anyway.....if you can afford the price, stay there.

I love the Charlotte Street hotel in London so I was excited to try out the Crosby Street Hotel when I was in NYC. I started off by having drinks at the bar with friends and falling in love with the place and the service.I splurged and stayed here at the end of a business trip and it was a fantastic experience. The rooms are so comfortable and I love the decor. The staff were exceptional and I will definitely come back here. I usually stop by here even when I don't stay here (too far from my NY office).

Im a huge fan of the soho hotel and haymarket hotel in london and am just delighted that firmdale have worked their magic in new york!loved the rooms with the floor to ceiling windows. was great for just gazing out on soho. As usual the decor in both rooms and public areas is immaculate. so tasteful, elegant but modern too.Staff were great. genuinely friendly.all in all a great addition to the new york hotel scene. somthing different and very special. cant wait to go back!

We arrived for labor day weekend and were blown away by the friendly service that was prompt but not pretentious. It's like having your own flat in soho for the weekend. We've stayed at ever ultra luxury hotel and this is by far our favorite. Room service was fast and good. We loved the bar and courtyard area. we will definitely be back, and its not soon enough.

Arrived at 11 pm checked in and went to Balthazar for dinner. Felt like Nebuchadnezzer and the hotel with its outside gardens and art made me feel like an emperor in the greatest city on earth. The hotel was like a personal palace.

I've stayed at lots of ultra luxury hotels in major US and Euro cities and I can honestly say that the Crosby Street Hotel is one of my all time favorites. The design is so current and cool yet not too pretentious as to feel unwelcoming. The service is friendly, the rooms are pristine, the views of Soho from your room are great...I can go on. The afternoon tea has to be experienced here and at night time the bar is magical. I'm not one to throw out compliments for nothing but tonight while watching Rachel Zoe's project show and seeing her hang out in the room and clips showing the hotel from the outside reminded me of how much I loved the Crosby Street Hotel....so much so that I started this account just to write this review! Everyone who is lucky enough to experience this hotel should be thankful!

First of all, we LOVED the design of this hotel. The public and private guest rooms are luxurious, quirky, and spotless. I really wanted to love the service too, but we had a few glitches, hence the less than perfect rating.We found our room to have plenty of space with a fantastic, wall sized window overlooking relatively quiet Crosby Street. Even though it's an expensive place, I think you get your money's worth by New York City standards. The room had a king size bed with Frette linens, an iPod, flat screen TV, radio, bathrobes, mini bar and ample closet space. Everything feels brand new and as though a lot of thought was put into the quality of the materials used and the little details. I especially liked the little window seats and textures used throughout the grey and lavender room. The grey marble bathrooms are a decent size, but not huge. Our room had one pedestal sink with a ledge running behind it to store your toiletries. The large shower had amazing water pressure. Now to the minor gripes. We found the service to be up and down. Chocolates and a welcome note on our first night but no sign of housekeeping on the second day until we called to request it late in the afternoon. Our electronic key stopped working mid-stay and requests from staff ranged from totally helpful to brusk depending on who was manning the floor. Our one meal at the hotel was one of those experiences that had me looking around for the Candid Camera. My husband and I each ordered the "Crosby Breakfast" because it appeared to be the lightest and most simple meal on the menu (eggs, yogurt, fruit and bread). The joke was on us because the servers brought each item on large, separate plates to our table (muffins! croissants! toast! scrambled eggs! yogurt! berries! melon! jams! jellies!) They actually had to start putting plates on an adjoining table because there was no room for the eight plus vessels that arrived. I mean, I appreciate that we were getting our money's worth (at about $30 per person), but the whole episode was kind of awkward and unnecessary (not to mention an absurd waste of food). So, as much as we loved the hotel, I can't say we 100% loved our stay. I would like to give it another try, but I am staying away from the restaurant.

A huge fan of the Covent Garden, I had high expectations for the Crosby and they were (mostly) met. The rooms (Luxury) are wonderful with a floor to ceiling, wall to wall of glass looking onto Crosby. The location (in SoHo) is perfect - great for shopping and one block away from the Spring, Prince, and B-Way/Lafayette subway stations. The staff is sweet and pretty and sexy, and, of course as often comes with that package, utterly ineffectual. Be prepared to do things on your own if you want to get it done (ie go around the corner to the liquor store on Prince get ice, make your own dinner reservations, and do your own homework on the neighborhood so as not to depend on the concierge); and have fun with housekeeping - they will decide on a day-to-day basis where THEY want to put YOUR things. I will definitely be back.

Everything about this hotel is outstanding! I spent three days in NYC with my 22-year-old daughter and we loved every minute of it. Attention to detail without overdoing it. The rooms are incredible with great windows, rooms and bathrooms. Near the subway so midtown etc is not far away. The restaurant/bar is outstanding and we loved it. The only hotel we have ever stayed at near this experience was The Inn of the Anasazi in Santa Fe.

This was our second stay at this hotel. We like this hotel because of the location, ambiance, décor. It’s a hotel, but the room you stay in doesn’t feel like a hotel room. However, we keep having strange experiences during our stay. For instance, after we checked in, the gentleman behind the front desk told us our keys needed to be made. While that would be done, we were escorted to our room by a different guy, which is usual, but the gentleman brought us to a room which was already occupied. He kept asking us if he heard the room number right from the guy behind the front desk. We replied yes. So strange. The gentleman then escorted us back to the lobby and talked to the guy behind the front desk. I guess they straightened it out and he escorted us to a vacant room. It was just weird. The first time we stayed here, we were stuck in the elevator for 45 minutes and rescued by the NYFD. Management apologized for this and gave us a free dinner at the hotel restaurant. Other than these mishaps, it’s a good hotel for location. Service is mediocre. Concierge is not dependable. They couldn’t help us get reservations to Locanda Verde. We worked our own magic touch and got in on our own. Water pressure is strong. Good lighting throughout the room, bathroom and closet. Great TV with HD. However, we had trouble figuring out how to turn the TV off fully. Amenities were great. They were good at restocking them each day. The hotel is situated in a pretty quiet location. I would agree with previous reviews the doormen don’t help you getting off a taxi with luggage and getting into the hotel. Also, for hailing a cab from the hotel, it was the same. We walked to Spring Street with our luggage and hailed one on our own. Another thing, our room rate did include breakfast, but it was not discussed on how that worked. In the end, we didn’t get breakfast. Overall, The Crosby Street Hotel is a good hotel to stay at as long as you don’t mind doing everything else other than cleaning your room on your own.

While probably not known as a "family hotel," the Crosby is certainly the warmest, and most intimate hotel I've ever stayed in.Why? The answer is simple: the staff looks after you as if you were their family.And while the hotel is definitely a hip and elegant place to be -- YOU, the guest -- are what the experience is all about, not any kind of pop culture around you. Everyone from the wonderful managers Annelle and Kathrin, to Orlando the Engineer, makes your experience and every interaction you have, memorable. Any problem or question or need you have, is taken care of, virtually immediately.I have stayed in beautiful big name hotels all over the world, and have never had this kind of service. You see, it goes beyond mere "service," because you don't really get a sense of "duty" here. It's more of a genuine desire to help make your hotel experience, and your life, easier and more fulfilling.I know this sounds bizarre, but it's the truth. It's kind of like, how you'd imagine you'd want people to act and treat you in a perfect world - with kindness, compassion, and an uplifting, playful spirit. You'll find this, and more, at the Crosby.As to the decor, I don't care what they are charging you -- the amount of money you'd have to spend to put a place like this together, and the details involved in creating such clean lines in an aesthetic sense -- isn't going to be made back in your stay, no matter how long you're there. Also, you should know I am NOT a celebrity, a heavy hitter, or someone who is high maintenance. I'm a guy from the Bronx who wears jeans and t-shirts who's done OK for himself, and that's it. The staff had no ulterior upsell motives in dealing with me, other than their desire to do the right thing and make you happy.Having said this, I don't care who you are, how much you earn or what you do for a living - stay at The Crosby for a once in a lifetime experience like no other. And who knows? Maybe you'll run into me on my next stay, as well.Because one thing's for sure - I will be back!

hotel is beautiful but seems to be run by 20 somethings who don't quite have it all together. Stayed here the last four nights and was underwhelmed with the concierge (very hard to understand what he was telling me about restaurants), and then last night at midnight I was told that if I wanted to get my 20 year old daughter a taxi I would have to run down to Spring Street and get it myself. The desk attendant said he couldn't leave and his manager had left for awhile. But there was another staff member standing right in front of the desk who didn't move an inch to help me. After I sprinted for the taxi I went back to my room and filled out a breakfast request and hung it on my door so that I would get my coffee at wake up time. When I realized they had missed the appointed time I called and sure enough they had no idea I had left a breakfast request on the door. While they didn't charge me for it, it still put me late to start my morning. For the price they charge the service should be better.

We are long established fans of the Firmdale experience, and were therefore very excited about the prospect of our first trip to the Crosby Street Hotel. On arrival we were not disappointed. The build quality, design and finish of the hotel is first class and echoed everything we had experienced in the past at the Soho, the Haymarket and the Covent Garden.But that is just one aspect of a great hotel experience and at this colossal price the service has to be equally fantastic. I regret, that with a few positive exceptions (wonderful welcome and good housekeeping) service here was consistently second rate.Twice in the morning we asked the concierge to make us reservations for dinner, twice they a) failed to leave a message confirming them b) failed to get is in to our chosen restaurants c) failed to book an alternative even on a 'just in case basis'. Generally we found the concierge service to be begrudging and inefficient.The bar service was surly and slow. When you are the only couple in the bar you should not have to wait five minutes to order and when you ask for the bill should not be told by the only member of staff you can track down that they are not your server and they will have to go and get someone else. That attitude is one of rank laziness and is inexcusable.These are just two examples of consistently slow, miserable, and attitude ridden service that we experienced. The sad thing is I know that they can do much better, particularly as Chris (Head concierge who was sadly not working the days we were at the hotel) is an old favourite from the Soho and is first class. This must be a recruitment and training issue, but for us has meant that we will not be in a rush to return.

Kit Kemp and her team have done an extraordinary job marrying style, service and location all in one. Nestled in Soho's vintage streets known for shopping, dining and bar hopping, this hotel offers a unique repose for wary business travellers and those looking for a rewarding night out. If you haven't been yet, just visit the bar and indulge in the imaginative wall decor while sipping your cocktail. The lounge offers peace and a fridge based on an honor system. Ideal also for special occasions such as weddings, anniversaries, press launches. The cinema below hosts sufficient seats for private screenings. Service impeccable. Simply fabulous.
user_name:
Service_Geek
New York City, New York

review_body: We are a small family of two adult and one 9 year old child.We were in New York to celebrate my (I'm the mom) 40th Birthday. From home, we could not decide between this hotel and the Thompson LES, so we had originally booked 4 nights at Crosby and 3 nights at the LES. But we fell totally in love with the Crosby, and after 2 nights we asked if it was possible to stay for a full week at our lovely Junior Suite on the 10th floor. At first, it seemed as if they were fully booked, but the staff did everything they could and we ended up staying 7 nights in the same room. The room: Upon arrival, we were given a room on the 4th floor overlooking the courtyard. We are big fans of light and views, and asked if they could put us in another room. Again, staff did everything they could and finally gave us the most perfect room located on the 10th floor - great views over the LES, Soho and Brooklyn Bridge in the distance. Big window, beautifully designed, enormous bathroom with tub and shower. The room was not ready for us, but we were treated to a drink on the house in the lovely library room (hotel guests only) while they made up the room for us.The hotel is gorgeous - we love the Firmdale hotels in London, but this hotel really beats them all. The restaurant, the library room - every-where's quirky and beautiful and a real treat to the eye. The location is (in my opinion) the BEST in NYC! Restaurants, galleries, shops, cafes - all are within walking distance. And the subway is just around the corner.What really makes this hotel stand out is the staff - nothing was too much trouble... they even remembered my birthday and gave me a tray of cupcakes.The only thing they need to straighten out is the service at breakfast. The breakfast staff seemed confused and disorganized. We had to ask several times for EVERYTHING - But everything that finally did arrive on our table was delicious, and we had it included, so this is just a minor comment, but someone ought to help the staff organizing the routines at breakfast. There was a lot of running around and forgetting everything on the way...That said, we really did enjoy our stay and will not hesitate to recommend it! It is expensive, but worth it if you appreciate beautiful designs and comfort and a small hotel in a superb location. We are looking forward to coming back.

We have just returned fron a family celebration in NY, which ranged in ages fro 6 - 82!. The Crosby hotel was perfect, the staff were friendly and very helpful, every need was catered for, even milk and cookies for the youngsters. The rooms are fabulous...the type that want to make you decorate when you go home!!! Beds are the most comfortable I have slept in. The location is perfect, quiet, trendy and right where you want to be! Overall if we were ever lucky enough to return to NY, this hotel would be first on our list.

Overall: Posh, terrific design, high comfort, friendly service but could be improved.We stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel for one night in May on a holiday weekend. The hotel did not seem exceptionally crowded. Many New Yorkers (especially local Soho residents) tend to leave town on the weekends, especially holiday weekends, so there were mainly tourists and out-of-towners around Soho and in The Crosby Bar. We came for a night away / special event though we typically travel for business. This hotel clearly strikes me as leisure and trend oriented unless your business is in arts, culture, film, media, etc. ACCOMMODATIONOverall: Excellent. We stayed on the 7th floor with views overlooking Crosby Street. The lead-pane look alike window is spectacular--one whole wall of the room, floor to ceiling. The window makes the room. Even though the design elements are not necessarily what I'd pick for my home, they are wonderfully done. Elegant without being stuffy, comfortable but also a bit witty. Heavy drapes, window seat cushions, comfortable chairs, superbly designed closet, solid cabinets and draws, superb fabric-covered walls. The bed was fabulously comfortable and the linens (in the bath as well) were excellent: Frette. Ample and well-placed outlets (rare in many hotels). The bathroom was floor to ceiling marble with high-quality hardware and a heated towel rack. The room was large by New York standards and feels much larger because of the window. And just excellent quality all around. Con: The A/C unit is loud and seemingly impossible to control or adjust. This affected our sleep quality (as did the very loud banging from a neighbor in the middle of the night, and the street garbage truck, but that's not in the hotel's control).DININGWe had dinner at The Crosby Bar (and have also had drinks there in the past) and drinks and lunch in the private outdoor courtyard. Again, great design in the restaurant/bard and outdoor courtyard. Comfortable, spacious, cleverly done. The food was quite good, particularly the appetizers and small plates (caprese salad, lamb tenderloin salad). Lovely, prompt and courteous service, though one of the waiters was young and a bit cocky and too casual (British public school boy?) The restaurant had the usual (for New York) ridiculously loud dance music on--preposterous, but certainly not unique to the hotel. We also ordered room service for breakfast, to arrive b/w 7:45-8:00AM, which arrived at 8:25AM. LOCATIONFantastic if you want to be downtown and in the thick of things. Right near terrific restaurants (from Savoy to Balthazar to Hampton Chutney to Raoul's) and plenty of street appeal. Crosby Street itself is one of the most charming streets in downtown Manhattan and is relatively quiet for that part of town. The curb appeal of the hotel is also quite high as it is set back from the street, though they could do more with the area out front (plantings, benches, etc.). There is a absolutely huge American flag hanging out front, which seemed out of place. The interior spaces of the hotel are fabulous design-wise and in terms of comfort. Bright and airy without being stark and cold.SERVICEThey have to do better. Everyone was friendly and courteous, though the staff seemed to be as engaged in people watching as anything else and they were a bit too casual for the prices they are charging for rooms. As noted above, room service in the morning was delayed, though pre-ordered. Lovely person at check-in but forgot to note: a) that the rate we'd booked included breakfast (and didn't provide specifics on how this would work with substitutions, etc) and a late check out; and b) that we'd need to call down front to get wireless code once we got upstairs (though we asked about this). Small issues, to be sure, but again, the overall feeling we got was that the service wasn't quite what it should be for this hotel.

We spent 4 Nights at the Crosby Street Hotel and were totally Happy!The Staff at the Reception and the Concierge Service is Great, Warm and really attentive. The Styling and decoration are just great!. Great Bathrooms, Great Beds. The Location is perfect, right off Broadway in a Calm Side Street.We were even offered drinks on my Birthday, very nice!The Only thing they Could improove is the Service at the Bar. It is mostly sluggish. It depends on the waiter, but there are few who serve you quickliy. I don't know if they are badly organized or poorly educated. But there is alway a lot of Staff standing around and still you have to wait a long time to be served and then to get your Drinks. For me, 1 Hour until you finish your Breakfast is too long, and i was not even on a Business trip.Besides of that, everything is Perfect at Crosby Street hotel!

I found it far more appealing than the other Soho hotels (Mercer, Soho Grand). The room is not large but the floor to ceiling window is an excellent design feature and fools you into thinking you are in a larger room. I applaud the use of colour and texture. The bed was amazing: firm without being hard. Same can be said of the bathroom. Quite small but incredibly well thought-out, from the way the door opens to the double sink to the ledge to put your toiletries on to the attractive fittings. The lounge reserved for hotel guests was wonderful as well.The only thing I thought the hotel could improve on in the room was the luggage rack. How do hotels think they can get away with putting one flimsy folding metal/leather luggage stand in a room for 2 people? Crosby Street, you are a smartly designed hotel, surely you must be able to address this(?) Unfortunately the staff is not quite as smart as the design. The keys they provided didn't work (they did fix this quickly), they were not able to provide (or really even understand the request for) a firm pillow, ie one that you don't sink into and suffocate. We waited 10 minutes and had to ask 3 separate people to bring our luggage down when we left. We asked to have a topsheet for the bed because we bake underneath a duvet. They did achieve this, but we had to ask for it each day for the next 3 days. On the plus side, the staff did seem genuinely friendly, with the exception of the comically bad waiter in the restaurant. All in all it was a very comfortable stay

stayed for a couple nights last week.probably for my money the best hotel in nyc.the Kemp family finally built this hotel from the ground up( check the artistic rendering of the construction on the website).profuse use of jewel tone colours, deluxe furnishings, variety (no two floors ,or rooms are similar),outstandingly landscaped garden, Miller Harris toileteries ,dynamite housekeeping service.the location is perfect, round the corner is Balthazar but the hotel is on a quiet street.restaurant provides delicious food reasonably priced.little touches( lavender spray at night for the pillows) I was greeted by a set of lipbalm containers as a gift)makes this hotel unique.The staff is expirienced( british transplants)obviously trained at other Kemp hotels.This is a welcome addition to the hotel scene(Andre Balzacs eat your heart out!).expensive, lowest rate is weekend at 475$ but you get what you pay for.I stay most weekends in nyc hotels and live close. Believe me i know hotels and hoteliering!!.Concierge hooked me up for a hard to get sat resevation at the Box.If i was to find fault, believe me this is hard- got a low floor room and could hear cars at night despite double glazed windows( very nice floor to ceiling ones by the way),was switched to a higher quieter floor at my request without a hitch).The Brits are a tad snooty at times( hey! its no longer great Britain!!), lack of door staff to greet and assist with my luggage,no one remembered my name(the Four Seasons Hotel staff are masters at that game)., reception staff dont stop what they are doing when you approach esp. when they are on the computer.enough of the quibbling.This hotel fixed my flowers( bought at next door Dea and Deluca )by adding some of theirs to improve on it, nice touch.every single detail has been thought of in the room design.Finally a hotel that you can actually read in bed.marble shower has grooved floor so you dont slip using the lovely shampoo they give you, refills no poblems!wow! Kit ! what a lovely job!!

My wife and I stayed at the Crosby a couple of months ago. We are in our late 30's, and have tried several hotels in NYC such as the Soho Grand (we hated it), or the 4 Seasons.Yes, we've had our little dissapointment: we carried ourselfs our luggage from the cab to the hotel without any assistance, we requested a room at the highest possible floor, and got one at the 2nd floor, the suite is not a suite, but a large bedroom (according to NYC standards), and yes, it is expensive for a charm/hip Hotel.However, the comfort, the cosyness, the ambiance, the decor, the location, and the kind service make it an amazing place to stay at.Also, beware of the concierge... they are quite efficient, but when I requested tickets for the "Fuerza Bruta " show, they asked for 300$/piece. I purchased them on the internet for 45$...!!!Like I say...despite all this...I'll stay again at the Crosby without any hesitation.

When I was looking for a hotel in the Soho area I came across to the Firmdale Hotels having a familiar ring from my recent research of hotels in London (we almost chose their “The Soho Hotel” for a stay in London as it enjoys an excellent reputation). Hence, I had a closer look to their Crosby Street Hotel opened half a year ago and I liked what I saw … We decided to give it a try for our family’s stay (couple with a teen) in NYC.The Crosby Street Hotel is a middle-sized (88 rooms) design hotel in a quiet cobbled street in Soho. It is stylish without being too minimalist but appears warm and comfortable. All the rooms have impressing floor-to-ceiling warehouse style windows suiting perfectly to the Soho area. The junior suite we had was spacious (43 sqm) and tastefully decorated with top quality furniture and was going to a quiet courtyard. There was a very comfortable king size bed and a sofa bed for our son (unfortunately always bedded, I never saw the room with the sofa not made up as a bed …). The bathroom was large enough for the three of us, also beautifully designed, with two sinks, a nice shower and even a TV (but not with many channels working). We did like the room very much although there were some imperfections. For example the air-condition system turned off during night-time without our having a hand in the matter or the wifi did not work (even after we complained).As far as the public areas were concerned there was a very hip bar/restaurant, a drawing room where you could have drinks when you were looking for peace and quiet or in case all the tables were taken in the bar and there was also a small fitness room. We did not eat in the restaurant except having breakfast four times and this was good (especially the egg dishes, the sweet dishes like waffles and pancakes did not suit us likewise). The service was sometimes rather slow but as we were not in a hurry we did not mind. Also we went to the bar after dinner but as it seemed to be a very popular place there was not always a table available for us but there was always a place in the mentioned drawing room where we were served our drinks. Staff in general were pleasant and helpful, again – as with the rooms - there were some imperfections. They were eager to help (a late check-out was granted without hesitation and with no additional costs) but occasionally something went wrong. For instance when my son and I were checking-in the room had not been ready yet so we had to wait in the bar. We did not mind but when my husband arrived more than half an hour later (he had to return our rental car) the person on the reception showed him to our room whereas my son and I were still waiting in the bar without being informed that the room was ready. One thing as far as the employees were concerned I have to point out: one of them was really extraordinary and that was Stephanie (host in the restaurant/bar). We chatted with her every now and then and one evening as my husband went to the bar on his own he mentioned to her in passing that we had happened to get engaged at this very day 22 years ago in New York (we are Swiss). The next evening when we went to the bar together Stephanie arranged that Champagne and strawberries were served to us to celebrate this anniversary and there was a card added with kind words (in German), what a wonderful touch!Overall, the Crosby Street Hotel is a very good choice when staying in downtown NYC but it has to be said that as the rates are quite high compared to similar hotels not only a perfect infrastructure is needed (well done here) but also an immaculate service (not always the case).

Overall this is a beautiful and funky new hotel in a great location.Pros: the rooms are gorgeous and enjoyable to be in. The bathroom is deluxe- great fixtures, hot water, water pressure, heated towel rack, etc. Cons- considering the cost of the room: noisy heat/a/c unit that we had to call to be turned off. You couldn't turn it off on your own. Then the room got too hot in the middle of the night and we had to call to find out how to open the window and tell them to turn the ac unit back on. It never went on. Our room was not cleaned until 4pm one day and they gave us a little attitude, unfriendly bartender, room service coffee served with skim milk (yuck- and we didn't ask for it).

Love the Crosby! The decor, the rooms, the service, the location all top notch. It is a little pricey compared to other hotels, but would definately spend the money again and stay here. Located on a quiet street right in the heart of SOHO. Employees made you feel welcome and right at home. Rooms and bed were extremely comfortable. Love the floor to ceiling windows. Slept great! Will definately return!

The hotel is gorgeous, and in the perfect location on a quiet street in SoHo. Whimsical design lends a fun but still elegant atmosphere to every space, from the lobby to the guest rooms, even the bathroom. The service, however, was wretched. The staff appears to consist of 20-something hipsters from Williamsburg who have been forced to work because they ran through their trust funds. I really have to blame poor management here because there seem to be plenty of staff standing around doing very little, and everything seems disorganized. For example, service at breakfast was at a glacial pace (over an hour from being seated to getting our bill on two separate mornings). They could not seem to keep the buffet stocked. Housekeeping could not honor simple requests. The concierge(s) don't seem to be familiar with the city and seemed annoyed that I would disturb them from surfing the internet to answer a simple question. A call to room service in mid-afternoon went unanswered. These are not minor details and point to a lack of direction and supervision. This hotel's management and staff would require a major change in attitude before I would consider staying again.

I already adore the Knightsbridge Hotel of Firmdale Group so i was really looking forward to see this, i was really not disapointed.Great decor, great service, great food!!Definetely my place to stay for future trips to New York

I have to admit to being a regular at Firmdale hotels - Haymarket, Knightsbridge, Soho in London, so i was looking forward to a trip to New York with guests at staying at Crosby Street.It is every bit as good as the London properties - it has all the individuality and quirky elements that make Firmdale one of the coollest hotel groups right not and yet it also has its location in SoHo New York and an undeiable American edge to the buzz.The rooms are not cheap but some of the best in New York in terms of comfort, amenity and style and probably the best beds I have ever slept in throughout the US. They are also quiet and the floor to ceiling windows give a real loft-style feel.The staff are just fantastic and concierge was right on the money in response to every request.The restaurant is good value and really buzzing with a young and arty crowd. Service is a little slow by New York standards but of a very high standard.

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights on the recommendation of a friend. What a truly beautiful experience we had. Nothing was any trouble for the staff. The first room, while lovely, was a little masculine for my taste so I asked if I could change to something prettier. The Luxury room we moved to was light & bright with lime green & white walls & bedhead on the 6th floor. The bed was huge and so comfortable. Full height windows which actually opened slightly if you wanted fresh air - a bonus in any hotel. Bathroom had 2 basins (although the first room only had one basin in bathroom) and large walk in shower. Plenty of white fluffy towells and lots of Miller Harris toilettries. We were given complimentary water, a little "sleep well" spray and a mini Miller Harris candle. Bar Fridge was full of Dylan Candy Bars, 1/2 bottles of champers, Dean & Deluca nuts and a map of Soho.My plane was leaving late in the afternoon so I asked if it was possible for a late check out. No problem whatsoever - I could keep the room until 3.00 at no extra charge.I had lunch in the restaurant twice and loved it and we also had breakfast twice. Wi fi is free - another bonus.Cant wait to go back. It is rare to find a hotel that ticks all the boxes like this one.

We spent four nights at Crosby Street hotel for a leisure/ business trip in March 2010. We're familiar with the Covent Garden hotel in London so knew Crosby Street was going to be pretty special. It still surpassed our expectations. The decor is fantastic - creative, tasteful, contemporary and stylish, whilst also feeling extremely welcoming and comfortable. The staff were incredible - helpful, friendly and proactive. We really had an amazing time. If only all hotels could be like this...!

My husband I usually stay at the Mercer Hotel but decided this was the year to stay somewhere different and so glad we did. Great Hotel, excellent location, very quirky interior, loved our room where the walls were covered in dark grey pinstripe material, with pink accessories, small bathroom with only a shower though - I didn't look to see if some rooms have baths. We had snacks in the restaurant/bar which were very good and late night drinks - atmosphere is buzzy without being intrusive - I loved this hotel, I can't praise it enough and it's great that Soho now has a hotel that is slightly weird and wacky and does not subscribe to the usual sleek modern industrial look of other hotels in the area like the Soho Grand, which I liked and my husband hated and 60 thompson which my husband liked and I didn't. Price wise, I think it is just slightly cheaper that the Mercer but the exchange rate being what it is, everything is expensive.

I went with my Mother to New York and wanted to stay in SOHO. Having stayed at other hotels downtown in the past, I was looking for a place where the rooms were not the size of a shoebox. We found it. We took a junior suite which is like a large room with a huge king size bed and large sofa. Our room was overlooking the courtyard. The bedroom was beautifully appointed and the bed was heaven. The bathroom is white and grey marble and had two sinks, a bath and separate shower. Even though we never saw them, the room felt like the housekeepers were always there. Gorgeous fluffy towels, bathrobes, divine amenities. I have stayed in the Soho in London (same hotel group) and they just get it right. The Crosby Street Hotel has an ecclectic charm that i don't think anywhere else has. Im into contemporary art so this was like living in a modern gallery. The restaurant/ bar is also wonderful and the staff are a mix of Australians/ Americans and English. ONe of the conceierges organised us tickets and restaurant bookings. They were all great, very helpful and made our stay wonderful. Crosby Street is around the corner from the famous Dean and Deluca and also Balthazar and was close enough to all Soho has to offer. If you are looking to stay downtown this is the place.

New York is my favourite city and it never ceases to impress. More often that not the Hotel will let it down, as a hotelier myself I am quite particalular on the details and underlying integrity of product. The Soho location is great and Crosby St is a quiet 'oasis', I suppose if you are in NY on business it might be a bt of a ride uptown - its worth it though. The moment we arrived we were greeted by real people that understood hospitality, they introduced themselves and remanined 'engaged' throughout our 4 night stay. The design is incredibly detailed, at once playful & eclectic, say good bye to hard edged minimalism, this place oozes comfort. The design has maximised natutral light which is so often a rarity and if you are lucky enough to be on one of the higher floors the views can be amazing. Even the lower floors look out on either the cobbled street or courtyard with intereting sculptures. The floor to ceiling windows also open! There are also some great public areas, some of which are for house guests only, including a courtyard which looked amazing after the huge snow fall, however I'm sure would be a highlight in spring. The bar and restaurant were very good, food very good, great martini's and as an Aussie it was exciting to find staff that could be trained on making a decent coffee, in a country that thinks coffee and Starbucks are related its a great asset! I could go on, however it will all be more of the same! Treat yourself and whilst not a bargain its an experience that is full of exceeded expectations. I was told the the owners brought over some of their key staff from their London hotels, it shows, they undersand service and its a pleasant change from the era of out of work actors or models attempting to play hotel!

My husband and I were lucky enough to spend Xmas and New Year in New York in the luxurious, but homely, Crosby Street Hotel. With all the warmth that is often lacking in high end hotels the staff made us feel welcome and nothing was ever too much trouble. We had Xmas lunch in the dining room and the food and the service were both perfect. The bed was absolutely fantastic and the granite and oak bathroom was superbly appointed with Miller Harris products in abundance.The artwork throughout the hotel was amazing and we often enjoyed coffee in the Drawing Room while looking out onto the outdoor terrace which was filled with snow covered sculptures and lanterns.The view, from the large warehouse-style windows in the bedroom of the quaint cobbled street and surrounding buildings, was both peaceful and inviting.Many delightful Soho restaurants and shops and fun places like Greenwich, Tribeca and Chelsea were all in easy walking distance.We can't wait to stay at the hotel in warmer weather and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone who loves casual luxury on a large scale!Many of the Soho shops and restaurants were

I have stayed in a great deal of high end hotels across the world and this is by far the best experience I have had. Staff are friendly, helpful and abundant. The decor of the hotel is chic and unforgettable. Unlike many hotels I have stayed in, we used all common areas as they are warm and inviting. The bar is lively and well serviced. (I got to see quite a few Hollywood stars there also which speaks to its popularity!) You are well placed in New York and a minutes walk from the lively streets of Soho. The bathroom suites have amazing showers and the Miller Harris products are divine. We have since bought the beds they have there for our London home as they were so beautiful to sleep on. The housekeeping service went above and beyond and it was a busy time of year so we left them with a lot to do!We had a 9 year old child, an elderly couple and young professional crowd and all were taken are of equally. I could not fault anything at the Cosby and am looking forward to my next stay. This is my first review on this website and that is because I felt it necessary to mention such amazing service.

The hotel is excellent and I have zero complaints and there are plenty of other reviews that share that experience already...I want to point out the actual street. Crosby Street is an amazing romantic classic downtown old New York cobble stone street smack in the middle of Soho but away from the tourist mobs. It used to be the hotbed for creative and artistic types. It's quiet, chic and bespoke (if you will). There are a few really impressive and unique shops all along the street right in front of the hotel! To the left is a super cool little surf coffee shop that recently opened. There is also a nice tapas place called N. Jil Sander has a wonderful shop at the end. Also on the end on the other side of the street is another very well done antique-y type shop. To the right of the hotel is a beautiful shaving and fragrance apothecary type place. On the opposite side of that is one of the best book shops I have ever been into! ENJOY!

We stayed at the Crosby Street Hotel for 3 nights over New Year's. The hotel is perfectly situated on a quiet street in what seems like the middle of Soho. The lobby and common areas are beautiful and comfortable. This is not a cookie-cutter minimalist design hotel: it is actually somewhat warm and homey. Our room was very comfortable and homey too, with soft colors, floor-to-ceiling windows, spacious closets, large bathroom, and a very comfortable bed. We ate one night in the restaurant, and the food and service were great. The room service breakfast was above-average, and was delivered within minutes of ordering. The only negative would be service. Although service in the restaurant was great, and our chambermaid was wonderful (extremely friendly and did a great job), the doorman service was subpar. When I arrived in front of the hotel in my car, no one appeared to offer me parking or baggage assistance. I had to go inside the hotel to request it. Also, no one opens the door for you, which is annoying when your hands are full with bags, coffee, etc. I don't think the doorman opened the door for me even once, and the front door to the hotel is not exactly easy to open. Also, when we needed help fixing our TV, they sent the repairman to the wrong room (apparently) and it ended up taking several hours for someone to come to our room to inspect it. Upon inspection, we were told we would have to wait until the next day for repair, which was no problem. When the repairman showed up the next day, all he had to do was tighten a connection and it worked fine. He seemed surprised that no one was able to fix it sooner. All that being said, I would definitely stay here again. The location is perfect, and the rooms are amazing -- very large, comfortable and clean. Dean & Deluca's around the corner is great too.

My daughter and I recently spent three nights at The Crosby Street Hotel during the period between Christmas and New Year's Eve. We were able to take advantage of a winter promotional rate of $505 per night for a luxury room including full breakfast -- not cheap but nevertheless good value considering the quality of the accommodation and amenities. Crosby Street is ideally situated between West Broadway and Lafayette Streets, just south of Prince Street, in Soho. After battling the crowds at the amazing post-Christmas NYC sales, it was such a pleasure to return to the warm welcome at the hotel and our comfortable room on the sixth floor with its view through enormous floor-to-ceiling windows of Crosby Street and the building tops on West Broadway. The hotel itself is within an easy walk of many excellent neighbourhood restaurants which was a plus because it was quite bitterly cold outside and we did not feel like venturing too far afield for our dinner. The hotel is beautifully designed and decorated with many delightfully artful and imaginative touches in the public spaces. Breakfasts were excellent.
