We had drinks in the bar on two nights -- the hotel offers a vibrant bar scene without being oppressively uber-cool. Bar service was a little slow but they were trying . Because the hotel has not been open very long they still have a few kinks to work out on the service side but it appears to be coming together quite nicely. I am looking forward to visiting this hotel again in the warm weather when the very attractive open air courtyard restaurant and bar areas will be operational. Overall, a gem.

Loved this hotel, fab decor and, since it is brand new, spotless. Room was quite large for NY, though the rates are pretty steep. Had all the facilities you would expect and staff were all very pleasant (more so i found than the soho grand where we stayed previously). Breakfast service in the restaurant was a little laid back (i.e slow), but not massively so and it was a Sunday. Location is perfect - paralell to Broadway in heart of Soho. btw - the burgers and fries in the soho park diner aound the corner are fab - you have to try them.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Crosby Street for 4 nights in November, and enjoyed every moment of our stay. The service was impeccable, the rooms gorgeous, unique and very comfortable (and a good size by NYC standards). Every room has been individually decorated and the cleaning standard is superb. The overall feeling was trendy but comfortable.We had breakfast included so took advantage of the fabulous breakfasts in the restaurant every day (although to pay for it may have broken the bank). Fresh juices, loads of cereal choices (incl several gluten-free options) and an enormous cooked-to-order menu. The service was spectacular.The concierge was always helpful and recommended some great spots (incl a fantastic fish restaurant called LURE). The location is perfect for shopping: you've got every chain store plus nearly every boutique imaginable within walking distance, plus it is right around the corner from Dean & Deluca--a NY institution. The metro is also very close.The gym looked very nice but we didn't use it. Same with the screening room. The rooms have blu-ray players and iPod docks. There is no blu-ray DVD library so bring your own. If you're familiar with the Firmdale Hotels in London you'll feel right at home -- even the stencilling on the door is reminiscent of the Soho or Charlotte Street Hotel. But that's no bad thing. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to return.

We split our stay in NY between the Ritz-Carlton Central Park and the Crosby Street Hotel. After following the development of the hotel closely (it only opened in fall 2009), we were eager to try this new hotel option in the downtown area, after previously staying at the Mercer, the Gansevoort and the Soho Grand. Our experience at the Crosby Street Hotel was very enjoyable. The design of the lobby, rooms and restaurant is very appealing (think modern british with modern art objects here in there). The staff was very pleasant, everyone knew us by name. I do agree in part with the previous reviewer, as we also had some minor issues which were resolved quickly. However, with room rates almost as high as the luxury hotels around Central Park/5th Ave - which also include Virtuso amenities like complimentary breakfast - there should simply be no issues at all. We made all the more challenging arrangements with the concierge at the Ritz-Carlton, so I cannot comment on their efficiency. Small requests were however handled professionally and to our satisfaction. In terms of F&B, the bar is very nice, but unfortunately hotel guests cannot reserve a table (I usually like to call from the room asking to the staff to hold the next available table - this works perfectly at the Ritz-Carlton and similar properties). We never ate in the restaurant, but breakfast (buffet and à-la-carte) was very good. Balthazar, an excellent french bistro/brasserie is right around the corner. Overall a very good experience, we are more than likely to return.

This is a brand new "designer" hotel with UK ownership. It fits very nicely into the SoHo scene and offers a warmer and more appealing décor than bland competitors. However, it's also staffed by the usual 20 somethings who think they offer service but more often than not miss the mark. When I checked into the Meadow Suite for two nights, I asked if I could extend my stay for a further night or two. The young man on reception said he could not confirm that, but he would speak to the Reservations Manager the next day who would call me. No call came. I also asked for a second key and was told one would be sent right up...No key arrived. This was the start of a pattern of very uneven service standards based on many promises but little delivery.The Meadow suite is a standard two room suite with a faux fire place that exists purely for aesthetics...It's main attraction is a "private" garden. However the back of the adjacent buildings all back onto the garden...so its neither private nor particularly attractive. At the time of my stay the "meadow" was just a rag tag bunch of newly planted shrubs...perhaps in a year or two it will justify the $1850 price tag for the suite. However in the meantime, its just a big disappointment. There's a set of outdoor lights to at least create an aesthetic appeal in the evening. However, there was no switch in the room or on the patio. An enquiry on the first night about how to turn the lights on met with enthusiasm but no solution. I was told they would consult the engineer in the morning and get back to me....As you can imagine, I never heard anything more and the garden remained dark throughout my stay.If the Crosby Street Hotel wants to compete in New York and charge their sky high prices they will need to try much harder...Needless to say I did not extend my stay and won't be returning to this confused little infant any time soon.

Wow--Been to many great hotels but none that match the level of service, sophistication, location and warmth as the Crosby. from the moment we arrived we felt like royalty--the staff, rooms, food and privacy is unmatched in NYC. IF you want to be in Soho, there is no equal

We are a family that travels a lot and stay in the best hotels all over the world and we had an amazing experience at The Crosby Street Hotel. We literally experienced everything that The Crosby Street Hotel had to offer during our week long stay with my husband (who runs a company in SoHo), my two young children and their grandparents.Upon arrival we knew we were somewhere special. The staff jumped out to open the door not just the first time, but every time we arrived (hands full with children and bags).The décor in the lobby of the hotel is like being in a museum without the stuffiness. The kids were never told that they couldn’t experience the art (though we kept a close watch on them). They very much enjoyed the dogs everywhere and the staff never once seemed annoyed by their bubbly presence (nor were any of the guests stuffy about them being there). A very wonderful crowd the hotel is attracting!The rooms were just as amazing. So much attention to detail and very spacious! We did have a two bedroom suite (well one bedroom suite with an attached room for the kids), but even the grandparents normal sized room was BIG for NY standards. The beds were cozy and we enjoyed the black out curtains being from the West Coast it allowed for us to sleep in. The showers and tubs have excellent water pressure and we loved the products that the hotel chose (which is usually hard on my long hair). The blow dryer was even exceptional☺ Room service was tasty and timely. There were plenty of options for us and they even had things the kids enjoyed! Something I especially enjoyed was that they got to know us very well and on the first morning I asked for salsa (which they didn’t have). The chef immediately made and every morning he made it for me from then on. You MUST ask for it, it’s amazing!!!The other thing that we thought was unique to this hotel was the housekeeping. I rarely even notice the housekeeping, but these women were EXCEPTIONAL! They would clean the kids toys, fold any clothing left on the floor and never forgot even a glass! Excellent attention to detail.Concierge was right on the ball setting up car service for our different dinners, theatre and out on the town outings. They also were a great asset to us in getting dinner reservations and spa services. I was able to utilize the gym during my stay and found it very well stocked with all the latest equipment, water and towels. There were a few glitches that were to be expected with a hotel that just opened. The DVD player didn’t work well the first night and they had some problems turning off the air in our room for about an hour one night, but both problems were worked out and didn't even really upset us because the staff was so friendly about it. We travel to NY frequently and will only use The Crosby Street Hotel from here on out!!!

These are just a few of the words to describe The Crosby Hotel in New York City. I have stayed in lots of luxurious hotels in NY and none have come close to this fantastic hotel! When we got out of our car, we were immediately greeted by Daniel, our doorman. Also at the reception desk was David and Elyse whom we continued to have a unbeatable friendship with during our stay. Our room as well as the entire hotel was beautifully decorated and had a personal touch. The owners of this hotel did an impeccable job! Every night we enjoyed ice cream in The Crosby Bar down in the lobby and each morning we had trouble leaving our hotel room because it was so amazing. Also, the drawing room provides a fantastic spot for afternoon tea. Everything about this hotel is spectacular from the service to the linens on the bed. I know that I will never stay in another hotel in NY but The Crosby Street Hotel.

My wife and I stayed 3 nights in October 2009 at Crosby Street Hotel We know the Firmdale hotels from London so we were excited to try their American way and to visit a LEED-certified hotel.We were not disappointed - Everything in this hotel was charming and beautiful. We simply love:-the design of the hotel with the tall warehouse style windows, the individually designed rooms and the very impressive oak-tree floors. -the huge and very comfy bed, -the large walk-in closet, - everything smelled and felt fresh and new,-the Miller Harris scent in the bathroom- the first morning we had breakfast in the room - delivered exactly as ordered – plenty and delicious, -‘Probably the best Beer in the World’ - Carlsberg Beer - was also found in the mini-bar, -the restaurant with selection of delicious wines, -the bar with a bartender with a lovely sense of humour and more than 400 bottles. -the atmosphere, - and the enthusiastic young employees with great attention to details. -the location is great – just in the middle of the charming SOHO – few steps from subway, busses and Broadway ----On a scale from 1 to 5 it deserves a 6 – surpassed only by Burj Al Arab in Dubai. Looking forward to staying here again.
